Problem is she still can't call me because it is like skyping with myself - aaarrrrrgggghhhhh!!!!  I am hopeful that she will be able to skype with my siblings, but don't know yet.  I don't know if my phone has to be near her device fo her to use my skype.  DON'T BUY THIS IF YOUR PARENTS DON'T HAVE A CELL PHONE!!!!!
title: Have never been more disappointed

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: ChiefB
content: Nice package but really poor fidelity in sound. Bass is fluttery, grumbling at medium volume. Far from "Premium Sound". Video is excellent. Notations starting with "Try''.... are in such small print that you need to be sitting within arms reach to read easily. Backgrounds are nice but boring, especially the predominate color... pea green and faded blue. The background paintings/drawings are generally uninteresting. There is no indoor temperature sensor.  There is a way to disable/enable the camera without disabling Alexa's monitoring ability.... just ask. "Alexa" could be way more intuitive and flexible in her understanding of questions and not require rote regurgitation of question formulation on subsequent questioning or requests. There must be some way that we humans can be relieved from Alexa's demand of complete and accurate remembrance/recollection of original task setup terminology for the myriad of tasks/requests we develop over time. We are not all "Watsons" but simple Earthlings. That's my review (so far) and I'm sticking to it.
title: Nice but with exceptions.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: SN
content: I wanted to like this, and the hardware seems very solid, but ended up returning it.  The main issue, as others have mentioned, is that the home screen constantly has ‚ÄúTry X‚Äù recommendations that cannot be turned off.  I bought the Show with the understanding these could be turned off.  It sounds like there were some workarounds in the past and/or for other Show devices, but none of those work anymore (as of December 2019).  I wanted to use the Show mainly as a digital picture frame, but having constant recommendations was too much to put up with.  It seems Amazon is either getting a kickback by promoting certain things (no, I do not want to try watching The Voice on Hulu), or they are incomprehensibly out of touch with what their customers want in a user experience or simply do not care. Aside from that (huge for me) deal breaker, there was an overall lack of customizability.  No ability to change the clock size etc.  All this is super frustrating because the screen and speakers are both really rather impressive.  Music sounded great and photos looked nice.  Alas, I‚Äôll stick with using Alexa without a screen foreseeable future.
title: Good hardware, Bad software

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: texellence
content: I wanted a small screen that would play amazon prime movies and television shows.  The reason is to be able to fall asleep to shows I already know (basically, bore myself to sleep) and that would not have a lot of flickering light levels.  I have and echo show 1 which would --after all kinds of machinations---allow me to get to prime television,  and would automatically take you to something, but not anything you asked for.  Then you can try to back out and get to what you want. I wanted Murder, She Wrote, for example.  It just kept saying it could not find it.  If you could get to something you wanted, it would boot you out after a short while. So I decided to get the Echo Show 2.  Same thing! I finally called support since this is the same behavior my echo show 1 was exhibiting so I figured software, not hardware.  I spent a long time on the phone, and the fellow finally agreed that these just don't work for what I want  it for. He could not get the machine at his premises to do anything I was asking. He thought it might be the comma in the tv show title. He said he would do a write up on it and someone should be in touch with me when solved.  After a couple of weeks I just returned it since I heard nothing. The good news is, this was a refurb and it DID include the power cord that many said were missing from their refurbished purchase.  So I am back to echo show 1.
title: Not for watching amazon prime

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: MeganK
content: Pretty sure this will get returned.  I want to like it but the primary reason I purchased was to watch shows from Hulu while I work in the kitchen and you cannot chose a specific season/episode.  It just plays whatever it wants.  There's no way to select it on the screen and after opening Hulu you can't tell it to "Play season 2 episode 10 of ......".  It just plays the first episode of a season.  If you tell it to play the next episode it just restarts the episode your on.  Seems a tablet may be better suited for my needs but then Amazon shouldn't advertise that it works with Hulu.  I also don't like that you cannot turn off the suggestions on the screen so when you have photos as your background there's always text across them.  Makes me feel like I paid to advertise for Amazon in my home.  A lot of the skills need much more fine tuning to be user friendly.  For example Ring has a skill so I can see who's at my front door on the device but it takes several seconds to connect as it connects through the website.  By that time I've already gone to answer it or pulled it up on my phone much quicker.  It does have great sound though and picture quality but I don't think that makes up for the lack of being user friendly.
title: Horrible with Hulu

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: FLRL
content: The sound quality on this device is better than the smaller Echo Shows and Dots that I've purchased.  The smart home features work perfectly.  Sitting on a table in the living room, it looks like a table clock but pictures can rotate through and there are various backgrounds to choose from. I've watched Prime movies on this device and the picture quality and steady streaming are very good.  Overall, I'm happy with the device.  There are a few downsides.  This version does not have the slide button to shut off the camera.  It's a command in the settings.  I prefer the button on the top of the 5" Show that allows me to block the camera whenever I want to do that.  It's possible to watch YouTube videos and I should be able to add YouTube TV but have not yet been able to get that to work or integrated Hulu.  I trust that if I spend some time on it, I will get everything up and running.  I recommend this product.
title: Excellent Speakers

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Michael Moss
content: If you are like me and the "the things to try" is constantly on the screen and it cannot be stopped. I have everything set to off and turned off the rotation. So far I have been seeing stupid "things to try messages" for the last hour. This is pretty much the final straw in things that annoyed me. The set up process was difficult because the screen was so dim, I could barely read what was on it. I actually had to guess what it was looking for. Then when it booted after an update I have been deluged with "things to try" There are literally hundreds of them. I am hoping that every it cycles through them it turns off and stays off. If it does not, I am returning this delightfully to save $150.  There is no reason to spend that much money and have a product that reminds you to be annoyed. Edit - I finally figured out how to make the things to try stop. Turn off the camera, turn off everything and then when the Show goes to home screen it goes dark except except for the time. So I have a 10 inch black screen with just the time.  I am returning this for a full refund.  It is so simple to fix this, Amazon has known how much people hate it for years. It show they are NOT listening.
title: One star ONLY because of "things to try"

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Rangermenace
content: If you know echo show 1 then you know this. The big screen is a major upgrade over 1 and of course bigger speakers makes for a better sound but not going to replace detected audio speakers. It looks good and I'm happy bought the stand which gives me option to change viewing angles. Screen is bright even at half setting and looks good even at a distance. Now i was happy with my show 1 but the special holiday price along with trade in offer just was to good to pass up so upgraded and happy did. Update: today got around to watching Amazon Prime movie "The Avangers", the screen is better than good its excellent and really shows on movies. The sound also was very good, you can play with base,midrange,treble custom to your liking. The speakers aren't bad at all and if you like base this sure can handle it, feel the vibe base. Very happy upgraded Update: Amazon trade in and save, one big fake. I sent in my echo show 1 in perfect working condition not even a blemish with screen protector still attached. It was wrapped in 2 separate layers of bubble wrap taped closed with some air cushions packing to keep it safe and it was appraised at $5.00. This is insulting, i happened to take excellent care of my electronics and how dare you imply i don't. I always thought of you as a fair company but now you beyond making me angry. Update: after complaining Amazon wrote this was a error on their part and refunded the $25 so i got whole $30 gift card. My show was in perfect shape and to treat it like a broken piece of junk was wrong.
title: Echo Show (2nd Gen)

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: lance
content: I love all my Alexa devises and my 1st Gen Alexa Show is Great "The Star " so why is it that when a purchased the 2nd Gen Show I got a 4yr old, drunken, dyslexic pirate? It does Not play my videos when I ask. it simply repeats my request in the form of a question over and over again " Do you want me to play Aquaman?" 4,5, 6 times. When I ask it took at When I ask Alexa to play Boston Legal from prime Videoes, I get "Playing Boston Legal" and then it returns to Home Screen. Asking The Show  to turn on or off a light or device, that when it's dyslexia must kick in because my new 2nd Gen Show cannot find the lights or devices. Requesting to see my video library, I get about 1/5th of my shows. The rest of my library gets lost but that's ok because the show 6 out of 10 times will not play them. I GIVE THIS REVIEW AS A TRUE AMAZON LOVER AND PRIME MEMBER WITH OVER 22 AMAZON DEVICES. WHAT WHENT WRONG? Bye the way on day 3 after I called in with my series of complaints they sent me a replaceplement 2nd Gen Show. Same Issues! I am going to send this POS back and get my 1st Gen Show out of the kitchen and return it to my nightstand, and all my problems will disappear with the UPS truck that shows up to take this back. Just as a small sidenote, this will be the first Amazon device that I have ever regretted buying, and that actually made my life worse. I originally purchased the 2nd Gen Show because I have ALS / Lou Gehrig's Disease, and I wanted to watch my videos on the 10.1 inch HD screen, when I go to sleep every night on my side. I guess it's back to the smaller yet far better working 1st Gen Show. Too many issues with 2nd Generation Show to give it my recommendation or a passing grade. Beware!
title: Give me a 1st Gen Show over a 2nd Gen Show any day of the week and twice on Sundays.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Nicole
content: I wouldn't waste my money on this again unless someone else you know already has one. Just get the Facebook portal where you can call/video and it has alexa built in. This product is not worth it and I would return it if they didn't have a 7 day return policy. Doesn't even play the songs I ask it to either (using VEVO). Supposedly you can video chat on skype but surprise you have to pay for it! AND it doesn't even work. You would think being the 2nd generation that it would be a lot better than what it is. I own 4 other echo devices and the only thing different about this one is you can see/hear what its talking about rather than just hearing it.
title: It's alright

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Denis-Mounie
content: Include me with the people who hate ‚Äúthings to try‚Äù PLEASE Amazon, listen to your customers and make this an option! I enjoy using the Alexa products and appreciate their helpfulness and entertainment capabilities, but the Echoes with screens that constantly have things to try at the bottom are irritating. I just want to be able to look at the time, weather and see photos of my friends and family without Alexa pushing things to try at me. Please make a good product great- you have the ability!
title: GET RID OF ‚ÄúTHINGS TO TRY‚Äù!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Irene Brackett
content: I have been able to set up several of the features the Echo Show is supposed to handle: smart bulbs, cameras,  video calling and notifications. However, the one thing I bought it for was to be able to watch TV on it. I own two firesticks which work great, all you do is download the app for the channel you want then connect with your TV provider, but this is where the Echo Show gets stuck. I try to watch a channel and when I get to the screen to select my provider it doesn't react. I see my provider available in the list, I tap on it and nothing. I have even tried doing this step from the Alexa app on my phone but nothing. I am pretty disappointed because this was about half the reason I bought the thing in the first place.
title: Doesn't work with any TV features

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Mr max
content: Oh. My. Goodness!  I have the original echo show and kep talking myself out of upgrading.  So so glad I finally chose to get the 2nd gen echo show!  Superior in every way, including of course the larger screen and better sound.  Various features are improved as well - like reminders.  I put the old show in the kitchen, where, it turns out, everyone in the household uses it! This new show is on a table that sits along the side of my bed.  The angle is perfect for lying on my side to watch you tube videos or prime videos when i go to bed.  The screen size is excellent for that purpose, and for reading lyrics.  The old show screen was hard on my old eyes.  The sound is much improved as well. The only thing I wish for (and this applies to both generations) is that there were more skills made specifically for the show, and that they were easier to find.  Most wanted? A calendar that displays on the screen, and maps, including local.  Without using the browser. All in all, I love the 2nd gen echo show and highly recommend it.
title: Yes!  Well worth upgrading!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Ltb
content: This thing is pretty much pointless, except for showing the weather.  If you like having leftist propaganda rammed down your throat, though, it‚Äôs great.  To prevent an Echo Show from flashing leftist propaganda and BS about COVID-19 on the screen, go into settings and disable News, Trending Topics and COVID-19 tips.  Here‚Äôs how: 1.  Swipe down from top of screen. 2.  Tap Settings. 3.  Scroll down to News and switch off the toggle.  On the same screen scroll to COVID-19 tips and switch off that toggle and also switch off toggle for Trending Topics.
title: Great if you want leftist propaganda piped into your house

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Paul Ervin
content: This could be a decent device for watching cameras and other screen related tasks but unfortunately Amazon does not give you full control of this expensive device. They control it. You can not turn off the try this from the home screen and it is extremely annoying. I bought it, I want to decide what is on the home screen. I will not buy another echo device with a screen nor recommend one. If this was on a television and I could not turn it off I would quit watching television. There are thousands of complaints about this but of course they could care less. Find a different device if you need a screen.
title: Find something else.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Alabamense
content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. There are several discussion areas on the internet that address this issue, and it may start cropping up in 2nd generation Shows as well. This defect appeared in my 1st generation Show about six months after purchase. What happens is that a loud click or pop can be heard when the audio activates. Ask Alexa a question and you hear a pop before and immediately after the response. Play music or a podcast or any audio/video source, and within 5 minutes of starting, sometimes earlier, the pop/click appears randomly, though as the video clip shows it occurs on average about every 10 seconds while there is an audio source. You can avoid this distraction by using a bluetooth speaker, but my point of contention is that this is a defect that has not been addressed by the manufacturer. I purchased a 2nd generation Show before this issue cropped up with my 1st generation one so I can only hope that the defect has been addressed in the 2nd generation. If this issue were addressed I could easily give this product 5 stars since it has so many advantages over the various dots that I also own. I will not, however, be replacing them until I am convinced that this serious audio defect is addressed and corrected.
title: Serious defect in Show 1st Generation audio

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Ron R
content: The device itself works fine, as expected. The sound quality seems very good so far. Not as versatile as the fire I am replacing but the show is much better integrated with Alexa than the fire, which is what I bought it for, more compact too. Why the single star? Amazon stole my WiFi password! When I plugged in my brand new show it connected right up without ever asking for my password and they're is no place in the phone so setup to enter or change it. They either have it stored somewhere on their cloud or it gets the password from one of the other devices on my network. Either way this seriously compromises the security of my network, which I take very seriously. So far as I know this is not mentioned in their privacy policy. So if you use Alexa and every hear that an Amazon database has been violated disconnect all Alexa devices and change your WiFi password, in that order. UPDATE: I got a message from technical support that said that, yes, Alexa does store passwords in the cloud but that this can be disabled. The fact that this is enabled by default and that the question doesn't come up during setup makes this option pretty thin protection. Shades of Facebook!
title: Serious security breach

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: johnny
content: Terrible constant advertisements, won‚Äôt turn off advertisements,  got wyze bundle for baby cam, cam shows only for short time then returns to useless advertisements, unable to get movement or sound alerts or move cam to see parts of room, terrible flashing advertisements all night long keep me awake when there is no emergency big boomy bass sound, can‚Äôt tell if any Dolby or quality sound processing is even present, really!? I can‚Äôt believe with all the sound engineers in the world this would come out. I am planning to return and wait for much better model. I would keep if I could turn off advertisements and keep baby cam on constantly as I can always ask for weather time  and news updates. I am surprised it does not even offer me my amazon wish list adverts or senior with bad eyesight sized time and weather options for images to be easily voice customized or free tickets to a local event or that my amazon packages have been delivered or my returns must be sent by date soon. Somebody wake up and make it useful instead of pushing sales advertisements that make me wish for another remote control just to mute the unrelated useless visuals. I have one echo to control my sonos and three iOS to see wyze cams. I am sorry to say that voice control over basic wyze app function and basic customizable echo show functions are not available. I also wrote in email customer service in Alexa app to complain about shows inabilities and no response at all. I get perfect customer service about all other buys and returns but why not customizing the amazon echo Show itself? Surprise surprise! Well how many upgrades to go until really useful? I need to care for another life now and I can‚Äôt wait. For all the time and years on amazon they can‚Äôt instantly make useful content available to me? I also expected amazon to compete with apple speaker and sonos speaker but no surround sound processing and at least the bass is booming. I am looking forward to new models and I enjoy most all other parts of amazon ecosystem.
title: Forced advertisements, Not better than echo I already have

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: A. Snyder
content: This is my second Echo Show, and the second one that does not work right. Bottom line up front: No sound comes out of this one, and yes, the volume is up and I've tried completely resetting it. I had the 1st-generation Echo Show, and its screen wavered and flickered incessantly (but unfortunately, that problem did not show up until after 30 days). I sent it back to be fixed, but all the "genius" Amazon techs did was reset it...which worked for about 30 minutes. Good job, Amazon techs! Now this second one, a 2nd generation, doesn't work out of the box. Alexa acts like it's working. In other words, if you ask for the forecast, it'll show up as text on screen but there is no acknowledgement or sound. If you ask it to play music, the scroll bar will appear and be moving (and if she knows the lyrics, they'll display on the screen), but again, no sound. Yes the volume is up, and I've tried unplugging and replugging, and a factory reset. (As a technical-type person, I can already tell you that the odds that a factory reset would fix this issue‚Äîor the earlier one with the flickering screen‚Äîasymptotically approach zero. That is, Amazon is just wasting your time when they recommend that for issues like this.) I would not recommend an Echo Show to my worst enemy, although they might indeed make a great torture device. Summary: Do not buy! And avoid at all costs. Amazon simply does not know how to make reliable devices with screens. (I have a non-screen Echo, and it's worked fine for years.) And their tech support is not good enough to make attempting to work with them worth it.
title: Do Not Buy; Horrible Quality Control

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Bart
content: It is nice product for what we wanted to use it for.  It works like a kitchen TV at our house with our Hulu subscription.  Only complaint is that the volume level is different by application.  For example,  Hulu sound may be just fine.  Ask it to play music and it is really loud even though you have not adjusted the volume.  Hopefully they fix this in a software update.  Otherwise screen is good.  I have it integrated with our home automation so it is nice to be able to tell Alexa to turn off the basement lights etc.
title: Pretty Good Product

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: hole in one
content: plug it in, went through all the procedures for connecting NO SOUND, called AMAZON HELPLINE went through all the suggested walk through still no SOUND, FINALLY clerk on the line (sounds like a call center) tells me they are working on an update and will automatically send me the updates, whisky tango foxtrot.
title: no sound

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: N.N.
content: So I was extremely skeptical of purchasing this because of the price, but ended up biting the bullet on Black Friday. With the one day delivery, I have it in my kitchen and completely set up. I am not tech savvy at all and this is so easy to use. The music quality is incredible. If you love cooking and using recipes as much as I do, this also does not disappoint. I am so happy within the first hour of playing around with this gadget.
title: This is a must!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: #WearetheSmiths
content: The sound quality you get will blow you away!  This is our first experience with the Echo Show since we didn't pick up the first generation.  Luckily though I didn't miss out on the newest version since my wife surprised me with the preorder a couple days ago and man am I impressed with it. We have ours in the bedroom, it serves as our alarm, smart TV, voice assistant and smart speaker. Everything it was meant for. I could see it being used in a kitchen setting too if you've used Alexa to help with cooking. We have several Echo devices around the house including the Echo Plus in our living room where we started our smart home experience. The Echo Plus has some great sound quality don't get me wrong, but the Show definitely is the better sounding system.  Adding this bad boy to our inventory of Echo devices was a great choice. You should do the same. Enjoy.
title: Amazing sound from the new Echo Show!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: B.A.
content: Lots to like about this product: 1 Good HD Resolution, good color. 2. Automatically gets dimmer for sleeping, well implemented. 3. Great sound for such a small bedside table device, however, not as good as a high quality soundbar which you can connect too via bluetooth, so echo dot + soundbar actually better. 4. Good video playback, but appears to require a subscription to prime video. 5. Integrates well with Ring devices.  This is the reason for my purchase.  I tell my device to "show me the back yard" (or any other named camera) and it does, with a larger and better, and generally faster view than the Ring app on my cell phone.  This is probably reason enough to purchase the item if you use the Ring system and cameras.  It appears you can do two way audio from and to the cameras. 6. Nothing from Google (say Youtube) is available directly, however, you can ask alexa to "open google', at that point you can access your email, youtube, and all other google services via the built in Firefox browser. No other streaming appears available without additional cost. 1. The biggest irritation for me, and one that could be easily fixed (and would probably result in a 5* review if it was fixed): On the bottom of the home screen, below the nice nature shot you have posted from your camera, the device insists on showing you every minute or so, something new you can try with your echo show.  Try x, y, or z.  This is incredibly irritating after awhile, especially, if you are not particularly interested... AND THIS CANNOT BE TURNED OFF according to Amazon support.  For a supposedly "customer centric company", very bad behavior.  Force your customers to watch a commercial on the device they have purchased every minute or so. The only way I have found to turn this off is to tell the device to "turn off the display".  This works until something alerts it and it comes back on again, and the "try x, y or z" begins again. However, you can train your self to ignore these messages, and eventually the home screen will time out, showing only a grey background with the time. The device does so many things well, or reasonably well, I could not give it less than 4* even with this irritating behavior. Review update:  This thing has grown on me with use.  Rating change 4* - > 5*. Seems to be a very well made quality item.  Functions well, particularly with Ring camera system.  Can look through any camera by voice command. Pandora music displays album cover, and progress bar.  A CD without having to take care of the CD. Fidelity is good, but better if tied to quality sound bar via blutooth. Can view email by saying "open google", then selecting gmail or news or whatever from the google menu.  Can respond to email, but difficult to forward to third parties, this needs improvement. Very pleased with the device... have even trained myself to ignore the small print suggestions on the home screen that cannot be turned off.  Occasionally, prompts me to try something interesting. Thank you, Jeff.  Nice product.
title: Quality Product with some VERY irritating behavior which cannot be turned off...

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Eli Manning's #1 Fan
content: This review is solely based on my thoughts and advantages of upgrading to the new Echo Show 2. Upgrade Pros: - Sound Quality - Bigger Screen Outside of those two factors regards the Echo Show 2 I don‚Äôt see any further justification that would fall into upgrading your original Show to the Echo Show 2. I did not see much a a listening skill improvement as sometimes I have to speak up to get Alexa to listen.  I did get a lot more of ‚Äúsorry, which device?‚Äù From Alexa when both Shows connected and yes they were of different rooms.  I also have the Echo as well 2nd gen.  I had issues with some skill sets built in with New Echo making connection or recognizing the demand..  Such as Apple Music , in which works perfect with my original Show but after connecting both, it seemed that I was consistently receiving the quote ‚Äú I cannot play Apple Music at this time‚Äù a lot. So I asked myself is it worth just to upgrade to a tablet size screen? (The Show 2 is literally twice the size screen of the original Show) Only thought of consideration for that would be to access view of security cameras, but even on that note, I have two IPads at 10 & 12‚Äù for that, so that was crossed off. Lastly the sound, only real advantage here is if you don‚Äôt have a sound system or a sound bar then yes this would be ideal for you.  Being that is not the case for me as I do have a soundbar, that was the last advantage that was removed in my book from keeping device and of course the device issues contributed the most to me overall to me.  It also take up quite some space as the back end of it extends quite a bit due to most likely its hefty speaker.
title: Review Based On If You Are A Echo Show 1st Edition Owner..

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Jorge
content: Just terrible. The Echo Show is so limited. Could be great in a few years but I‚Äôm not willing to wait because it‚Äôs TERRIBLE RIGHT NOW. Let‚Äôs start with what it CANNOT do. Can‚Äôt play: YouTube or Netflix. Doesn‚Äôt search: you can ask it questions but it won‚Äôt know 90% of them AND it won‚Äôt search it on bing. So the ad that Amazon shows saying ‚ÄúAlexa show me a recipe‚Äù is FALSE. You can‚Äôt manually type in searches either. Partial capabilities: Searching, some apps let you search. Let‚Äôs start with Hulu. You can bring up Hulu but won‚Äôt have the option from the home screen to search on Hulu. You‚Äôll have to find the right verbal request that‚Äôll allow you to drag the endless screen for what you want. Example: I wanted to watch the current season of South Park. Me: ‚ÄúAlexa play South Park season 22 episode 1.‚Äù Alexa: ‚Äúhere is South Park season 1 episode 1.‚Äù This happened every time! I had to have it bring up the South Park page then scroll to the episode I wanted. 22 seasons of scrolling took so long! Let‚Äôs talk about the touch screen! THE NON RESPONSIVE TOUCH SCREEN! I practically had to punch the thing to get it to react to my haptics. Am I supposed to double PUSH to get a video to play? Or pause? Don‚Äôt even try to drag the progress bar to rewind advance an episode or song, just accept your fate and play from where you‚Äôre at or start over. I can complain about so many more first world problems here, but it‚Äôs not worth my time or yours. Pass on this and get a tablet.
title: NOT WORTH YOUR MONEY. Limitations abound.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Thomas Wallner
content: Edit 1/11/2018. I stick with my 2-star rating but this is relative to the 10" Fire tablet and price. The Show 2 is not bad and I get it that there are niche uses.  Unfortunately, those niches are not for me. IMHO the Show should run Android and not this experimental and buggy funny interface. Even if I liked this funny interface, it is also available on the tablet. I like an Echo Dot with a screen (=Echo Spot). Amongst others I can travel with it and easily change the WiFi. Can I travel with the Show? Possibly but ... It does, what it does and it is not bad except that the current software has issues. I cannot play Prime movies. Sound is worse than my $50 bluetooth soundbar. Screen is just 720p. Why, please why does this thing even exist? I mean, for that price Amazon could have taken the 10" Amazon Fire tablet hardware and pug into the speakers of the Show. And please: what is Amazon thinking? Another proprietary power plug? How about USB C? No, the Show is not bad. It just misses the point (for me).
title: Something is missing for the price

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Craig Sherwood
content: I really like this upgrade but it has the same problem (if not worse) than the first generation - the Bluetooth connection sucks.  I have a Fire Tablet which I use for movies and music and when I pair with my soundbar it is perfect.  Whenever I pair the Echo Show with the soundbar it continues to cut out frequently.  I had the same problem with my first gen Echo Show but not this bad.  I had to go back to using my regular Echo with the soundbar to get a good sound again. Whatever technology they installed in the Fire tablet and the Echo I wish they would pass on the Echo Shows because it just does not work.  My whole house runs on Alexa including thermostat, sprinklers, lights, etc. so I love the overall product - just not the Bluetooth so I can not fully recommend you buy it unless Bluetooth is not important, then it is superior in every other way.
title: Nice upgrade but Bluetooth connection sucks

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Jeremy B
content: Doesn't have any sort of home screens, no apps. Nothing like a tablet and nearly useless. Cannot preform searches. I get real tired of hearing alexa say "sorry, i don't know that". Amazon has purposely blocked things like netflix, even through the browser. This thing should be able to do everything the fire tv can... you cant even shop on amazon with it normally. you get some weirdly watered down version of everything. My $50 fire tablet is far superior to this $250 POS. Not worth the money. The Echo plus seems to understand commands better and do more things. NOT AT ALL what you'd expect from an amazon device. Regretfully purchased.
title: NOT WORTH THE MONEY

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Rosieminnie
content: I am an Amazon Echo fanatic. From that very first Echo speaker tryout invitation to the 1st generation Echo show, I fell in love with Alexa products. So, when they announced a larger screen Echo Show, I pre-ordered like most people. I have had the product for a while now, and I must say that I am a bit disappointed. Cons The problems with the video feature. First --- Alexa voice recognition on that is lacking. It takes more than one try to get the right video to play. I never had that issue with the first generation Echo Show. Second --- Alexa does not pause or stop the video on command. I have tried several commands such as ‚ÄúAlexa, Pause!‚Äù, ‚ÄúAlexa, Pause the video!‚Äù, ‚ÄúAlexa, Stop!‚Äù, ‚ÄúAlexa, stop the video!.‚Äù The only thing that works is to command Alexa to play a song, then command it to stop the song. I wrote Amazon about this and never got an answer. I am not sure why, Amazon used to be so good at answering those questions, but this time around, I got no help. Third --- Alexa does not pick up where you left off. When I get up and use the screen to pause a video when I come back the entire video is gone, and the screen is back to normal. I then have to ask Alexa to play the video again. This would not have been a problem, but if it is a show that you are re-watching, you have to remember the specific season and episode you were watching to ask Alexa to play for you. It is a frustrating issue and still need improvement. Pro I love the sound system. I know that at the beginning people were complaining, I guess I lucked out because I never had an issue with the sound of the Echo show. I never go higher than volume 5 because I tried volume 10 once and it gets really loud. If a song with bass is playing, you can hear the bass super clear. Alexa can respond well to many commands as its past contender. It can show you what you need to see or read it to you. I do not use the Audiobook feature because I do not like audiobooks. However, I did ask it to read me a book to see if it works. Alexa can only read you specific books. You must give it the title of the book in order for it to work. There are skills available for children that can select more random books. I have tried the Amazon Storytime feature, and it can read you random bedtime stories, which is cool. I wish there were one for adults, that can just read random books as asked but that just me being picky. I love the fabric cover of the New Echo Show. My very first Echo show, I had to buy a cover to prevent it from being scratched and looking worn. The new fabric feature is perfect and easier to clean. Overall, despite the drawbacks of the video feature, I will highly recommend the Echo Show 2. I use it often and still watch some shows and newsreel on it. I am sure, as past experiences have shown, that Amazon will soon correct those issue with the Echo. So, don't be afraid to invest in one.
title: Expected Better

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Angela M. Alexy
content: I, like many other reviewers, bought this because I work at home and wanted a hands-free entertainment device so I'm not delayed from things.  The video streaming commands are beyond frustrating.  I constantly have it not play things I'm requesting.  It won't pause by verbal command.  When you do pause it, if you have to do something longer than 2 minutes it closes the entire program and you have to find the episode you were watching again.  Alexa's voice is insanely loud and I can't adjust it... so after my son goes to bed I can't use it because it's so loud I don't want to wake him up since my office is right off his bedroom.  I constantly have issues with the touch screen not doing what I'm telling it to do (such as pressing play).  Disappointed to say the least since I love my Echo and thought by the second generation kinks like this would be worked out.
title: Glad I got it on sale, I'm disappointed.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Barrett
content: Received my 2nd Show as the first only lasted a year before dying.  This one has made it about 1 month before the software update pushed bricked the speaker on it.  Still responds and shows on screen but no matter resetting it to factory or every other option provided has addressed the issue.  I've placed it on Facebook Marketplace to get some semblance of money back for it as it's utter garbage and after a couple hours on the phone with offshore representatives who pretend to be sympathetic to my issue and keep transferring me I'm simply done.  I have several HomePods and they do what is needed and don't all start asking the same question when the "catch phrase" is used to invoke the AI assistant from the speaker.  Save your money, buy a HomePod.  Infinitely better speaker quality and voice recognition.  This device is also creepy when you play your voice back on your account and what they are listening to.
title: Terrible Reliability and Software Breaks it

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: RetiredGuy
content: The home screen constantly rotates messages for you to "Try" on the Show. It is distracting and useless. I would not have bought the Show if I had known about it in advance. It is like having a TV constantly display messages for you to try some product or another. Nobody would knowingly buy that TV. Whomever at Amazon thinks it is a good idea should be re-educated. Give the user an option to turn off that dumb message. My advice to all: don't buy the Show until they change this.
title: Get rid of the "Try.." line

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Munchiniwa
content: The Echo Show works well but there are two problems that drive me crazy. First - Although it shows the time on the wallpaper screen, it does not show the day and date like almost every smart watch in the world. How hard would it be to include the day and date? Consequently I have to ask it many times every day to tell me the day and date. Old age is a bitch. Second - This is an Amazon problem, there is no way to contact Amazon about wish list features -- not just for the Echo but for anything. Its the old IBM mentality where they know better than the customer what is best for us. Amazon should have a separate or inclusive website just for feature requests for their products.
title: Missing Feature

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: wanda holmes
content: Purchased the show for my daughters  and sons for Christmas gifts because I liked mine so well. Purchased the 2 for me. Always watching a movie or talking to the kids or great grands it‚Äôs always in use. Have a show in one bedroom and bathroom also as well as dots, echos and tap scattered throughout my rather large home and love them. The 2 sits in my kitchen. So in love with these products I convinced employer to buy shows for use as intercom between offices. Perfect for yourself or as a gift. Will be gifting  2 two shows for Christmas gifts this year and more light bulbs for me. The 2 is very viewable. I especially like it has a built in hub so will be easy for gift recipients to hook up their own lights etc.  wish it came with the stand
title: Built in hub

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: DOAbarrelroll
content: While the hardware is very nice -- loud, clear speakers, decent camera, large, bright screen with good viewing angles, unobtrusive design -- the biggest selling point for the Echo Show over the other Echo family of devices as is needlessly underutilized: The screen, while nice, is an afterthought. The majority of all functions will only give you an audio response only, even if there easy to find corresponding video available from the same sources the Echo Show is pulling from -- news briefing from different media outlets, as an example.  For video streaming, the big players either aren't available or require jumping through several hoops in order to get them to function. If you'd like to utilize the device as a digital picture frame, you're able to use Amazon Photo -- a thing no actually uses as far as I can tell -- but unable to link the device to any image services or accounts which people actually use. Most of my gripes there aren't necessarily Amazon's fault as other companies are certainly under no obligation to create skills linking to their services for the Echo Show, particularly when many of them are direct competitors of Amazon and their services. It's unfortunate and frustrating, but it is what it is. My main complaint is one which Amazon has no one to point a finger at but itself: The screen is 10" worth of unused space 90% of the time, with only 1/12 of the area being used to display the sort of information you'd want at a glance on an always-on display. It shows you the current time and temperature, but there is currently no way to customize or add additional information. Not the current day or date, upcoming scheduled appointments, particular stocks, moon cycle or whatever other info you might want at a glance. To repeat, this $230 always-on display does not allow you to have the current day or date displayed. You need to ask Alexa to tell you this information. There is less information display on a 10" display than what is offered on the ~1" screen of you smartwatch of choice. There is no way to customize this information. This is less functionality than your average digital clock. To add insult to injury, apparently the ability to display the current day and date IS available on the Echo Spot for $100 less. This may seem to a minor issue, and largely I think it is. But it speaks to the sort of decisions -- or lack thereof -- being made with this device as a whole. Amazon hit gold with the original Echo and decided to slap a screen on it, but don't seem to know what to do with the screen, even when it comes down to the most basic functionality. If these sort of things are added in a future update, I will happily change this review.
title: Wasted Potential

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Jacob S.
content: I purchased this initially so that I could have a nice device in the kitchen for  hulu, music and pictures. Then as I started looking into all the smart devices it pairs with, it became an essential hub of my home. The voice recognition is great, Alexa rarely doesn't understand what I'm trying to do, and its usually due to user error. The picture and sound quality are amazing. And I love rotating pictures on the home screen with the weather updates. I have deactivated the camera for safety, and because I don't use it. But I am interested in trying it out eventually.  So far I love using it with Ring, August locks and the Alexa outlet plugs. All in all its a great product and has done so much more than what I expected. I highly recommend it.
title: Great hub for smart home devices!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: John D Walton
content: Echo show lives up  to its billing.  Great unit.  With some trepidation I bought Echo Show for my wife's 81st birthday. Now the downside possibility was that she would not use it....she hates computers, hates anything mechanical, does not want any clutter on the kitchen counter tops.  She doesn't even have an ATM card....I bought it two weeks early, set it up when she was out, found a place above the counter to place it and hoped for the best....she loves it (well at least likes it a lot)....she doesn't have to ask me about the weather, she has learned to do shopping list and to do list and she has at least looked at the receipes.....and all she has to do is say  "Echo, Print"  whatever it is and she has a hard copy. Thanks for providing a great product!!!
title: Echo Show is very easy to use

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Dennis Rogers
content: This is better I  every way to the old first generation echo show. The screen is better and clearer and if you love plenty of bass, this has it. The sound field is wide and will fill your room. It turns on my philps hue lights on slightly faster also. If you got the old show, the  this is a worthy upgrade, everything about it is better, and for a 10" screen, because its so compact it does not look a monster like the Lenovo 10" smart screen, so love the smaller echo show form factor.
title: A big improvment in every way

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: clairenpaulimom
content: If you have more than 1 person in your house, this is probably not for you.  I tried setting up an Echo Show for my Teen Daughter.  I thought it would be nice for her to have reminders on it, her alarm, I can "drop in" to make sure she's up...  etc etc.  One problem.  Can't setup an Echo with An Amazon Teen Account.  It must be an adult account.  So, If I set it up with my account... she can see all of my purchases, things on my to do list, she can add to my todo list, add and remove MY reminders. Also, there is no way for Alexa to truly recognize the voices like SIRI does. If I lived alone, I guess Alexa would make a great companion to have around....  but as she stands now...  not so much.  Oh... yeah... and if you are watching a television show or movie with a character named Alexa....  your Echo will answer.  Let's just hope a television writer doesn't have a great sense of humor and work the phrase "Alexa, buy 100 pair of socks"
title: Still needs A Lot of Work

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Rose Collum
content: I was looking forward to receiving this, to use in my upstairs office to have videos and news shows on while I work.  (as well as other things, since I already own three echo dots and love them)  But after I got it plugged in and went through the installations, configurations and updates, there was NO SOUND.  I looked in settings, all volume was up and enabled.  There was NO documentation on sound issues, and no indication I would have to purchase external speakers.  Shocking how little information there was on the issue in the tiny pamphlet included.  IMMEDIATE RETURN.
title: Defective Product

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: FTC
content: I would give this device a much higher rating if the battle between Amazon and Google didn't interfere with it's operation. As it is the echo show is limited in capabilities such as not being able to play Netflix, browsing capabilities. Everything you search on google takes you to an Amazon page. So forget trying to buy something elsewhere. It's the customers who buy these devices who suffer. Pretty sad when you pay for something and are short changed because of a squabble between 2 corporations. Then there is the fact of learning to use it. A manual in the form of a downloadable pdf file would help immensely. Hopefully they will upgrade and improve this device so it is compatible with and will play well with services other than Amazon. Otherwise I would consider buying other devices. It has some nice features and the sound is good but it could be so much better. For that reason I feel Amazon is making a mistake in not bringing this product to it's full potential. People will buy Google Home Hub, Facebook Portal, Lenovo Smart Display and others if Amazon doesn't get wise.
title: Could be so much better

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: MartyO
content: Purchased two Echo Shows when first released a few years ago.  One for me the other for my elderly parents.  Echo Show has provided me with peace of mind and made caring for my elderly parents so much easier.  By far the best feature is the ability to ‚Äòdrop-in‚Äô on them and see how they are doing.  With the ‚Äòdrop-in‚Äô feature there is no need to jump in the car when they don‚Äôt answer the phone.  Another time saving feature is the ability for my Mother to create a shopping list.  I can access her list and pick up groceries or whatever else they need without having to make a phone call and write everything down.  Many other features such as reminders, timers, memory skills, music, hand free phone calls and much more have given me reason to appreciate how much Echo Show has improved my position and duty to care for my parents.  And I should have written a review sooner to show my appreciation.  As much as I have appreciate this device over the past couple years, NOW move than ever, my appreciation is beyond.  The current global crisis has been difficult for everyone.  My Father is no longer with us and my Mother is living alone in a senior community.  To stay safe, the senior community does not allow visitors during this Covid-19 pandemic.  Residence must stay in their apartments for now.  I‚Äôm not sure if my Mother could have tolerated the isolation for this long without Echo Show.  Being able to video chat with her children, grand children and friends has been an lifesaver for all of us.  It allows us to hang out together and stay connected.  Therefore as much as I appreciated everything the Echo Show provided, today more than ever, my appreciate is beyond.
title: Appreciate Today More Than Ever

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Images Per Second
content: This 2nd generation Echo Show has a very large and bright, clear, crisp screen. It is hefty and build quality is solid. The 1st gen sitting next to it is dwarfed in comparison. It was easy to set up, just like the 1st gen. I'm hoping it doesn't develop the same annoying popping sounds that my 1st gen suffered from because it looks great on my desk and works seamlessly with my apps. I was a little disappointed in the sound quality, however. Due to the fact that they moved the speakers to the sides instead of having them fire forward, it becomes necessary to pay more attention to where the unit is placed (i.e., you have to pay attention to objects around it and how that impacts the sound deflection.) I realize this was a design choice in order to maximize the screen, so that's the trade off.  This is my fifth Echo device. Each style (Dot, Tap, Show, etc.) has its place. Keep in mind, the 10 inch diagonal screen is contained in an 11 and one half inch frame. Take out a tape measure and be sure you have a place for something this big. As I live with my Echos, I find them to be more than just gimmicks or entertainment devices. Rather, they have become great tools to help with productivity in the office, garage, kitchen, and theater. Overall, I am very happy with this purchase.
title: A Great Upgrade

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Amazoner
content: I have both generation 1 and 2 of Alexa show. I bought the generation2 with hopes of it being better at hearing my voice from across the room. I have not found that to be the case. I have had the new show for about 3 months now and I love the new features with the new one. The screen is much better, as is the sound system. I bought the swivel stand and the screen protector and I am glad I did. Not that anything has happened to it, I have it sitting in my kitchen area and that is always a good idea to have as a safe guard for your Alexa device. Some of the key differences between the devices are the ability with version 2 to have a freetime, where you can restrict activity. Hunches is where you have a connected device that you think or have a "hunch" may have been left on too long, you can have Alexa check on it. One real feature I love is the Guard feature. Guard feature detects if your smoke or CO detectors goes off, if there is glass breakage, and can set away lighting. The Guard feature only notifies you if any of these occur it doesn't call authorities, that is left up to your security system. However, I like having the notifications coming to my phone so I can remember to us the drop in feature on Alexa to see what is going on. There are other version2 features but these are the 2 biggest new features that really make buying the new one worth the argument. The Amazon support is great and seem to be really up to speed with any technical issues or questions you have. Overall I love the new version vs the old one.
title: Version2 better than version1

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Brandon Taylor
content: I have used Alexa since the first one and I am delighted with the new Echo Show. The prior generation looked dated out of the box and featured a small screen, but it was the best version of a smart home speaker out there. When I opened the box to this one, I was impressed with the stylish design, beautiful front screen with no unsightly speaker under the screen like the prior model, and crisp sound. It is a wonderful device, and if you have the prior Show, it is a worthy upgrade!
title: Wonderful Update to Prior Model

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Nyoka
content: I bought this for integration with my security cams, to drop in on my kids echo (his room is some distance from the living area of the house), & I was happy to find out the rest of the features. On major issue- major voice control quirks. I have to over enunciate to get it to work for nearly anything. I‚Äôve given up on using it for my Phillips hue lights, it rarely works, and usually ends up asking me what I said multiple times. I have no accent, and my diction is clear, my career involved being heard by many over the radio, so I know that isn‚Äôt the issue. There is a 3 to 5 second delay anytime I tell it do view my nest  cameras, this is a dealbreaker, we had an intruder try to break in, and in that instance 4 seconds to identify the person smashing your front door feels much too long. I‚Äôm beginning to wonder if I‚Äôve got a defective model, it seems to have gotten more quirky after a couple initial weeks of trouble free use. Drop in was a large percentage of why I bought this and the kid friendly module. That feature is a bust. We‚Äôve got a spread out house, I‚Äôve got to go through 3 security doors to tell the older kid to come to dinner. A voice activated PA sounded lovely. It. Doesn‚Äôt. Work. It is frustratingly slow, it squeals with feedback the entire time, and if he is listening to music, he seems unable to hear me at all. Sometimes I won‚Äôt disconnect, leaving me with dinner prep hands trying to get the squealing feedback to end. This feature is worthless. Note- returning device. Issues have gotten more prevalent. We watched videos on the amazing screen the first day, but that‚Äôs it. We should have gotten the google home hub for the best support and intuitive smart device controls. Lesson learned.
title: returned & purchased google home hub, all my frustrations/issues are gone now.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Rick Cruz
content: I wanted to be happy about this product and for the first couple of weeks I was. For the past few weeks it either gives me the wrong information, videos abruptly stop and it reverts back to the home screen saver, things that worked before on it don't now, or it will abruptly talk at least once almost every hour. I'm gonna start with the creepiest one, the fact that it talks. Once an hour, usually at night it will wake up and either say sorry I don't understand or something else without anyone near. We've had to unplug it at night so we won't get woken up. Secondly, videos just stop playing and it reverts back to the home screen. This is super annoying when I'm trying out a new recipe or trying to entertain my little one for a minute while I take care of dishes or something else. Next, I had synced my ring doorbell and nest cams up with it in the beginning and now it refuses to bring up video from either of them. And lastly, it is a pain trying to bring up anything because either the wrong thing is opened or it'll constantly say "Sorry I don't understand" or "I didn't hear that." To be sure that it's the device and not software, I had checked for updates, restored to factory defaults, and even unplugged the thing for hours hoping that any of those would fix it. Nothing works!!! It is so frustrating. If you get this device, please spring for the warranty because now I am out of the window for returning/replacing it, so I essentially have a large cumbersome paperweight.
title: I wanted to be happy about this product, but...

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Danny D
content: I wanted to like this item, but I just couldn't. My biggest complaint is that you cannot change the news that shows up. You can only turn it off. The news is nothing but propaganda. I tried talking with support about it, they kept offering ideas that did not resolve the issue at all. They don't even know how their own product works. On top of that, we have to constantly tell her "Cancel" because she thinks we're talking to her or get the response "I can't do that right now" on simple things like telling her to go to the home screen. I would say the processing power on it is terrible too. My kids like to watch music videos on it, but it's so slow to respond. And forget about wanting to watch any kind of shows. It's just too slow of a product to do that. Wish I never bought it. Best use I've found for it: Prop the ipad up on it. It's actually a very nice angle. Yes, the ipad that's several years older than my show works 10 times better than the show.
title: Best use: Propping an ipad up on it

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Reeann
content: Purchased 7/15/19.  Have had issues off and on ever since then with the audio not working.  Every time was told to unplug it and plug it back in.  Altho this was annoying it always worked. However it happened again 2 days ago and I unplugged it and plugged it back in...nothing.  Alexa heard my commands as I could see them on the screen but I heard nothing. Called for help and was told to do a factory reset, which I did.  Still nothing.  I was then told since it was out of the 1 year warranty (by 2 1/2 mos.) I was out of luck.  They couldn‚Äôt help...I would have paid to send it back and have them fix it but not an option.  I am extremely unhappy.
title: Unreliable

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Kathy
content: This device is so very disappointing. I feel the disappointment is so profound because I had great expectations. I received this for Christmas and got it all set up. I was very excited to see all the utility this thing could offer. Less than 48 hrs later it‚Äôs back in the box. It seems that they failed to account for the fact that users might want to restrict access from their children. In this digital age, that oversight is unacceptable. I simply could not believe there is no way to lock kids out of this thing, but after an hour utilizing amazon support, I had to accept this fact. No screen lock with pin or login required. Yes, you can require a pin for video from your amazon settings...BUT this will still allow videos that are rated for general audience. There is no ‚Äúalways require pin‚Äù option. This means Sesame Street and such playing any time. So unless you want to let your kids be on this thing all the time, or spend all of your time physically getting them away from it, I can‚Äôt recommend for any home with children. Do better Amazon!
title: Have kids? Don‚Äôt buy this thing!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Just A Mom
content: I upgraded from the Echo Show - 1st Gen to the Echo Show - 2nd Gen. The 1st gen software was upgraded to the same as the 2nd gen, so if you have the 1st, you won't need to upgrade to the 2nd to use the new software features unless.. you want the full screen and a much better sound experience. The 1st gen device configuration was very poor with its boxy appearance and annoyingly prominent speaker location.  The full screen presentation of the 2nd gen combined with the speaker moved to the rear is a winner and in my opinion, that alone is worth the upgrade but then I just like new electronics.  The 2nd gen device looks better on the counter, it's sharp and easier to see text from across the kitchen because the screen is larger. The software update also centered the announcements on the screen which adds to the new look and makes it easier to read on the larger screen.
title: Worth the Upgrade from 1st Gen

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Sheldon Thomas
content: I'm being a little favorable and grading this on a curve with credit for the potential that it has.  If I could I'd give it a 4.5 stars (4 stars for today, .5 stars because it has load of potential. Display: Excellent. It's big and I felt it was going to be too awkward at first because of the size but once I started using it the size of the display (and the unit) were more spot on. Interface: Good, customizable.  Scrolls information if you want and adjusts based on lighting and activity around it (i.e. turns off/dims when dark and not active). Can control quite a few things including lights from the interface and also does a great job with video and other media both with displays and control.  Alexa works well in displaying information in usable forms (lists, links, data, video clips, etc). While I can control lighting, I found Google Home hub has a better interface for controlling things; just easier to get to and very easy/quick to turn on and off things in the same room.  I have not used any of the video calling etc. but from what I've seen that's pretty solid. Sound: This thing sound great.  Full sound.  Not going to replace any high end systems for music or movies but it's good.  I tend to use it for audiobooks when I'm doing work around the house moreso than anything else and it's great for that. Amazon still hasn't integrated things like Ring into this as well as is should.  As a comparison, the Google Home Hub integrates excellent with Nest. Someone ring the nest doorbell and it immediately shows the camera, it very quick with accessing other cameras or the thermostat.  I think it will get there and when it does it potentially will be better as I think the hardware is better (faster, better display, etc).
title: Good with even better potential...

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: fineshmecker
content: Sound was on and off for first month. Then, after return period expired, no sound at all. went through diagnostics and resetting to factory settings. no sound. Attached external Bluetooth earphones and heard sound. Ergo, the show internal speaker connection is defective. Turns out this is a known quality issue, widely written about. I called customer service and they insisted I send back the unit for warranty inspection before they would send out a replacement and was told I would receive a replacement within 5 business days. That was a week ago and no communication so far. My order list says that it was submitted to a repair vendor who will repair and return it in 10 business day.  They should have sent out a replacement with overnight shipping to replace the faulty device and then asked me to send back the defective one in the box with a prepaid shipping label.
title: Speaker Defective- Waiting for warranty "repair"

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Julie Rose Olivier
content: I‚Äôm not technologically incompetent by any means... I have hooked up close to 20 Alexas and echo dots .. I ordered this echo show on prime day and I set it up ( it was already pre reg‚Äôd to my Alexa device account) it connected to the WiFi at our house but I can not get any sound of of this device. It can hear me commanding but I can‚Äôt not hear anything. I took all other devices offline and off blue tooth but still no luck ! Amazon please offer advice and instructions
title: No sound

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Stefanie Martens
content: We have all Alexa speakers (spot and dots) and this thing is crap. We own it now 1.5 year and it isn‚Äôt working anymore. We tried everything but always when you Wanne ask Alexa something the system is breaking up. Wonderful!!!! Can‚Äôt even listing to music anymore
title: Not working anymore after a year...

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Renie
content: How completely insane that you can't turn the Alexa 'suggestions' off!!!  large bright white letters at the bottom of the screen "try asking Alexa to................"  Arggghhh, what is the matter with you, Amazon!!!!  Beyond annoying, and distracting!!!  I bought 2 of these several months ago, but unable to set up till just now - what a mistake, as now I can't return them, which I would in a heartbeat, and buy Google instead!  Amazon has RUINED an otherwise great and useful product, simply by being totally insensitive to their customers needs.  (just read the huge number of complaints by users!!)  I own 6 Echo dots, a Google Home, and lots of smart devices - but wish I hadn't wasted my money on the Show.  I am very disappointed and angry with Amazon over this.
title: wish I could return! Amazon blatant disregard of numerous complaints about Alexa "suggestions"

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: chaw704352
content: update 6/11/2020 Still the worst echo purchase I've made. Sits in a dusty corner as an overpriced zwave hub. Touch screen still has almost zero uses. I would have liked if this thing could integrate into a security hub for Ring products with an always on video.... But no. Getting too a ring product takes "yelling" and spins for 30 seconds while your doorbell rings (on 1gb internet service). Just but an echo plus and skip the screen. They never figured out why they have a screen. Older review The touch screen is worthless. It physically works great, but software is built around voice interaction only. AMAZON MOST PEOPLE WILL WANT TO USE THIS AS A TOUCH SCREEN INTERFACE TO GET TO MUSIC, SMART HOME ACTIONS AND CAMERA APPS. Nope. Everything is done by voice. This big beautiful screen has no great way to touch your way to your music or videos, RING cameras, etc. Why is this a problem? Say someone is at your front door. Ring doorbell goes off. What does this device do? Nothing. Want to see it on that big screen? Then it is time to tell at Alexa to show the camera...so now the guy at the front door knows you are home. Yes you can set up a few quick touch shortcuts. But they are two screens into the program. Want to show multiple ring cameras at once....nope. Want it to show a camera when motion is detected....nope. Want to play a specific song on Spotify or Amazon music using the touch screen....nope. have to tell at it. If you already have music turned up, guess what, it can't hear you anyway. You will have your phone out to solve these issues using your Sonos or Bose or music player app. Seriously what is the point of this big beautiful screen on this device if the software is built to avoid you using it at all costs. Most people just want the home screen to be a few apps or triggers. Or maybe show an Amazon owned ring camera. If we could get this, it would change my opinion of this device. This fix is not hard. Not sure why Amazon refuses to be part of the touch screen world. For many applications it works better than voice.
title: Just Fails on So Many Levels

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Ben
content: For some background we have had a ring doorbell for a little bit now and an echo dot. This is important because while it's not hard to pull out your phone to check on your ring feed, having the show is faster to pull up your ring feed and why not view it on the big pretty show screen? The show can also control your whole smart home if you have more smart devices that you want to use it with. Now on to why I mentioned having the echo dot. While I love our echo Dot and it is not a subpar device in anyway (has awesome voice recognition and Spotify sounds very good on it) the sound on the show is so so much better. It puts out every tone and beat in the songs and it can get very loud. Crystal clear quality. However if your wanting to get this for the sole reason of watching your Netflix or HBO I would recommend just getting an HD10 or even an HD8. While it's not impossible to watch these services on the show, there's a few extra steps you have to go through. If your watching solely prime video stuff it's flawless. Just get both if you can afford it! I have an HD8 and we haven't gotten an Amazon device that disappointed us :) All in all, the show can do so much, big pretty 10 inch screen, and the sound quality is amazinggg.
title: Worth every penny

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Mitzi
content: We have a Google mini but wanted to upgrade to a smart device with a video screen.  We selected the Echo Show 2 because the reviews said the sound was superior to the comparable Google device and because the built-in camera allowed video conferencing - something we do regularly.  While the speakers and picture lived up to our expectations, the quality of Skype calls was poor.  And, my wife was never able to get it to connect properly to her calendar. Most importantly, Alexa did not give correct responses to many simple questions, including follow up questions to the trending topics that were suggested that we ask Alexa. Just 2 examples of many, Alexa suggested we ask about: A rare chimera cardinal, but it was unable to respond correctly when we asked to see pictures. And, Usain Bolt beating the NFL 40-yard dash record, but it could not respond correctly when we asked what was the record time. Also, it was unable to respond correctly on multiple occasions when we wanted to see recipes for specific foods. Every day we experienced numerous instances where Alexa could not provide an answer, but we were able to get the correct answer from the Google Assistant. (The requests for pictures was done with our smart phones but others were done with the Google Mini.) The inability to respond and/or the incorrect responses from the onset caused us to start testing and comparing Alexa versus the Google Assistant right away. After a week, we had enough and concluded that Alexa was unable to meet our needs. Because of our extreme frustration with getting accurate information, we never bothered to connect Alexa to the other smart devices in our home, so we cannot say how Alexa might have handled tasks like turning lights on and off. And, I was not satisfied with the limited selection offered to shopping inquiries versus the selection offered when looking at Amazon on my computer. While the reviews indicated that Alexa is compatible with more 3rd party devices, they also said that Google had the edge to answering informational inquiries. We just never imagined that the discrepancy would be so great. If getting answers to questions regarding news, sports or 'how to' are important, we suggest you go with the Google Assistant. The final irony came as I prepared to return the product. Alexa was unable to respond to the question of how to reset the device to the factory defaults, but Google was able to give me the answer.
title: Alexa needs lots of improvement.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: AB
content: After spending a lot of money to have the largest version of Amazon‚Äôs echo show I was very disappointed and surprised to discover that users are unable to change the clock face like they are with smaller versions of the echo show. I own two echo show 5‚Äôs and have always been able to customize the clock face to a configuration and font that I like. Because the regular echo show does not have this feature, this means that I cannot display the date on my home screen and that the time and the weather icons are very small and always remain in the top left hand corner of the screen. Since I typically have my echo devices double as clocks, I am frustrated that I have paid so much money for a device that doesn‚Äôt include this basic feature that it‚Äôs cheaper models have available. I am considering returning it for this reason, but would love it if Amazon would create an update that makes this feature available on all of its echo show devices.
title: No Custom Clock Face Option!!!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Matt
