content: There is a delay in audio from my iPad to the Echo Show via Bluetooth so when I play video on the iPad, the sound from the Echo Show doesn‚Äôt sync with the video. I didn‚Äôt have this problem on the original Echo Show. The 2nd gen Echo Show screen is definitely larger and more vibrant. Overall it‚Äôs not that useful unless you are going to watch something directly on it. It has Prime Video, Hulu and for some reason, NBC. Without Netflix, this makes it a light offering. The content (like news stories) it pushes out is rarely relevant to me. If you like following cooking recipes on tv, then this is probably good for the kitchen. Alexa has all the same problems she has on every other Echo device, most frustratingly she can barely answer questions about what the device can do. Instead she either refers you to a help section that mysteriously isn‚Äôt available on the device itself even though it has a screen or she just says something like, ‚ÄúHm, I don‚Äôt know that.‚Äù One improvement on Alexa‚Äôs shopping skills, particular to this device, is that you can look at the products, though it‚Äôs a narrow set.
title: What are you really going to use this for?

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: J. Hoffman
content: I had the Echo Show Gen 1. We liked it and when there was a great deal on Prime day we jumped at the upgrade. I have liked the bigger screen and the sound quality is great (huge upgrade from gen 1). We have however had issues with this gen 2. It goes to sleep (shows time only) when we are in the room. We will talk to it and it will wake up respond and go back to sleep. Unplug/replug and then there is no audio. The only resolution for no audio has been to remove the plug from the back of the Echo Show, unplugging from the wall will not fix the issue. This has happened twice since our prime day purchase. Wondering if typical behavior or if we have a bad unit. The "Drop-In" feature takes too long to connect and has strange feedback (for the first few seconds after connected); video takes a long time to show (dropping in on devices in my home). Other annoyances are the "Try" messages that cycle through the home screen (on my Fire TVs as well).
title: Great Screen; Buggy Software

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: drivec
content: I bought a Google Nest Home Hub and an Echo Show to compare which is a better picture frame and home hub. While I use Amazon Echo for all my smart speakers, the Google Nest Home Hub is the better assistant with a display. The Echo Show has a larger screen, but the picture quality is lower than the Google display. For the digital picture frame feature, Google has Echo beat with a much better presentation - Google's display stays in picture frame mode by default and can show two portrait images side-by-side. The Echo show doesn't even shuffle the images on the home screen, which is baffling! The biggest thing is that you can't turn off the "Try this" prompts! This makes the Echo Show fail as a photo frame. This would be a 4-5 star product if Amazon enabled Home screen photo frame shuffling and allowed you to remove the "Try this" prompts. For a better photo frame, get a Google Nest Home Hub.
title: "Things to Try" needs to be turned off. Google Nest Home Hub beats Echo Show in features and quality

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Sb
content: STOP! DO NOT BUY!! Look at the forums. Sound does not come on after it has been unplugged, even if it is unpaired to another device, even if you reset to factory settings, even if you unplug it repeatedly. AND THEY KNOW ABOUT THIS PROBLEM. My guess: They are unloading these things hoping a certain percentage of people will just pair them to a bluetooth speaker (which, richly enough, most people will buy from Amazon) & they'll still make a profit. I bought a couple of these, one for my elderly parents (because, after all, Amazon advertises how good this is for old people). Dealing with this issue would take a year off their lives. They'll be devastated not to get the drop ins to the grandkids. How can they advertise this as a device for old people? Why didn't I check the product forums first? DON'T MAKE MY MISTAKE! READ THE FORUMS.
title: KNOWN SOUND ISSUE!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Kevin
content: I bought the gen 2 Alexa Show with the aim to use it in the kitchen, to use it as a screen for some Ring devices, and to view web videos when I'm cooking. Big issues: Ring integration: The Ring integration sucks. When motion is detected or a doorbell press happens, you should have the option to have the Show automatically display the Ring camera that's reporting in. Web video: I had aims to use the device to watch Youtube videos and read about the workarounds that exist for the device inexplicably not having a Youtube app (due to some Amazon tiff with Google). I thought I could get around this by using the integrated browsers, but this really doesn't work well. The browsers seem to expunge cookies every time you switch to the home screen, so you get logged out. Youtube, Youtube TV and DirecTV online viewing are basically non-starters. Who the heck uses Hulu? Audio mic: Our old first gen Alexa (not the show version) had no issues understanding us when being asked to do something. This gen 2 Alexa Show has a much harder time picking up requests and many times we have to repeat the requests multiple times before it figures it out. Lack of recipe content: There are tons of simple recipes that I ask for that just aren't found. This highly touted functionally of this device pretty much stinks. On the plus side, the sound quality is pretty good. The screen looks fine and is bright enough.
title: Lack of ability to play Youtube videos is terrible, Ring integration is weak, voice pickup not good

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Mindcrime
content: While I liked the original Echo Show, it often felt like a version 1 of a product. I didn't care very much for the design of the product, the looks, and the screen size/quality. When Amazon offered deep discounts on the new Echo Show if you traded-in your 1st gen Show, I decided to take the plunge. We mostly use our Echo's for listening to Amazon Music, and for the price the Echo's, including the Show, performed well. Gen 1 of the Show had good but not great sound.  The screen was good but not great. Gen 2 addresses both of these issues and as a result, the product feels and looks like what the Show should have been all along. This biggest and best part of the gen 2 Show is the screen. The screen is basically the whole front of the device and it looks really good. Out of the box I had to adjust the brightness as the default setting was too low. Everything on the gen 2 screen looks good. From song lyrics to 5 day weather forecast, the screen is bright, clear, and with good resolution. I recently purchased the Amazon Fire Recast device which allows you to stream "over air" TV to your Fire devices and to your Echo Show. On the gen 1 Show, watching tv was difficult because of the screen size and quality. With gen 2 Show, watching TV is much better. The screen size and clarity fo the screen make watching local news/tv a pleasure. The screen is nice enough that streaming Prime Videos is nice as well. The sound on gen 2 is also improved. The sound is louder and fuller. Out of the box the bass is too much and drowned out the rest of the music. The Show has an equalizer setting that allows you to adjust the bass and treble. The gen 1 Show did not come close to the sound regular Echo's can provide so I generally listened to music over the Echo's rather than the Echo Show, unless specifically in the kitchen where my Show is located. Now with gen 2, the sound is good enough that it is not a compromise. The big question is, is the gen 2 worth the upgrade from gen 1?  Absolutely, especially if you can get it at the discounted prices. At full price it is still a good upgrade but may not be worth it depending on your particular use. For me, listening to music and watching TV improvements would make the full price a generally good value.
title: Nice upgrade to original version

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Scott C. Voth
content: Amazon had a nice discount on this for Prime day so I decided to upgrade my gen 1 Show.  It has a much bigger screen and the sound seems to be better too.  I was trying to decide between this and a Show 8 which is slightly smaller but a lot cheaper with the Prime Day deals.  I decided to go with this because of the better speakers and have been pleased so far.
title: A nice Improvement from Gen 1.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: TSpencer
content: Two main things I don't like is how the plug goes into the back of the unit. It sticks straight out so you can't have it up against the wall on the kitchen counter without bending the wire, and I am afraid it will eventually damage it. So it sits out a few inches taking up more counter space. The second, bigger issue, is the one with the sound cutting off and having to be unplugged to reboot to get the sound back. This is a KNOWN issue and I really wish they would come up with an update to fix it. I don't know what sets it off so it's not like I can just "not" do whatever it is. It would be really nice if this had an easier to access web browser so I could get to recipes easily. I still end up using my tablet propped against the wall for that. The sound is great but it would be nice if it were a little more customizable as the bass is a little too heavy. The screen is a nice size, it integrated well with my other home automation such as lights and outlets. I haven't done any video calling on it so cannot speak as to how well that works out.
title: Small issues add up

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: flamingoland
content: This came as a bonus on black friday with my phone.  My son was away in the military and I thought we could use it to skype.  If there are specific things you need echo for, be sure it 'does' it first.  Had to go all around the mulberry bush to get that to work.  On top of it, Amazon has discontinued its music/streaming service that allows you to upload YOUR music and listen to it, the main reason I even have echo (I have another one, not a show).  I have thousands of songs, mostly local and odd live performances from festivals I film and local shows that are not available commercially, and why on earth should I PAY amazon for music I own?  I talked to chat and they were no help and I will not longer recommend echo products as that's the main reason I use them.  Otherwise, it's just an expensive turn on the tv paperweight!!!
title: came free with my new samsung phone

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Oceans24
content: So the Spots went down the tubes and they don't plan to fix them. So I replaced them  with the Show's - the 8in and 10in. Well , Surprise! Surprise! Don't buy the 2nd gen 10.1 unless you want to see a sleeping screen almost 100% of the time on it! Grrr! Don't waste time on the settings. It's not you. I had it confirmed by their tech department today.  Only after fooling around with it for the past several days. They did a software update and it changed it by causing the screen to sleep right away with no control/options to change it. While we are use to having our other devices with screens awake all the time, you can forget it on their biggest brightest best screened device (oh and most expensive too). The 10 .1 2nd generation no longer stays awake. It goes to sleep and stays there until you wake it up. Very frustrating. Either don't buy it or plan to return it unless you like this. Frankly, I can't stand it. It will do this while you have music playing,  and I've read even while recipes and other things are going.  I haven't tried videos. I don't think I can bring myself to do it. And, what is the point of having things rotating on a screen ( which by the way was something else we had to get used to that we didn't like and couldn't turn off) but once you could get used to that with at least the items you liked, now you don't even have that going because they disappear to a sleeping Screen? I just don't get it. My only thinking is they want to protect their warranty on this beautiful display by having it go to sleep. I asked the tech department if they plan to put through a software update to keep it awake or at least give you a choice. Guess what, no idea. I wish Amazon would get it together and please the customer. I wonder if they asked anybody first. I'm thinking I'll return it and just get another 8. Hopefully they won't do it to that in another update. I... Just... Don't... Get... Amazon.
title: Warning! Don't buy it.. sleeping screen almost 100% of the time on the 2nd Gen

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: eoz
content: My main purpose for buying this was to use Skype to chat with my mom. Since chat is currently one of the few apps that allows group video chat, I thought I could chat with her and others at same time via the Echo Show. However please note that group chat via Skype on the Echo Show does not work. Only worked when did person to person video call. I feel there should have been some mention that if Echo supports Skype it does so without full features. I submitted a question before buying but nobody knew the answer to I'm writing this review to save others the need to buy then return. Also not while the device itself is nice (big screen and great speakers) the software takes no advantage of having a screen for input purposes. You control this completely by saying "okay alexa" which for me personally isn't ideal. Also there were suggested videos that you had limit control over and really didn't want to see. Overall, they could have made a much better device if the software was applied differently on many fronts.
title: Good hardware, horrible software

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Mark
content: I have 2 of these, accompanied by other, various echos, and the place where these ones shine is that nice, big screen. It may be sort of frivolous, but I like seeing random pictures and information on screens in my house throughout the day; It makes everything feel so high-tech, like I'm living in the future! The rotating imagery also kind of refreshes the feel of my house--Like, it's not always the same view when I look into a room where they are. I like that there are a couple of browser options, because aside from Alexa skills, if you have an internet browser, you can put anything you want to on the screen. Time and temperature resting screens are great too--They're like extra clocks. One drawback is the sound. It's plenty powerful, with 2x 2.2" speakers, but the sound layout is kind of a let down. Unlike the Echo Show 5, there are no front(under) slots for forward sound, and the feel of the audio is a more distant sensation as it bounces off the walls behind them before reaching me. This gives a very bassy(I like bass!) sound, but crisp treble is lost, and the audio in general feels very detached from the screen that I'm looking at. The only other drawback is that it doesn't have a physical cover slide for the camera, which can be forgiven, as this idea didn't come out until the Echo Show 5. Later versions will probably have this. With all considered, They are very sturdy units, and I got screen protectors for them to make them more durable. Having a nice-size screen with all Alexa features in a room that you spend a lot of time in is amazing. I'd recommend these if you have the cash, and are looking for a new toy. If you catch them on sale, don't waste the opportunity. For music only, go with the new Echo (3rd gen), which is essentially an Echo Plus (2nd gen), minus the smart home hub, and on-board thermometer(I actually love the on-board thermometer on mine!).
title: Amazing device!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Michael6296
content: Like the concept, but for me, its just another echo at a higher price. I have 3 echos, 6 Dots and a tap so I have experience with these products, but still find this one awkward to use. When you play a song, lyrics scroll. So if you like karaoke at hope, you'll like this. The connectivity with blink cameras (the reason I purchased) is underwhelming. I expected to see all 10 of my cameras on the screen, get alerts etc. Instead, no alerts and I have to ask for which camera I want to see, remembering all 10 names. So once I get an alert on my phone, I can then use the device to ask to see a live feed. I might just be an Alexa eShow dummy, but I liken this to my short lived Google Glass experience.
title: Mixed review. Kind of Underwhelming

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Don Jones
content: The Eco Show is a great product and a lot of fun to have around the house. If you have an Amazon Eco or Eco Dot, the Eco Show is a must have! The Eco Show is compatible with both the Eco and Eco Dot and the Show is very easy to set up, it‚Äôs almost completely ready out of the box! And the sound from the Eco Show is awesome! You can adjust bass, treble, etc. The screen is huge and very clear. I don‚Äôt watch movies on my Eco Show, but one could and it would be a great devise to do that on. I have my Eco Show, Eco and Eco Dot synced up so I can hear my Amazon music all through my apartment!! It sounds awesome! The cost of the Eco Show is reasonable! There‚Äôs not enough room on this review to tell you what all the Eco Show does. I would recommend if you‚Äôre thinking of purchasing one to go on UTube, they‚Äôre several reviews on there that gives you a great idea as to what the Eco Show can do. I can tell you that all the reviews are positive! Mine was a Birthday gift from my family and I love it!!
title: Eco Show is a Must Have

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: herodotus
content: Update: do not buy this product. It has major software problems with zigbee support. I had  power outage yesterday and after rebooting all of my Philips hue zigbee lights went offline  and can not be added back. Nothing works. Tech support was useless. Everything was on surge protectors and many on ups. All lights work manually but they will not connect to the show and the deleting and readding  does  it work.  Alexa software updates are not well tested. The GOOD: The Echo Show 2nd Gen (10‚Äù) device is awesome. We‚Äôve had it for a couple weeks and really enjoy it. The audio quality is superb. The screen is crystal clear and bright. MICs seem to be good at picking up requests without issue. The BAD: We really want to mount it on the wall but there are only two companies that sell mounts. One is USA based Humancentric and the other ATOPHK (chinese). The Humancentric mount is two flimsy. The ATOPHK design looks ok and appears to be better designed than the Humancentric mount - the company seems a bit questionable. No web site. All the writing has very poor grammar. Makes me nervous to trust a $250 device to  a company like that. I wish Amazon would provide a wall mount that has  pivot and rotation capabilities. We want to mount it so that it could be seen by the person cooking then rotated to the kitchen table so we can play games like trivia from the table. UPDATE: I bought the ATOPHK mount. It works. But some issues. See my review about it. The mount is a bit over priced. But quality is good. The UGLY (and this is really bad and thus the 2 stars): There are MAJOR flaws  with the Alexa App and Echo devices regarding Zigbee support. I have a bunch of bugs open with amazon on this issue and this is the sole reason i gave the Show 10 two stars. If you have a Echo Studio, Show 10, or Echo Plus they have a Zigbee hub in them. Zigbee is a low power low bandwidth home automation protocol for devices like Philips Hue bulbs, water sensors, and door/window sensors. The issues: 1) amazon never took into account what would happen if the echo with Zigbee (ZB) support died or was replaced (upgraded to a show 10 in my case). If you have a bunch of ZB devices (we have 9 hue bulbs) that the echo w/ ZB support goes offline then all the ZB devices go offline as expected BUT if you have other echo devices with ZB support (we had a Echo plus and bought a Show 10 and Studio) they will NOT automatically pick-up control of the ZB device. Amazon failed to implement multi-master or master/slave failover. So if you have critical devices using Echo‚Äôs as the ZB hub and that Echo dies even if you have other Echo w/ ZB support online they will NOT be able to take control the ZB devices. Not good. Especially if you are not at home if the Echo w/ ZB dies. 2) If you go into the Alexa App you can NOT migrate the ZB devices to another Echo device. There is NO way to do in the app. 3) if you deregister Echo w/ ZB support in an attempt to force them to ‚Äúfailover‚Äù to another echo. All the ZB devices attached to the device disappear from the devices list AND from all your routines. With NO warning. This is really bad. 4) if you are using Philip Hue bulbs you have to manually go to EVERY device to migrate them to the new Echo device.  you have to go into Alexa App, then go ‚ÄúAdd Device‚Äù, press help  (?) button, scroll do to zigbee unpairing question, select it, then go down to section about philips hue bulbs, go to the bulb to get the serial number, enter into screen. The app will then reset the bulbs association with the old echo  and rediscover it. At which point you need to manually add it back to all the groups and routines.  It took me over an hour to deassociate and rediscover the bulbs, and then add them into the right groups and routines and retest everything. Ugh! BTW, The amazon plugs controlled by the Echo ‚Äúfailed over‚Äù to the new Echo Show and Studio fine. This problem only appears to be related to Zigbee support. Amazon really need to redo the entire Zigbee support for the Echo product line and Alexa app. These types of problems are not software bugs but a major flaw in the design of how they engineered ZB support and severely hampers the use of the Echo devices to be used in home automation - especially for critical components like sensors.
title: Great device, MAJOR FLAWS with zigbee support. (Updated review)

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Leonard J. Mullen
content: Let me start by saying I own two of the 10" Shows, an 8, a 5, and five (5) Gen 1 Echo Shows plus a Recast, an Echo Auto, an Echo Connect, and four Dots.  The Echo Show 10 is the very best Echo device.  Rather than repeat what others have posted, let's stipulate to the fact that the Echo Show 10 has great speakers, a terrific HD display, and really good mics.  I'll use this space to explain how I use these devices.  In my opinion, what you can do with the Echo Show 10 is at least as important as how well it does those things.  I bought this particular Show 10 from Best Buy along with a Show 5 and a smart LED bulb for $179.99.  Same price I paid for my first Gen 1 Show. ********** How I use my Echo Show 10 ********** I have a Show 10 on my kitchen counter. While I'm planning and cooking meals, I direct Alexa to add ingredients to my shopping list. I ask her for recipes for whatever I am in the mood for. I ask her how much does a bell pepper weigh (because I dice and freeze mine when they are on sale and recipes often call for one medium bell pepper, etc.). And I set timers -- "Alexa set a fourteen minute timer for ribeye", "Alexa set an eight minute timer for lobster." When I make jerky, I set eight jerky timers to remind me to change the temperature or rotate the trays. Names come in handy if you are cooking Thanksgiving dinner at the same time. I can check the timers from any Show. This time of year, I like to cook outside. The Echo Show's AC networking allows me to take radio, television, and the world wide web with me. I have one on my desk at work. I have a lot of smart devices in my home -- especially lights and especially in the kitchen. I don't leave lights on at night. I can simply direct Alexa to "Turn on sink" or "Turn on Kitchen" (Kitchen is all the lights I use in the kitchen). This comes in handy when you are up to your elbows in dishes and the sun decides to set. It comes in handy when you need a midnight snack too. The Echo Show 10 has a built in Zigbee hub so you can control Zigbee devices without the need for a separate hub. Most of the time, Alexa is entertaining me. I have a collection of photos playing as my background. The Echo Show 10 is an excellent digital frame. I listen to radio stations -- music, talk radio. Alexa keeps track of my favorites. When I select a radio station or album on one Show, the rest add it to their 'recent' lists. Very handy. I have a Recast, so I can stream Free TV to my Shows. I can also watch Pluto in a browser. I have an electric fireplace insert that looks really great, but it doesn't make any sound. I have a first gen Show tucked behind the insert. When I run the fireplace, I direct Alexa to play fireplace sounds and to turn off the display. I have a Show 10 in my bedroom. I bought the Show 8 to replace this so I can slide a cover over the camera when I want privacy. (Just kidding. My kid already told me he is taking it back to school. Turns our his privacy is more important than mine.) The Show 5 and Show 8 have mechanical shutters for the camera. Sometimes I work from home. The Show is great for voice calls. It's great background noise (TV/Radio) when I am 'mostly' working. I set an alarm to get me up 'weekdays'. I left a first gen Show at my mother's house. I have it configured so I can 'drop in' if she does not answer the call. I have an Echo Connect installed, so every device offers to pick up when my landline rings. I put a first gen Show in my dog's pen. Initially I put it in there so I could drop in on him when the automatic feeder rotates to make sure it was working as expected and to see how he was reacting to it. (After a short time, he stood over the feeder and barked when he was hungry.) He was alone all day and I could drop in on him. Not sure what he thought of it, but he would get out of bed and bark back at me, so... You can interact with the ecosystem using a phone app. So, my shopping list, calendar, and contacts are in my pocket. I can drop in on any Show from anywhere as long as I have my phone. Use one as a baby monitor for secure monitoring. With Prime Days just around the corner (I guess), I bought one of each model of the Show into work. It was like a carnival. One guy googled things to ask Alexa. (If you have one, say, "Alexa, I am your father.") We discovered trivia games, math quizzes, and a thousand different ways to interact with Alexa. Amazon offers exclusive deals via the Echo devices. I secure purchases with a PIN since the Show makes it SO easy to buy stuff from Amazon. Communication is an improvement opportunity. Sure, you can call people or drop in on other Echos, but we are talking about 1x1 communication. Everyone else is doing 1xM or MxM. Amazon ought to work on a 'party line' feature that would let the family get together. Other than that I have no complaints. The browser experience could use some attention as well. My main beef with the web browsers is that after a period of inactivity, the Show returns to the home screen. If you are watching a video or following a recipe, you have to continuously touch the screen to prevent this. Best accessories for the Echo Show are 1) smart phone, 2) Recast, and 3) Connect. Your smart phone is just a portable, cellular, battery powered, very tiny Echo Show. The Recast lets you watch free TV on your Shows. The Connect turns every Echo device into a landline.
title: Terrific kitchen assistant -- and a whole lot more!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: C'est Moi
content: It sounds great, looks great. However, it's quite big to be placed on a side table or any table. At the same time the processing power of this thing is terrible. Doing a web search or YouTube search takes me back a few years of all the smart device development I've seen. Very slow. Screen should've been FullHD for the dimension 10". Due to its size sitting on the side table it's in close proximity to the eyes almost as close as a tablet computer usually is. But where a tablet at this price range can be found with FullHD screen (in fact fire HD tablets) this comes with HD (720p) only. Lastly the price on this is doesn't seem worth it, given its lacking in processing and screen quality. I think for base price show 5 at $75, show 8 at $100 and this show 10 (2nd gen) at $150 is ideal for what it offers. This show would be worth $200 to me if it had 1080p screen and had faster processing capabilities.
title: Sounds great but the screen, the internals and the price...

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Traci A Vidal
content: The Alexa Show is a big pile of poo.  I have to shut it off and restart it constantly (per their tech support advise) as well as disconnect it from our internet and then reconnect it every time I use it. It doesn‚Äôt switch between windows while it is idle. It just shows what you should say for the things you like and want to see like the news. I have had it for two months and it has red lined me three times. It is really frustrating. It may be going back. My lap top sitting on the counter works better.  How ever if you want it just for music it works nicely and the sound is great. But I would have gotten a blue tooth speaker if I needed just music.
title: Not worth the money.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: GE7EA
content: First off I'll say that I like my echo devices for the most part. I was given a "TAP" as a gift and that was awesome. It's a bluetooth speaker and an ECHO device. I've since purchased 2 DOTS, a ECHO, and ECHO SHOW for my 88 year old father, which led me to get one for myself after not being able to video chat with him using Skype on my IPAD. I was excited to get it and to call him, but there was no audio. Amazon support did their job but it wasted a day, and I feel like they should have offered a replacement after the first tech chat session. I reset the device to factory, checked for software update and still nothing. They said they would check with their resources.....I left for work,. Upon returning home I tried again and nothing, so I chatted and tried to change the EQ and enable voice screen and they then told me they would request a replacement.  They should have done that from the start. I hope the replacement works.
title: Prime Day Deal????

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: LegoDad
content: I've been using the Echo devices since their inception.  I was fortunate enough to get into an early adoption queue. It's amazing how embedded into my daily life these things have become.  I use them for so many things - from morning repeating reminders to get my son his ADD medicine to timers for cooking and my favorite, adding things to my shopping list.  I love being able to just ask for a song and have it play. Weather forecasts, current temp outside, news synopsis...  It has become such an integral part of our household. The Echo Show was a nice addition, I liked the screen, especially when it came to monitoring multiple timers, or being able to look at lists without having to use the app.  But it was a bit small for use across the room, so some things I didn't ask unless I was closer to it. This new one removes that restriction.  Screen is huge, seeing the two side by side is just amazing.  It's bigger than I had expected just from reading the specs and measurements.  Screen is vibrant and crisp, text is clear and photos are well displayed. My son loves that there are so many genres of jokes he can ask. I love that the Echo is one of the central parts of my automated home.  Switches all over the house, lights, thermostat and video cameras - I love being able to just ask to see a camera and seeing it, or turning lights on and off, or changing the temperature of the house.  I was happy before the Echo devices to be able to do all that from the cell phone, but it's even more useful now that the Echo can control so many things.  Works well with IFTTT but I still prefer the skills where it can directly access something. There just isn't a downside.  I'm passing my V1  Echo Show to my mother, who also received my V1 Echo when I upgraded to the newer little cylinder tower for the V2 Echo.  And I've given her my old V1 dot when I got the newer dot.  It's nice having them in a few places around the house.  The dot in my bedroom is my only alarm clock I use anymore, despite having a nice Philips glow light wakeup system...  It is just so much easier to say, "Alexa, set alarm for 6 AM," than to hit the buttons on the alarm clock.  Especially when you're setting different times for different days. And even for napping sometimes - just tell it what time to sound the alarm, and take a little nap without worrying about napping too long and screwing up your sleep schedule. Worth every penny for my household, wouldn't be without one anymore...
title: Worthy upgrade from Version 1

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Catal Breen
content: This is, by far, the most useless and bug infested (by this I mean technically flawed) piece of smart home equipment in the Amazon Alexa family.  I thought this would be great as a cooking assistant in the kitchen but it has a life of its own. It plays random videos without any instruction.  It then goes into modes where it responds to no commands at all. It literally sits unplugged in my kitchen 70% of the time.  I honestly should throw it out but having paid over $200 for it, I keep hoping a new software update will at some point fix some of its flaws and make this paperweight into something useful. Amazon, you should honestly be ashamed of this product, but hey, Microsoft thought Windows Vista was a good idea once upon a time.  You can make up for this by pulling it off the shelves and making something that doesn‚Äôt suck to take its place. For real...like now.
title: So bad....this is Amazon‚Äôs ‚ÄúWindows Vista‚Äù idea

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Marilyn
content: I love  my Echo Show.  I first saw one of these while visiting a friend and had to go out and buy one the next day. First of all, I am totally ignorant when it comes to this kind of technology but from the minute I took it out of the box and plugged it  in the  on screen step by step instructions had it operational in no time. Now when I want to know sports scores, listen to a certain song I suddenly thought about from years ago, find out what movies are playing near me, etc I just ask Alexa. While playing music the sound is excellent. Yesterday I thought I had a problem with it since Alexa was not responding so I logged onto the Amazon Echo web site and in less than a minute I discovered what the problem was. The customer rep, Miranda, whom I could actually understand because she had no accent, was so helpful and knew immediately what I needed to do. I was actually embarrassed how simple the solution was.
title: So Easy to Use

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Tara Devine
content: I am incredibly disenchanted with the ‚ÄúTry‚Äù phrases on the bottom of the screen that cannot be removed. It is ridiculous and I am considering returning it. Why won‚Äôt Amazon allow this to be removed? If one knows how to ask Alexa and get new skills, why do they need a big bold phrase saying ‚ÄúTry ‚ÄúAlexa tell me how to open a tight jar.‚Äù How absolutely stupid. I know how to ask Alexa if I want and can also use Goo*8e. Any word about whether this will be an option in a future update - I was able to get rid of it on my Show 5 (I don‚Äôt mind one flash of it as long as it then goes away). I would keep it and order another if they made this optional. Doubt Amazon will even care about this review which is also disappointing.
title: Not sure I can live with ‚ÄúTry this‚Äù boldly on the screen at all times

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Sisco Muniz
content: So far, I'm happy with this Echo Show 2nd Generation.  The sound is great and you can adjust Bass, Midrange and Treble to your liking. Mine didn't include a User Manual, just set up instructions so I had to go online to check out user features and controls. Unit pretty much stays on and responds to light sensors. While room is dark it is on sleep mode displaying a dim clock, date and temperature.  To power off press and hold mic/camera mute button. Not a lot of user apps except for Tubi, YouTube, Hulu and Prime Video (if you're a subscriber). For Music, you have Pandora, iHeart, Prime Audio. Audible,  Kindle also works with this device. I'm able to turn on/off Lights, TV, Received and Fan from my bedroom. This device does not have a camera cover but you can mute camera and mic with a button. With my Prime account I'm able to watch HBO on this device.
title: Excellent

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Lisa R. Beaver
content: After reading many reviews we purchased the show and are very happy with it. We already had a couple Dots and a Spot in our home. The sound quality is great for what it is. We uploaded photos to our Prime account and created an album that rotates for our background. While some may find the different pop ups annoying, we enjoy them. I can see where some would like a way to turn them off, but our house enjoys seeing and frequently clicks on the snippets. The pip ups also help us to learn new skills a available with Alexa.  We frequently use this with our Premium Prime music and the family enjoys seeing the lyrics. It‚Äôs nice to also view particular items on Prime we are interested in buying. Prime videos are not what you might expect, but we didn‚Äôt buy this solely to watch movies, though we do at times, while cooking. Overall we‚Äôre very happy with this purchase.
title: Happy

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Tatiana G.
content: üë∏My house is, and will probably forever be, owned by Alexa!üë∏ First, let me say, that I bought the Echo 2nd Generation, and the Google Hub at the very same time, just to try them both out. And boy, I could not send that Google Hub back to where it came from fast enough! It may be great for smart home only users, but it is no fun or really that useful, other than that, at all! You cannot even get answers or videos that come even close to what Google gives you on your cell phone!! And, it is not for the sight impaired- meaning me. If I needed to know the time after 6pm, I asked Alexa. I don't get it... And, oh yeah baby! I love lyric mode on this thing! This bad boy can rock your booty off, for sure! The bass vibrates everything on my kitchen counter! I love it!! I call mine Alexxx sometimes... it answers, most of the time, no matter which name- Alexa or Alexxx. I do wish it had a man's voice, sometimes.... really could use hearing one once in a while! It's kinda funny, sometimes, I just get ignored- similar to a man lol. Like, when I asked her to repeat the same song for the tenth time. Or, she will just decide that I need to listen to a certain playlist, instead of said song. It's annoying, but sometimes the first song is so good, it gets me to listen. Still... If I say play this song, and she says, I'll play "this" instead, it's rude! Another thing I absolutely love, is watching YouTube. I've saved my Channel to the homepage in the Silk Browser, so all I have to do is just tell it to open YouTube. It goes straight to my homepage. I can go to or watch my subscription feed and playlists, go to my watched history, watch recommended videos, and easily search for anything I would like to watch. It is so quick and easy to navigate! My most favorite thing to watch, is Criminal trials, and they last for weeks. So, while I'm working in the kitchen doing other things, or just sitting around the table, I can pick up where I left off on my Fire Stick, and watch them right there on my echo. I can search the internet for anything! I can type it in, or make it even faster by using my voice and just hitting the enter key on the onscreen keyboard. I've heard a lot of people complain that there are too many steps to do things on the Echo. But, I can get to anywhere on mine almost as quickly as I can on my regular computer. I hate to say that I haven't ventured out into the many, many things this thing can do, other than these few things, but they're the ones that I enjoy. One day, I'll try venturing out into unchartered territory for myself on this lovely device. I know I can tell you one thing is for certain. I will definitely be buying more of these wonderful, booty shaking, singing to the top of my lungs, mind blowing gadgets very soon! I just have to have them in several rooms! I highly, highly, highly recommend the Echo 2nd Generation to everyone! REALLY, EVERYONE!!
title: üé∂üéµüé∂ It's all about that bass, bout that bass, bout that bass ~ and bringin' booty back üé∂üéµüé∂

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: John B
content: I thought I would love it. . . I started with google but the speaker died 8 months later and customer service was horrible... so I switched to amazon Alexa. I like the speakers a lot, but I have spent more hours then I care to admit with customer service on the devices with camera's. The camera is fuzzy when your drop in... it takes several moments to clear up... sometimes longer. Hulu works great... Spotify works great... asking questions, great,  custom service is great and they are so fast to respond, they switched out the device, they just don't know how to fix it. nothing else works... No Netflix, prime, Plex, sometimes the browser its self is less then helpful.... and the device freezes up. today it started beeping for no reason. I couldn't figure out why. I finally factory reset it and it stopped... I don't know why this has happened but unfortunately I would not recommend this to anyone just because it has been a headache. just use a computer, tablet or something else... If something changes I'll update this review.
title: I was so excited

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: MEW
content: The larger the better in my book. Sound seems better than 1st iteration. Much easier to use bue to size and videos are more easily distinguishable. It will auto reconnect to wifi in case of internet or power outage which happens here frequently as with Echo Spot but the screen size and sound quality is so much more impressive, I just wish Alexa knew more historically significant info, geographic areas of the world and you could select multiple languages for responses. It would be handy to have someone else who understood French, German, Spanish, Russian and Italian on whom to practice. No one else remembers any of their language training and it makes it tough to keep current. Just a thought for improvement for future updates. Please. Size of screen also makes it easier to see my son and his large family in another state and Alexa often helps me locate my iPhones by dialing until I can locate them by vibration if necessary. Alexa has and reinforces good manners which seems to be a dying art in communication.
title: screen larger and more easily seen from a distance and sound bolder

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Jonathan Feist
content: Good looking screen, well performing device that gets loud. Make no mistake, this is not a high resolution TV for streaming your favorite Prime video channels, nor is it the perfect sounding speaker to stream Amazon music, but it does both of those things quite well. There are not many skills that take advantage of the display on this echo device, but I like the simple clock that it is for most of my day. The touch screen performs well and the microphone seems to work better than on my echo dots. In terms of sound, it gets loud and it sounds pretty good, but it does a weird thing with bass. It's almost like there is a dedicated driver for bass, and that it's coupled with a vibration motor, because if you can feel it, it's deeper, right? I don't know what it is, but it's overemphasized to my ears, giving the impression that it's trying too hard to be a great speaker, instead of settling for just being a really good speaker. The mute button is convenient, but I'd have liked to see a shutter for the camera as well. Ultimately, I'd have liked to use this echo device in the bedroom, but not with that camera on it. It shall remain in the 'public' parts of my home. In the end, I can recommend the echo show to anyone looking for a smart speaker with a display, but is invested in the Amazon ecosystem. Amazon really needs to solve this feud with Google, it is a mistake to not have YouTube on this device.
title: A fun way to experience what Alexa can offer.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Summer Tanasi
content: Brand new Echo Show ordered on Prime Day. Zero sound. Saw some online forums this week with other consumers reporting the same issue. Have tried rebooting device and triple checking Bluetooth/WiFi. So disappointed.
title: Sound doesn‚Äôt work

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: soloz2
content: The echo show is a new addition for me.  I picked up a 2nd gen and an echo show 8 on prime day and they are fantastic additions.  I put the 2nd gen in a room I previously had an echo in and put the show 8 in the kitchen to replace the dot I had there.  Both sound a bit better compared to the echo devices they replaced, and having the screen is an excellent addition.  I like being able to watch news while cooking or cleaning.  I am somewhat disappointed in the smart home integration of the 2nd gen.  I picked up some Phillips Hue white and color ambiance bulbs and I had anticipated I could change the color through the touch screen, but you can't.  You can only turn the bulb on or off.  Even changing the brightness has to be done via app.  I haven't played around with voice change of brightness or color, but that is likely possible.
title: Good sounding echo with a great sized screen

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Bonnie K. Graham
content: At first reading so many reviews that addressed dislike for the ad issue with this version of Echo Show I was a little nervous; but was such a great price during Prime Days decided to upgrade my smaller and older version, which I moved to another room. So glad I did, the sound is so impressive and clear don't even worry about a speaker and the photos are bright and clear. I do not find the adds a burden and actually kind of like them as they give me new things to try that I had not even thought of, and I've found some functions through them that I use a lot. I feel this is a much improved version and the larger screen is a joy to work with when using the recipe function. Going to buy several more for Christmas gifts so I'll be able to call face to face with family that live far away. So happy I purchased this and highly recommend.
title: So loving this

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Albert
content: Despite an annoying idiosyncrasy, overall I like the Echo Show. It's nice to have a screen to watch movies and shows in the kitchen while working there, as well as listen to music from a device that has a great sound for its size and designed function. Its annoyance is that the touch feature doesn't respond as your phone or watch does; it has a lag when you tap the screen, and sometimes I have to tap it a couple of times to get it to wake up and respond, particularly when I want to watch movies or shows. Volume control can be the same way sometimes, as well; a slight lag on occasion. Voice response from Alexa is just what you would expect: prompt and on-point, even when there is a lot of background noise going on. Other than that, I really like my Echo Show. And it integrates nicely with our other Echo devices in the house.
title: An integral part of your kitchen

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Matt D.
content: I now have both the original 5" Echo Show and the 10.1" Echo Show. The larger screen, for my old eyes, is good especially for viewing WYZE camera Alexa Skill views while in bed. I'm also very pleased with the enhanced speakers and resultant sound. I could not find a review of the power consumption by the 10.1" Echo Show so I just used my Kill-A-Watt device to determine it pulls .09 amps, 5 watts at idle and 7 watts streaming WWOZ,  a local community radio station. A most excellent improvement! And Alexa seems a bit more attentive with the new microphones, Good Girl!
title: It is an improvement over the original Show.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Shelley P.
content: I was pleasantly surprised how much larger this one was over the original Show.  The screen display is also much better.  The sound quality is also great.  I'm glad I decided to purchase the newest version. After reading some online reviews, I decided to update mine.  First, this isn't my first device. We have one in every room (echo, dot, show - 1st gen, & spot).  Second,  the more you use it,  the better the experience and the better it is for Alexa to understand what you want.  Third, once I figured out how to set up groups and connect all devices, the experience increased significantly.  I can play music in any combination of rooms in my home from my cell phone app.  It's been entertaining randomly starting funny songs on the bathroom dot when my unsuspecting husband is hanging out in there too long!  Fourth, I work from my home office and have my spot on the office desk.  Once I synced my calendar,  it was a game changer! I can see upcoming meetings from anywhere I have a screen or just ask the non-screen devices what's on my schedule.  I LOVE this feature! Finally, having 3 adult children, I bought all of them a 1st gen show, now we can do video calls to each other from different sides of the country at any time since this works both on the screen device and on your cell phone.  This is wonderful and my favorite feature.
title: Much larger and better than the original

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Tina
content: I bought this, so I could "call" my parents, who live in Memory Care. I love that I can "drop in" automatically, without them having to get to the phone.  It works wonderfully.  All I say is "Alexa, drop in on parents" and walla!  It auto-answers on their end, and the video of their room goes opaque for about 10 seconds (for privacy purposes), and the Echo Show "announces" that I am calling them.  I can even mute the call (which also turns off my video), and still see/hear them (they can't see me when I'm muted, but they can see a small video image of their room in the top corner of the Show's screen, so they know they're still on video).  It sits on my desk, so when I'm in between calls/projects, I "drop in" on my parents several times a day.  Great for monitoring my parents (and their caregivers, who are pretty darn good). You can also make 2-way video calls from the Alexa app on your phone.  Not as nice of an experience, but it's nice when you're away from your Echo. The only thing I don't like/understand, is why it's mandatory to associate their contact with a phone number (video calls go over the internet, so they don't need a phone number).  I hope they fix this in the future. To be honest, I haven't used the Echo Show for much else, except to play my favorite radio station, K-LOVE (positive, encouraging).
title: Wonderful option for video calls with aging parents

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Ashlee
content: Through the return/refund period it was cool, but then about 6 months later the political ads started showing up. Nothing but DNC, AOC, biden or pelosy being displayed or CNN headlines every time I walked by. Alexa, don't show Cnn, don't show ___ "I don't understand" and I wasn't able to not show news outlets. Finally it went in the trash. I don't want to be bombed with politics by Alexa. I want a refund, if it was going to be like this it should have been from the beginning. Instead they intentionally withheld the politics until after the return period ran out is the way it looks to me.
title: Politics, DNC politics galore.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: MeghanM
content: This was a gift, so I really wanted to like it. We also have other Alexa devices that haven‚Äôt given us many problems. THE ECHO SHOW WAS A HUGE DISAPPOINTMENT! The voice recognition is awful. It‚Äôs constantly going off during our normal every day conversations in the kitchen, which our regular Echo never did.  It rarely gives me an answer to anything I ask it... all I get is ‚ÄúHmm, I don‚Äôt know that one‚Äù.  (Then I asked Siri and get an immediate answer). I have also tried linking our Amazon Music account to it multiple times and it still doesn‚Äôt recognize it - although it says it‚Äôs connected. I could listen to any song I wanted before, and now it gives me a long spiel to upgrade my account (to what I already pay for) if I want it to play.  I was most excited for the screen but that‚Äôs no better. I‚Äôm always having to swipe or hit buttons more than once.  I‚Äôll definitely be switching back to my original Echo!
title: Hate it!!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Steve Segal
content: Got 2 on Black Friday. Heres my review and criticisms of this device. Im confused and conflicted about this device. I feel like Amazon knows they need to improve on the software. Pros : Sounds amazing - 11/10. Like seriously, the bass on this thing is wow. It's really clear. Now onto the cons.. On my phone, I can touch anywhere, and get a response. There needs to be a back button, there needs to be swipe functionality, like from the bottom up on an iPhone.  Im touching parts of the UI on the Show expecting it to do something, and Im frustrated that I can/cant click on certain things that are or arent obvious. There needs to be a Device list similiar to how I control my devices via my Android on my phone. I can say Alexa (show) turn on Philips Hue. I get the Device, it pops up. I even get a brightness bar. But I cant view any of these devices whatsoever in the 30 Internet-of-thing type devices I have connected to the Alexa ecosystem. What. Why? I dont have friends. I dont use this for making calls or video calls. Thats what phones are for. This product should really be relagated or somehow updated via software to include alot of the features lacking. The homescreen is extremely limited. There needs to be way more access to font sizes, font types, what shows up on the home screen. I mean come on, Google killed it. There needs to be options for screen "timeout". Just take a page from Android 9.0 or whatever. If Amazon takes into account these comments seriously - and I think they do, especially with the always learning doomsday robot named Alexa, she'll probably write code just based on reading this comment. Edit (1 hour later) - Seems Amazon does take these comments seriously. I got a phone call - asking for feedback. Not even an hour after posting this review. I further explained my situation. Interesting. Gave them more feedback on the ecosystem. I think it really comes down to Software. The hardware is great. Few other things mentioned. Im still unsure whether I will be keeping the device. It is cool to note that they do (for obvious reasons, they read the comments) just wasn't expecting a call or anyone to care or read. As busy as they are, and to receive a followup call. Hope my voice recorded feedback helps, Mr. Bezos.
title: Amazing sound - BUT - Lacks basic touchscreen support and software functionality.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Lorac
content: For the most part this 2nd gen Echo Show does what it says.  It still needs to do more things that make use of the screen (for weather and traffic) rather than just print the basic info.  How about a google map with traffic?  full details with pictures and radar for weather?  The most annoying thing is the continually-scrolling "Things to Try" that cannot be turned off.  While displaying nice pictures from a recent family wedding I see things across the bottom of the screen like "Try Alexa tell me a horse joke" or "Try Alexa tell me something weird" etc etc NON-STOP.  My first intention was to "try" this Echo Show and see how much I liked it and then get another one for the main floor of the house (this one is in my office) and another one for the vacation house but because I can't tun of the "Things to try" on the screen I won't be buying another one.
title: "Things to Try" on home screen is beyond annoying, I won't be buying another one!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Lawana Stewart
content: Alexa is an awesome A.I. permanent house guest!! We love interacting with the Alexa echo show! Every morning we check the weather! She's great for reminders, recipes, radio, timers, games, history questions, jokes, so many free apps, calling my sisters, music, or music on demand with a minimal small fee! Worth every penny of it! It's a tad cheaper to ask Alexa to sign you up for Amazon Unlimited music! If you have an elderly parent who isn't very tech savvy, this is idea, as you can personally set it to auto answer when you video call to check in. I actually think this is a small safety net for elderly parents, family members! So easy to use! Just like the Commercial, they will be asking her questions and playing their favorite songs!
title: Best Permanent A.I. House Guest ever!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: AftrBrnr
content: So, where to begin?  How about with the Good: Screen - nice size, bright and vivid Sound - nice, room-filling sound Unit design - nice aesthetics, but functionally lacking without a stand - As far as the Bad or weak points, there are quite a few, but fortunately these *could* be resolved with policy or software changes: Performance - overall, it's a fairly sluggish compared to my other devices.  This could be issues with code, hardware or servers - there's no way I can say for sure either way.  Hopefully, it's something that can be remedied on the AMZ side. Screen - there's not much to watch on it.  Or rather, it's really hard to find anything worth watching.  Your choices are Amazon Video or Hulu. > No Netflix > No casting from other devices > No Plex video (music works fine) > No SlingTV (we're a Sling house, not a Hulu house) > No YouTube (note - there's a workaround to get to YT by using an included browser, but it's slow and awkward. Additionally, finding what you want on Amazon Video is painful on this device.  Videos I can easily locate on a phone, tablet or set top box are nearly impossible to locate. All in all, it feels a lot more like the Fire Phone than it does a Fire tablet, in that it seems geared more to sell stuff than it is to meet consumers needs or demands . Unit design - as a counter-top device, it REALLY needs to be up off the counter a bit more. Otherwise, there's a good chance that at some point a spill will ruin it.  I bought the ATOPHK stand  for an additional $44 (ouch!).  It's a great stand, but something like this really should be included with a "premium" product like this that is meant for the table/counter. I bought this Echo Show because I love gadgets, but only because it was on sale.  I wouldn't have purchased it at full price and, having bought it and experienced it's limitations first-hand, I'm not sure I would buy it again until the functionality/compatibility is expanded significantly.  As it stands, a $29 Echo Dot connected to my home system via bluetooth has 90+% of the value I get from the Show. Your mileage and desired usage may vary! Note to Amazon:  I *really* want to like this a lot more than I do.  Tweak up the speed and give me more access to other sources and you'll have a 6-star product. -- .:: 3-month update ::. The above observations and opinions are unchanged, both good and bad.  But I've found something else that I think is worth mentioning.  I found that video surveillance of any kind is slow / delayed significantly. I've tried BlinkXT2's, as well as several budget-friendly Dericam cameras (via Monocle) and both had a serious 12-18 second delay on the Echo Show.  For instance, the pizza delivery guy was ringing my doorbell before I saw his car pull in my drive. There is nearly no delay when viewing the same video streams from either camera on the phone apps, both on wifi and off.  Also, network monitoring shows my bandwidth is far from saturated.  That being the case, I can say with a fair bit of certainty the issue is with the Show and not the cameras or network.  My guess is there's a shoddy x264 codec in there somewhere, or the overall hardware's just not up to the task. Either way, I'm keeping it at 3 stars for the looks and sound quality, but I'm still largely unimpressed.
title: Slightly underwhelmed but hopeful. Overall rating at this time: meh.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Tom Davis
content: For the first year of owning this product, there were no issues.  Occasionally I would have to repeat the wake word to get the device to listen to me, but that is a trivial issue. The bigger issue occurred right after the replacement and support window ended (1 year).  I no longer can get sound out of this device at all.  No audio confirmations, no music streaming, no weather or news...basically, the reason I use my device outside of Amazon Photos integration is ruined.  I have attempted factory resets, power cycles, you name it.  Not being able to receive a replacement at this point is deeply disappointed, and I hesitate to purchase another unit because of the issues I'm seeing now.
title: Audio Stopped Working After Just Over One Year

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: J King
content: A bit lame for $200.  For $400 I could get an iPad Mini and do 1000X more than this will do.  Not very customizable visually at all.  I can change the background and turn a few home screen options on or off.  Trending Topics is totally irrelevant to me.  I searched for ways to replace it with trending news stories from news sources that I like. So far there is no way to do this, even though this would be a very simple feature to add and would be much more useful than the trending topics.  Finding good skills (i.e. apps) is difficult.  For every 5 star skill available, there are fifty 1 star skills you have to look through.  I do like the suggestions that cycle at the bottom of the screen. Try ‚ÄúAlexa ...‚Äù.  This is actually useful along with the email they send you once a week with the same kind of tips.  Overall, the UI is extremely basic and boring though.  At this rate, you should wait for maybe the 5th generation if they are even still making these that long.  The 2nd generation is unimpressive and I honestly feel like I wasted my money.  Stick with the Echo Dot which is more reasonably priced.
title: Very Boring Visually

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Diana M. Anderson
content: I got the Alexa show last July.  It was my 1st show, but my 4th alexa in my home. It doesnt like to connect or sync with the others. Such as playing music in every room. Sometimes it works but mostly not. The other 3 work well together. The same with asking it to play a station or music channel. The other 3 will find a channel and play all day. The show somedays will but often wont. Today I keep asking it to play a praise and worship station. It just plays the one song and quits. When I ask again, it plays that same song again. I have tried factory reboot several times. That helps for a few days. But sometimes it just works by itself. I love having the words to the songs. Finding a recipe. But it is beyond frustrating to not be able to have it play for the day. If I ask to play a regular radio station it will. But then I have to listen to commercials and a dj.
title: I want to love it

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: H. Lockett
content: Hated it. Everything it does, my phone already does. That whole "it's only listening when you wake it up" is bunk. It would light up the second it heard a footfall, any footfall, anywhere in the vicinity. Worst part, when I downloaded the app to my phone, it diverted phone calls, and I missed them. Do we really need every single thing connected? Seriously? I guess I'm now officially of that "your music's too loud and get off my lawn" generation. Expensive toy that is completely unnecessary. There is such a thing as too much tech.
title: Didn't Really Want It, Got Talked Into It

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: CathyC
content: I was so excited about getting one of these.  A family member has one and I LOVED it.  Granted they paid half the price I did but, if it did the same and worked then the price would be worth it.  IT DID NOT live up to the hype and the price was not worth trying to figure out why it did not recognize my commands.  Even the HELP center couldn't figure it out and just gave me a free return label.  Great now I have to look elsewhere for a better product.  It seem to be fine with the installing and pairing but every time I asked for something NOTHING.  YES I am tech savvy and followed all the prompts still nothing!  Another tidbit they don't disclose is you need a subscription to AMAZON prime for movies, TV, music.  No other services can be used (i.e. NETFLIX, HULU, ITUNES MUSIC etc.) that is a BIG requirement to leave off the description.  I expect a full refund.  I have been an AMAZON shopper for years and this is the biggest disappointment I have had and the price was way beyond what it is worth.
title: What a RIP-OFF for the price

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Malcolm Granger
content: I love my Echo Show (1st Generation) so why not the Generation 2? Since countless reviews have focused on the big and beautiful screen, my comments are added here: 1. No doubt this is a gorgeous screen. The small clock typeface has been fixed, although much to my surprise, there is little to no clock customization. Worse, the only background "themes" are the simplistic (and very tiring) "illustrations" and no background at all. What happened to the wonderful photos I have on my Show 1st Generation? This is Amazon's star product; I would have expected all kinds of new customization features and details. I settled for my folder "Album" of various photos that I have in my Amazon Photos app. Just say "Alexa, add this album to my background" and they will cycle every 1 minute or so (and no, there does appear to be any way to cycle these any faster...). Any yes, as another reviewer stated, an entirely different background pops up with an ad or notification. 2. The loud Alexa voice has been fixed I have read. I don't really like the side and rear speaker placement however - poor Alexa sounds as if she is within a box. The sound is indeed louder with an accentuated bass (and a three-level equalizer, woohoo!) but the music is missing a clear location. It sounds diffuse and non-distinct. 3. The worst surprise was this irritating screen-goes-blank after 2 minutes feature, which is carried over from the 1st Generation. Why does this happen? I can no longer see lyrics or title or the art after the screen dies. Arrgghh. 4. No Youtube. We all know why but that doesn't make it any better. And no, the Silk/Firefox work-around is just stupid. Just make up (Google and Amazon) and bring the native YouTube back! In retrospect, I'm glad I have them both. The 2nd Generation will take over the kitchen and the 1st Generation goes with me to work. Why all the critical comments despite the 4-stars? Because the new Echo Show is placed right next to my Lenovo Smart Display, which has a seamless Youtube and great sound/screen as well. The 2nd Generation Echo Show is just so much nicer than the Smart Display which was one of the biggest disappointments for me in 2018. Amazon can quickly fix most of all these nit-picking comments in future updates. Give us more customizations in the GUI (backgrounds, themes, clock styles like the Echo Spot), fix the blank-screen irritation, and PLEASE bring back Youtube!
title: Two steps forward and one step back...

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: antique girl
content: The Echo itself was mainly purchased to use with Ring doorbell (A gift from my daughter since I live alone).Without the Echo it took a long time to see who was at the front door thanks to the Echo Show I can access Ring much faster.The picture is great and the sound is excellent,no problems there.I purchased this when it was on special and you got a free Dot HOWEVER there was a catch there that Amazon failed to mention.Since I used the pay in installment option the so called "free "Dot was not included.The CSR at Amazon was not helpful at all and told me I could return it but that's all they could do.Of course I did not return it since I need it for Ring.I am very disappointed in Amazon for not being clear on that.Personally,I think the Echo Show is over priced so if they had of included the "free" Dot it would have made it easier to swallow paying that price.Amazon , you can do better than this,right?The endless ads on the screen are a pain and take away from whatever screensaver you are using.Only good points are clear picture and good quality sound but,if I wanted to watch a movie,I will use my laptop with a much bigger screen.And as mentioned before,Alexa often misunderstands me and I speak clearly and enunciate words properly. Also, heavy to take room to room.Oh, and did I mention overpriced with annoying ads on front of screen....of course I did!!
title: Alexa often misunderstands me

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Bryn‚úîÔ∏è
content: Love this product! It‚Äôs fun and functional! I know people worry about ‚Äúthe man listening to his/her conversations‚Äù . Well, I have absolutely nothing to hide. If you have nothing to hide, what‚Äôs the big deal?!? Seriously people, we are walking around with smart phones as an extension of our arms!!! ‚ÄúThey‚Äù (whomever THEY‚Äù) are already are listening!! This product simplifies our life. In the dark, I am not breaking my neck fumbling around for a light! Alexa turns the light in for me! Every night she helps me go to sleep by playing white noise, she sets my alarms and she plays games with my family!! I haven‚Äôt even begun to access all the great things Alexa does. I get weather, news and I don‚Äôt have to YELL to call my family down for lunch or dinner!! She makes my lists and she reminds me of everything. My hubby didn‚Äôt want to like her but he uses her!!! She reads recipes for me.. she tells me when my amazon delivery is here. It works exactly like it is supposed to! LOVE this product. I haven‚Äôt had any issues with it. Easiest product I have ever used.
title: Fun and Function!!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Robert S. Hargraves
content: I have the previous version of Show as well as this new one. The sound is much improved and the monitor is great sized compared to the original. The biggest disappointment here is with the video interaction. Simply put, its a fail. I was looking forward to the Hulu option and even signed up for a new subscription just for this device. That said, the interface is essentially non-existant. its just awful. When watching on my ipad, i can access a full schedule, but on Show, there is no such option, only a list of the channels....doesnt even show what is currently playing. this product will never succeed if they dont address this video streaming fail. sad.
title: Meh...

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Herrick Ross
content: A little known function that doesn‚Äôt get its spotlight enough is the fact that the skills for the Ring doorbell on this device is amazing! When someone pushes the ring doorbell, the screen automatically alerts me that someone is at the door and brings up the image. While I‚Äôm not sure if other doorbell cameras have the same skills in Alexa, this is truly a great feature that is worth its weight in gold.
title: Great to use with Ring doorbell

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: PVT
content: I wanted to use the Echo as a bedside clock but the small clock/weather numbers are not adequate.  Ease of use, integration with other devices and sound quality are all excellent.  It seems like an update to include the same clock options that on the other Echo Show devices would not be too difficult. Updated: Posted review too soon before I allowed the screen saver to come on.  The screen saver has an adequate clock for my purposes.  I do wish there were other display options.  My smart watch has numerous choices for displays.
title: Disappointed with Home Screen Updated

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Canopus
content: I remember installing my first Echo, when dinosaurs roamed the Earth. Load this app, do this, do that, can tech support, but got it done. The then 3 more, easier each time. Now, I unbox it (well designed package), set up the cables, turn it on, and it installs itself with some prompting. Never opened my app on  my smartphone. Took about 20 minutes, because it had to update itself.  Easy. And it worked, call a relative who also had one (a Echo5) and surprised them.  Yea, I could Face Time, but a smartphone or a tablet are a little more expensive, plus I am an android man.  Plus if you are a gadget nerd, that don't matter. "...the most toys wins" kind of guy. I am still learning how to use it. Upon discussion with other owners, I will get rid of the annoying sales crap, (it can be done, but Amazon should fix that with a software update...PLEASE?), I am pairing two speakers too it. Have used it for Movies via Prime, but believe it or not, I use it primarily like the phones of the old days, in the kitchen, talking, watching stuff, and the like. I do like it. Work well with my HUE and RING. Again still learning. Recommended. Will an echo8 or 5 work? Maybe, especially other rooms, but as I said...toys....
title: Big Difference between the early days

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Jonathan VonEngeln
content: Fails to recognize simple commands that my other Alexa devices (echo 2nd gen, echo dots, echo input, and echo flex easily recognize.  I have my Alexa Show in the kitchen, sometimes when I say commands it understands, about 1/3 to 1/2 the time it does not.  All my other Alexa first party devices have better voice recognition function.  (One echo 2nd gen, three echo dots, one echo input, and one echo flex.)  Sometimes the Echo Dot in the living room picks up and responds to what I'm saying while the Echo Show in the kitchen does nothing.  It needs to be rebooted at least once every couple weeks or it doesn't work at all.  It's getting worse as time goes on.  I was initially more satisfied with this product, and it does work great for voice/video communication through a skype like function with family and friends.
