That's its greatest asset and the only reason I'm giving it two stars.  It's good to let my kids speak with both sets of grandparents at a whim - we also bought one each for the grandparents.  They have the same problems.  2 stars to this if it didn't have the great video calling system -- almost 4 stars with because it's so handy - (the picture and voice calls are fantastic!!!)  but 3 stars overall because of the frustration when trying to use it as intended with the lack of voice recognition compared to the other Echo's.  It's truly really bad.  I unplug it often in pure frustration after repeating myself multiple times.  (I have no accent at all, I'm just American, mid-western, fourth generation).
title: Poor voice recognition compared to other Amazon Alexa first party products.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Braden gallucci
content: Looking forward to Netflix integration. Update: after only 3 days with this  It randomly opens skills with no command. When given a command it will open to some random video and will not stop unless I unplug it. For the price I'm surprised at the lack of features. The fire tablet has a show feature and it actually works better then the show and the show is way more expensive wth amazon! Trying to deal with CS is a joke. Um have you reset it? Yes the last 3 people I have spoken with asked me to reset it.. um ok can you just reset it for me. Really after 3 resets how is the 4th going to make a difference can anyone tell me this? So far it's ok. I'm disappointed it does not integrate with Netflix or youtube. It is definitely 100% amazon integration only. The video quality is nice no complaints there.
title: A little disappointed but over all ok.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Andrew
content: Bought this on the first day of Prime Day (yesterday), so props for the next day arrival. The obvious - I doubt this is too many people's first Alexa device so I won't go into too many details.  Alexa is good for a limited number of tasks out of the box: Timers, alarms, occasionally answering a question usefully, weather updates, etc.  As a standalone totally not worth much money.  I have mine paired with a couple of smart LED bulbs and a Logitech hub so it has a bit of actual functional use, turning on the TV/entertainment center and setting the lights to the right setting. Specifically the the Echo Show: Pros - sound is very good Screen is nice Alexa works like it does on any other device Solid value at $160 plus a Hue bulb and Dot Recipe idea looks cool and seems to work with a few minutes of testing. Cons - Basically the same as everyone else has written, but here goes: Camera aims at the ceiling - should come with the stand Amazon is selling for $30 Always has text asking me to try some task HULU plays a random episode of any TV show you ask it to play (edit - may not be random, just playing from first profile). No YouTube Can't make the time bigger on the homescreen I can't seem to get it to interface with my FireTv.  When I say "pause Hulu" or "pause FireTv" it doesn't do anything.  It appears to be all setup correctly within the app.  (Works with Netflix though by saying "pause Netflix") Solid 4 stars - some presumably easy software updates would move this to a 5 for me.  Only the camera is a physical defect.
title: Pretty cool but has some major flaws.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Diabolic Doyenne
content: Let me start by saying I have 4 Echos and THIS, this is the ONLY one I returned. About the only good things this has going for it are the sound and video qualities; after that it falls apart spectacularly. I bought this as a little TV for my kitchen, but the delayed touch response was so maddening I couldn't deal with it for more than 2 days.  The streaming capabilities are very limited. While it does have all the services (Hulu, Netflix, et al) you can only start where you left off so it's impossible to rewatch a previous episode unless you start it on a different device. I also tried asking Alexa for a specific show, season and episode. I think she may have had a mini stroke trying to sort it out. Just buy a small smart TV (which is probably cheaper anyway) and avoid this whole mess.
title: A slow, dim witted mess....I had to return it

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Mr. Pros and Cons
content: This is pretty much a one stop shop for a smart hub.  It has prett much everything from youtube to the internet.  It uses silk or firefox for the browsers.  The display is good, but the sound, the sound blew my mind.  I really want to take it apart to figure out how its producing the bass.  I mean this thing is packing some serious bass hitting speaker or something.  First I thought it was my TVs audio system's subwoofer that was bumping but to my amaze it was actually this device.  Unfortunately there is a downfall.  It doesn't have a camera cover built in like the echo show 5. Pros - Perfect sized screen.  The sound is amazing good. Great piece for the living room. Cons - No camera cover.  Looks like you would have to buy it separately.
title: Great smart home hub with amazing sound.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Julia E
content: Buyer Beware! There is an issue with the audio on this model, my first one had no audio at all, I got a replacement and the second one the audio lasted about a week,then pooped out. Getting it replaced again has been a nightmare. I spent over an hour on the phone with the reps trouble shooting, etc.. then come to find out it is a software issue that they've been unable to resolve which would have been nice to know the first go around. Then the second rep takes my information and when I asked when it would be coming she was very evasive - seems  they are now out of them which I'm sure was caused by having to replace a lot of them. What a mess -  and them not being upfront about it is really disappointing. When it worked it was a great product.
title: BUYER BEWARE  - IT HAS AUDIO ISSUES. I'VE HAD TWO THE AUDIO DIDN'T WORK

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Weblee
content: I am going to write a long review here because Amazon does not seem to have an easily accessible  technical support channel for customers who purchase and use Alexa devices.  One way or another my laptop got a virus that was sending out massive amounts of spam so my ISP IP address was blacklisted.  I re-imaged my laptop deleting everything and everything on my home network was reset to factory defaults along with reinstalling firmware where possible.  Once everything was online I noticed my Alexa dot was connecting in a manner I found suspicious.  It was a challenge getting a technical person but Amazon customer service lined one up and then tracked me down after I abandoned a call to customer service. My household depends on the Alexa devices for lighting and device control so having them offline for a while had a big impact.  I'm relieved  now that I know the level of security that is baked in.
title: Great tech support when you finally get a technical person

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: DJ ATX
content: I could go on all day! A must have.. I love the Ring Doorbell integration and the ‚ÄúDrop In‚Äù aka Intercom system.. I have a Show 5 in the Living room and the Show 2nd gen and dots throughout the house.. I can see what‚Äôs going on downstairs or even connect to my parents Show 5 I got for them for a video call.. I have the Philips Hue system to control all the lights and it links to all my TV‚Äôs, alarm system, doorbell, my music and video apps and stereo amps, so I can voice control my entire house now, thanks to the awesome Prime Days deals! Even if you just have it as a stand-alone device and have no Alexa compatible devices, it‚Äôs a must have!! I had 2 power strips that it discovered and I had no idea they were Alexa compatible! Very impressive system.. another reason it‚Äôs a must have is if you have a ring doorbell or any cameras with your alarm system, you just add an app, login and you can see/control everything. I have motion zones on my security cameras and I have it set to automatically pop up whichever cam was triggered. You can do that with Ring, too but I have it set to just say ‚ÄúAlexa, Show (video with audio from the camera but your audio is muted) or if you say answer front Door it pops up with your audio un-muted (so you can talk back and forth). Far too many features to mention here, but I absolutely love it now because I can control EVERYTHING in the house, even some things I had no idea were Alexa compatible that were found during discovery !
title: A must have. I‚Äôm a full out Alexa household now!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: mary
content: I programmed for my friend‚Äôs assisted living room because his phone was lost. Now I can call and SEE him!  He can call me although without video. Then I call him back immediately - problem solved - we have video then. When not using as a phone, he sees favorite pictures scrolling on the screen  throughout the day. A lifesaver for his isolation situation during Covid!!!
title: Perfect for assisted living residents and family

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Scott W
content: After using Google's suite of products for several years, I decided for a change given Google's security practices and fumbling around with integration/Nest changes/whatever else they'll change next week. I've owned a Dot for several years and added to the collection with a couple more Dots, couple Shows and other devices. The Echo family feels more integrated and natural than Google devices. However, I've found Echo searches (like web searches) to be a little more limited in some cases than with Google - no real surprise there unless they switch over to Google's search in the background. No biggy though since I still have my browser and phone when I need to fall back. As far as the look goes, The Echo Show 2nd Gen is rather large. My wife immediately took it over and placed it in the kitchen. It does look nice and she enjoys the fast recipe searches as well as some toons while cooking. The base is definitely sturdy and isn't going anywhere without someone intentionally moving it. I've got the black model and it looks rather nice overall. Videos play well and look ok. The brightness could stand a little work and under different lighting conditions, it isn't necessarily what I'd want to spend any large amount of time. Sound, as with all these devices is ok and nothing stellar. About as good as built in speakers on a TV I suppose. You can fiddle with the bass, treble and mid range to get slightly better sound. It's decent enough for a small set of speakers and serves the purpose. One thing that I really like about the Show is the ability to connect to other devices like an intercom. This feature works very good and if you've got a camera on both ends, it even functions as a video call (similar to Duo in Google land). The ability to send a text message (which is read aloud) and notification (requires user action to read) and even call from your phone are all big pluses as well. I was much more impressed with how well this worked with the Echo family than what Google comparatively has. An odd downer on the Show 2nd Gen is a rather stupid glitch that has apparently existed for over 6 months and Amazon has completely failed to correct. If you unplug the device from the wall and then plug back in, most all the time, the sound will not work. The only remedy is to unplug the power cord from the device itself (not the brick at the outlet), wait a couple seconds and then plug it back in. Do that and all is well. So if you ever move it, plug into the wall first, then into the device. So this isn't the end of the world, although one does have to wonder what kind of fubar they have going on where the order of plugging something in breaks it. Lost a star on this one. Overall, I am really enjoying the Echo family and this device in particular more than the Google family. There's some features that Amazon has done better and with the skills system, you do get to try out some extras whereas Google sees fit to be an Apple tool now and lock everybody out. With Amazon putting these puppies on sale so much, I'm glad I took the plunge and switched over.
title: Very happy minus the power/sound issue

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: MikeB
content: I'm not a fan of this device so far. In fact, I was in the kitchen trying to use the device and I'm having such a hard time I decided to come and write this review. I use my Echo Show in the kitchen - as a photo frame when idle, for kitchen timers, to watch shows, and to look things up on occasion. As a photo frame, it does ok. I think I'm with about 99% of the reviewers by being disappointed that you can't use this as just a frame. It always has to display something to promote their products/services....try this skill, buy that product. The timer feature works well. I like that I can name the timers and have multiple. Of course, they always have to screw something up. In the case of timers, the timers (with names) will display for a short while. Then the screen will go into frame mode and only display one timer with no label. So now you can't just glance at the device and know. Now you have to do something with it to display what it should be displaying to begin with. When you have active timers, just display all the timers with their names. Geez! Watching a show was not an easy task. I started with "Play The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel." That didn't pull up anything right away. It took a few attempts to pull up the show. When it did, I expected it to start with my next episode. This was not the case. In fact, it didn't reflect which episodes I had watched already vs. not. I had to figure it out on my own. The device does not listen well. As I stated, I have this in the kitchen. I also have an echo dot in the other room....on the other side of the room. It's about 30 feet away. I would estimate about 50% of the time when I say "Alexa", the echo dot in the other room picks up. I will put my face 6 inches away from the device and sometimes it still won't work. This is what just happened again that was so frustrating. Honestly, I don't want to use my voice for everything. I want the option. I think most of us are familiar with a tablet. My preference would be for the Echo Show to have an interface more like a tablet. The fact that you have to use voice for 95% of what you want to do, and this doesn't work well, causes me to get very frustrated. It doesn't seem like a premium device. It feels more like an entry-level experiment. On the plus side, the updates seem frequent. Who knows, maybe it will eventually get to state where it's not so frustrating to use. It's not there now.
title: Not exactly what I was expecting

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: iDRMRSR
content: I bought this to replace an old school Echo speaker only.  I use that via bluetooth to play audio from a Microsoft Windows Surface device, audio that comes from a special server accessible by a browser like Chrome.  The old Echo speaker worked perfectly.  I wanted 2 more things, first, a slideshow of my Amazon photos, and second, a self-dimming clock.  Both those functions worked splendidly except... When streaming Bluetooth, the Echo Show would frequently just flat out stop working.  No audio.  Or after about an hour, the audio over the Bluetooth would become fuzzy and distorted and broken.  If I turned off the Windows device, the Echo Show still thought it was connected!  I had to restart the Show and repair the thing to my Windows device. While playing the audio, it would constantly show me "Now Playing", which interrupted the slideshow and clock entirely!  No way of turning that off that I could find.  And worse the Show would randomly connect and disconnect with the Windows over Bluetooth.  USELESS TO ME IN THIS STATE!  I wanted the better audio from this to play while it just kept displaying my photos and appointments on the home screen, but no, it kept switching over to NOW PLAYING.  What an awful thing. I've been using my Echo Speaker Only for two or more years without problem!  I wish this Show would achieve the level of connectivity and reliability.  I now have my old Echo Speaker, with the microphone muted, sitting next to the show so I can play my audio AND display my photos and appointments and clock continuously. It's unacceptable to have two of these things next to each other!  Worse yet, if you have multiple Echo devices within earshot of each other, and I mean one or two rooms away, when you say Alexa, they all wake up and dogpile each other and it's a crapshoot which device will actually process your command, like "Alexa, what time is it". They should allow you to set ANY WORD as a WAKE WORD so that  you can address each one separately and uniquely.  Furthermore, when one device (wake word Alexa) announces that you have an AMAZON shipment, another device nearby with the wake word of AMAZON will wake up and almost attempt to reorder the item. This smart speaker world is fraught with frustrating pitfalls especially when one of them THINKS it hears it's name, or an Amazon Alexa advertisement is playing on the TV and they all wake up stupidly. PLEASE FIX THIS.  Getting rid of these rough edges, and it would be a pleasure to have them around.
title: Considering returning this thing due to Bluetooth problems

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Ryan Adams
content: This is such a great concept but I feel as though it was not ready for release. Yeah of course Alexa works and the screen is cool at first, but like others have mentioned its subpar content make it kind of janky. THIS IS NOT A TABLET. You will pull your hair out trying to treat it as such, i learned this the hard way. I wanted to add some things but simply cannot due to how poor Amazon made the UI. You can tell her to search "google" and bring up a web browser. I was able to watch NBC football games like this, but ESPN, CBS and NFL Network all require location access, and since this is not a tablet, there is no way to enable those services. I feel like a lot of people learn these things the hard way after they get their Echo Show, so I feel obligated to let everyone know. If you're looking to buy an Alexa and don't have one, this is good. If you already have one and are looking for a little more control over your devices, this is great! If you are looking to put this on your desk for media content? RUN, RUN for the hills, and wait for Amazon to actually provide app downloads plus more content for their show.
title: Cool device, subpar content (web browser limited) and no app download!!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: David
content: This almost seems like a beta test item the user interface is horribly clunky they could‚Äôve at least put the fire tablet OS on it. Not only is Alexa kind of clueless unless you ask her the prompted questions. The Hulu in her face sucks because I can‚Äôt click a show and then look at all the different episodes and seasons I just have to deal with whatever one is showing and there is no search functionality in it. There‚Äôs no YouTube and there‚Äôs also no Netflix which really doesn‚Äôt make sense on a device that has a large screen.
title: Just buy a tablet it will perform way better

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: AMD Huntsville
content: I have multiple Amazon devices and enjoy them all.  However, the two Amazon Show 2nd Gen units have a very muddy dark display regardless of how bright I have the display set.  It is really strange, though, how brighter both became after being set up a couple of days.  (Upon first setting them up, I had thought I might need to return them because of the dull display).  While they are a bit brighter, the display looks horrible alongside the bright Show 8.  Another issue . . . had I wanted black, I would have ordered black.  I am extremely disappointed with the black bezel on the sandstone units.  unless you turn it around, you don‚Äôt even see the sandstone sides and back!  Why even make the two colors, Amazon??!  Oh, and why not a manual camera cover switch like the Show 8 . . . $200 and have to use Duct tape . . . Geez!!
title: Nice . . . But Step It Up A  Notch, Amazon!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Zax.
content: Having a screen feels more natrual. I got into computer voice dictation back in 2006. And got the first echo device in my family when the 2nd gen eco first came out. And have used it quite a bit. I debated for a long while if having a screen was worth the investment. And finially told myself "if I've had to think about it this much. I might as well try it" and I'm thankful I did. The screen feels more natrual to the device. Having a voice dictation speaker has always been cool and useful. The vivid touch screen adds a nice amount of feedback that always seemed to have been missing. Its pleasing to ask for something and see it take place. The upgraded audio is also a huge plus. I was always reasonably impressed with the 2nd gen echo audio. For its size and mono set up it handled audio better then I expected. The audio on the echo show is more surprising still. You wouldn't expect to receive such deep tones and well balanced highs from a computer screen, of course it wont out do any of my multi thousand dollar audio systems. Nor would I expect it to. For a bed side device its ample and effective. Exceeding expectations. The touchscreen is responsive enough to enjoy using, color and contrast are generous with high quality visuals nothing seems faded out, another concern was viewing angles. There is nothing to be concerned of with it however. Build quality and materials gives it a premium feel the glass screen is highly finished while the fabric speaker grill is tight and well made. Features are plentiful, from weather and pictures to noise machine and alarm clock. YouTube viewed from a browser is extremely responsive. To summarize it. They did a good job making this device. And if you're familiar with smart speakers you should find yourself enjoying the added feedback of a screen. I wont tell anyone they must upgrade to this device because you really dont need to. However if you're getting your first smart device or you're interested in the newer tech it offers. You should buy one. The most important thing to understand is what it can do. What it cant. And what it's good and not good at. If you go into the purchase educated, you will not be let down. If you think you'll replace a computer or tablet with it however, I can't help you when you feel slighted.... that is simply put, not the devices fault.
title: Visuals are a welcomed feedback experience, it will not however replace your tablet.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Rob Gordon
content: The second generation Echo Show has been a great addition to our Echo ecosystem. It integrates nicely with my Nest indoor cameras, my Ring exterior cameras, my extensive Philips Hue lighting system, and my Logitech Harmony hub.  Faster at bringing up camera images than my iPhone.  I also love the way I can instantly get recipes, see a video on preparation, send the ingredients to my shopping list and a link to the recipe. Communication features are also excellent. I can use the Shows as an intercom throughout our home (we have an Echo Show in the Kitchen and in the Master Bedroom, Echo Show 5 smaller units in two other rooms we use as home offices, and 1st gen Echo unts in several other rooms.  I can broadcast messages ("Dinner is ready") across the whole system or use them walkie-talkie style from the app on my iPhone.  List of uses keeps growing!
title: Great extension to the Echo ecosystem

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Harley
content: Absolute Garbage.  Worked for 1 hour then sound no longer worked.  Called help center but they could not do anything to fix it.  Huge waste of money for something that does not live up to its hype.  Really expected more from Amazon. Sending it back.  Will look into google home.
title: All functions seem to work but the sound. NO SOUND

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Jeff Probst
content: As others have said ( yes I read the reviews, but thought I could get around it) you must have smart phone. I'm attempting to set this up for my 85 year old mother in law that has no idea how to use a smart phone, let alone an app. She did not have a cell phone so we purchased one of the only remaining big button flip phones available, thinking all we have to do is switch over from my wife's cell phone number to the new flip phone. No you have to call Amazon in order to change the phone number, you also have to receive the text message. While on support line call I attempted to have the text sent twice, no text. Amazon support says, its the phone carrier blocking texts, and that they cant reach the carrier. Funny thing is I called the carrier right after  hanging up with Amazon support and talked to someone there. Their not blocking texts. This is by far the most aggravating POS, I've ever tried to use. Why would you make a device that cant be accessed from any home computer for setup? Why do I need to call support to change the phone number linked to an account that I set up and have full access to? This truly is the dumbest piece of "Smart" technology I've ever seen. We also purchased a Ring doorbell/camera for use with the show, it does not do what you expect it to do either. The video doesn't go straight to the show when the bell is rung, you have to tell Alexa to show the front door. Someone obviously rang the bell, show me who is at the door, duh!! No the video has to go somewhere into the either then you have to tell this smart device to give you the video. Stupid!!! We also wanted to have family pictures as a screen saver, also a PITA. You need a FB account or some other account, you cant load them into the app, or to the device, or a memory card. There are simple picture frames that allow you to install a memory card with all the pictures you want, not this POS!! If your setting this up for your own home, it's probably pretty painless. If your trying to set it up for someone else, especially an elderly family member forget about it. It's far too complicated and aggravating. I'm stubborn, it's too close to Christmas, and so I will get it to work one way or another, but it should not be this ridiculous to get this to work!! After calling customer support to have my wife and name removed from the account and leave my mother in law on the account with her new phone number, they removed her and the number we had setup. Her name and wife's number were still on the account.  Another phone call to change the number, another text message, that mysteriously worked the first time. Next was getting the ring to work with it. Called customer service once again, after going thru every step including resetting everything back to factory settings the CSR and I were both about to give up. Then she asked me to ask Alexa who's account we were in. It was still somehow on my account??? Installed everything Christmas eve, would like to say it was painless, but no there were a few issues, mostly with the doorbell, anyway it's in. It's been two days, my oldest daughter lives with my mother in law, she says she awoke at 2am by rap music blasting from the show. My startled 85 year old mother in law is sitting in front of it not knowing what to do. Apparently my mother in law has been sitting in front of the show reading the stupid suggestions all night thinking that Alexa needs her to do them!!! Christ on a wooden crutch, how many people have to complain about something before you fix it Amazon!!!!
title: Mostly useless!!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Merry
content: I'm disappointed with this product. It's way over priced for the amount of functions that it offers, or should I say what it is incapable of offering! I should've stuck with the regular echo for $200 cheaper!
title: Waste of money

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Kevin Adams
content: We are really enjoying our new echo show. Nice screen size, excellent sound quality, good mic clarity. Everything works well, the only frustrating part is even though it recognises each user's voice, it will not automatically switch to use their account. You have to manually ask her to switch user accounts even though she know who's talking! And while she does well most of the time, there are times when she is maddeningly frustrating with her "I can't help with that!"
title: Nice screen and speaker

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: J. Williamson
content: This was purchased as a replacement for the Kindle Fire in the Show Mode Charging Dock that was used in the kitchen.  Although the Fire was terrific for accessing stored data and watching Dish TV in the app, it was somewhat unstable on the dock.  Therefore, it was replaced with the Echo Show.  I had expectations that it would work as well for those purposes but not be so unstable as in a dock. Echo Show Good:  The screen images and sound are fantastic for a device of this size.  It is responsive and fast. Echo Show Not so Good: No apps, but it must use skills.  That prevents watching the Dish Anywhere app in a simple way, as there is no skill for it.  I did find a work around by accessing it through the Silk browser, however, it fails to keep a connection and drops after less than 1 minute.  After multiple attempts to access it without interruptions, even after setting a bookmark, it's too frustrating to persist. Not so good: No ready access to Amazon Drive.  There is no skill?  It would be nice to access saved recipes that are stored as data.  The workaround, again, is to access the Silk browser (only say "Silk" - if you say "Silk browser" she does not understand), access Cloud Drive as you would on the computer, pull up the specific .pdf, which opens nicely in the window, click on the magnifying glass so that portions are large enough to read.  Nothing gets larger.  No response to the enlarge request.  Some photos will open sized to fit the horizontal screen but, for the purpose of accessing a document, it seems to be a fail. All in all, if you are interested in accessing recipe videos and saving them through the Echo Show platform, it works well.  If you like to listen to music or access predefined skills, it is fine.  If you want more specific interaction, the Kindle Fire works much better.
title: Mostly good

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Joshua T. Wire
content: There is a lot to like about the echo show and a few major hang ups.  The biggest con is when you say ‚Äúplay baby Einstein videos‚Äù she responds ‚Äúplaying top result‚Äù then never actually loads the video.  Even a prime show ‚Äúplay the stinky and dirty show‚Äù results in a bing search instead of launching the free prime show on Amazon‚Äôs own service.  I tried adding ‚Äúon prime‚Äù and it replied that nothing by that title exists.  Then once it does actually play the video will frequently stop playing.  My internet is great and works on other devices fine. By far the biggest complaint is video but this device has an issue actually launching a task.  It often gets hung up and you have to repeat yourself to get it to do something. I think it just needs a little more power to run itself. The things it does nicely are the digital picture frame mode while in standby.  You can go onto prime pictures and set what shows up.  You can say show pictures of ‚Äúname‚Äù etc. With prime music the lyrics scroll along with song at the same time. It can be helpful to say show me a picture of a eastern bluebird etc and see what it looks like. All the things your standard echo will do this can too. Some things I wish were better.  It needs a dedicated set of free workout videos on screen.  Let‚Äôs do a cardio workout together etc. If you set your screen to pictures it would be nice if nba updates and random ‚Äúthings you can say‚Äù would stay off.  The video skills need serious work.  They need better YouTube support.  Needs a more snappy system. Overall we are satisfied with the purchase and use it a lot.  It‚Äôs a worthwhile purchase and they still have many kinks to fix
title: Playing video is a big problem.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: VKSheridan
content: I have 3 Echo Dot devices, 2 Echo Show (Gen 1) devices and one Echo Auto.  My home is loaded with smart devices that includes light switches, dimmers, stream devices, cameras, doorbells, garage controllers, plugs and door locks.  I want the ability to control anything and everything with just my voice.  If I counted up all the remote controls for just what‚Äôs in my living room, I‚Äôd have at least a dozen.  While the Echo Show doesn‚Äôt do a whole bunch more than the dot, it can show me what my cameras are staring out when triggered.  Instead of grabbing my phone to see what triggered them, I bark at Alexa and view the feed.  I was pleasantly surprised to see the Echo Show Gen 2 has a Zigbee hub built in.  It‚Äôs kind of a waste for me since I already have a SmartThings hub but it‚Äôs nice to know if the hub goes on the fritz as it might save me from replacing it.  I read how folks don‚Äôt like the size of the clock or the weather icons and had to laugh.  I just ask mine to tell me the time or weather as there‚Äôs really no sense trying to read it across the room.  I understand some folks hate the constant ‚ÄúTry this.....‚Äù on the home screen.  Set the ‚ÄúDo Not Disturb‚Äù to 24\7 and it all goes away until you command the device to do something.  Once you‚Äôre done, it goes back to sleep.  The only gripe I have (If I can call it that) is sometimes the command recognition isn‚Äôt the best.  Telling it to turn on the ceiling fan sounds nothing like turn off the porch light but sometimes, Alexa gets either confused or disoriented when there is some background noise.  Beyond that, I enjoy trying to see just hw many things I can automate with this device.
title: Function is only limited by creativity......

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: The Shopinator
content: THIS is the product that SHOULD have been the Gen1 release and every feature (of the guts) was available and affordable to make, so I wanted to get that criticism out of the way straight up. Now the goods and bads, mixed by feature. Come for the sound? Stay for the display. The reality is that this is NOT HD, but ED, 720p for video playback. HD is 1080p for video playback. If UHD can be built into cellphones, not even phablets, then the raw displays and drivers are clearly MUCH cheaper as they increase in size. Still, this is a much better, approximately twice as large display than the Gen1 Show's display, though it doesn't seem to be any brighter, something I've seen lab-tested to be so. Since this is not OLED, it's not going to do better in your sun-drenched kitchen than the Gen1 did, even if it is clearer and larger so you can see it more easily on the other side of your island. But what really disappointed people most in the Gen1 Show was the sound. Not that it was bad... it just wasn't good. I have $30 portable radios that blow it away. The recently upgraded software for Spot/Show helps GREATLY by finally providing individual bass/mid/treble controls which most people will set wrong. And while the bass and "whomp" is MUCH better from the new Gen2 Show, it's typical big passive radiator v tiny active driver sound. Flabby and prone to splat, even at moderate volume (maybe halfway up with a good sounding recording like stuff from GRP). So, sure, it's able to play louder and it has more bass but it's not quality bass. If there was enough room for a huge passive radiator and the cavity(s) needed to make it function properly, there was room for an active bass driver with a smaller passive so it would be in much better control using a folded audio waveguide, if needed, perhaps even as a replacement for the passive. Most people can't hear that this isn't quite there but people who are accustomed to real audio, my career background serving audiophiles for decades, know better than to go for passives. But they're cheap, so I get it. Lots of bang for the buck... or whomp for the buck. At lower volumes, though, it works and sitting on my desk in front of my second monitor, it couples will with the desk surface for bass I feel in my hands. I will experiment to see if this is a good thing or if decoupling is smarter. Also, this new larger Gen2 Show is actually SHORTER than the Gen1, so it is easier to put on a desk with other media equipment and still see behind it, key for me, even if it is much wider and deeper. Please continue reading in my replies since AMZ doesn't like long reviews even when they are very detailed and warranted...
title: AMZ is getting much closer with the Gen2 Show, a good upgrade!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: AUSTINITER
content: I'm very disappointed in this device.  Even more disappointed in Amazon's lack of any customer service.  Device less than 6 months old and begins to play music when its off, then begins videos when its supposed to be off.  It hears me say something and then such sometimes what I mention appears on my device.  I think there's a major  lack of privacy by Amazon thus I'm selling my device on Craigslist and getting away from a device that listens and sometimes reacts to what ive said.  Privacy is something everyone should be concerned about and zero customer service means not worth it.
title: Echo - Not worth the value & No Customer Service to get repaired

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: BobCz
content: Amazon's technical support is non-existent. Until they straighten this out they will never be a true home automation system. I use Wink along with Alexa. In Wink I deleted many devices when I moved recently. I then went into Alexa a deleted the devices there. However, after less than an hour, all the devices show up again even though they no longer exist in Wink. Well, two calls to Alexa support and 'nothing'. Tech support was clueless. Wink says it's a Alexa problem and I believe them. I now have 60 devises that show up on Alexa that do not exist.
title: Not a Player in Home Automation

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Techno Nana
content: First I must admit I am an Alexa junkie.  I started with the dot, the dot in colors, the Echo, the Echo in colors, and now the ones with screens.  The smallest one in my guest room, the mid size in the kitchen and the big guy in my home office.  My office is in the back of the house far from the front door.  I can ask it to show me the front door and, while taking a few seconds to do it, it does.  So I know whether to go answer the door, or if there are more Amazon packages left out in front.  Could be just a plant blowing in the wind.  But I am a single older woman trying to make my house smarter than I will be in a few years.  Some of the Alexa products came free with other things like my Ring Doorbell or my new subscription to Sirius.  I give them as presents but I LOVE having them all over the house so I can say ‚ÄúAlexa play Mellow Folk EVERYWHERE‚Äù!  My house is then filled with music, good quality sound, in every single room ‚Äîeven the bathroom.  Will I sneak watching an episode of Grey‚Äôs Anatomy on the 10 inch screen, yup already have.  I do have an iPad Pro that is for other things.  I also have several kindles.  This one is more for my piece of mind, living alone after my husband died in 2018.  My new house is set to be run my Alexa.  Only the iRomba doesn‚Äôt listen to her very well.  But sometimes I feel like I have a roommate who turns off the lights when I ask and keeps track of my shopping list.  Now I can see what is going on too!!!! Granted sometimes I think Alexa is a blonde who isn‚Äôt as smart as Google but she is MUCH funnier!
title: If you are an Alexa junkie this one is for you!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: sarahjoy4him
content: For the $229 price tag I thought it should do more.  I bought the Alexa Show so that my kids could communicate with others and myself while at home, for access to Hulu and a fun tech item.  I have been able to communicate to my wife but others have not been as intuitive.  I know my son tried calling me yesterday and it nothing came through even though I was on the phone.  I'm going to have to play with it to figure it out.  I just wished it was more intuitive.  Hulu does work and it is not to have on in the kitchen where we have placed the Amazon Show.  But you have to ask for specific shows.  There is no way to surf your account or pick a specific episode.  I wish I had some navigation capability.  I also wished it had some YouTube functionality.  I realize that it is owned by a competitor but there could at least be some internet functionality that would allow you to access it online.  I also wished it had the ability to connect with my Pinterest account.  I use Pinterest with a lot of recipes and I would enjoy having it on my Amazon Show. Overall, the Amazon show is nice to have but it lacks a lot of the functionality that we are used to with out phones and tablets.  It does sound great and I do like the bass balance.  I know my kids love asking it to play their favorite songs from Amazon music.
title: Could do more.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: avex
content: I wanted a smart home assistant with a video display that showed me a feed of my smart cameras (specifically my Ring doorbell) and that functioned as a digital picture frame. So the Amazon Echo Show does show me the feed of my Ring doorbell, but my expectations were the Echo Show to display the feed if someone rang the doorbell. It's a bit cumbersome needing to ask "Alexa" to show the camera IF you know that someone is at the door.  Ideally, this functioned more like the Nest doorbell + Google home mini hub. It's kind of a head scratcher why this feature wasn't included as it's a pretty common use case people would expect to have. My 2nd complaint is that it does not continuously cycle through my Amazon photos.  After a while, it just stays on one photo.  I've read that unplugging/plugging in the device would cycle through the photos again (or asking "Alexa" to play slideshow). Knowing what I know now, I probably would have opted for a Nest doorbell to go with my Google home mini hub for my home video surveillance needs (although I would still be using the less expensive Echo devices since I prefer "Alexa" voice commands) and skipped purchasing this. What I like about the device is that it's loud, bright, the on screen display for light controls and the rotating photo display (when it works).
title: Mediocre echo device for what I wanted

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: John Fernandes
content: The voice recognition is no better than the much cheaper echo puck, which is amazing considering the premium price you pay for the "microphone field array". Alexa is reasonably good at answering questions, and is infinitely better at getting you information than the Siri HomePod.  It is even comparable to Google's intelligent home puck in terms of getting you answers.  Overall, it is way better than Google because of the large number of very helpful and entertaining apps that are growing for the Amazon ecosystem. The sound quality, however, is terrible and not even close to the same league as the sound quality in the Siri HomePod.  Not sure if it is better to get a cheap echo puck and connect it to a good sound system, but this would be the better solution if you want good sound quality. It is neat, however, to be able to view videos on Youtube on this, in addition to Prime videos.  Not sure if it can do Netflix, but that would be a killer app for this appliance.  We don't have Hulu or an equivalent for it in Canada, but my Echo Show in the USA works beautifully with Hulu, and it is really nice to be able to use it on the counter when we are cooking, etc. This is a good thing to buy if you tend to be an "early adopter" of technology, as such people tend to be more forgiving of new technological solutions to problems they didn't know they had.
title: As good as an echo puck for voice recognition, but sound quality is poor.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Dan W
content: I received  brand new Echo Show 2nd generation.  Out of the box it worked fine for about an hour.  I unplugged it, took it to a different location, and the audio would no longer work. The device was responding to voice commands and playing music and movies as I instructed but no audio.  I tried plugging out and back in and then did a factory reset.  Still no sound.  I called technical support and they were unable to solve the problem.  I was told to return the product and was told to not return the power adaptor that came with it because they would not send a new power adapter.  That seemed odd and has me worried that they may be sending  refurbished rather than a new device as a replacement.  I noticed other purchasers of product had complaints with sound not working as well.  It seems there is a glitch in this product that Amazon should fix before selling more of them.
title: product doesn't work

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Sergio
content: This is beyond frustrating!! I have the echos another try after returning them for failure to do what it advertised. This time around I got the echo studio several dots and 2 pluses and an echo show. I made a simple music group and all I get is I‚Äôm sorry I‚Äôm having trouble playing the music! I tell it to pause or stop the music and it doesn‚Äôt do a thing. I called amazon but nothing they said helped. Who has time to keep resetting wifi and unplugging all echo devices and plugging back in!? No one!!!!!! I feel so stupid for investing so much money! I eve pay for amazon music hd family and can‚Äôt get a damn song to play????  Beyond ridiculous, and aggravating. So now the devices sit there unable to play any music out of the 50 million songs amazon has not one can play on these devices. Too much stress for the money. The devices work a day and the next day you‚Äôll hear things like I‚Äôm having trouble playing the music. I want to grab them and throw them in the trash!
title: Does not work as advertised! Major music problems!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Allan J.
content: The screen is the right size and the sound quality is just as good as the first generation.  The increased screen size is much better and easier to read from a distance.  If you are looking for a central Echo Show to have video conferences with other family members this is a nice one since you can have a few people participate in the call.  We keep ours in the kitchen which is the household hub so it works out great.  You can even video conference and drop in on multiple echo shows in the same house since we moved the old one upstairs.  It also integrates perfectly with our ring door bell system.  We have 3 echo shows distributed around the house so you never have to run downstairs to see who is at the front door.
title: Replaced my first gen Echo with this one.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: A. Prest
content: If you hope to be able to visually monitor incoming telephone calls by using this in conjunction with an Echo Connect, forget about it. I have two Echo Show 2nd Generation units and two Echo Show 1st Generation units  and none of them show od say who is calling either with a name or a telephone number. All the screen shows and a voice says is "Incoming Call" with no visual or audio indication as to who is calling. Apparently, these features used to work but they no longer work. The Echo Connect is also supposed to announce the caller information on Echo units that don't have a screen, but that doesn't work either. For more information see the Amazon Forum about this issue. It looks like Amazon Tech Support ahs dropped the ball on getting this fixed. I just spent an hour on the phone with Amazon Tech Support and it looks like they haven't done much or anything to solve this problem Check out the bottom of page 2 and all of page 3 on this Amazon Forum to read complaints that started on October 31, 2018: https://www.amazonforum.com/forums/devices/echo-alexa/476517-echo-connect-talking-caller-id-not-working?page=2
title: Does Not Show Caller ID or Caller name on the Screen

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Vanessa Valenzuela
content: First and foremost....the sound that comes from the Echo Show is AMAZING! I listen to it all, from Country to 90's rap.... The Beetles to Disturbed. I was blown away by the quality of the sound output. It makes cooking and cleaning more enjoyable and upbeat. If music really isn't your thing, you should be impressed with the recipe finder and follower feature (I'm sure there is a legit name for this feature but "Recipe Finder and Follower" just rolls off the tongue so I'm sticking with it). The Echo Show pulls recipes from various websites, and doesn't just force you to follow some site that has paid extra fees to be featured. If you select your recipe, Alexa will even read it to you step by step. My 11 year old loves the Echo Show because he can easily find videos he wants to share with me by simply saying "Alexa, find me a video of Ariana Grande doing impressions of other singers", etc.....and then selecting the right video. The device has also solved petty arguments such as "does green colored mucus mean you have an infection?". My 14 year old loves it because he can ask those hard to answer questions like "How much am I worth on the Black Market?" or "Why is my mom so bossy?". The multitude of ways this device can make your life easier is amazing. The only con I have noticed so far is that sometimes I have to say "Alexa" repeatedly when it is playing music. That's more of an annoyance than a real problem unless you are listening to some raunchy rap or Bill Burr when your child walks in.
title: The sound on this thing!!!!!!!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Joel Steele
content: This device is by far the worst addition to the Echo family so far. The idea of a screen to communicate is shrouded with incessant messages, haptic feedback, miserable intelligence and overall inconvenience. You will be much better off buying a cheap iPad and using the Echo Dot so you can at least move it. Ideas to improve for the next generation: -IMPROVE THE TOUCH SCREEN The screen is so unresponsive, I'd love to give up on it entirely. I have to press "buttons" on the screen five or more times for it to register. While I'd love to alleviate these woes with voice commands, the device is severely impaired and has selective hearing. Often times my commands won't even have a single understood word. As much as I'd like to tell my Echo Show to "stop giving me command options," it won't "know that." -Display options If I have to see one more "Try, Alexa, tell me something weird" prompt, I might throw up. You're a passive device, not my reluctant friend with ADD. -Improved syncing: While your speakers are marginally better than previous Echo devices, the connection between devices to have multi room music is awful. They are not in sync and it sounds collectively distorted and unpleasant to say the least. Can I have my money back?
title: Obnoxious, Infuriating, Antiquated

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Mr. Eddie S.
content: I just got this Echo Show 2nd gen today and I know it‚Äôs way too early to be writing a review on it, but I found a few problems with this version that I hope Amazon will address in a system update very very soon. The first problem I found with the device is, when turning the camera off in settings it also auto turns the screen off when you don‚Äôt use the device for a very short time. I like for my screen to stay active at all times and hopefully this will be something that Amazon will work out very soon, because safety should always be number one goal and for this reason I want to keep the option to keep my camera off. Another issue that I found is the time and weather display in the upper left corner of the screen is smaller than that on my Echo Show 8 HD. This is something else that I hope that Amazon will look into and fix in a system update very soon. After all, it is important to be able to see these things from a distance away. So far these have been the only cons that I found in this version so far. Everything else I like a great deal, the picture and sound quality, screen size, and not to even mention something that I didn‚Äôt even see mention before buying unless I was too excited and over looked it, but this baby comes equipped with an Intel Processor as well which makes me feel even this much better about ownership. I have yet to pair my phone with this version like I did with my version 8 but plan to do so very soon for an even better musical experience. As for my Echo Dot, well I hope it enjoy it‚Äôs retirement. Overall, I am very please to say that I got the Echo Show that I always wanted and that is this 2nd Generation. If you too enjoy a powerful music experience, this is the way to go, the Echo Show 2nd Generation, happy shopping. Update, and I don‚Äôt believe this pertain to this device but all. I found while adding more basketball teams to my echo devices that the number is limited. This is something that Amazon need to look into and fix soon. I feel that there should never be a limit on anything you feed to these devices and not being able to add all the teams that I want, might they be my favorite or not is a turn off for me. Another thing that doesn‚Äôt pertain to these devices [kind of] that someone else mention that should be brought to Amazon attention and that is this thing with being limited to what music, etc you can and can‚Äôt hear. I feel that being prime members should entitle us to all that amazon have to offer. After all not only do we pay for being prime members, we are also loyal customers who should have all that Amazon has to offer. Besides, it does get annoying being told that the song you are trying to hear is only available through a prime music account. I also believe that this would boost the sales of Echo devices because people will a unlimited world sort of speak. Update: I don‚Äôt know if I mention this or not, but something else I noticed that hopefully Amazon will take note of and fix in a system update very soon, when you have information on the screen no matter what type of information or duration that information should stay there until you the user go to the home screen. With the screen going back to home by itself can lead to a bit of a problem in cases where you are not done with the information at hand.
title: An Awesome Device with a Few Hiccups and Suggestions

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: J-Babe
content: When I bought this during Amazon's "Prime Day", I was excited to give it a shot. I love my Echo devices and use them all the time. I figured this one would be a fine addition to my collection. By and large, it is, but there are a few things that led to the 3-star rating, which I will explain below. First, sound quality and voice recognition on this thing are superb. Video quality is quite good too, though from my own eyes I would say most top end tablets have this thing beat handidly. This thing will hear you from wherever you are in your house, and you will hear it. Now, the reason I didn't give it 5-stars is this: I don't see how truly more useful this thing is over my other Echo devices. Its limited functionality as a screen device is what brings it down for me. There is very, very limited "app" support (and good lulck trying to side-load anything). You're at the whim of the Amazon catalog, which basically limits your video options to Amazon Prime and Twitch - both of which are fabulously entertaining platforms, but still very limiting. This device flourishes in a kitchen setting where you can view recipes and watch on-screen instructions, but the options there seem quite limited and not as versatile as just having a good cookbook by your side. Its a great device for music, but so are the other Echo devices. The option for on-screen lyrics is neat, but also useless in the grand scheme of things. By and large, what makes this device great is also what makes it hard to review: its really meant for the kitchen. I tried it as a bedside table device, and it didn't really ad anything. Tried it as a living room device, but for what purpose? In the kitchen? That's where its meant to be. And that, combined with what I mentioned above, is its limiting factor.
title: Limited use for a touch-screen Echo device

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: reader9996
content: I've been curious about these Echo products for a few years but we waited, hoping to let Amazon work out some of the security kinks first. I came across a great cyber Monday sale and so we decided to give it a try. I wanted this one specifically for my kitchen, for recipes and videos. I read up a lot on it in advance, how to speak to it etc. There is a definitely some training on both sides. I approached it with patience as I figured out the right way to ask it do what I wanted. My husband (who normally hates technology) quickly took to it and loved it. It has a long way to go yet as far as being a bit more intuitive. There are moments I'm glad it has a screen, when it gets befuddled over "return to the song" (or something silly) I can just walk over and tap the screen to get what I want. Sometimes it trips over itself. But, I can have my hands in the oven and baking and ask "Alexa, set timer for 6 minutes" (you can set multiple timers with different names - whaaaat?) while I'm watching some random tv show or news, or listening to music. "Alexa, how many tablespoons are in a half cup" or "...set a reminder pick up my prescription", "add garlic to my shopping list" "what's on my to do list for tomorrow?" Catch my drift? I really have found it super handy.  I also listen to MORE music. I pay for Amazon music subscription but really only listened on my phone at the gym etc. Now on a whim, I find I come home from work and ask "Alexa, play radiohead" or something random while I'm taking off my coat, and voila! The quicker/easier access to music makes me utilize the service so much more. I'm still a bit wary of the security, so I've left some things out. I didn't connect my contact list, as I wouldn't want an accidental call to go out to someone while we're having too many glasses of wine at 11pm. No one needs that. The drop in thing is no-go for me. I locked down as much as I could on that stuff. I like that there is a mute button I can press when I don't want her to listen, but we haven't used that as much as we thought we would. I've used it when talking "about her" to someone else on the phone (she kept piping into the conversation with her confusion, LOL. MUTE it Alexa.) There's also a ton I still haven't tried. I haven't done any shopping on it. I haven't used it for smart home items. I haven't even used the Skype. And I STILL use it constantly and feel like its been impactful in our home. All in all, a few gaps to work around so not nearly seamless, but otherwise, it's truly changed our kitchen experience for the better. So many neat little features. I rated it 5 stars based on how awesome this technology is and how great it is at some of these features. I was tempted to go 4 because it has so much further to go, but that didn't seem fair. It's a new technology. I grew up in a world before cell phones - so when I compare that and consider how far this has all come? 5 stars.
title: We caved. First Alexa specific product. Love it!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: chaedog
content: So we've had our Echo Show here now for a long time and we primarily upgraded from the first gen show because we wanted better sound and this device does have better sound.  However I'm not sure what happened, I think there must have been an update a month or two ago that has really made the device kind of sluggish.  We'll be standing next to the show, facing it and when we ask Alexa something a different echo device that's in a different room will respond because the Echo Show now takes a second to respond or so it seems.  It also will just randomly stop playing music or when you ask to have it shuffle songs by a group it'll play one song and then just stop playing.  We're constantly having to restart it because of this, usually after a restart it'll work fine for a bit.  Its not a home wi-fi or internet issue, we have plenty of wi-fi setup throughout the house and use a mesh network and our Echo Show is right near one of the devices even. I'm kind of bummed, I mean we enjoy our echo devices but when they don't consistently work its quite frustrating.  I think this might be our last Echo device and we'll slowly phase them out and replace with something else, when that happens I guess we'll cancel our Amazon Music unlimited subscription too, no use giving them more of our money.
title: Better sound than first gen show, but other things are worse!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Adam Rainford
content: I purchased this product for my grandfather who loves his echo dot. This is a surprise gift for his Christmas. The show was packaged great, it felt like I was opening a new iPhone. The setup couldn't have been simpler, as I don't really like the Alexa app. Everything was done on the screen and there was no need for the app. I did mess up the setup by mistyping my phone number and that led me to call Amazon but they were able to fix that quickly. I was quite impressed with the overall build quality, the speakers were loud and it has decent bass. Also, the screen brightness automatically adjusts to fit surroundings, so when I wake up I am not blinded. I purchased this with the Wyze Cam $5 addon, and I will leave a review there for that. But the ability to pull up cameras (this is my first show) and see them it fantastic. I couldn't be happier with this Show.
title: Setup not done on App

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Amazon shopper
content: Alexa and my Echo Show is one of the most helpful life tools. I am so surprised at the amount of ‚Äúskills‚Äù she has. I can just ask her to search something, set a reminder, add things to my ti-do list, add items to my shopping list, ask for interesting facts, news stories, recipes and more. I can also tel her to play music of a certain genre. You can set up routines and Alexa will be triggered by a code phrase, such as ‚ÄúWelcome me home‚Äù or ‚ÄúGood morning‚Äù. For example, after setting up a morning routine, I can tell Alexa ‚Äúgood morning‚Äù and she responds by telling me that I‚Äôm blessed, then goes into details about my traffic route to work. She then tells me the news. I was able to add whatever ‚Äúskill‚Äù I wanted her to do during my morning routine. I can also tell Alexa to open movies, play clips and open videos on YouTube. I also have Echo dots in different rooms, so I can ‚Äúdrop in‚Äù and speak to whoever‚Äôs in that room even when I‚Äôm at work  I can Link all dots with my Echo Show to play music on every speaker throughout the house. I can also do video calls with whoever has an Echo Show. I can send voice messages to my family even when I‚Äôm away from home. There‚Äôs more, but I‚Äôd recommend purchasing to find out other skills that Alexa can do. The Show can do more than the Dot, only due to the video features on the Show.
title: Try it, and you‚Äôll wish you bought it earlier

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: 3rd Time is a Charmer
content: Integration into the ecosystem. It is an all or nothing thing in my opinion. Our household is fully engulfed by Amazon. My 1 yr old's first word was "Alexa"! I got the Show during Prime Day. As with all technology, in order to keep up with smooth functionality, devices need to be upgraded. The Show is definitely more responsive than my 1st gen Echo. Pros: Sound - for a multifunctional product, the sound the Show produces is quite impressive. Responsiveness - Voice recognition is so sensitive that it sometimes picks up my voice from across the house Cons: Interface - Some will argue it just is not meant for this type of UI. I feel it would definitely benefit from having more tablet like functionality. There is nothing worse than repeating yourself 5 times to no avail. As mentioned in some other reviews, trying to watch movies on the Show is complicated to say the least. Integration - Alexa just isn't able to do everything the Show wants it to be able to do. I would love for everything to be hands-free, but only if it serves its purpose. Alexa responds quickly, but not always accurately. Overall, it is great device. Especially if you can get it for under $150. I got the Show to provide easier access to my Ring Cams (another amazon product), and video chat with older relatives. For these purposes, it holds up its end of the bargain.
title: Room for Improvement, but surprisingly pleasant

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: James A. Hodder
content: This was a good value item to me. I bought the bundled Show (10") that came with a Phillips hue light bulb, and a reduced price echo dot. I am very pleased. It's not perfect, but I have no serious complaints. The sound quality is very good, and I only rated it 4 stars because I like a little more bass. It will probably please most people. The integration is easy. I turned it on, and since I already owned a tap, it hooked right up to my intranet WiFi. I put the echo do in another room and once I enabled both the Show and the Dot for communications, I had intercom capability on demand to our computer room. The voice recognition is actually pretty amazing, and it can almost hear you even if you whisper. One minor complaint, is that I have an old yahoo email account, and the device is currently not capable of letting add that account so I can see my mail. It allows gmail, icloud mail, Microsoft email and one more. I talked to customer service and they confirmed that currently the allowable list email providers that it can be integrated with does not include Yahoo. I plugged the Phillips light bulb in and got it to work after a couple of tries. The instructions were not quite clear. They indicated I had to turn on the light and then turn it off to activate it and get it to lock up to my WiFi. After I did that and it was unsuccessful, I quickly realized that there was no way the light would work with the switch off. Once I turned it to the on position, the app on my phone saw it. It works fine, and besides on and off control, you can control the brightness from the screen or by voice command. By the way, I was impressed with the Echo Dot sound quality. For such a little device, it puts out pretty good sound. It's not like high priced stereo, but it is decent. I am still playing with the Show, and learning some of the skills. There are hundreds of them. I appreciate that when it is idle, you can have the display show different information in sequence. One of them is a random skill that comes up and periodically changes at the bottom of the screen. Overall, I am very pleased with the Amazon Show.
title: Good value

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: ITsTheXFactor
content: It's a vast improvement on the original Echo Show in aesthetics and audio quality, and it delivers most of what was missing from its predecessor for the same price. If you're decidedly on team Alexa, this smart display is the one for you. The second generation Echo Show is miles ahead of the original, but many of the first generation device's characteristics remain.  Four microphones on the front of the device and four on the top only slightly change the look of the controls. As for better hearing, Alexa heard me the first time with the new Echo Show at distances where I had to repeat the wake word three or four times on the first generation unit, Also The redesign brought much-needed change which makes me a lot more likely to want an Echo Show on display in my own home. the second generation Echo Show sounds much fuller, deeper and just plain better than both its predecessor and the Lenovo Smart Display. That's true for video chatting, online content and music streaming. Yes, a Google Home or HomePod will still win out for room-filling, quality sound. But for a smart display the new Echo Show is no slouch. Speaking of Fire TV, the Echo Show will integrate with Fire TV Recast to put live TV on the Echo Show as a recording .Fire TV Recast is a DVR setup for your smart display. Not everyone will value watching real TV on a smart display, but if nothing else, Amazon is taking the logical step of marrying its video services to its video-capable hardware.
title: Amazon Finds the promised Land

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Dawn Armstrong
content: This is my favorite Echo yet!!! We started with the original when it first came out, then got a dot when those were introduced and when the show came out I have been wanting one so bad. Finally this black Friday had enough to get one and i don't regret it! We have it in our kitchen and I love listening to music on it. It plays the lyrics!! Now i can sing along even if i don't know the words!!!! I also love watching some prime videos on it while i cook and bake. I watched some Jack Ryan on it and the quality is soooo good!!! I finished watching it on my laptop and the quality was better on the show then my laptop! I cant wait for more of my friends to get this so we can do the video calling. Next time they are on sale i might just buy another i love it so much! :)
title: Quality and sound for videos is awesome!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: SuperMom Vivian
content: Surprisingly, the Echo Show 10" has been really convenient and useful for our family in the 8 months we have used it. We originally bought the Echo Show 5" and absolutely hated how the screen was small, sound was terrible, and and it just seemed overall slow and lagging. I love the idea of it, but the Echo Show 5 was a disappointment. However, I took a gamble and tried the Echo Show 10" and I'm so glad we did!! I can't imagine my kitchen without it! Pros: - Sound quality is great - Nice to add ambient music while cooking to eating. - Screen is Large and Bright: Easy to watch videos of recipes and aid in meal preparation. - Video - I can call family/friends with the Echo Show easily and also check on my wyze cam for the nursery. - Many Functions - So many functions to play around with. From pictures to games to news or just a timer. Cons: - Some apps respond a little slow through Alexa but I'm unsure if its the developer or the echo. - Sometimes Alexa gets a little stupid and doesn't respond or listens and doesn't do anything. Overall, the pros way outweigh the cons and for us, it's a must-have product in our kitchen. I look forward to future Echo Show products and potential improvements!
title: A Must Have for the Kitchen!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Thoughtful
content: New Echo Show 2nd generation, arrived defective: no sound whatsoever! Upon installation, it updated its software, connected to wireless, but no audio. Checked that it wasn't muted and that mic was on. Did factory reset, still no audio. Sending it back to Amazon. Anyone else having this problem with this batch?
title: No sound whatsoever!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Bubba Bighatt
content: This was a gift.  So i hooked it up, ran it through the setup procedure, and.... no sound.  "Alexa, tell me a joke".  Joke shows up on the screen, but no sound.  Called Amazon customer support, who advised that they are having a problem with Echo show 2nd gen. Asked me to wait until end of day to see if engineers come up with solution, but called back in an hour and asked me to send it back.  So.... 1 star for sending out a product without adequately testing it, embarrassing me in the process.
title: No Sound!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: BeccaM
content: We have a great many Alexa devices, dating back to the original Echo 'tower' device, but also including the Echo Show original model. We were never terribly impressed with those; it was nice having a touchscreen, but it was too small and while the sound was okay, it was nothing special either. Well, the 2nd generation Echo Show has a screen the size of a tablet and much, much better sound. I had been thinking about buying the Echo subwoofer, but I don't think it's really needed with this Echo Show; the only way to improve it much more would be to pipe the audio to the stereo receiver. We also got the adjustable stand for it, which is nice, but honestly it should be a standard included component rather than an add-on accessory. I deducted a star for the same complaints I had for the first generation Echo Show: Please, Amazon, give us the ability to TURN OFF the "Try "Alexa, (some random command" suggestions. I hate them. Customers have been asking for this option since the day the Show was first released two years ago. And second, give us the means to display the clock (customizable would be best) and/or weather larger on the screen, like with the new Echo Show 5.
title: Huge improvement over the Echo Show first generation

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Kricket
content: So far,  I love my Echo Show 2nd generation.  It was easy to set up. I highly recommend getting the kindle book for this device as it certainly helped answer any questions that I had.  I did find a tech glitch that,  from an internet search, may be common to the Echo Show. I had no sound,  but when I unplugged the cord in back of the Show,  waited a bit, and replaced it,  the sound returned.  If I do not unplug the device from the base before unplugging from the wall first when moving the show elsewhere,  the sound disappears when I plug it back into the wall outlet.  So.....always unplug it from the base first,  if you have similar issues.  Fantastic sound,  by the way, and very stoutly built.
title: Great device,  a bit of a sound glitch.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: MichaelJ
content: We have several Alexa speakers and this is our first show. Overall we like the concept, and the sound quality is good but there are a few things about it that are frustrating. I don't know how anyone can give this thing 5 stars though, primarily for the main reason below that it's slow. So about slow. I don't know how Amazon could ship this honestly in the state it's in. Drop in calls sometimes work fine and other times time out or take forever to connect. Same with skills. The Jeopardy skill regularly crashes back to the main screen and videos are slow to respond or become unresponsive for many 10s of seconds requiring me to manually cancel it or on rare occasion reboot the device.  Honestly in this area it needs polish.  I'd send it back if a replacement speaker wasn't the same price (I got it on a sale at a substantial discount).
