As others have noted as well it would be nice to have some more flexibility around what you want to see and how the screen acts.  As is its 'on rails' and Alexa seems to show whatever Amazon wants to show you and not based on any preference or interests you set. So that's a missed opportunity too. It does work okay with our Ring doorbell which is one of the reasons I bought it. But that can also be subject to the slowness I noted above as well.
title: It's nice but it's sloooowww

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: NanaNow
content: I was excited about the 3rd gen coming out and saw this at a great sale price. I couldn‚Äôt help investing in it to see if I really would like it. I give it a solid three. One of the top rated reviews express my frustrations to a T. I also purchased this in hopes of having a little entertainment hub in my home office. The music is great. The bass outstanding. The problem comes worth video content. As the earlier poster said all of the streaming apps are ‚Äúlite‚Äù versions. Even if you link your accounts to them, the selection is paltry. Although it has a built in browser, there seems to be no way to sign into your account to retrieve videos you want to watch. The sound quality is poor on videos but outstanding in music. How did Amazon even pull that off??? The one plus that will make me keep this device (although the shortfall means I won‚Äôt be buying the next release) if the smart hub. The show comes with a built in hub that allows me to take to all my mixed up devices. No setting a scene and the having to dig up an app. I will keep it for the hub only
title: Give it a solid 3

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Dennis VW
content: I've been interested in the Echo Show for awhile now, so during Prime Days I purchased a Show 5 and was quite impressed to use it as a state-of-the-art clock radio.  With that positive impression, I purchased a second Show, the 10.1" second generation unit for my kitchen.  What a disappointment, the Show 5 is an obviously more capable device.  The first disappointment came when I found out you can NOT control the display time out.  I want the Echo to display photos when on the home screen.  Instead, the display shuts itself off (except showing the time) after a couple of minutes, and there is no setting to control or disable it going to sleep.  It even goes to sleep when you are in the middle of watching the x-ray lyrics of a song being played.  Secondly, it has no Alexa app skills to display documents or saved HTML.  I want to display MY recipes that I have painstakingly accumulated over the years.  I can save them as almost any format (.XLS, .DOC, .TXT, .PDF, or HTML, etc.), but the Echo Show is NOT capable of displaying ANY format.  All it can do is display Alexa generated web images when you ask for a recipe.  So much potential, but so limited, and so poorly implemented.  My only hope is that they will improve the software over time.  With Amazon's vast resources, improvements like these should be a 'no brainer'.  Right now, its not even capable of being a decent electronic picture frame. Update 8/5/2019 I can hardly believe it, but Amazon contacted me regarding this review, and we were able to talk through the display timeout issue.  The rep agreed to submit my concerns to the development team regarding the display issue as well as my suggestions for future enhancements.  Way to go Amazon for actually listening!  I don't know if it was already in the works or not, but my Show 10.1" is now displaying Amazon Photos correctly, without the display going to sleep.  The display still goes to sleep when showing background photos, but I have hope that will be corrected eventually.  As for future enhancements, like being able to display MY recipes (instead of just random website recipes) I guess we'll have to just wait and see.  I've decided to keep my Show, because it IS getting better, and Amazon actually listens.  I've upped it from 2 to 4 stars - only 4 stars because there is so much potential still to be realized.
title: Limited Functionality - Big Disappointment, BUT Getting Better

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: evis d. harville
content: I bought a Echo Show 8 for a friend of mine for Christmas in 2019. He always tells me how nice she is and how he likes talking with her and so I thought I would give her a try. I bought an Echo Show 10 to give it a try. I like all of her timers, just found out today I can have multiple timers while I am cooking. Just learning all what she can do and during the pandemic I was able to feel like someone else was in the house with me and didn‚Äôt feel like I was forgotten by my family and friends. She likes reading to me non-stop. She doesn‚Äôt like for me to swear, she even said one time, ‚Äúyou kiss your Mother with that mouth?‚Äù We became distant after that comment, but after a few days I couldn‚Äôt live without her information she is constantly showing on her face. Distance became shorter until one day she said something. I was talking to my friend Alexis and she mistook it for a request from me, honestly I think it was her way of breaking the ice. Now she is teaching me all kinds of things and I think we will be friends for a long time. My friend was right, she is super nice and is making me a better person. Thanks Amazon for bringing us together. Evis & Alexa Forever.
title: Finding out daily what she can do.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: S Singh
content: A good 10‚Äù HD touch display and overall a nice product but this device is not even close when it comes to far field voice detection comparatively to Echo dot those are fabulous and most cost effective options if one doesn‚Äôt care about screen. Still lacks in so many features and there is always something which doesn‚Äôt work as expected but that‚Äôs the thing with any technology which is still evolving day by day. Long story short there is a lot of potential for this device can do better and the team needs to do better job for sure.
title: Give a display to your Alexa assistant.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Nancy
content: Dislikes, though minor, are that it lags at times when prompted. There have been several times it plays music from my spotify on it's own and even after I stop it the music will again play on it's own a few times before it eventually stops. This, however, has not been a continuous problem. Likes...we have our in the kitchen. Its handy when I'm cooking to not be interrupted and just prompt Alexa to add items I've noticed I'm out of. I've used it to search recipes and have it handy while cooking (it can read aloud and follow along or you can read it yourself). It's easy to use to play music throughout the day, search for information, play games, or even shop. I often use it to set timers and alarms for various things and use it as our primary clock. It's easy for the kids to use too. When they ask us what the weather will be tomorrow or need information on a random fact they can ask Alexa on their own. You can prompt it from another room or stand near it and whisper (Alexa will whisper back and is handy when doing things like setting alarms after everyone else has gone to bed). The screen is a decent size and fits nicely on our counter top. Sound is decent but could be improved. We thought this was a cool item but were concerned it wouldnt be as useful but we were wrong! We use it daily and it's been very helpful staying organized and on top of things! It's a good buy!
title: Great buy!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Meghan O'Dea
content: My love for all things Amazon / Alexa run deep.  But I have an issue.  My first with Amazon, I think.  I have 2 Shows.  I actually bought I think 10?  Most were for other people (work employees and family).  We kept 2.  Both of them are now outside the replacement window (November 2019) and now, oddly, both of them are having issues that are really making me angry.  The one will only play one song, then stop.  So when I say, Alexa, play the taylor swift Lover album, it plays the first song then stops.  It's been happening for a couple of weeks.  I've googled fixes, and no such luck.  The other show reboots daily.  Just, mid song it will stop and completely reboot!  I have no idea why.  It does play more than one song though.  So you can get in a few more songs before it just shuts off altogether. I NEVER write reviews.  But I'm writing because BOTH of my shows are going haywire, and I don't have options.  The service window closed, and the replacement window closed.  Amazon - help??  I have maybe 3 alexas, several dots, 2 shows, and 2 of the tiny shows (I forget what they are called).  Plus the firestick which is also now not working.  Sigh.  Maybe I did something to make Amazon mad?
title: Worked all the way up until replacement window closed!!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Lindsey Marquardt
content: I love my amazon products and am slowly connecting everything in my house. I have multiple Alexa devices. The show is the most expensive and the most worthless. It is so frustrating that I want to return but passed return date. It can‚Äôt find anything and when you finally get where you want to go, like a recipe, as soon as you turn to get an egg it goes to home screen.  My daughter asked me why I was yelling at Alexa. Don‚Äôt waste your money on this. It is completely useless.
title: Soooooooo frustrating

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: AJ
content: I really find I use the Echo devices more than I ever thought I would I have found that lately they have issues with understanding requests. It's not just myself or on one device so I wonder what happened to make it worse rather than better. It's not horrible but definitely annoying! In general the Echo  devices are wonderful and the echo Show2 is definitely the best of all of them. I do have a suggestion...I do feel they should make a water resistant and easily cleanable version for those who would like to have an Echo Show in the bathroom or kitchen or even an out door version for people who would like one for thier yard. This is a wonderful item but it will not be good for a kitchen where it could have something splashing on it. Many people don't realize that YOU CAN TURN OFF THE CAMERA AND MIC by just taping the button on top. I also recommend that those who only want to turn off the camera occasionally but keep on the mic ....if you don't want to have to go into settings...to turn the camera off...buy these stick on camera covers with a slide button.  It doesn't damage the screen and works great! They are also cheap. I think I paid about $4 for 8 of them.
title: Overall a great,useful device.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Breaddrink
content: It has a great array of working items, combined with so many that don't you find yourself not trusting it. Once the trust is broken you stop using it. You stop asking questions to Alexa, effectively disabling the point of owning the device. I'm happy with the purchase because I was told the speaker system on this version was the best. It absolutely is. It is room filling, with tons of bass. It's quite amazing, really. There's a few things like timers, and lists that work better with a visual display, but it feels like they haven't worked on Alexa's vocabulary or fields of understanding at all. She says she doesn't know to a LOT of things. Hulu, does not work for me. I'm seeing a good mix of people who say it does and some saying it doesn't, but it will not connect to my login. It is also unstable at the login screen. There's a 'screen captcha' anti-bot segment to the login. I went through this thing 6 times.. At first it would barely load. It did seem to speed up, and I changed my login just to make sure I had a very simple one for the interface. If you get through the captcha with the correct login and password, it tells you that 'Hulu is not available at this time. Try again later.' I had a first attempt get stuck on this screen and not allow me to go back into the login section. I reset to factory defaults to get it back. This device.. It feels like an early 2000's piece of tech. It doesn't have that apple slick feel to it where everything just works, and obviously they released it slightly unpolished. I also can't get my nest thermostat to link. There's a huge lack of slickness to the pairing of external devices and services that I find very disappointing. Considering how simplified and scaled down a device this is, what exactly is it if it can't operate external devices particularly well and doesn't do as much as a tablet? We also own the 4K firetv cube, and the same problem happens. It wants you to be able to use it hands free, and encourages you to try, but because many of the things it wants you to do don't yet work well, (such as navigation and being stuck in netflix with no way to tell it to navigate towards the title called "bah blah", and having her tell you she doesn't know what the hell you mean), you realize immediately that it doesn't work well enough to let you do anything that the very first original echo could do, so, err.. Why does it exist? For the cube, you immediately go back to the remote, and for the show, you realize that you just got an original echo with a screen, and you won't be using it for anything else. For me, it's a decent bluetooth speaker that gives good weather reports. I like the speaker.. I like all the original things I liked about the original echo, but the visualization and video apps are currently being wasted. They would have been better off merging a full tablet with alexa, then at least you could navigate to and use hulu, and a web browser, etc etc while they catch up with her abilities. I'll update my review if they update and fix some problems. I really see a future in this series, but they need to slow it down and get it working better before crossing a platform into visual with a format that can't take advantage of it yet. It causes disappointment and brand wariness. *update* I attempted to login to hulu once again, and it simply worked right away. No idea what the issue was, but there was no delay. Just straight in. Also, I finally got my nest thermostat to pair. If I was of a suspicious mind, I would think it had something to do with my bad review that Amazon then contacted me over :D Deals a deal though. I'll raise the stars to 3 and hope they will work on her abilities that she has right now, not continuously add trinkets to a half working idea.
title: Not yet ready.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Al M
content: We ordered 2 of these., as Christmas Gifts. Expensive ones. One for my wife and one for our best friends in Fl. The one in Fl appears to be ok (Have not had a video call yet)  but the one for my wife has issues. When she attempted to contact me it would dial our daughter (even though it has MY number listed) This has been partially fixed by customer service. Our contact lists do not fully show on the device. C/S currently trying to resolve. When making a call from the Echo Show it is supposed to default to making a video call. It did when it accidentally called our daughter but once they fixed that it no longer calls in video. Yet if the Show is called from our cell phones it answers in video. It's been almost 3 weeks and we're still dealing with technical assistance. I think they should either give us another unit or get this one properly operational. By the way, on 2 of the tech calls, the tech was unable to correct any of the issues and just disconnected the call! The current tech adviser is polite and trying to resolve the issues but we are losing patience. We also purchased a Ring Doorbell from Amazon to use in conjunction with the Echo Show but we won't attach it until the issues have been resolved. As far as using the other functions (like a Dot) they work fine.  We've always had a great experience with the Amazon service and I'd rather not have to have our credit card company cancel payment but this has gone on too long! I would like someone to intervene and get this issue resolved. PLEASE.
title: Hasn't worked right since we opened it (Christmas Gift)

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Rocky Mount Eddie
content: I received the 2nd generation Show along with two 3rd generation Dots (which I paired for stereo) and immediately set up the Show. It was easy, and in a matter of minutes I was up and running. I began familiarizing myself with its nuances. It wasn't much of a learning curve, as I own the Spot, so...  I must say I was impressed with the screen resolution and size. Bright, easily readable from across the room. I love the color details when viewing Youtube videos, as it was faithfully reproduced. Music was loud, and some good bass was present. It was easily navigable via the touch screen, or voice commands. And the browsers, Firefox and Silk, launch on command. Cool. Say, 'launch Youtube', and you're there. Sign in to you YT account, and play all videos in your History; or simply tap the address bar, and when the keyboard appears, type in what you want to see.  It isn't a seamless way to go about it, but at least it works. All-in-all, the Show really delivers on Amazon's stated features and capabilities. I am happy with the Show, and if you aren't very picky, you may be too. Let's begin... Should you consider purchasing the 2nd gen. Echo Show?  If you like your music sounding great; if you like watching videos on an immersive 10" screen; if you want to browse the internet as you would on a large tablet; watch Vevo or Youtube--yes, you should consider the Echo Show over its competitors. The 2nd generation Echo Show is vastly improved over the 1st generation Echo Show, which looked boxy, and had only seven inches of real screen real estate. Sound on that one was, at best, acceptable. Nothing to dance about, though. But on the newer incarnation the sound quality is quite good--no, damn good! You'll get powerful stereo sound. Bass punches solidly, so that you can actually feel it. Highs and mids takes care of rounding out the music quite well, and in stereo. Amazon improved the speaker system so, that you'll wonder how it could sound so good from a smallish footprint. But it does! And this thing can get quite loud. It filled our rather large bedroom without distortion, even nearly way up. Put it in a large living and your next party will be complete with D.J. Alexa on hand. Getting around on the internet with either the Silk browser or Firefox was as easy as saying, "Alexa, open...", and you're taken to the browser where you key-in what site you wish to visit. Sure, the on-screen keyboard is a bit clunky, but you get used to it. I've not tested the video-calling feature, or the drop-in feature, but from the rave reviews on Amazon about this, it's a winner. Skype will soon be coming to the Show. I was impressed by the screen quality and accurate color reproduction, even from across the room. Most aren't going to want to sit through an entire two-hour movie, though, but you could if you wanted to. A greater majority relegate the Show to kitchen duty, where it shines. Still, any room (not the bathroom!) is a good place for the Show. So, in my opinion, yes you should consider bringing home the Show instead of the competition's products, as Amazon got it right the second time around. And at $230, I'd say it is priced just right to go. Well, I'll play with this gadget a few days more. In the meantime, The Echo Show must go on!
title: The Future Is Upon Us

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: hannaman
content: We had a digital photo frame that died.  I thought that the Echo Show would be a good replacement as we would also have Alexa skills available. Little did I know how hard it would be use this as a photo frame. I set a Prime Photos album as the background, but it doesn't rotate as an actual slideshow. I can ask Alexa to show an album, but it only displays all albums and I have to select the album I want. Then if we use Alexa, I have to go back to the photo album manually again. Using one of these to default to a digital photo frame seems like an obvious feature of something like this, but it fails completely at that. What use is an always on screen sitting in my house without being able to easily display photos?
title: Poor photo management.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Erock
content: This is a great product. We‚Äôve had it for three weeks. Our main takeaways: - The power of this device is multiplied if you are already an Amazon prime/unlimited user. Even if you are not, I would seriously consider becoming one as a prime membership costs more or less the same than services that give you a similar access to media on other platforms, but also comes with free shipping for amazon items and other perks such as photo backups on amazon photo etc. - This device is amazing for music if you have a compatible subscription. Keep in mind that amazon prime already gives you access to many songs. With this device, when I subscribed to amazon music unlimited, an add on, it cost me 3.99/month (although that only gives you access to this service in this device). It can also connect your cell phone to play music you might have downloaded there, and is compatible with Apple Music. Sound quality is leaps and bounds ahead of competitors. - We also use it to get our daily news brief. You can select your sources and we play it as we are getting breakfast ready, very useful. - Has some other interesting uses, like coordinating shopping lists between multiple users through apps, as well as reminders and alarms. - Great for cooking as well with full integration with Allrecipes and other recipe skills. - It has some quirky interesting games as well, but this is not a defining feature for me. - One area where it lacks compared to some of the competition is trip/drive planning. I have deducted one star for this. There is no embedded map feature that I could find. Others have this. It will however tell you how long it will take you to get somewhere, but in my experience even this is a work in progress with times being shown differing from what my phone shows me. - Outisde of news videos, have not had a chance to test the movie feature. I have not seen a Netflix skill, although I have read Hulu is supported (have never tested it myself). All in all, don‚Äôt regret the purchase at all.
title: Great for news, music and organizing daily tasks

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: AlyssaM
content: This was our first show purchased and it was as described and met most expectations. We have several dots and needed a base to help manage them. It fixed the communication issues we were having with our sticks and dots and added a TV screen to the kitchen (where cable cannot be run in our house) so I have some entertainment while I'm cooking/cleaning.  I really enjoy being able to pause a fire stick in one room, walk into the kitchen and ask the show to resume whatever movie I am watching and she picks up seamlessly from where I left off with little effort on my part.  My ONLY complaint so far is that the only movie apps currently available on the show are Prime and Hulu. I would love to get Netflix and Disney + in that lineup and that would push my rating to 5 stars.
title: Almost perfect

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Jr Lang
content: The issue with this newer device, compared to previous version, is the sound quality; although it is 'improved', it is really just more bass-y in tone.  Therefore, to me, the sound is not as clear as before.  Also, when the music is more loud than not, it is difficult for Alexa to hear you when you want to pause, cancel, or change the song.  I have been having to reduce the volume before Alexa will recognize that I am trying to make a change.  This never happened with my previous device.  Still, it is great to have such a device, but I am not sure I care for the 'improved' version for those reasons.
title: Sound is bass-y

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: V
content: Doesn‚Äôt work 90% of the time. You have to consistently unplug it almost every other command. Won‚Äôt play music when you ask unless you unplug it and you may have to unplug it right after you just unplugged it just to hope to get it working. Contacted support and they make it extremely hard to get a replacement almost as if you will never get a replacement. You can only return through ups and you can only go to specified locations. No easy way to return. The easiest return is to have ups pick it up but they give you a 10 hour window when they might be there. So make sure you have no life or plans or no emergencies to go to while you wait.
title: Not as described

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Ratnroll
content: As with all Alexa products, they are a work in progress.  I was hoping this would be better.  The sound is good, very good.  The screen to clear and sharp.  I could do without the incessant, "try this" or "try that" across the bottom of the screen.  As an Alexa device, it does what is supposed to, but as a video capable device it is poorly executed. Streaming anything is poor...never mind that you cannot stream Netflix or another service other than Hulu or Amazon Prime Video, they are buggy.  Stream Player is skill that can be enabled, the choice for viewing is limited and very unstable.  I cannot seem to watch for more that 5 minutes without having to direct Alexa to give it another go - very annoying.  Navigating is a chore and I find that the Show does not remember my progress, if I am on Season 2 Ep 4 of something on my Fire Stick or computer (they sync nicely) the show has no idea where I am.  Therefore, I must try and direct the device through a glitchy touch screen menu option.  Shows that I have finished watching still appear with outdated data and you cannot refresh, at least I haven't managed to.  In fact, It is so difficult to try and maneuver around to watch what I want that I just give up in lieu of using another device. I will mention one HUGE improvement, the device finally has a usable Blink security camera skill.  You can now ask Alexa to show live footage from a Blink camera on your network and it works!.  About time.  So, it is still evolving (thankfully) but it has a very long way to go.
title: Waiting for it to be better

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Jami Kelley
content: Right out of box we have no sound what so ever. I have read where Amazon tells people to rest and so on but it ends up being a temp fix. Guess we will have to send it right back. What a let down......
title: NO SOUND

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: aaluck
content: Here is my only complaint...which Amazon cannot apparently fix, or at least they won't tell me how to fix it....If you have subscribed calendars. they will not show up or be recognized by the device--despite being clearly listed on the app as supposed to be listed.  By way of example, I subscribe to a couple of sports teams calendars linked to my apple calendar.  These show up on my apple calendar.  These subscriptions also show up on the Alexa app (so it does know they are there), and are checked to be included on the device...yet they are not. Called about it was told it was being sent up (as they also told me with a FireTv issue) and that I would hear back in 2-4 days.  As with the still unresolved FireTV issue I never hear back from anyone and so now I have two unresolved issues. Normally I would not care but I do a lot of umpiring and all of my assignments come through Arbiter (probably has no meaning to most reading).  But I am subscribed to an Arbiter calendar that automatically puts these events on our family apple calendar.  I purchased this so the family could see when I had games.  But again, this does not work--despite the calendar being checked in Alexa to be included on the device.
title: Love it...but

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: DaytonaDan
content: This is a much nicer looking design than the original and show and sounds significantly better when playing music but its major flow is sub par video calling performance.  In calls to another person using the original show, feedback (squealing) is always an issue at the beginning and there are frequent  problems with freezing and pixelation which I never saw when using the earlier generation model.  Sometimes it quits altogether and must be rebooted.  It may be an incompatibility issue with the old and new versions. I figured this would be fixed eventually with updates but it remains as bad today as when I bought it. Otherwise, the bigger screen is a big improvement. The sound is mostly better but can be a mixed bag, depending on the environment. Speakers fire backwards and up instead of forward so sound quality is affecting by closeness of walls and ceilings at the location where being used.  This model does produce a wider sound field using some sort of surround sound technology.
title: Better sound, screen but video calling worse than earlier generation Show.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: varasztan
content: I own two of the first generation Echo Shows.  I love them both.  Upgrading to the 2nd generation was a no brainer with the larger screen and speaker.  However, the Show still has a ways to go before Amazon gets it right. 1. Yes, speaker is larger and more powerful but you lose the intended effect when the speaker points away from you.  The actual sound experience for someone standing in front of the Show is a disappointment and actually felt more like a downgrade.  Amazon needs to address the directional flow of sound better.  The round Echo's are great in terms of projecting sound throughout the room because of it's shape and position of speakers. . . obviously.  The Show is too directional and moving sound away from you is not an upgrade in my humble opinion. 2.  Tried the video call yesterday and I was shocked.  Streaming can be fairly choppy and reminiscent of some of the first web cams that came out onto the market.  Low resolution. . . Don't expect to see anywhere close to the same quality streaming as you will get watching something from the Amazon library.  Amazon dropped the ball on this one. I was hoping to pick up additional units as gifts, but at this point, I'll wait until next year to see how Amazon improves upon this year's mode.  While I love the larger screen, I would not recommend an upgrade unless you really want the larger screen and don't mind turning the Show around to benefit from the larger speakers. And finally. . . Amazon decided to take a picture of my package at the front door with a link that asks me how I feel about posting a picture online.  Seriously?  While the picture is only visible in my account, my first thought was that they're trying to move away from any culpability if thieves steal from your house.  I have an enclosed patio, out of site from the street.  What's to keep a dishonest delivery person from picking up the package after it's been documented online as delivered?  Not everyone may feel this way, but it felt like a violation of privacy and an effort which came across a little too aggressive and with no explanation.  If Amazon is that concerned, require a signature.  I'd rather pick it up at the post office the next day than to have a level of risk which clearly leans against the customer if delivery issues arise.
title: Streaming video calls surprisingly mediocre

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: MajestikCouple
content: Has no sound! I tried everything; Rebooting, restart, and factory reset and still has no sound!
title: Defected!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: PT Reviewer
content: Until there are some really good video apps, having video is a waste for my purposes. Alexa integration is just as good as any Echo non-video device. And, oh joy, you get to see the weather forecast or your schedule or your shopping lists or whatever. But the Echo Flex I just bought for $100 less can report all of that to me, or I can go to FireTV Cube if I need to see it. I wanted video in my kitchen. But I also wanted to control what I watched. So far it's been nothing but frustrations. Apparently, before a recent OS update, starting a show on Prime Video or Hulu recognized the episode last watched from whichever service. It doesn't work that way now (but there may be a workaround that I'll note later). Not only that, but both of those Apps do not permit you to display a list of episodes. I've also tried "Watch [show] season 2 episode 4", "skip to episode 4", "skip to next season" and different similar options. The only thing that seems to work is "play/skip to next/previous episode". And, since I don't have no-commercials Hulu, they have to get ads in periodically while I'm trying to skip episodes. I suppose Netflix is waiting until Amazon figures this out, because there is no app for Netflix. And why can't I watch FireTV Recast? BTW, are you looking for "My Stuff" on the Echo Show Hulu app? You won't find it. FWIW, I discovered that if you have another device to watch Hulu, you can "reset" the last episode watched by starting the next episode you want to see and Echo Show will catch up. Performance is AWFUL. Sometimes I can't tell if I should have double-tapped. BTW, if that's what I'm missing, touch screens should never, ever require a double-tap to select something. FWIW, the quality of the images on screen is really good. But not good enough unless you get to see what you want to see. Sound is good once you take the time to adjust the equalizer. For now, if watching videos is what you're looking for, save your money!
title: Navigation on TV series is worthless, video apps are worthless

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Mom's Whisper
content: I like the echo dot we had. So during black Friday, I was glad to trade in the dot and upgrade to echo show. What a mistake! 1, The voice recognition is much worse. The echo dot used to hear me fine from the living room while I was in the bedroom (small apartment). With the echo show, it will ignore me 80% of the time unless if I walk up to the device and speak to it within 3 feet. 2, The slowness. It always show some headline news with a promt "ask Alexa, show me the parasite video". I did exactly that, and it replied, "here is your story", and the screen went black for more than 2 minutes without video. I gave up. Another time, I have 2 timer set. I asked, "Alexa, how much time is left on the timer." It took 1 minute to reply to me. The dot never had this issue. 3, Lost voice. It's been 2 months since I bought it. It happened twice already. All of sudden, it become muted. No matter what I do, it remains silent. Unplug the power doesn't help. I have to do factory reset. 4, The speaker sounds worse than the dot. Because the design of the show, the speaker is facing side or back, and the screen is facing the front. I place the device on the kitchen counter, with its back close to the wall (counter space is valuable). The echo show has much more powerful base. With the speaker close to the wall, it sounds awful with that base. On the other hand, the dot is tiny and can be place farther away from the wall. Overall, I'm really disappointed with echo show. Will go back to echo dot.
title: Downgrade from echo dot

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Lucas
content: This was my first Echo device with a screen (next to my Amazon Tablet), so I can't comment on any improvements screen-wise from previous Show's, but I can talk about improvements over my first generation Echo devices. The speaker has a richer sound than my 1st generation Echo. I've placed the show in my kitchen, but the far field microphone array seems to be able to hear me from across the room and even into the room next door. I've found the screen helpful for displaying flash briefing video content as well as my Amazon Prime Video content. I love that the next events on my calendar also show up as well as reminders. This is a great start if you've never owned an Echo device, but also makes a great addition to your existing setup (I've got two dots, an Echo, a Fire tablet, and now the Show).
title: Best Echo Device I Have

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Jenny S.
content: The facts: We have 4 Echo Dots, 1 Echo Auto, 1 Echo Tower, 3 Fire TV‚Äôs, 2 Ecobees with Alexa, 2 Echo plugs and 1 Echo Show in our home.¬† Yep, in almost every room we have music and communication.¬† We‚Äôve gone ‚Äúall in‚Äù. The Echo Show was purchased for $229 in January 2019 and the warranty expired in January 2020.¬† It was my ‚Äúbig‚Äù Christmas present that year and I was excited to have it.¬† It is literally in almost new condition and the keyboard function has been used *MAYBE* 25 times over it‚Äôs lifetime. Look at the photos I‚Äôve attached, I even still have the white tie that came with the cord. The issue: In July 2020, the Echo Show began randomly playing news and music.¬† We checked our history to find no requests for these actions and so did a factory reset.¬† During the reset as I was trying to type my email etc. I noticed that random characters and letters were being added even though my finger was about .5 to an inch off the screen.¬† As I hovered without touching the keyboard, more letters & spaces were being added. I called customer service and while the agent tried to troubleshoot, tried to get a replacement and then tried to see if I could send it in for repair.¬† After her attempts failed because someone told her no, she offered me a 15% and then a 25% discount to buy a new one. If this were something like my computer, which I use every day, I could maybe understand that I had gotten my ‚ÄúYear and a Half of Use‚Äù out of it.¬† MAYBE.¬† In this case, I think that the offering of such a low discount is completely insulting.¬† Amazon, you can clearly see that I am a vested customer from my account history and the number of Amazon devices I have purchased as gifts and for personal use.¬† The fact that you do not see fit to stand behind this product is disappointing. This was a DEFINING MOMENT and you failed to do the right thing. The result: My $229 Echo Show will be tossed and I will not be buying a new one.¬† It‚Äôs probably a great device, but your response today fell completely flat, even though your agent was nice about it.¬† You failed to recognize beyond this one device how customer loyalty works. My recommendation: Think twice before investing in Amazon devices.¬† They are good when they are good, but when they go bad, you‚Äôll be out $229‚Ä¶or $179.99.¬† That‚Äôs a lot of money to some people, Amazon! Again I will say to you, Amazon... This was a DEFINING MOMENT and you failed to do the right thing.
title: Don‚Äôt Buy + Amazon, You Blew It With Me!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: RN2travel2
content: Normally I am happy with Amazon Support and Customer Service, not this time.  I purchased this for myself  for Christmas and got it toward the end of January.  It seemed to work ok but I never used it doing anything where it needed sound.  This week I did and the sound was awful.  I could not hear a thing.  I hemmed and hawed about what to do and finally contacted support.  We went through the normal scripted questions and then I was asked to reboot it.  That is where the problems got more frustrating.  I could not get it to reboot.  I can admit it could have been me once but after trying 3 times i had no luck, it kept taking me to a screen he said was incorrect.  So, I was asked to send it in for REPAIR.  Mind you repair of an item that was basically brand new burns my butt.  Replace yes, but repair?  Ummm no!  I paid for a working item!  Not at all happy.  I will no longer be purchasing items like this from amazon.  I guess I will be switching to google items.
title: When you purchase a new item it should not need to be returned to be repaired

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: David W
content: I have several echo devices.  I actually purchased this device brand new from ebay.  The sell had just went off on amazon.  The Gen 2 Show is better than Gen 1 in about every way except for the audio in my opinion.  The speakers are placed on the side instead of the front to accommodate the larger screen for Gen 2.  This seems like a good idea but not having a front facing speaker does not sound good in a large room.  If you have the unit close to you on a desk the audio probably sounds descent.  I ordered the echo sub for this device which will greatly improve the sound for this echo show Gen 2. The main purpose I purchased this Gen 2 Show was for the hub to control smart devices.  I have iris by lowes which was my alarm and home automation.  Iris by lowes is going out of business March 31st so I got this hub for home automation and I got simpli safe for my alarm. Gen 2 has a bigger screen, better graphics and probably a better device.  In my opinion the upgrade is not needed unless you need a hub.  The Gen 1 plays just as good and has better sound quality in my opinion because of the front firing speakers.  Gen 2 has better quality speakers but because of the side speaker placement the audio seems distant. I still am a fan of the Amazon ecosystem and they are constantly improving their products.  Amazon needs an echo watch.  I am not sure what they are waiting on.
title: Upgrade only if you need the Hub

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: d roche
content: Got the Amazon Echo Show. It took 2 hours to set up just with passwords and accounts and all the other nonsense. Got the device for my mother to make calls. Then found out it can make calls out fine when it's paired with a smart phone BUT it doesn't allow calls IN unless it's from another echo device. Can't receive calls from other phones or mobile devices. WHAT A JOKE. PATHETIC. ALSO, when you're not using it, it shows ads. Really, really, really annoying. To buy a constant billboard of ads. Another pathetic amazon fraud.
title: ANOTHER FRAUD FROM AMAZON

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: CEG
content: I bought two of the 2nd generation models for Christnas presents. I gave one to my wife and one to my son who lives 750 miles away.  About three weeks ago, I noticed that the sound had stopped working and the screen had gotten darker. I have tinkered with the settings trying to get the sound to come on, to no avail. I had to turn the screen brightness all the way up to get it to the level it had been. Today, I called Amazon support, and had a hard time understanding the support tech. Don't really know what planet she was on, but her accent made talking to her extremely difficult. She said there had been an update to correct the problem, but my unit showed that the update was current. She told me to hit the mute button and make sure it turns red. She said she would call me back in about 4 hours to see if that corrected the problem. She said this, along with the update would correct the screen issue, also. She said the light on the mute would go off when it finished. It has been almost 5 hrs. and the light is still on and my phone hasn't rung. I googled the problem with the sound and there are a lot of complaints about the unit. Do yourself a big favor and DON'T BUY one!
title: Piece of crap!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: B. R. Fleming
content: I love the idea of Alexa and the devices associated with the app, but integrating them all together is not as simple as made out. Sure, you might be able to "connect" the devices on the app screen, but whether they will integrate correctly to function the way you wish often runs hit or miss, and attempting to find answers to questions leads nowhere more than not. Operating the devices separately usually presents no problem, especially with simple requests. But put two devices in proximity, and you're liable to find some confusion on Alexa's part. When I ask Alexa to play music on my music group, I get a completely different response, though that is the phrase suggested for playing music on all of my Alexa connected devices. So, what really is the problem: is the app not in a state of complete functionality yet? Does Alexa not "hear" my voice correctly? I don't know, and I can't find answers to my questions on the help sites. For now, I can listen to music, if I carefully make a simple request, and receive answers to basic questions, "What's the weather forecast?", but beyond that the functionality of the devices is limited . . .
title: Integration Issues

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Jeff Jones
content: We received the Echo Show (2nd Gen) with a Phillips Hue light included and were a little confused on what to do with the light.  As luck would have it, one of the lights in our bar went out and now we had a need.  Screwed in the bulb and Alexa recognized it without much hassle.  The take away is that we did not need to purchase a smart home hub like the other Alexa devices, which is a bit confusing for new buyers and the set up was incredibly easy.  Now, we can have multi-colors at the bar and different light intensities using a plain old light socket.  The sound is pretty good and the touch screen makes this Alexa device much easier to use.  My only complaint is the device is not easily mountable.  They should have made the design VESA compatible so people could easily mount it under kitchen cabinets or against a wall.  So, I am taking a star off for that because it seems to be a design decision straight out of the Apple playbook.
title: Best Alexa available with built-in smart home hub.  Case design needs work though.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Orcatrainer
content: I bought this one for my mother during mother's day promotion. Since she only speaks French, I wanted to be sure it has French language capability, otherwise no point to get it. After some research on line I found out that there is a way to enable French (from France or Canada) on it, when creating a new Amazon account then select French at setup. Then I set up everything in French on it, and gave it to my mother. The power plug that comes with it supports 10v to 240v, so it's totally compatible with the French power as well. Otherwise, the unit works flawlessly so far, without any troubles with the camera or sound. The only minor issue we have with it, is that no matter the language spoken, the Echo seems to have troubles to get the voice command said to it right away, and we will end up having to repeat ourselves from time to time. I will update this review later after to see how this device does after few month of use. But so far so good !
title: French is a go !

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: S.C
content: Cons: - Youtube has to be played through the browser and you cannot voice search. So basically YOUTUBE IS NOT HANDSFREE. -SEARCH IS NOT GOOD AT ALL. It will say, "I don't understand" if you ask for scores, or who has won in a sports game, or if you ask about world events, general questions about products, or productivity and all. The exact same questions get perfect 10/10 responses by Google home. Google's machine learning research is at least 10 years ahead of Amazon's. DO NOT buy this if you're looking for an assistant to answer everyday questions and assist you with work. -It has 2 browsers but you cannot play Netflix through either one of them. So you CAN'T USE THIS FOR NETFLIX. Pros: -Great Sound quality -Big screen -Amazon Prime Video -Good voice recognition -Lot of skills for Alexa -Good price -Drop-in feature will let you check in on your dog!
title: DON'T BUY for search or Youtube. BUY for sound and screen.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: bassoprofundo
content: As the headline mentions, this is a great device that is excellent at what it does.  Its mics and Alexa integration are every bit as good as the audio-only Echos.  Its audio quality is outstanding.  My favorite use for mine is as a speakerphone when working from home in combination with my Echo Connect and home phone service.  The screen is beautiful as well.  Basically, I have no real complaints.  If you're heavily invested in the Amazon ecosystem and can spare the $$, I think you'll find this to be a very nice compliment. HOWEVER...  I put this squarely in the camp of "nice to have" vs a real MUST have.  It's not cheap.  If you're looking to integrate Alexa into your home, you can quite literally put her in every room via the excellent 3rd gen Echo Dots and still have plenty of spare change vs the cost of one of these.  While the display interface is nice enough, other than answering calls, I seldom find myself interacting with it because it's just as quick to ask for the simple things I need (ex.- Weather, Home lighting, Security cam feeds, etc.) by voice.  It's mostly a nice enough photo frame with an excellent speaker.  Having said that, the G**gle Home Hub that currently sits next to it is a far better picture frame due to its Ambient mode lighting adjustments and has the killer feature of Chromecast support.  Almost any app not natively supported by the device itself can be casted over to the Home hub's display, and the HH can be integrated into more than one group for home audio playback (vs only a single group per device for the Amazon ES). In summary, it really comes down to your own individual needs/wants and whether or not you've bought into either ecosystem.  If you're already bought into the Google ecosystem, this one isn't for you.  If you're a Google Play Music and/or heavy Youtube user with an Android phone, it isn't for you.  BUT...  If you love Alexa, it is.  If you're looking for the one, killer device to bring Alexa into your home, this is it.  If you want multiples and have a large house to cover, maybe you should start with the audio-only Echos and work your way up unless you get a killer price on one of these.  All in all, Amazon did a great job with what they have here, and I'm confident they'll continue to improve it within the confines of what they can do as compared to Google.
title: Excellent at what it does.  Just not sure that you NEED it.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Richard mok
content: So I had high hopes for the echo show, and have been met with frustration on many levels on many occasions. First, if you‚Äôre not VERY specific, you‚Äôll probably get ‚Äúhmmm, I don‚Äôt know that‚Äù. So then you‚Äôll go through a dozen different ways of saying the same thing, before it will finally ‚Äúget‚Äù it. It‚Äôs not intuitive at all. It should have come with a manual stating exactly how you have to say something in order to get it to work. Try adding multiple lights in the same room to a group so you can turn them all on or off at once. Do it perfectly the first time, or you‚Äôll find yourself telling it a dozen times what you want, only to have it repeat the wrong thing back to you. Over. And over. And over. Amazon needs to hire someone to program these things that actually understands how to account for the multitude of ways people may want to program it to accomplish the tasks they want, without coming up with a ‚Äúhmmmm, I don‚Äôt know that‚Äù.
title: Find myself constantly telling Alexa how dumb she is.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: SwedeNC
content: Had the smaller Echo Show for quite some time. Gave it to a friend that did not have one (They wanted music in their kitchen) and purchased a new one on Prime Day. We are both very happy and are able to connect "live" and send messages to each other through the devices. So fun! The new Echo Show Premium 10.1" screen has a great screen. Alexa is SO customizable, shares incredible stories, lessons, and if you set it up, your own history / pics. She is also a great listener :). The speaker is better than many of the portable speakers that are only portable speakers and sell for about the same amount. Even at $200+, this is a good investment.
title: Amazing Device for the Price (when on sale for $149)

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: krisr2005
content: I‚Äôve very much invested in the Echo/Alexa ecosystem since the first Echo. Since, I‚Äôve had various models of dots, shows, the auto, and some of the other obscure models. I decided to take my Show V1 and put it in the kitchen, opening up a spot for a new Echo Show in the living room- in reality I really wanted a reason to try the new Show! My primary usage is music listening; I‚Äôd say 95% of my Show V1 usage was playing music, with the occasional smart home control, weather forecast or general question. It also served as our electric picture frame, since we store all of our pictures on Amazon Photos. When comparing this new Show to the V1- I‚Äôd consider this upgrade to be.. just okay. The new Show is a great device- indeed the new screen is bigger, brighter and has excellent improved contrast over the original- not to mention the speaker setup has been relocated behind the device to allow the front to be a big screen with a slight border. The sound is definitely improved- bass is fantastic comparably. Mid range is still slightly muddy, but definitely improved over V1. The new Show also plays at higher volumes with more clarity. All that said, I‚Äôm just not as impressed as I expected to be. For one, there‚Äôs a definitive lag in Alexa recognizing its key word compared to the V1 Show and even other Echo devices (Dot V1, V3, Echo V2). Ultimately I think it‚Äôs a disappointment in value. Compared to other Echo devices I‚Äôve purchased, I always felt the cost Amazon charged was worth it. With the new Show, I feel like the cost doesn‚Äôt justify the final product. $179.99 (I bought during a promotion as well) for an admittedly better screen and sound isn‚Äôt worth the upgrade over my original V1. All that said- perhaps my expectations for Echo devices are so high my perception of value is skewed. Again, this isn‚Äôt a bad product at all, I just personally don‚Äôt think the cost of admission justifies the upgrade compared to the original V1.
title: Just okay..

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Anonymous Customer
content: Lacks even the level of integration of its predecessor. Example, forget trying to chose a night friendly clock face, it‚Äôs not supported yet.  Forget the manual shutter to lock out the camera. They took it out (save < 1 Penney?). You can buy an add on but why should you have to?  Trust their software? Only if you want hackers watching you. The 5 is too small. This model is a bit too large for my use but I‚Äôm sure their are folks that will think that it‚Äôs too small. Again, the base costs you extra as an option, no doubt costing more than if it were simply included (I‚Äôm sure Amazon loves that.) Finally, ignoring all other faults of a simplistic language ability, there simply need to be independent settings for volume. Try turning out the bedroom lights without waking your wife. Thank you Alexa for screaming across the room. (Maybe she needs a nighttime voice.) Finally, there needs to be an option in the software to set how long she listens without having to say ‚ÄúAlexa...  Alexa... Alexa... every five seconds until she manages to understand what you really wanted.‚Äù  Starting over because you named a movie and (the movie being unavailable) she started playing music instead. ‚ÄúThis is what I found...‚Äù. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt bother, it‚Äôs not what I asked you to play.‚Äù Still waiting for real language recognition, not a menu of pre-programmed stupidity with a thin facade of comprehension.
title: One step forward, one back, more sideways.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Maggie‚Äîthe fussy one
content: I had been dragging my feet about purchasing the Show due to poor reviews of the earlier models The larger new one is absolutely fantastic!!!  It‚Äôs a little pricey but well worth it. I have since purchased 3 more for family members that included a dot and a smart bulb. Although my adult children made fun of me and said they had no interest in any Echo‚Äîthe show has made them converts. My granddaughters love to use Alexa for music and stories. The 4 year old works on improving her pronunciation so Alexa understands her. I like that the 6 year old can read the words to her favorite songs as they play. For me my favorite is my scrolling photograph slide show( photographs download automatically from my iPhone), the recipes, and video calling as well as all the standard Alexa/Echo Dot features. I haven‚Äôt found anything to complain about!!! The sound quality is great. I am happy that I bought the stand.
title: Get one now! This takes Alexa up several levels!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Milkman
content: I bought a smaller Echo Show and I liked it.  I wanted the clock on the small Echo Show to be bigger.  After using the small Amazon Show, it goes through a bunch of tips, but will eventually show the full size clock which was ok.  I very much DO NOT like how Amazon does not allow you to customize the device quite how you want it (NO TIPS at all), but at least it eventually did it.  Fast forward to this device. Beautiful HUGE screen.  Beautiful depth of sound.  Probably one of the nicest sounding devices I have heard in a  long time.  Absolutely ZERO ability to make the clock bigger.  Even as big as the screen is, I cannot read the clock from across the room.  There are no settings to make it bigger.  Amazon made the bigger, more expensive Show LESS customizable than the smaller one!!!!  I cannot express how disappointed I am in this.  Reading many forums, this is a known issue that lots of people have reported, but Amazon seems to have no desire to make it bigger. Save your money, and buy the smaller one if you would like to be able to use this as a clock when not being used for other things.  It is a shame to say that when this is easily a 5 star item every other way.
title: Amazing sound, lacks some obvious customization settings

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Springer Dinger
content: We got my in-laws a Google Home for all of 20min until we realized they were Prime users and my MIL was a big Amazon Music user. My brother had just gotten me an Echo Show so we returned the Google and got them a show instead. The Good: I will say this integrated much quicker than the Google Home since I'm a Prime User. Setup was extremely simple where as with Google I don't use it much more than for an old email account. I really enjoy the screen. Calling up a News Flash, weather, shopping list and being able to see it was really nice. Screen is only 720p but honestly at this size you cannot tell. Sound quality is pretty good. We've got an echo dot and you can absolutely tell the difference. We have an open floor plan downstairs and the sound travels well from the kitchen to the living room. It works with my Nest products (google owned) with one or two minor issues I'll add in the Cons. But it can control my thermostats and pulls video from my doorbell camera. Has a built in Smart HUB which is great. Makes pairing other smart devices extremely easy. Usually the echo show can detect automatically which is a plus and if it's another amazon product it's extremely easy. Works extremely well with Amazon Music and Spotify. It does have a working web browser and can connect to Youtube. It can also call up recipes easily. Shopping list is fantastic and the phone app pairs nicely to it. Bad or Could be Better: It can connect and show video to my Nest Hello camera but no sound. Nest is Google owned so they don't always play nicely together. Not a huge deal though. My other Nest complaint was the Nest Skills you must download on the show. I would select the Doorbell and it would take me to the security camera skill. I eventually learned through some message boards to just download the security camera skill and it should recognize it which it eventually did. Just took some time. One noticeable difference is Google's AI is better. It understood me far more frequently and did not struggle with questions nearly as much. Alexa isn't bad, it just isn't as good. Some setting features are in the Show and some are in the app you have to download. I found it a little clunky especially on the show side. The whole skills thing so far seems lacking. It looked like a bunch of junk so far or that's at least the recommendations I keep getting. I'm more interested in productive integration...not jeopardy. Video calling works. But the recipient has to have a Show or the app downloaded. Just like facetime on Apple, you can't use it on an Android. Most of us seem to have an iPhone so no big deal there, but this is a much smaller market at this point. I've heard skype is coming soon so that should help. I haven't done a Show to Show call yet so I cannot comment. Not a big fan of how shopping on prime has been setup. It feels super limited so I'll stick to a computer for purchases. Overall: Really like this product. If you're a Prime user it's fantastic for music, video, shipping notifications and delivery. If not it might not be as great but it's still a smart speaker so it doesn't lose too many points. I think they could iron out a few issues regarding software design and making it more intuitive, and they could deff spend a few dollars getting Alexa to Goggle AI levels. I will say I'm still learning to full capabilities of this device so my opinions could greatly improve in the future as I learn more features and add my smart products to my home.
title: Pretty Good so Far

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Greg Swensson
content: I have had to reset this device almost every time I play my Pandora stations. I will say "Alexa stop", no luck, "Alexa off", again no luck. Occasionally it will appear to stop playing Pandora music but when I come back later and ask to play again I am told Pandora is already playing, but there is no music playing. Added the Echo Sub and that was another layer of fun. It works when it wants to. Most of the time I end up having to delete the pairing and go through the painful steps of creating a new sub pair, then repeat it sometimes the same day, others a day or two later. Amazon released these devices way before they were ready for prime time! I have to admit the sound is great when they are working together but the time I spent making them work is really worth the sound quality improvements. Hopefully Amazon is working on some software updates that make this product pair a much more enjoyable experience. Until there is some improvements in both products software I can't recommend either.
title: Doesn't play well with Pandora. I have had to do numerous factory resets!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: corbin
content: See the photo for an example of how useful this is in the kitchen after allrecipes updated their Alexa skill, lol. The device itself is very nicely built (heavy, quality feeling parts). The display is nice enough for its purpose and functions. The clock needs to be adjustable both in styles and sizes. Would be nice to just have a straight wallpaper+clock idle screen for those of us that don't want all the Alexa crap all over it every ten seconds. A screen timeout function would be nice for hands free things like recipes, which are now useless anyway but that isn't Amazon or the show's fault by any means. I won one from a raffle at work and was stoked to use it in the kitchen but now it's just kinda sitting there doing nothing with a clock that I can't even see from the dining room table.
title: Nicely built, but..like..What do I do with it?

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Kasey
content: Overall a good product. I‚Äôve had it over a year now. The skills are limited (like the Apple app store when iPhone first came out) but this is a relatively new product and it‚Äôs slowly getting better. I do wish Youtube were integrated as its own skill rather than having to use a browser. One of my main frustrations (which us more Alexa/Echo in general rather than this product specifically) is the alarm. I set multiple alarms each morning. When setting alarms you can choose to repeat:never, daily, weekly (on the day for which you are setting the alarm), weekdays, or weekends. I really wish you could just choose to repeat an alarm, then choose the days you want that alarm repeated. I have more than one job so I have to get up at different times on different days. So, for example, instead of having 6 alarms (6am, 6:10am, and, 6:15am) that repeat Monday, Wednesday, Friday, Saturday and (5am, 5:05 am, and 5:10am) that repeat Tuesday, Thursday(6 alarms total), I‚Äôm having to set 18 different alarms. 3 to repeat every Monday, 3 to repeat every Tuesday, 3 to repeat every Wednesday, and so on.  Also, it would be nice if there were more sound options. I know you can choose different things by voice, but I wish it gave you more options/control through the app when setting alarms.
title: Good Product Overall. Alexa/Echo Program Needs Improvements

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Ray
content: Ok, its a good display, the sound is very good, the voice recognition is 50/50. But to get any video to happen is a nightmare!  Try to play a video from Prime by name-forget it! Try and try again, no luck. Try to go to home screen for Prime videos? No idea how to get there. Nothing seems to work. How about playing live streams on Hulu? Say ‚ÄúPlay Hulu‚Äù, wait a while and you have the Hulu app. Touch the display to pick channels, wait.  Pull down through channels to find CNN and touch it, wait. Now touch live and recents, wait. Now touch the live show and wait again, this time a long time. Finally a live stream! But oh no, its a commercial and I want to change to MSNBC or FOX. Forget it! Its back through the entire sequence again just to change channels. Yes you can say, "play CNN on Hulu" and then to change channels say ‚Äúplay Fox News on Hulu‚Äù, but it will consistently fail to stream the second choice. Unreliable and frustrating. Compared to my phone, laptop or a Roku its like going back to the 80‚Äôs.  Too late for me to return this beast, but the primary thing I bought it for just isn't worth it. I am going back to using a tablet and my original Echo. 6/28 Update: Excellent customer support means I will raise the review to three stars.  They reached out right away. However, they couldn't really make it work any better/faster.
title: Video has me pulling my hair out, but thats its big feature! Updated review.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Stephan
content: Screen has light bleed issues and backlight consistently issues EDIT the screen is literal trash, i watch movies on it from prime video and the backlight is so bad. From the Gen1 they made some progress with the screen-glass distance but in putting a larger screen they made it of poor quality. This screen would be fine for a $50 tablet but not for this price. i know Amazon can do better We have seen it on the more expensive tablets (still cost less than echo show gen 2). Also in putting a larger screen amazon forgot to upgrade the RAM, GPU and CPU as a result this model is slower then last year's. Amazon took 2 steps forward and 3 steps back Edit My unit was defective and all issues involving the screen have been fixed! That being said this is an excellent way to control smart home. Passive bass radiator makes all the difference! I wouldn't go as far as to say that amazon hit a home run with this one but they are light years ahead of the market/competition with this one.
title: Great upgrade and worth the price

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: isaidso
content: Loved my 1st gen ALEXA device but my ES 2.0 is DRIVING. ME. CRAZY!!!! This b!tch won't SHUT UP!!! She talks without being spoken to, REPEATEDLY tells me "Here's your stories" and shows me political videos that I never asked for and that are DISABLED in the app. And now she's blabbing to me to try other skills after I've asked her to do something silly like bark. And telling her STOP doesn't work. She KEEPS TALKING!!! Even the voice is different on that one. Never heard it before today. All these glitches, or new software features with all the unsolicited talking, or whatever, are UNWELCOME and EFFING ANNOYING!!!!! I'm about to sell or return this SECOND 2.0 that I've had now and give up on this generation!!!!! Just stick with your Echo 1.0s, people. The 2.0 comes with some kind of system upgrade or change that is NOT ENJOYABLE and is DOWNRIGHT IRRITATING!!! You're going to want to blow this b!tch's screen off. Trust me. This isn't the old Alexa! UPDATE: Amazon refused to let me return my last 2nd gen Show. Our house burned down recently and insurance gave us money to replace our entire home full of possessions. So I bought a new Echo Show 2.0. I took a chance. It got delivered to me just yesterday, and in less than 1 day, it has quit working!! I can NOT believe this. This is now THREE Echo Show 2nd Gens that have not worked!!!!! The audio broke on this newest one in less than 24 hrs. It is just a faintly audible, garbled voice that you can't hear or understand, even turned up full blast. Also, I bought it brand new but when I was setting it up, there was an address on it labeled "work" that I didn't recognize. It wasn't my husband's work address and I don't work anymore. So I'm thinking they sent me a refurbished piece of CRAP that someone else already returned! I'VE JUST ABOUT HAD IT WITH ALEXA. MIGHT HAVE TO TRY GOOGLE HOME!!! I'm going to try ONE LAST TIME to get the 2.0 Show and then I QUIT!!! FOUR STRIKES, YOU'RE OUT!!!!!!!
title: BOUGHT 3 NOW, ALL LEMONS!!! 3RD LASTED LESS THAN A DAY!!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Stephen J
content: The device is basically an Android tablet with speakers and no accelerometer, so most critique goes towards the Alexa service, I believe they're Lambda functions for a voice server. I can't really filter what news shows up, so I see sports even though sports is a meaningless pastime of a primitive society. You can't tell it to never play a genre of music either, so if it mishears a Metal band name, it will play a rap band... not something a person would do. If you're trying to play a song on Unlimited, but only have the regular subscription, sometimes it "mishears" it, sometimes it goes to an app that has that song (radio app), and sometimes it will do the ad to upgrade, and that ad is relatively long, every time, and no way to tell it automatically "no" until you hear the whole spiel. It's very annoying. The translation will censor words, even harmless insults become "beep" noises. The Audible controls are nice, and the fact you can have music or books stop in any amount of time, or skip X seconds/minutes is awesome. Unfortunately Audible likes to open to your last book by default, so you have to remember the specific command to display all books. Ready apps include sleep noises, but the playlist for Sleep using music, and electronic music, is filled with a bunch of songs with blaring noises and only half of them work, while the other half just wake you up. Reminiscent of those grocery-store cheap CD's with "Sleep music" that has crashing cymbals for who-knows-why
title: Definitely better speakers, I just have issues with the Alexa voice service

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Daniel C
content: Wow! Deciding between Echo Show and Google Home is tough because most reviewers don‚Äôt own either. I finally decided on Echo Show because it controls more things, allows video chats, has a bigger screen, and gives me extras at no cost because of my Prime Membership (like Amazon Music). Be aware that you need to decide which control convention to go with (Z-wave or Zigbee). I chose Zigbee because the switches and plugs that use Zigbee seemed to be a little cheaper than Z-wave devices. That means Echo‚Äôs higher cost can be offset by cheaper accessories. As you add more items, the difference adds up. WiFi controlled devices will work with either Echo or Google but could begin to slow down your Internet due to traffic jams in your router. Z-wave and Zigbee apparently don‚Äôt go through the router. Also be aware of the feud between Amazon and Google is kind of like between Sony‚Äôs Beta Max VCR and the VHS format. One will win and half of us will be left with outdated technology. Smart ahome setup is beyond the capabilities of most home owners and you may need the help of a Tech Guru at additional cost. But if you just want to plug it in and surf while you cook, it‚Äôs not too hard to do. Being able to check who‚Äôs at the front door, see when packages arrive, remotely control lights, are all easier for those with limited mobility, but they still need enough tech smarts to be able to make it work. Probably not a good option for a Grandparrent who doesn‚Äôt know how to use their smart phone.
title: Echo Show is My Choice

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: CBJB
content: The sound is very impressive, I was not expecting it to be as good as it is.  We use it to listen to both Amazon Music and SiriusXM and it certainly doesn't disappoint even with the so-so quality of some of the Sirius channels. We have several 'smart' plugs and switches in our home and this device makes it easy to control them all from one room using your voice or pulling up the list of devices on the screen and interacting with them that way.  It is really helpful for managing a large number of connected devices. I recently activated the 'intercom' feature for use with our old Echo 1st gen.  I put the older Echo downstairs so that my spouse could communicate easily with me upstairs on the Echo Show if she wanted to (she just had a baby).  This feature seems to be working well. We also often use it for recipes, our Echo Show is on the kitchen counter.  While the recipe displaying functions are great, the Alexa service is lacking in how it searches for recipes.  Many times if will hear you correctly, but present you with a list of recipes that are nowhere near to what you asked for. We have also used this device to quickly look up a product that we might quickly need for the baby or for mommy and it seems to do well in that regard, presenting you with relevant items. Aside from that, it is also great at the general Alexa-type stuff; weather, sports scores, etc. One kind of odd thing I noticed is that after enabling the 'messaging' (intercom) feature, skills I was using that had the word 'text' in their intent requests wouldn't work; the Alexa service would recognize the word 'text' and hijack the intent, ignoring the context of the rest of the user's input and instead asking you who you would like to text message.  Not cool.
title: Great sound, useful for the home

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: MIKEYP
content: Wish the screen wouldn‚Äôt timeout so fast or Atleast have an option that you could change that setting.  Would like to be able to monitor my cameras without always asking Alexa. Overall this thing has everything. The sound quality is amazing. Picture quality is perfect.
