I‚Äôm still messing with it and trying to figure out how I can use this in everyday life as I‚Äôm slowly transitioning my house to be a full smart house. But for now with cooking and listening to music this thing is amazing. Add a screen time out setting and I‚Äôd give it 5 stars.
title: Great sound

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: tiki888
content: Don't expect Alexa to be anything like Siri or a search engine like google. 60% of the questions I ask, her response if "Hmm I don't know that one". For the price I paid, it isn't worth it.  Google knows much more.  Maybe the company should have considered putting in a search engine.  That way, you a have 50% of getting the right answer. I had it put printing on for a screen saver.  If you ask about the picture, she has NO clue what you are asking.  Even Siri was smarter that that, I just don't like apple products.
title: Alexia is DEFINITLY not smart!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: nf
content: We really wanted to love this and we were very sad to have to send it back! My mom is 92 and still lives independently. She is still very with it but now almost completely blind.  She has two Alexa dots and an Alexa microwave that she uses daily. They are both completely voice activated and have given her back freedom and independence in her life. Verbally she can cook a meal, ‚Äòread‚Äô a book, listen to music, set reminders and timers, use a calendar, ask for information, listen to the news and even make phone calls with these amazing Amazon devices.  Unfortunately, the Echo show does not add any helpful skills that can function completely by vocal commands. Currently, with Covid 19, all religious services are being done virtually on zoom and Facebook live. We have gone over and helped mom to tune-in and she loves being able to hear the services and she can see a little bit on the monitor. This has made her very happy BUT she hates not being able to do this independently. We were really hoping that the Echo show would be able to help with this but there is no way to verbally accomplish most tasks without having to see and touch further prompts on the screen. We were also very excited to see that the new Echo show had visual recognition technology. This is a nice feature but it is still very rudimentary. It can read a label on a can and, sometimes, a prescription bottle but that's about it. Verbally you can ask Echo show to go to a site like Facebook or Prime video but then the info is displayed on the screen which is very small for someone with limited vision and then you have to  'touch' the even smaller icons on the screen in order to accomplish the next steps. Just imagine...If you could ask for a site and it would go there or use follow up verbal prompts to get you where you want to go. Mom currently uses the verbal cable remote and it hears her requests and reads the additional information to her so she can make a selection. Imagine...If you could hold up a piece of mail or an announcement flyer and have it read to you. Currently mom has a device that she can scan slowly over a document and it enlarges the text so she can see a word at a time. It is very slow going but it is independence for her. It would be amazing to have the Echo show 'read' these kinds of things for the visually challenged. Imagine‚Ä¶If the design team turns their R&D on its head. Instead of fun and novel things that these devices can do instead think of how they can be so much more and can really impact and change lives. Maybe they can try designing and using them while blindfolded and see how it makes you realize what else needs to be there to be useful and create independence. Currently the Echo show is fun and has a lot of novel features for your household but it has the potential to be so much more. We are hopeful that the design team will help these devices to continue to grow and develop. They have the potential to go beyond fun, novelty items and become invaluable tools for so many!  When these things happen we will be first in line.
title: So much potential to help visually impaired but not yet there

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Marcus Rodabaugh
content: I received my Alexa Echo Show 2nd Gen and loved it from the start. The sound quality was great, the AI intuitive, and voice recognition did amazing at even understanding me with food in my mouth. Within 20 days, the screen flickered and lines went across it. The next day the screen didn't even respond. The device still worked as an Echo but no longer showed you anything. I called support to get help and they had me ship it back. It was never mentioned it was being sent to a 3rd party to be evaluated to be repaired or replaced. To me, this should have been an immediate replacement and apology. It was within the first 30 days. Its technology, you can't control every little semiconductor or the fluctuation in power going to it. So, I understand some will fail. Most happen within the first 30 days. As a consumer, I don't believe I should have to be waiting for any device to be repaired within the same month I bought it. Support on the other hand, was trying over and over to justify why I should wait. So that way I can be happy to get my original device I purchased back in 1 to 2 weeks. I guess what I should have done, was sent it back as broken. Then, bought a new one. It would have cost me nothing and I would have my new one in the mail the next day. I was a computer tech for 10 years, I sold computers and their parts, as well as, fixed them. In those years of sales experience I would have never thought about telling my customer that just purchased an item, they would have to wait until someone else (other than me or my shop) evaluated the item to determine the issue and then decide to fix or replace that item. So, I guess in the end, it was poor support and quality that is forcing me to give this device a 2 star rating.
title: Great Device, Poor Quality

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: BASEL ALDOSERY
content: Aside from everything Alexa does which is great, Mostly I use the built-in firefox to browse to YouTube.com/TV to have the best YouTube experience on such a device, And this experience will not Be complete without a wireless 2.4Ghz USB remote control, I bought a micro USB OTG adapter So that I can connect The wireless USB  dongle to the echo show 2, Not a lot of people know of this feature which can also allow you to connect keyboard and mouse to the Echo Show 2, and with this combination You get a true YouTube mini television set experience. It can also play Hulu and Amazon prime videos by voice command which is awesome,  for example Alexa play Seinfeld, And it will catch up from you where are you've left off. And with twitch skill enabled you can watch your favorite twitch streams, What more do you want? Netflix, HBO, & YouTube TV isn't supported yet though, but you never know, maybe one day it comes to the Echo Show!
title: It's my daily bedtime YouTube Sanctuary!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: 1966 Nova
content: My grandma and grandpa used to go get food from the food bank where they met a man named John that volunteered there. My grandpa was in his 90s so John began delivering the food to my grandparents. My grandpa passed away at almost 102 and John continued to bring food to my grandma.  Johns wife had passed away so him and my grandma became friends. They would talk about how much they missed their spouses and would share memories.  John volunteered for many years at the food bank. Now almost 80 years old and still helping out. He recently called my grandma and told her that he wouldn't be able to make her deliveries anymore. He said he had cancer and had only 2 weeks left to live and he won't be leaving the hospital. My grandma went to visit him and took him some red roses as she knew he loved red roses. As she was leaving, John began to cry. My grandma told him that it's ok and that he will be able to see his wife and daughter that had passed away.  She also told him to tell my grandpa that she misses him and that she still loves him and will see him soon. John passed away a few days later. My grandma was left missing her friend and my grandpa. I won a set of 2 of the Amazon Echo Shows from my amazing job at a Christmas party that was held in February. I know it sounds odd. This was the best way to ensure everyone could attend. So I sent one to my grandma and had my cousins husband set it up for her. I can tell you that my grandma has found new life thanks to Alexa and this Echo Show. My grandma is legally blind but can see some things. The screen on the Echo Show allows her to see pictures of the family and she can zoom in. This is so great because with the Alexa integration my grandma doesn't feel as lonely or helpless. I am so thankful for the Echo Show... thank you for bringing happiness to my grandmother again.
title: Thank you! Happiness has been brought back to my Grandma

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Steven
content: Right out of the box it had no audio, had it replaced and it worked. Ot sounded pretty good until it started acting buggy. Then no audio at all on anything. Now im waiting for a replacement. They made a ticket and still waiting. Apparently the factory that was making the units that I had gotten was shut down because all of the units from it were buggy. Im glad they hot shut down for it. I as well as others in my situation should not have to go through this. And wait impatiently for our replacement yet again. We should also get credits to our Amazon account for future purchases for all of this hassle.
title: BUYERS BEWARE!!!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Vicky
content: Compared to the show v1, this is a massive upgrade. The sound system, and the display make this device so much more comforting to both look at and use. Voice recognition is fantastic, sometimes maybe a little too good. However, this device has many more flaws than expecting. The first show v2 I had came with a type of "ghost tap", where the screen taps without you actually tapping there. Not normally a noticeable problem, but when typing anything or scrolling through a page with hyperlinks, automatically typing in an extra letter or jumping away from the page is extremely annoying. Contacted amazon, and they replaced it. Great customer service. The replacement device started working fine and obviously came in pristine condition. This time, the bluetooth was the one that began malfunctioning. The bluetooth would break connection, which by itself is not a huge problem. However, the echo claimed that my iPhone was still connected when it clearly wasn't. Turning off bluetooth on the phone did nothing. The echo still remained "connected" to the phone - when it wasn't. Not a horrible problem, so I tried to manually remove the phone and commence repairing. However, the show refused to disconnect from the phone. It would say "disconnecting" yet would never actually disconnect. It was only after a factory reset that the phone was truly disconnected, and the problem was seemingly gone. Paired just fine, music played just fine, yet a few minutes in, the problem happened again, and now, Amazon has gone to try and solve the problem. Another complaint I have is the home screen. Mainly, about why the time remains so small. It's got a massive screen, with a lot of just background space, so why not let us, the consumers, customize it more? I'd love to enlarge that time display, and be able to utilize the home screen the way I want it to. All in all, with the issues solved, this is a phenomenal device that I'd love to have back in my life.
title: Fantastic device with quality control flaws

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Pixie Perfect
content: Constantly disconnects and can't locate wifi.  I repeatedly have to reset by unplugging almost every week. The voice recognition is horrible! I tried calibrating, ,updating, changing the language, speak clearly, but it just doesn't understand me. My Echo Show (1st gen) doesn't have these problems and the only thing that makes 2nd gen a step up is the size of the screen and sound quality. With everything I've gone through with this device on top of the price tag ( I pre-ordered when this was first announced), I can honestly say don't waste your money.  I would 100% return this if I could. EDIT: Amazon reached out to me to essentially ask if I had tried turning my unit off and on again (thank you for wasting my time with that call btw).  Since this unit is continuously having issues, an offer of a new unit or a refund would have been great, but no, I got "have your tried updating".  If you even bothered to read my review, you would know I've done everything short of opening up my Echo show to check physical connections.  Usually Amazon's customer service is extraordinary,  but this last occurrence was purely lackadaisical.
title: Don't waste your money!!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: GWL
content: My expectations were rather too high here. Unfortunately, this Echo Show only has limited functionality, it has the Echo suite but then for streaming content is limited to Amazon Prime and Hulu only. No other streaming services are supported. I like to have a selection of news channels and not limit myself to NBC. You can link your Pandora account, but unless you specify when asking for a song to be played through Pandora it will attempt Amazon Music service 1st. Clunky when trying to voice menu search for recipe's etc. Will stick with my Fire tablet for now. On a positive note, speakers are awesome in quality.
title: Make sure this unit's capabilities meet your expectations before buying.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Lenox
content: We have several echo dots and shows around the house and thought about putting a dot on the garage for music and connection to the house. But a neighbor heard a friend complaining that a new babysitter was able to activate and deactivate the ring alarm using her voice that was not trained in the system. We also have ring and was looking forward to connecting it to the echos. Until the wakeup word can be made personal and private, the four basic well known wakeup words are security risk to activating and deactivating the Ring security system. I would consider disconnecting the security alarm from Alexa.
title: Warning! Stranger Deactivated Ring Alarm

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: J. L. Garcia
content: The Echo show (2nd Gen) loses all volume control when powering back up after a brief power failure/ or by unplugging the unit from the wall outlet for a few seconds.  The only way to return volume function to the unit is to unplug the power from the back of the unit for 5 seconds....(unplugging from the wall outlet does not work).  We often have power glitches in Florida and to come home and have the unit not have any volume  is extremely annoying...  the only way to return volume functionality is to unplug the unit from the back for 5 seconds.  I thought I had a defective unit ... but the replacement unit is doing the exact same thing....  I invite all to try the experiment... unplug your unit from the wall for a few seconds and see what happens to your volume!
title: Loses All Volume when powering back up after a powerfailure

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Natasha B.
content: We recently received the Echo Show 2 as a gift. The sound quality is much better than the Echo Spots we have. Also being able to visually see multiple timers is very handy. Honestly I am extremely disappointed that I can not read my kindle cookbooks on the Echo Show. Sure you can have it read to you in Alexa's robotic voice but that isn't practical. I think not being able to access the kindle books is a huge flaw! If they would allow full access to your Kindle library that would make this product much more useful. Also would be handy to have icons for skills on a home screen because lets be honest some skills require very specific wording that doesn't roll of the tongue naturally. Overall it isn't terrible but it is missing some key features. If we had not received this as a gift we would not have purchased this unless they added those missing key features.
title: No bad but it is missing some features.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Holly R.
content: I do love this item. We have had the Original Echo with Alexa for 5 years. I cannot be without Alexa!! We have always used as a timer, shopping list, Pandora, prime music, sleep sounds, and various other skills. I like the Show, but I had higher expectations. We are going to use it with the Ring Doorbell system and to video call relatives, but so far I have used it for recipes while cooking and prime video. So my problem is while using a recipe, I also wanted to set a timer. Once it goes to the timer, you can't tell her to resume the recipe, you have to ask her to find the recipe again and start over. I was also watching/listening to a movie and had the same issue. She won't just go back to where it left off. I had to ask for the movie again from scratch. But it did pick up where it left off once I got it back up. "Third world problems"! Overall, I'm glad I got it and cannot wait to find out what else it can do and see how it gets smarter over time, like the Echo.
title: Still needs some work, but good

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Jack D Friedman
content: It's about what I expected.  It has a very clear display and once I found how to adjust the sound settings it actually sounds pretty good.  It responds to my voice much as any of the echo devices. Showing the actual information that i request is a lot better than hearing it.  Overall it seems to take the Alexa automation system to the next level. I haven't found how to turn off the display yet. It does dim automatically after a while. I bought it for $179 including a smart bulb from Best Buy. I have the Alexa app installed on my phone and tablet.  Both work seamlessly.  I can control Alexa devices between different locations from either device.  This feature gives me a great sense of security. Currently i have around 20 lights and switches connected.  3 different manufacturers of the devices.  Plus 3 fire tv devices. All install and work easily. Make sure your internet has a strong connection.  Enjoy scheduled events and routines as well as manual control. I love the drop in features so I have an intercom just in case my cellphone is outside of range. I'm shopping for compatible affordable security cameras.  When I find and install those the display will pay for itself.
title: Echo show 2

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Night of Starz
content: Oh boy, what a mistake I made buying this.... I just don't get the disparity between the marketing to skill set of the equipment - this product seems to be a donosaur pre-release of something that could be good that's coming in the future that we don't get to have or enjoy because we bought the lesser functioning version FIRST. NO HOME SCREEN TO CONTROL THE MACHINE & it's capabilities are non-existent to VERY DIFFICULT to harness or control in ANY way. I would not have bought this had I known. I would like Amazon to give us updates that improve this machine, like allow WEB SURFING & an actual home screen to control this machine. Even if I watch Days of Our Lives online episodes, all it allows is to go forward or backwards but not to control a 'refresh' option when Alexa Show goes frozen for hours during a commercial or show... this product I thought was going to be sci-fi-fun absolutely perfect advanced technology - this system IS SO LIMITED IT'S a NIGHTMARE to try to operate.  Voice commands are so minimal in scope and ability, I was shocked. What an overpriced product for just a wonderful speaker and a dinosauric operating screen even if it does have touch screen.  Like I said, you can't refresh anything, you can't ask it to find a business, or a local transportation website  which seem to show that it does not access the actual entire World Wide Web which is just loaded with useful information ti draw upon  - no web surfing at all through it. In other words, it can't even do what the web can and go to a place to get you the information it couldn't give you. It had a hard time finding my purchased amazon music, it can't go to a website, it can't play online episodes well of things: IT FREEZES and no refresh button, no controls, no voice capabilities with these things. Alexa show also asks you to link your home computer though vicky something when you try to get it to reach a website, then cannot link your computer when you follow the instructions for that - there's something wrong here - Amazon, where is the complete list of what this product even does other than weather or something very miniscule? I am shocked, I thought this would be sci-fi type fun it would be so advanced & am just shocked at how very little this Alexa Show can do. Positives are it does play really good radio stations and you can ask it to tell you how to say some common foreign language sentnces or words.
title: Skill Set LACKING

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: KLantern
content: I got this as a gift and so gave it one star. I would give it zero if I had paid for it (or if that was possible). If you have a smart phone, Chromebook, laptop, etc...this is just an annoying, overpriced, large waste of space. Can you use it to video call others? Yes..but your other devices can do that too. Can you listen to music? Yes..but the less expensive, no 'Show' devices can do that too along with all the other skills like lists, calendar, news, etc... Can you watch a show on this? Yes...but if you have a tv, don't waste your time on this. Long story short, I would never get this for myself and will never recommend it to anyone.  One of the best rated apps for the Echo Show is the 'escape room' game which I tried to play with my child and was immediately disappointed. The 'escape room' is just a still shot of a room and all your 'clue's' are spoken...slowly, by Alexa. My daughter was like "what is the point of this?!?!?" We also tried the 'Spongebob Challenge' game...again, no touch screen interaction and so frustrating for a kid used to actually interacting with other screens able to do things. So long story short...this is sooooo not worth it!!! Not yet anyway. It might be some day, but as of now...it's just an over-sized, over-glorified speaker. I only post a review if I LOVE something...or in this case...HATE something.
title: You don't need this. It is a waste of money and space.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: E. Tucker
content: Not going to beat around the bush here, the next version of this device must be able to tilt the camera out of the box.  I mean really, this is my only issue.  Where it sits, or really anywhere in my house it is always aimed up at the ceiling which means there is typically a light in the background and as anyone that has ever taken a photograph knows when you have a light in the background it will darken the overall image to adjust for exposure.  If you look at the second picture I posted you can see how it has a very high angle, capturing more of the ceiling than the rest of the room.  This was done so you can stay in frame while talking, however with those lights in the background I or anything I am trying to show someone on the camera come through darker making it difficult to see details unless I move to block the lights with my body or whatever I am holding up.  The ability to either tilt the camera or adjust exposure manually would help this issue.  Second, we are about to have out first child and my in-laws live about an hour away.  They wanted a way to be closer to the family without always having to drive back and forth.  So when I purchased this device I also purchased one for them.  My initial idea was to put one in the nursery so they could "drop-in" on the baby, issue is all they will be able to drop-in on is the ceiling and maybe a top rail of the crib.  So unless I am in there holding the echo and showing them the baby or holding the baby in front of the echo it just won't work the way I wanted it to.  Which is why it is now in the kitchen. Hopefully Amazon will design this feature in to the next version of the echo show.  Until then I think I am going to grab either the tilt stand for the echo show 2nd gen (while it will help, it sucks having to purchase something that could have been built in and I don't know if it will tilt down far enough to accomplish what I want) or I can purchase an Echo Spot and a tilt able wall mount that I can mount above the crib. Everything else about the Show 2nd gen is amazing.  Speakers are great, has very clear audio even at high volumes.  Image quality is good.  The presence of the device is unobtrusive.  Amazing build quality.  I love the device.  Just wasn't expecting such a high angle on the camera, it may be obvious to some but it took me a bit by surprise once I started to use it.
title: One drawback keeps this from being a 5 star device.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Kim McG
content: I have to see if there is a way to adjust the bass. Music sounds incredible!! But it's too much bass for speaking to be clear. I bought this for my dad in a nursing home to replace the echo show 5 he has now. The echo show is a complete GAME CHANGER for communicating with loved ones in nursing homes! My 84 yr old dad is such a stubborn tech-phobe! Never would get a cell phone or computer. But with no personal phones where he is, the e.show5 was a god send. Plus he plays all of his old time country & blue grass music. He thinks it's the greatest thing that he can just tell Alexa to play Johnny Cash or Loretta Lynn &not need a cassette or disc lol. Plus with th he drop in feature, he "checks up" on every freakin day lol.. & really enjoys seeing who hes talking to.  I cant wait to bring this big one to him so he can then watch movies!
title: WOW! THE SOUND IS GREAT FOR MUSIC... BUT.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: mommyO4
content: It‚Äôs a decent product. We also have the Google Home.  The Alexa has an amazing sound speaker, but be aware that you cannot play multiple songs on multiple devices without a $15 a month charge. This is very frustrating. I have a family of six, each person owning a dot and we have the show. The kids all want to set their own alarms and reminders and it is quite frustrating. This technology Seems like it is in its infancy, unfortunately.  Alexa get stumped very easily on questions, and you have to have just the right wording. However she does search for recipes and you can scroll through them and pick the one you want. That is helpful in the kitchen. It does have a large selection of music on Amazon music, however to get an unlimited amount, again, you have to pay for it. This is why we got the Google home as well, So we can get what we need without the hassle of trying to re-word every question we ask Alexa. That being said, the Google Home and the minis do not have good sound systems. They are decent, but Alexa blows them out of the water with her sound system.
title: A quick review

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: bananafarm
content: The device is a huge disappointment overall. The biggest problem is that sound died after 30 minutes, and won't come back even after powering off and on and resetting the device. It's pretty useless at this point without sound. The software is also rather awful: - Ring integration is sluggish. Half the time, the camera stream won't appear. The rest of the time, it takes about 30 seconds for the stream to come up, and even then it's very pixelated. - The device is very slow. Every menu takes several second to load, including the back button. - The developers don't understand hit targets. A lot of the buttons, such as the back button, are difficult to hit with your finger because they're so small. You're better off buying an iPad and keeping it always on.
title: Died after 30 minutes

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
content: This is a great counter item for playing videos from Amazon Prime or listening to music from Amazon. Alexa integration works really well and if Amazon music/videos and Alexa is all you want this for, than it's easily a 5 star. The sound quality is fantastic. However for me, there are several limitations on a 'show' device (since it's not a full tablet) that I did not know about (and should have done my homework). First, you can't stream from most other sources, like Netflix or Youtube.tv etc. Second you can't really customize the home screen, it just rotates through a bunch of things and Alexa tips I'm not really interested in. I'd really like the ability to customize what's on the home screen carousel. Last and least important, there's no battery so if you want to move it to another location, you have to wait for it to boot up again once you plug it in (it doesn't take long but it's still annoying) So I returned it, and will hope that eventually Amazon simply puts something like a full HD10 tablet in a similar desktop mount with good sound.
title: Great sound and size however issues for me that kept it from being 5 stars

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: R Knox
content: When it worked, it worked great. It would be nice to be able to shut Alexa off and not have a system listening all of the time. We bought,  the system in August 19. Worked fine until Jan 20, then the sound quit working and I could not find a way to get the sound to return. I always liked the Amazon return policy and have used it a few times. I realize the system was over a month old, but it should work for a year. I could not find a way to return the system and get a system that works. That is all I wanted to do. Product is great. My Item is defective.
title: Sound stopped working

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: 2Believe33
content: I purchased this for m mother who had difficulties with an iPhone, not to mention all the scam calls she would get! She can make calls out on this to whomever she‚Äôd like, but only certain numbers can call in...just what she needed! She can video chat with her friends and family if she chooses or just speak to them like a regular phone. At one point she actually watched a movie on her SHOW. It is a bit difficult for her to remember that it is a machine and sometimes says too much when short and simple is necessary. Overall, it‚Äôs perfect!!!
title: Best item for elderly!!!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Sharon P
content: Like this product a lot because it has so many uses.  I have not tried out all of them yet, but the ones I have used work great!  I had a nice video chat with my son who also has an echo show.  it was a great way to see each other without actually being in the same room with each other!  Can't wait to try some of the other uses I know it has!  It plays music really well and has some killer recipes you can use!  I would highly recommend this product!
title: great for many uses!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Kelly
content: We have so much fun with Alexa! She does useful things like display the day‚Äôs weather, and silly things like give you ideas of how to dress for that weather! (Linen jumper, espadrille, and a woven handbag for recent temps!) The home screen scrolls with pictures the kids ask her to take of them and suggestions for news stories, skills, or tasks she can complete. Every day my kids ask for the birthday lineup and what happened on this date in the past. We already had Echo Dots, but the suggestions on the Show have taught us so many new things we can ask her to do. She quizzes multiplication tables, tells the kids how to spell words, and was the center of family game night with Escape the Room (awesome!).  I wake the kids up by asking her to play playlists on the Dots in their rooms and we listen to our music all over the house. If my big kids are home alone I can use my phone and to video chat on the Show and see that everything is all right. Love that I can visually see my shopping list and watch Prime shows right where I left off on my iPad. Once she kept NINE kids quiet at lunch by telling Disney stories. My own virtual personal assistant!
title: Family Fun

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Skiddlywinks
content: I am really glad I purchased this. The audio is amazing. The bass is deep, the trebles are strong. It can get really really loud. I have actually turned down the bass and keep the audio at about 5. The visual features are really nice. We keep ours in the kitchen and I love being able to use Firefox to look up recipes and watch Youtube while cooking. Having Hulu and Netflix capabilities are also really nice, but I haven't gotten around to setting them up yet (shame on me!). The Alexa features are really nice, although I find myself using mostly skills that dont truly benefit from the Show's screen. I need to look into some more. Either way, for what I use this for, I love it. Its sleek and a wonderful addition to any smart house array. Now I just need to buy some cameras for home security and also use the video call more often!
title: Loud, Clear, and Pretty!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Tom S
content: When I asked Alexa to call my dad, this Alexa automatically changes  my command to ‚ÄúDrop-in‚Äù, and the call was automatically connected to my dad‚Äôs echo device and started showing the view of his echo device. I have checked the log and it shows Alexa recognized my command correctly. It‚Äôs more like a server end issue. I have contacted amazon on this matter but amazon has not sent me any conclusion yet.
title: Privacy issue

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: MAB
content: There are NO INSTRUCTIONS other than a brief: plug it in and swipe the screen to go to settings and download the app. Really?!  The app settings are minimal. When trying to set up the Echo Show to have the camera show my living room to view my pet in action, there wasn't anything even remotely close to showing me where I might find how to do that. Fortunately, a friend has an Echo Show and told me to go to CONTACTS, then go to my own name, then look at the icons. Find the one that shows a house and tap it. Geez. Who would ever have thought to do that? The positive remarks are the sound quality is excellent when playing music. Also, AFTER it was set up and I was totally frustrated, I received two helpful emails from Amazon that gave a little more information about the features available. That info definitely should have arrived in the box with the device. Alexa and I are gradually getting to know each other. I am hopeful that this device will become more useful to me. Otherwise, it is a very expensive radio. I am sure if I subscribe and pay for other features it will be even better, but I don't appreciate having to invest more money to enjoy those features.
title: Minimal instructions! Figure it out for yourself by trial and error.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Bonnie R.
content: I‚Äôve got two echo shows first generation and one echo and when I saw this large screen echo second generation, I really wanted it. I liked the idea of the bigger screen because I occasionally will watch a movie on it. Other than that, it‚Äôs really not much different than the first generation. One of the things I do not like at all, is the amount of bass. I‚Äôve turned the base all the way off and it still vibrates terribly. Enough that I almost want to take it back.  As far as voice recognition, I often have to repeat things two or three times before it understands me. That can be very frustrating. At times it doesn‚Äôt hear me at all, and other times it gets the entire thing wrong. You just never know.  But that‚Äôs no different than the generation one. I have gotten it to integrate with a few things in my house, but not as many as I would like. I will need to keep trying. Sometimes the directions are not easy to follow. I would like to have the same music in several of my rooms but have yet to be able to accomplish that. I do like the ability to keep adding to my shopping list by voice or to check my shopping list by voice and then pull up the shopping list on my phone while at the store. I use that quite frequently.  It‚Äôs much more limited compared to Siri when trying to look something up.  It will often say, I‚Äôm sorry, I‚Äôm not able to tell you that, etc.  It is constantly updating the  little stories that you can read or see a video but unfortunately, it usually doesn‚Äôt give you enough detail or kind of just leaves you hanging. I‚Äôm pretty much always disappointed with their little stories. I will keep investigating what else I can do on Echo, I‚Äôve only had it a few weeks so I guess I need more time. If anything changes I will update this review.
title: It‚Äôs ok.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Dianne Gaffney
content: My parents live in an assisted living facility, they are losing their ability to use their smart phones.  The drop in feature has been an excellent way for us to check in. For example my brother and I can "drop in" from the Alexa Ap on our phones, my parents don't have to answer or worry about anything - we just show up and can video chat. The trickiest part was getting aunts and uncles authorized to drop in (they had to down load the app and enable to the Alexa communication).  I had to enable them to drop in (it was a little quirky but we eventually got everyone up and running). I chose to keep this device under my account so I could keep control of it, my aunt accidentally dropped in on my kitchen Echo, when she was trying to drop in on my parents at the assisted living.  It would be nice to have a little more selection on what devices folks can drop in on, but overall this was a win for us!
title: Drop Ins Great for Elderly!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Rag
content: I got the 8" Alexa Show first and was very pleased with the device. Then I ordered a 10.1" Alexa Show. The larger screen is really a big improvement for displaying things like recipes. If you are only going to buy one Alexa Device I recommend the 10.1" Show. It is the most expensive but I feel it is the best of all the Alexa Devices
title: I have both the 8" inch and the 10.1 inch Alexa Show, I prefer the larger Alexa Show.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: jmscott
content: Mu husband does not know how to power up a computer. He is not interested in technology tools. However, he loves the Amazon Show because it us always on and the voice recognition works. I created music playlists for each of us and he can now play his favorite music without my assistance. I love the ability to add items to my shopping list and add appointments to my calendar while washing dishes. My husbands To Do list is easily updated. When we play games like Jeopardy, you cssn read the questions and see the answers all at the same time. I'm hooked and love the convience of the Alexa products. We now have an Echo Show for the kitchen, an Echo Spot for the bedroom, an Echo 2nd gen for one of the bvathrooms and the garage. My kids are each getting an Echo Show for Christmas for their homes. Thanks Amazon for making these products affordable.
title: We love the easy instant access to weather, music, recipes, and abundance of skills

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: J.V
content: Echo Show 2nd. Gen is not good as the Echo period. The biggest problem is and I think it is the most important one and that is... Voice Reconition. If there is any little noise around  while you are talking to Alexa, Alexa will not understand. You will wait and nothing will happen. Will not give you any indication that is not understanding either. Plus, the receiver (mic.) volume is super low so in general you have to scream for Alexa to get it. I wish it had a microphone volume adjustment it is this unit not there yet. By the way this is my second 2nd. Gen version too, I returned one for the same reason already.. This 2nd. one it started OK. but now is back to not understanding again. The Regular Echo must have voice cancelling in it because it would understand with no issues whatsoever.
title: Not as good as Regular Echo

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Karen and Wayne Madeley
content: We like the bigger screen size, but can't tell much difference in sound quality from the Show 8. speech recogni. better than the show 5 and 8. Controls all our smart bulbs and smart switches just fine. but information searches are better with google home. blame google not Amazon for not sharing their toys. ADDED TO REVIEW changing the stars to 1 because of 1 major thing....Told "Alexa" turn screen off she did for 20 seconds then right back on. tried the command 3 different ways same result back on within 30 seconds. Unplugged and restarted same results. Now my echos 8" and 5" do NOT have this problem but the 10.1 does. we have 2 of them and both do this. It was bad enough not being able to turn off suggestions but this is the straw that broke the camels back.Very tempted to return both units.
title: NO CLOCK FACES LIKE SHOW 8 and see added comments below as to why the stars went from 3 to 1

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Linda L.
content: Okay this is my first show, I have lots of dots and mostly play music on it and use it as intercoms in a house. I actually bought myself the show to see my daughter who lives an hour and a half away and trying to stay close to my first and only grandson.  I bought one for my mom and she is a senior struggling to live on her own still. She is not too good with a cell phone or or any kind of technical stuff she's used to be what you kind of lost that when she started to lose her memory.. So I thought this might be a good thing and it works great. I said it so I can just drop in so she doesn't have to touch it I can just call it or name and I bought a stand for her so I can point it and the direction where I can see pretty much her living room kitchen the area where she hangs out the most.. not to leave little cheat sheets around for her to talk to Alexa like if you follow them on say Alexa call Linda. Alexa what is the date Alexa what time is it? Alexa what's the weather today! I set up all the reminders on it for her meds & I can do it from my cell phone cuz I set up her account. so on my phone I sign out of my Alexa account sign in to hers to leave the reminders I know it seems like a little tedious thing but until they come out with something different this is perfect it's hard to drive over there everyday 5 times a day... her memory has really fallen so this is awesome she likes to watch the Patriots or golf I put reminders when they come on. The cute thing is I will say to Alexa remind you and she will say, oh no I remembered.. all her appointments, all her to do list, everything I put on Alexa to remind her and have her repeat several times so she actually gets the job done.. I think it should come on adjustable stand, I think it's kind of crazy that we have to buy a stand for it but that said if you buy it on sale it's not so bad but at full price they should give you a stand. Another great thing I like is if you have Amazon photos it can be a photo digital frame and no offense one of those aren't cheap so that alone is being andespecially for her senior I can load pictures up all the time as you can keep looking at them.  I just wish more people would have them. and the other complaint that I have would be the show doesn't seem to understand my voice as well as all my other dots.  I know that sounds crazy but it's totally true.. anyways I love it I think it's great for seniors especially and for checking on kids it's amazing. I think that there's other things that they could put on it to to make it a little bit better hopefully they'll kick it up a notch.
title: Totally worth it!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: UncleMike
content: I took advantage of the super sale and bought the new Echo Show 2nd gen.  So far I am not happy with it.  First the screen always looks dark even though I set the brightness to high and turned off the adjust with ambient light.  On my original Show the screen would automatically go to sleep after several minutes.  If the 2nd gen has that setting I cannot find it.  The best I can find is to tell it to turn the screen off.  Why not a setting for sleep with several time options.  Last, my original show came with a very nice screen saver set of beautiful pictures from around the world.  The 2nd gen comes with a slide show of pastel water color type drawings or a blank gray screen.  There is an option to upload and create your own slideshow.  Why not at least give us the same as the 1st gen with additional options.
title: Screen Brightness Not Good

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: William B Winfield
content: We have the Echo 5. We loved so much we decided to get the Echo Show.  We thought bigger would be better and we were wrong.  Such a disappointment.  We were expecting everything would just scale up from echo 5 to the Show.  It doesn't. Text is small. The clock is smaller than on the Echo 5. We leave our Echo 5 showing the clock. We tried on the Show and it is so small we have to walk up to it. There is a zoom but it lasts about a minute  and the goes back small. Voice recognition is worse than any previous Alexa device. We often have say the wake 3 times to wake it up. Amazon should fix it so you scale text and clock on this unit. At least the clock shouldn be scalable. I'm afraid I can not recommend this. Stick with the Echo 5. I would have returned but wife likes the sound quality.
title: Go for the Echo 5

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Michael Erickson
content: I'm satisfied with my purchase. It does what it's claimed to do. I bought it as an upgrade to the Aamazon Dot I got a year ago. The crystal clear sceen is excellent - very sharp colors for any picture or video you might play. I'm not that into music, although I do you it occasionally for that. I mostly enjoy watching YouTube Videos on it. In regards to YouTube access, you just ask Alexa "Open Silk" to open its browser, and use the touch screen to open YouTube. I found it easy to use. It's cumbersome typing in the specific video you want, so it's best to touch the microphone icon and simply speak the name of the video. Once videos appear, you can use the screen to scroll to the one you want. I only have a couple minor complaints: The screen is always on unless you tell Alexa "Screen Off". But if you happen to bump the screen with your hand or arm, it comes back on. There is no "off" button. You can use the Do Not Disturb feature to have the screen be off at specific times, but again, if you accidently touch the screen again, it comes on. Secondly, the reviews rave about the sound quality. But I've found that the bass seems to be pretty strong, resulting in a sort of a muffled sound when Alexa responds to a question. You have to adjust the volume in those cases where the voice isn't super clear. The voice on the Echo Dot is clearer at times in comparison. At least that's my opinion. Others may disagree. Overall, I really like this product. It's screen is big, but the unit isn't much bigger than the screeen so it doesn't take up a lot of space on a counter or table. I don't use the Echo Show every day, but I'm still glad I spent the money on it.
title: Quilty product, sturdily-made

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Greg
content: I bought this for my 85 y/o mother for Christmas. She is terrified of tech, so she was not pleased, but after showing her how easy it is to use, she loves it. After a day or two she is using it to make shopping and to-do lists, reminders, alarms, cooking timers, checking her calendar, reading recipes. Sorry if this turned into a review of my mother. The screen looks great and the audio is amazing. Very easy to set up once you connect to your Wi-Fi.
title: Wonderful

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Matt Oler
content: It doesn‚Äôt really do anything. Doesn‚Äôt reply to my voice unless it has no other sound in the room even birds chirping. It doesn‚Äôt shut down at night lights will flash all night long unless I unplug it. Doesn‚Äôt play music. Will not play back my pictures on my phone. I down loaded every app associated to the show. It a good thing I won this product on a drawing because I would had sent it back what a waste of money if I had of paid for it. I guess I will give it to goodwill maybe some kid may like it. I know I wasted hours on it reading, watching video, asking people about it, can‚Äôt not find anyone who would buy it!!!
title: Waste of money, good reviews must be fake.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Richard Gruber
content: The Echo Show is a nice piece of tech, which is missing one important element.  Amazon should have included a battery which would allow a small amount of portability.  While the stand Echo can be located near an electrical outlet and function, the need to locate the Show at an outlet often negates the effectiveness of the camera and screen.  I'd love to be able to place the Show on the a kitchen counter or table and have a video chat.  If I wanted to move to the family room, it would be a simple matter to pick up the Show and move.  A small battery would make this feasible. Aside from this one drawback, I find the Show very nice indeed.  Looks like I'll have to build my own.....:P
title: Almost there

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: TigerVas
content: The echo show 2nd gen 10.1, is slow, the youtube integration in the browser is the worst. You can play the web videos for not more than 5 minutes and the home screen ahows up after 5 minutes. Called the support on this issue, that is an another big review i have to write about the tech support on echo devices. The good , big screen and the sound quality.
title: good screen and soind, but slow as hell and youtube and web videos work for only 5 minutes

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: JM in OH
content: I have been using the Echo Show in my kitchen for the last 6 months. Frankly, it's not very useful.  It shows topics you can learn more about (which to my knowledge cannot be customized to be what I‚Äôm actually interested in knowing), but you have to enunciate very clearly for it to pick up on what you are saying, even though it‚Äôs a suggestion from the Echo. Then the information is frequently inane and not worth the effort.  I‚Äôve also searched recipes on it, and it does give multiple suggestions and allows you to add ingredients to a shopping list. But when cooking from the recipe, the ingredients are on one page, and the instructions are on another, so you have to toggle between screens to see how much is to be added at each step.  I does play music well, and listens to commands such as to operate the connected Wi-Fi plugs I have throughout the house.  But for general information questions, it‚Äôs poor at best. Frankly, I wonder if I‚Äôd like Google for the home better for information.  I frequently ask Alexa something, get a wrong, off topic answer (or hmm, I don‚Äôt know that), and go to my phone and ask Google and get what I‚Äôm looking for.  For the money, not worth it.
title: Not that useful

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: The consumer's voice
content: I've got nearly 20 of these Alexa devices spread out over two houses, and this one is my favorite.  Has a large, vibrant display, and arguably the best sound of any of my Echo devices.  I cannot compare it to either "Plus" - don't have either one of those, but can compare it to every other one and this Show produces a rather decent thump with the bass and the treble carries well.  The passive sub adds more to the depth of sound than one might expect. One complaint, and this is common to both this new Show and the original.  When you get a notification or a message on most other Alexa devices, you get a yellow ring on top that pulses to let you know at a glance that you've got one or more of them waiting for you.  Nope, nothing on this screen unless you happen to touch it and see the banner that says "new message for..." or whatever.  Would be really nice to be able to see at just a glance from across the room if you've got a message or notification.  I'm sure they could fix this with a software update, but I guess not enough people have complained about this for them to address the issue.  That's really my only gripe so far, and the reason I docked this review one star.  If they fix this, I'll be glad to put up a full five star review.
title: New favorite Alexa!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Jeremy Mettler
content: I was really looking forward to getting the Echo Show so I could stream videos hands free in the kitchen while cooking. Unfortunately, the show falls short in this category, so I have returned my device.  For a device that has such a great video screen it seriously lacks support for video streaming.  There is no native support for YouTube, Netflix or any of the major streaming services, except Hulu.  You can access them through the Show's internet browser, but you can't use voice commands to do this, which completely defeats the point of having the Show.  Because of the limited streaming options that are available with voice activation I am giving the Echo Show only 2 stars. If you want a device for your kitchen that will let you stream videos from your favorite services a better option would be to get a Kindle Fire HD 10 put it in Show mode and hook up some decent speakers or to get a small TV and attach a Fire TV Stick. The sound quality is really good, but not as good as the Echo Plus.
title: Lacks good support for video streaming

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: kaprica 1
content: its ok, plays my audible books while im cooking, the ‚Äú things to try‚Äù feature, which it seems cant be turned off is so annoying. also unable to look at kindle recipe books, no alexa i dont want you to read it to me, show me the book ...... i got it mainly for drop in and calls while im cooking,  ut i think its going back and ill just use my ipad instead. id have kept it and just made it work for me if wasn‚Äôt for the stupid things to try. and yes ive been all through the app and supposedly shut it off and yet they‚Äôre still there . disappointed, would not recommend
title: disappointing and annoying

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: James W. Allison
content: We really like our 10" Echo Show.  My wife uses it for recipes, shopping lists, and occasional music.  Sorry, to me, the sound quality REALLY sounds like a portable transistor radio from the 70's. Wait. No.  I had a Panasonic portable radio that sounded BETTER than the Echo Show. We love the integration with our Ring doorbell - when Alexa says, "Motion detected at the Front Door", we know to check for delivered packages if the doorbell doesn't chime.  Of course, when a deer wanders by the front door at 2 AM, it isn't QUITE so appreciated... The "Adaptive Brightness" feature is useless in our kitchen - when the lights are "off", the screen is unreadable, only becoming bright enough to see the home screen (weather, timers, etc.) when the kitchen lights are "on". On the whole, the 10" Echo Show was a worthwhile purchase for our family - useful, but not a show-stopper.
title: Lousy speaker, Adaptive Display unusable - but still, a good buy

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Kristin Y.
content: The biggest selling feature for me was the fact that I would be able to watch Prime and Hulu on it and it's the one feature that doesn't seem to work very well. I have tried using it with Hulu three times. It was fine the first time, lagging and freezing the second time, and would not open Hulu at all the 3rd time. It also wouldn't open Prime video on command, but I at least know how to manually get to what I want to watch. I don't know if there is a way to do that with Hulu. I spend a lot of time in the kitchen and I like to watch TV shows and movies while I'm cooking because it's the only time during my day that I really have to myself. Pretty bummed that doesn't seem to be working. It does work very well with our Ring doorbell, kasa cameras and lights, and I did like that I was able to import my Google calendar. BUT that wasn't even the main reason for buying the Echo Show and I could have continued using the apps on my phone for those functions.
title: Room for improvement

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: D. Blanchard
content: Great Trade in Program. Amazon generously gave me a $30.00 Amazon gift card and added a 25% off on my next Amazon Echo Show 2. I saved cash and got a great upgraded product at the same time. That‚Äôs how I like to do business! Thank You Amazon! So I‚Äôm an ordinary person with no particular flare for setting up and using electronics but This was the easiest set up I have encountered. It was up and running after an update almost immediately. I was so happy about that. I use my Echo Show a minimum of 4times everyday. I start with my Flash Briefing, weather, calendar events and Ring security‚Äôs videos.  This Echo Show2 is the best bang for your buck because it is so versatile depending on what you need. I also purchased the adjustable base for it as I do lots of video chats do i am  always adjusting it for one reason or the other. Also: just so you know.. if you place your order thru (smile.amazon.com)Amazon will make a donation to your favorite charity..Food Bank, RedCross, etc. it is a great program. This is a great Amazon Product and I am Very Happy with it.
title: ECHO TRADE IN PROGRAM. Great  product!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: JAS
content: Absolutely love my 2nd gen Echo Show.  Used the Amazon trade-in program (with my 1st gen Echo Show), which worked exceptionally well.  As for the new one, I have it in my kitchen on the breakfast bar.  And yes, with speakers in the back, it does need an open area so sound isn't muffled - no big deal IMHO. The screen size, sound, and color are superb.  It certainly dims well at night, so believe it would work fine in a bedroom.  Although some folks have entered negative comments about the various banners that come across the screen, I love them - they give me ideas about how to better use my Echo Show, as well as catching headlines and trending topics that I'd never think to ask about.  As a Prime member, I can easily stream music from Amazon.  Also, yes, the Echo Show can stream SiriusXM, which I have.  All you need is to pay for Internet streaming from SiriusXM and enable the skill for Alexa.  Works great (although you won't see any info about the song or artist, which does show up on regular SiriusXM device screens).  I use my Echo Show not only for music but to search for recipes, get the news and weather, change channels on DirectTV, call friends and family that also have Alexa devices, etc.  Very versatile!  Glad I upgraded!
title: Love the screen size and sound!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: H. Tharp
content: Recently purchased the Echo Show and I‚Äôm so very pleased with this item. It has been fantastic for keeping in touch with family and friends from all over the world. The video calls are crystal clear and the sound quality for calls and enjoying music rivals that of a Bose system. We‚Äôve enjoyed bible study via video and even coffee dates via Video on the Echo Show. Music is absolutely a joy on this as the sound is incredible! Bring a hub for security cameras in and around my home have worked perfectly and being able to see who‚Äôs at the doors etc. have all been exceptional. Alexa even guRds my home when I‚Äôm not there. I highly recommend this item. We have Echos throughout our home and I‚Äôll be buying more of the Echo Show!! Thank you Amazon for a high quality, useful and pleasurable device. During this Coronavirus Crises this has been heaven sent for staying in touch with family and friends. Blessings to all.
title: Echo Show Is An Incredible Device!!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: MB
content: It can‚Äôt multitask. And no Netflix. Say you‚Äôre listening to music or watching a YouTube video in the web browser or watching Hulu if you ask Alexa to set a timer. It cancels out whatever you were doing just to display the timer. Then you have to go back and restart whatever you were doing before. Also if you‚Äôre watching Hulu and you are finished you can‚Äôt say ‚ÄúAlexa Stop‚Äù or ‚ÄúAlexa stop playing‚Äù it doesn‚Äôt do anything. You have to say ‚ÄúAlexa go home‚Äù which doesn‚Äôt feel very intuitive. And it would be nice to have some Audio EQ options don‚Äôt get me wrong the sound quality is pretty amazing for the size but I would like to turn down the sub just a little because it vibrates all the knives and plates that are sitting on my counter and creates a negative listening experience. Would also be nice to have quick access to apps and other functions on screen instead of requiring you to use voice commands 100% of the time. Physically this thing is clean and solid good quality, software wise functionally it works well, the UI needs some more improvement. I‚Äôm glad I got it and also glad I waited for the 2nd gen to release before buying.
title: Excellent quality, UI needs to utilize the touchscreen more.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: gregory
content: We purchased this product over a month ago, and straight out of the box it had a hard time understanding. You ask for it to do something and it doesn't understand or hear you or give you the option of saying him I'm not familiar with that. And she says that quite often. I don't know if it's a faulty unit however, just has difficulty understanding when I ask to do something sometimes it does, or most of the time it does and sometimes it does not. For example, she said, you know you can ask me what the temperature is at a certain hour during the day, so I said Alexa, what temperature will it be at 2 o'clock this afternoon? And her response was, hmm, I don't know that one. Even though less than just two seconds prior to that she specifically asked me to ask for that question, perhaps I need to communicate with Amazon customer service and see if anybody else is been having these problems.
title: What you need to know prior to purchase

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Kate
content: Just have been using for a week but while trying to set it up I could not adjust the size of the clock fonts and could not get rid of the Alexa tips. discovered these are common complaints. Because it is an item that is always on it is very annoying. While researching the show it sounded like a wonderful household companion that would fulfill my every need. After receiving it all I hear is I don't do that or I don't know that you are saying while all the time scrolling things to try. (my attempt at humor) Seriously I have set it up with the smart plug and the security camera and enjoy listening to classical music. I do hope they find a way to get rid of the Alexa tips and ways to adjust the clock size as not everyone has young eyes. After Christmas will set up a calendar etc..
title: Just like being married

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Felian
content: This device is too slow to your commands. I also own two echo dots and they are capable of listening and responding to my voice almost instantaneously, you would expect that a higher end, newer designed device would have a better, faster response, but it doesn‚Äôt. I have to repeat the same command multiple times to receive the wrong response more than half the time. I feel like an idiot who‚Äôs talking to himself and no one is listening, not even a modern machine that is supposed to be designed to listen. You‚Äôre better off buying a tablet, just pair it with a good Bluetooth speaker and you‚Äôre golden. Trust me!
title: Too slow

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Sherry
content: Hey Amazon - can you please  look into thee frequency issue with the Echo and Echo Show?  There are forums lamenting how dogs are adversely affected, they cower, tremble and hide in fear.  Someone on an amazon forum put an ultrasonic frequency detector on their devices (Echos, Dots, and Spots) and found they all show a significant amount of energy just above the 20KHz range when Alexa responds. They believe this is probably what dogs are hearing.  I have an Amazon Echo and an Amazon Echo Show.  I would really like to use them and say good things about them, but my golden retriever shakes profusely and hides any time I turn either of them on.  Please please Amazon...please find a remedy for this.  TY
title: Frequency of signal hurts dogs ears - please provide a remedy Amazon

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Jeffrey N.
content: Still a bit buggy, freezes up once in awhile, especially when interacting with the other Alexa units, such as "everywhere group" for music, or dropping in.  I'm not going to get into voice recognition capability or accuracy of queried questions or requests because that is something we've been fighting with for the last 30 years.  I don't expect a miracle any time soon.  The speaker is very good considering the unit isn't meant to replace the studio module, and the screen is nice.  Calling out songs you want to hear is going to be annoying without Amazon Music, so be prepared to either pair your own playlist from your phone over bluetooth, or fork out a subscription to Music.  I do wish, although it's obvious not particular to one company, that you don't have to keep paying $10-$20 a month for this, that and the other.  I think that has been the slow decay of the cable companies.
title: It is definitely a good addition to the house, but I'm still finding it to be a bit buggy

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Marcia Henry-Young
content: I bought Alexa Show as a Christmas gift for my dad who is ill. I was very excited that he can play his music by voice command since he is not technology savvy. The hope was that the voice command will allow him to listen to music when he wants. Unfortunately Alexa pays two to three songs and stops. He has become so frustrated with the process of constantly asking to play songs that can't be found, and going to Youtube and getting bumped off so frequently that in a few days he said he does not want to use it anymore because it is too stressful. My internet search shows this is an inherent problem with the system and many have sited this short coming with Alexa. I think the company is obligated to address this issue and should assist persons who bought this faulty system. I hope someone can assist.
title: Very Disappointed

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: C. Medley
content: Before you buy, make sure you don't mind rotating "Things to try" messages at the bottom of the screen. You can see them now in some of the product images. Just know you can't turn them off on the main screen.  They just keep rotating and rotating and rotating. After reading the Alexa SDK docs, it is clear Amazon really likes this feature.  It is core to their UX.  See 8.2.2 at https://developer.amazon.com/docs/alexa-voice-service/functional-requirements.html  After spending two days with the echo show, all I see now is "Try ... Google Home"
title: This device should be called "Things to try".

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Sam
content: At a recent visit to my son's apartment I noticed he had an earlier version of the Echo Show (the 5).  I also noticed it had many uses.  After a long conversation of how this could improve my life in my kitchen (where I spend a ton of time learning new recipes and creating new ones of my own, I knew I had to have it.  So I put it on my birthday gift list and my sweet son bought it for me.  It sings to me, sets my timer, teaches me new recipes, answers almost all of my questions, and the list goes on.  I didn't know I needed it but now what would I do without it! lol
title: I didn't know I need this but now!!!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: DoodlePie
content: We've been using these for about 2 months now.  I was worried about them not being loud enough but they are and the sound is pretty great.  It looks good and love that we can put our own picture on it as the homepage.  I love that it engages you throughout the day by adding interesting facts and new stories that show up on the screen.  However I have to remove a star for the same reason.  Let's say that Alexa shows a fantastical story about a huge banana someone has sculpted and it made headlines all over the world.  When you ask her to tell you about it, she reads the story but there is no true picture of the object in question.  Instead, you get to see a regular banana instead.  The name is Echo SHOW.  Please show me what you are talking about.  The video quality is pretty good when talking to others in different rooms and the recognition of voices is better than other Echo units.  For instance, the Echo Show in the basement will sometimes answer me at the same time as the Echo show upstairs.  I think I'm going to purchase another one but I hope that the stories get a little more, "showy".
title: Almost perfect

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Dr. Leonard Hofstadter
content: 3rd UPDATE: I am now updating my rating to five out of five stars. Seems this latest update not only fixed follow up mode, it also fixed the annoying auto-wake function. Voice recognition has improved as well. Very satisfied now. UPDATE: Amazon released an update for the echo show that just loaded on mine, and now the follow up mode works perfectly. No more redundant commands just to perform one operation, excellent! Now if they just put a function to disable the auto-wake on the echo show, so that a shock sensor doesn‚Äôt wake it up every time you bump or even loud sounds wake it up and start flashing, stuff I don‚Äôt want to see. Overall great device, I change my review to four stars. There are a lot of good things about this product but bad things too. Right now it‚Äôs laying face down on my table, because I refused to have it bother me constantly by waking itself up in any movement, or even some sounds wake it up. For about the last week the follow up mode has refused to work, and this is a hindrance because the echo show will keep flashing mindless garbage on the screen until you tell it to turn the screen off. I didn‚Äôt want another voice command just to enter each operation. The intelligent thing to do would be to ask Alexa to perform an operation and then she does and after about 5 to 10 seconds the screen goes dark again. Sound is very good, real bass and treble.  Nice display, useful to have video information added. So, please fix the follow-up function, and maybe even change the programming to make the screen go black after the intended operation has been completed.  Subtle irritants in an otherwise excellent product.  But then again irritating enough that I‚Äôm considering throwing the echo show right in the garbage.
title: Very Good

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: jthomas
content: I received the echo show as a gift. It works well listening streaming music, radio, and some movies. Streaming movies that work well on my phone and laptop DON'T work well on the echo show. I suspect the echo is simply too slow to handle the job. I have a 5-year-old tablet that is somewhat slow such that some movies stutter and time out. The echo show behaves the same way such that it stutters and breaks up the movie. If I simultaneously watch the same movie on my laptop, phone and echo show; only the echo show messes up. However, if I watch an old YouTube black-and- white western on echo show, I don't notice any problem. I suspect the echo show is simply too slow for HD movies. Echo show will read kindle books to me as audio, but surprisingly kindle on echo doesn't show the text. Echo show doesn't respond to seemingly obvious commands for kindle. Echo show seems to have been released to the market before it was ready. The screen is good, but I'm glad I didn't waste money on it.
title: Too Slow To Play Some Streaming Movies

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: K. P.
content: Super amazing device, I am only giving it five stars because of the quality. Really wish this had a camera cover slide like the show 5 or 8, I would like to keep the mic on without the camera sometimes. Also, Alexa can really suck at times. Sometimes an echo will not recognize what you are saying on one echo until you talk to another. Sometimes an echo in a completely different part of the house will respond for no reason. Search results are usually the craziest possibilities, often having nothing to do with what you asked. The most infuriating thing though is the smart home devices, they must be uniquely named but literally any overlap and you get a constant question about which device you mean because there are multiple devices with that name. No matter what device you say at that point the device is not found. The weirdest part is that the devices are grouped into being paired to a specific echo, so why can Alexa not figure out the device in the group? You cannot group lights together inside a group so you end up with many crazy named groups for your devices, instead of groups being nested. Say the wrong thing and the other side of your house turns on. Alexa will recognize the user speaking but this seems to only apply to two things, asking who is speaking and asking which account. Unsure why the account doesn't change based on the user talking. Family members have different names for things and asking who's account is logged in constantly is tedious...
title: This is a really cool device but Alexa has room for improvement

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Ross
