content: I can tune live channels with Hulu, and thanks to the new browsers you can get to YouTube etc, all on a quite usable 10" screen. One negative is that the processor they chose for this model can barely get the job done. There is considerable lag to video operations, like clicking the screen to get the pause/back menu, asking Alexa to back up a few minutes etc. Sometimes it seems like it isn't going to do anything but it usually works after some pondering. I can't imagine that it would have cost much to make the thing slightly faster - look at the Raspberry Pi 4 for $38. The second negative is the sound. It is loud enough to hear over kitchen noise (just), but it is all base with very little highs. There are settings you can use to balance it out. Overall I'm pleased, and if there was a good sale I might by another for the study.
title: Makes a nice TV for the kitchen

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Irina
content: I‚Äôve had this for a year and a half and I love - hate it. It started having problems from the beginning. Would just freeze, and the blue line will be listening all the time but nothing would happen, occasionally the screen would go black, it would disconnect itself from wi-fi. I was unplugging it couple of times a day to reset.Customer service gave me great run around multiple times. And finally some nice lady in customer service there FINALLY put in request to have it checked out. So they ended up sending me another one, which basically doing the same thing now. But mostly would disconnects itself from wi-fi and sits there totally useless until I unplug it and plug it back in again. Very disappointed with this device. What I love about it is that I can watch news in my kitchen every morning, I even like that suggested feed with ‚Äúfun facts‚Äù or whatever happened in the world. But honestly IF APPLE ever comes out with similar stuff, not just their speaker,  I‚Äôm totally ditching ALL Alexa crap!
title: Nice idea but devise has way too many issues.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: CJ
content: But the Show failed in just about every way. First, when you ask it to search for something, it usually brings up something totally unrelated (I asked it for a sous vide chicken recipe and it brought up the temperature in Chicken, Alaska - I didn't even know there was a Chicken, Alaska so I guess it taught me something!). I'm highly disappointed that this doesn't have a web browser - lots of issues there because it can't do much because of that.  Beware if you're buying this for recipes as I did.  There is NO "skill" that will allow you to enter your own recipes to view on the screen.  Yes, you can download "Allrecipes" skill and "Food Network" but I've even tried searching for my favorite recipes on Food Network and this device does not bring up the recipes (ex. Alton Brown's refrigerator pie). Amazon has a long way to go before this Show device is actually usable.
title: Expectations High - Dissappointed!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Joseph M.
content: I bought the 2nd edition of the Amazon Show because it now has a much bigger screen, making video possible at a decent distance. The only bad thing is that you can't load a Netfl;ix app, they do not have one that works with the Show. So while Amazon advertises watching video on the Show, what they really mean is that you can watch Amazon video, and only Amazon Video. You can't watch NetFlix because they did not make an  NetFlix app for the show, and Google owns Youtube, and since Amazon won't sell Google devices, Google won't let Amazon have access to youtube. This needs to be taken to the FTC to force them to work together. Amazon does not have the faith in their own products to keep selling. I have no intention to get any Google Device. I did have one, but I quickly got rid of it. My house is full of Amazon devices.  Now I have to consider sending the Show 2nd gen back, as it won't do what I bought it for, which is watch Netflix.  Yee, it has a beautiful screen, and great sound, but that is only if you get to watch what you want.
title: Does not support a Netflix app, they say they are working on it, but i doubt it.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: tim berla
content: My family and I bought several of these for communicating with our 90 year old dad. Visitors are not allowed where he lives due to covid-19, so this is a great way to connect. It has many good features and is pretty reliable. There are many things I'd like to do as administrator of my dad's device (from my phone or computer). Here are a few: 1) View a call log, or even an activity log of all interactions with the device. My dad's memory is very spotty, so knowing what actually happened on his device would be very useful. 2) Present a video or photo or slideshow on his device. I have been able to make a photo album of my photos his background, which is great. But it would be very useful if I could project an image or video right now on his device. Then we could discuss it. 3) Control all the random shit that Alexa puts on the screen. It would be great to be able to just turn it off and only show my photos.
title: Great Device - software needs many more features

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Dancing Nancy
content: The Echo Show 2nd generation is wonderful.  It is my favorite Echo product (and I have most of them).  The sound is killer!  I keep mine in the kitchen.  I love being able to use multiple cooking timers and see each of them.  I can watch Hulu as I am cooking.  Being able to pull up a recipe video is very helpful.  I had the first Echo Show and I didn't care much for it (poor sound, small screen).  I have the Echo Show 5, too.  I like it a lot.  I like it better than the Echo Spot (which I still like a lot).  It is a matter of budget, needs and space.  I don't like watching shows, youtube and recipes on the Show 5 but the Show 5 is way better than a dot and more useful than an Echo.  I prefer to the use the Show (and Show 5) with a stand because it is more functional.  I just don't like products with a large base sitting on my counter. The video drop-in feature is great if you have an elderly parent you need to keep an eye on.  It can be fun for grandchildren or any loved one.
title: Can I give this a 6 star rating?

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: josh doolin
content: As the primary cook and kitchen cleaner in my house, I wanted something in there I could watch my shows, live tv, and also youtube videos to follow along recipes. My laptop was my first solution, but there are many instances I have gotten gunk and food all over my laptop, even when I thought I had washed my hands clean. This was my solution, and it has gone well above and beyond what I wanted. Hulu Live integration with full voice control has made me feel like Iron Man, constantly able to switch between checking timers, playing music, looking up a recipe, and watching basketball easily. What I didn't expect was the super high-quality speaker that takes up the entire back of this thing. If you turn it up loud, you can feel the bass in your soul and feet. It is quite possibly better than the sound bar I purchased for my flatscreen. I hope all regular tvs end up this way, because going into the living room and having to do things manually is not as fun anymore!!
title: Great for  hands-free videos. Sound Quality is Insane.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: HipShooter
content: I am a satisfied owner of several Amazon Alexa-based products. First, I could not set up the Show.  No matter what I did, the red line remained at the bottom, indicating that vocal input and output were turned off.  I could not get rid of the line by hitting the button on the screen .  Neither soft nor hard reboots worked. I talked by chat and telephone to support people.  They had no idea what to do, and finally recommended that I send the Show back for a replacement.  Well, the replacement, which was supposed to arrive in 2 days, was still AWOL at 2 weeks despite two attempts at getting Amazon help by chat. Finally, I cancelled the re-order and sent back the original.  It seems to me that Amazon is growing too fast to maintain proper quality control in production, delivery, and support. I'll wait a year before attempting to buy another Alexa device.
title: Something is Wrong with the Echo Show and Maybe with Amazon

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Lynn S.
content: I've had the show a few days and wanted to use it like a second/portable tv for streaming tv and movies. I thought a screen could "screen" almost anything - nope.  Even though others have reviewed the limitations of the show, it was difficult for me to picture how a device so beautiful could be so useless for streaming video. I can't get flash and netflix to work on it through chrome. This means I can't get my cable tv and online dvr to play from the xfinity website on this device. I just don't see how I can use this unless I fork over hundreds of dollars to purchase prime videos and tv. Even though I have prime and the first season of a show is listed as free - the show told me I needed to go to the webiste and pay for the tv show in order to watch it. So, if you are happy watching whatever show manges to scrounge up for you or you really want this for video conferencing/camera monitoring, I would give this a hard pass. Yes, the sound is decent but I tried placing mine against a wall (normal) and the sounds is awful and bounces of the wall. This really needs to be placed a couple of feet away from a wall. Incidentally, the stand you can buy for this fits perfectly and works well. Disappointing and confusing device.
title: I don't get it - it's a beautiful brick.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Jelena Petrovic
content: What a wonderful update from the first echo show. The large screen with great quality pictures and colors is going to be a great addition to my kitchen. I have wanted to put a tv of some sort in the kitchen for entertainment but didn‚Äôt have much wall space. The echo show 2 is just what I needed with a large enough screen that I can watch videos on with high quality yet it takes up so much less space and provides more entertainment than a tv would. Plus amazon makes it so easy and quick  to set up by automatically connecting you Amazon account on the device if you check the box when you make the purchase. My information was already preloaded when it turned on that I didn‚Äôt need to enter my email and password or any of that tedious stuff that new device set up usually requires. I also purchased a bundle with a free Phillips Hue lightbulb that connected to the devices smart hub with ease. Now I can turn my light on/off with a command or through my Alexa app. As well as chose from a variety of light colors and dimmer settings.
title: Wonderful addition to my kitchen with endless smart features

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: flpnout
content: I bought this from RC Willey store during the Christmas holidays since they offered a no tax day. My worst regret ever. After using it for 4 months now, it has been pretty frustrating to keep repeating what you want it to do and often times it says "Unable to ....." Then after repeating it will do it. I should have gone for a Google home as my other friends have recommended. Turning on lights and TV is such a hassle when to get done with several attempts until she finally does it. Never buying another Alexa product again!
title: Terrible! I should have just bought the Google home over this piece of junk!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Breana
content: Since we‚Äôre about to have the first grand baby of the family... I purchased two of these, one for my in-laws and one for my parents.  Additionally we bought a Echo Show 5 (the smaller version) for us to use as a baby monitor with our Nanit and to video chat the new grand parents. However... video chatting isn‚Äôt intuitive... there are no directions to be found... and even when I called the help line (which was super helpful) they didn‚Äôt even have directions they could send.  I‚Äôm the millennial... how am I supposed to expect my boomer parents/in-laws to figure it out if I can‚Äôt?! Okay so that was my frustration.  The fix is you need to know their device name, and say ‚ÄúAlexa video call <insert device name here>‚Äù and then it will video call them.  If you just call ‚ÄúAlexa call <Person‚Äôs name>‚Äù it will call their home or cell phones ü§¶üèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è.  Once you do it once, Alexa is pretty smart about video calling that device in the future... but you need do it like that the first time. But again I don‚Äôt think the device is super intuitive... I can‚Äôt figure out some things and goodness know my parents and in-laws struggle with something‚Äôs as well.  Once you figure it out, no issues though.
title: Love once I figured it out... but not intuitive

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Kenneth T.
content: I don't know how I let my self get suckered into buying this with my phone..... It has very good rich audio quality which I do use to listen to music sometimes, but I feel like have very little control regarding what sources of music it plays from and I don't like that.... Alexa will only play from designated sources and using the web browser to load stuff from other places removes the futuristic talking aspect of the device so.....  I would not recommend unless you need a smart home hub or whatever.... Plus Alexa does some weird creepy stuff from time to time... She thinks you are talking to her when you aren't or when the room is silent. I don't like it...
title: Not needed...

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Susan C.
content: Haven't had a lot of time to explore all the things the Echo Show has to offer. It is fun to begin understanding how to communicate with Alexa (she even has a birthday...November 6th). I'm going to get a book that explains in detail all the things Alexa can provide. As for the sound, it's fine for a small box that sits on my kitchen counter. I haven't received my 2 Echo Dots so of that is the integration I don't know yet. Though it does find songs I want and books I'm listening to on Audible. I'm sure I'll enjoy it more as I learn all of its capabilities.
title: The Echo Show is everything you'd expect.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Carol Meaney
content: We got our original Echo and Dot and Auto as soon as they became available.  But, we waited on this one because we wanted bigger and better.  The sound is awesome, and the highest volume is too loud for us to ever use it!  The screen is amazing.  We love that we can view our own pictures and short videos.  We haven't called another user yet, but we will!  It's on our kitchen counter, where I do work from home, so we placed it on a small bench under a cabinet, so that I could see it over my laptop screen.  It functions verbally just like any other Echo.  The only downside is that you have to wait for a blue flashing line after you say the wake word before it will hear you. It's fast, but not as fast as our others, with the exception of the Auto Echo - that thing seems to take forever!  The best is when I say, "Computer, show me Fleabag," and there it is.  We had to call it Computer as it is within earshot of Alexa in the living room and Echo in the TV room. It gets confusing sometimes, but we laugh a lot around here.  We also like that we can see and manage our shopping and other lists right on the screen. It's like having a giant app that opens on demand.
title: Almost like having a guest in the house!  We call her "Computer."

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Jeremiah Smith
content: Got this per request from my son so he could feel more connected to us when we moved.  I was hoping to be able to read all the Kindle cookbooks in my kitchen that I have bought over the years.  That really needs to addressed by Amazon, really disappointing.  I have tried a couple of recipes from Alexa.  Ok, but I would like to read my cookbooks instead.  I have tried the Fire for this purpose but it has more bloat software than any other computer.  I also hate how Alexa has to suggest something every time I ask her something - just answer the question! And the screen is always on with some bs on it I don‚Äôt care about (? the weather in Singapore-I live in Wisconsin).  I just unplugged it this AM because she would not close/turn off  the screen - who knows when I will feel motivated to plug it back in.  One positive note, I like the sound.
title: Add the ability to read Kindle books!!!!!!!!!!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Amanda J.
content: Echo show seemed to be the answer to my search for a device I could play music on and watch shows while I clean the kitchen/ house.  The idea of having a Smart Screen with voice recognition is great. But here is the thing it is super limited. Though Echo has a touch screen you can't actually touch and scroll through everything. I have many videos on Prime but I can only access my last 25 purchases or so. Hulu is available, but it won't allow you to switch accounts if there are multiple users. Also you can't pick which episode you want to watch on it, it automatically starts with the first or last viewed episode. For the cost of it I was expecting to have more features and to be able to do more. I can't pull up recipes I have on Pinterest or other sites only the ones  Alexa suggests. All in all unless you have the ring doorbell and a family member with another you want to "face time" with this isn't the best bang for your buck. I wish I had just held out and saved more for an iPad which would have done everything this does and more just with a lesser speaker. What's good: Speaker quality is great. Pleasing to the eye Not Good: Limited use on apps When you ask Alexa todo anything her voice is way louder than what you are actually listening to Doesn't always work and I have to repeat myself a lot.
title: Wanted to love this but....

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: MC
content: I waited about a month to see how I liked it and I can tell you that I neither love it or hate it. The echo show is just OK. I bought this to replace our original echo and I really don't think it sounds as good. I have played a lot with the equalizer to try and make it sound better but still has a funny bass sound and just doesn't sound like I would like it. It doesn't sound bad just not as clear as I had hoped. I was also hoping that it would also do better at picking up voice commands but does about the same as the old unit. The addition of the screen is nice sometimes but not as much as I was thinking. It can also be very distracting for little kids that tend to be drawn to screens. I am always telling the unit to turn off the screen. Probably the most annoying thing is the volume control. It would be nice if it could normalize the volume. Different apps YouTube, Amazon music, etc. all play at different volumes. You also can not control the volume of her voice separately from the main volume. So if you have to turn up the volume high to hear a video on YouTube or another app the voice volume is crazy loud. It would be nice to have a system (voice) volume control separate from the main volume. Maybe this will be fixed with an system update or something in the future.
title: It's just ok

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Kurt H Andussies
content: I have several of the Alexa devices (dots, spots, and a 5inch echo. The 5inche screen turned out to be too small for video calling. That was the reason I purchased the 10inch echo show screen size, the improved 5pixel camera, and the improved sound. I am very happy with the echo show 10 and the main reason I purchased the 10inch, staying in touch with my family throughout these Covid-19 pandemic times. I really enjoy the big screen. I am new to this and have a few problems I am sure it will resolve with time. One problem, when video calling, the screen seems to focus on the other end, get darker or gets distorted, and then it might return to normal. Also, I receive many emails about Alexa‚Äôs skills and it is hard to remember them all. I should be able to access a list of the skills from the Echo and find what I am looking for. What I also would like to see, is the portability of the unit with a rechargeable battery support for transportability within the WIFI range. For the night, I would like to put the screen on black, only showing the time, date, and temperature. I probably will find the solution and be able to apply that function. At times, it automatically does go into it. Time will tell. Generally, am very happy with it.
title: It is a very nice screen size for video calling

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Amy K
content: So disappointed. Can only video chat with one other device. For this to be worth the cost, it needs the ability to do video chats with multiple accounts at once. Bought 3 of these for myself, my mom, and my grandmother. At the very least we thought we could enable the zoom skill. But no... you have to pay for business zoom account. With social distancing a priority, please add this ability soon. The image quality is great as is the audio quality. The appearance is nice nnd modern. I do wish a stand was included that allowed tilting. For now, I have to prop a book under it to tilt it down enough.
title: Not as satisfied as I thought I would be

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Arthur W. Wallace
content: It is great being able to see our Ring cameras on simple voice command. We have integrated some Kasa switches and can ask Alexa to turn on or off numerous things (lights, heating fans, heating pads). We integrated a Sensi thermostat and can control the temperature. The three things we do the most is check the weather, set timers for cooking, and play music. The sound quality is pretty good. There are two things I would change. There should be a micro RCA jack so that the system can be plugged into an amplifier when one wants to play the music on a larger scale. The other is Alexa should inventory the commands that we give and get better at recognition. Alexa doesn't seem to learn that I have about 10 commands so it makes the same mistakes over and over when I don't quite enunciate clearly. We are repetitive in our commands, Alexa should learn what we ask for more readily. Overall it is a tremendous device with speaker independent, continuous, untrained voice recognition.
title: It works well

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Stefanie
content: I wanted to use my show for streaming music mostly. But it isn't very helpful. you have to know exactly what you want to listen to there is no way to browse which is very disappointing as it has a screen. You're better off just getting an echo dot.  The to do last and shopping list are huge pain to use. Almost everything wants to default to a shopping list which makes it next to impossible to make to do list and you can't change the default name on it. I am a big Google user it's nice that I can see our household Google calendar through echo show. However that is it there's no way to use any other Google functions or Netflix Hulu kind of works but is not that reliable and once again the browsing capability is not there.  In general probably should have gone with a Google home unit. It would have sucked that my Amazon music wouldn't stream but I end up using my phone and going through Bluetooth anyways because I can't browse for my music on my show. Also with Amazon show I don't like having the drop-in feature so anybody can drop in on us so I just don't use it instead. Where with Google home I could use their video calling and that would have worked awesome.
title: Disappointed.  Was hoping for more from a touch screen

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Jennifer Perry
content: I wanted to be able to use this primarily for recipes in the kitchen. I save alot in Pinterest. There's just no good way to do recipes on this. Can't access pinterest unless through the web on the device and that's pretty much worthless. I'd also like to use it to see who is at my front door and connect with ring. Rarely will it ever connect. Between ring being slow and the Show being even slower, whoever was at the door is long gone before I ever see anything, if I even get connected at all. She's pretty much only good for a few laughs and playing some music. Maybe good for the weather if I don't feel like stepping outside to see for myself.  Sound is decent. Haven't tried video calling yet so I'm hoping she will be good for that all winter with grandparents so far away.
title: Lack Luster and Disappointing

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Ryan
content: The best part is the built-in Zigbee controller - you can control lights direclty without it going over the internet.  Most Wi-Fi solutions have a small delay and it goes over the internet vs a Zigbee just goes directly to your device - no internet needed except for setup. Also, with some of the Wi-Fi devices that go over the internet, it is possible for places to see if you go on vacation. They can tell because when you turn on the device it hits there servers. No activity, user might be on vacation. There have been some home robbed and I wonder if this is what is going on.  Anyway, a Zigbee interface does not usually go to some 3rd party first because data is just going directly from your Echo Show to the device.  Amazon may have a log of Zigbee history but I trust Amazon would not share this with a 3rd party.
title: Built in Zigbee controller - Help keeps home safe

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Neal Sanghavi
content: The echo show doesn't work. We have 2 replacements in 1 week because out of the box the audio never worked. Not a single sound, effect, or anything. Tech support have been nice and is sending yet again another replacement, but how can I trust a device that can't work out of the box 3 times in a row!! Love echo devices but until this bug is fixed it's a complete fail.
title: No sound on all 3 replacements

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Steph
content: As always,  Amazon has delivered an excellent product in the Echo line!  I love the new screen size and sound quality!  Making video calls with family members on the second generation Echo Show allows us to be closer with a larger viewing area, crystal clear video and quality sound.  Watching videos on the 10.1" HD screen or listening to music with the premium sound speakers while completing daily tasks has made these daily tasks so much more pleasant.  In addition, using the recipes to make new dishes is so much easier to read and follow.  Answering the Ring Video doorbell or watching a live view of your outdoor areas through the second generation Echo Show provides you the ability to view who is at your door or view your surroundings while standing across the room from the Echo Show.  Of course there are many other features, apps and skills that enhance the second generation Echo Show as well.  I definitely recommend getting the new version Echo Show!
title: Love the new screen!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: B. Dean
content: Initially, this was a great product.  over the past two months, the service has deteriorated and it's not clear if it's the specific device or the services.  It often responds to requests to playing music, adding reminders, or setting a timer with "I don't know that one".  it often takes multiple tries to have it understand us.  When pausing or stopping music, it acts as though it's obeying and then 5-10 seconds later, it starts playing again.  the poor quality has been mostly over the last 2-ish months.  I've tried resetting the device multiple times without improvement. there are no updates.  Customer Service hasn't responded via the alexa page. I will say that the build quality is really solid.  out of frustration, it's been slapped off of it's perch, onto the floor on the display with ZERO impact. no scratches, no cracks and the same iffy service.
title: What Happened?

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Lori A Degre
content: Absolutely LOVE my Echo show!!!! I‚Äôve wanted to get one for over a year, the clunky look of gen 1 stopped me from buying it at the time, and I had 2 of the tallest 2nd gen Alexa speakers already. I didn‚Äôt think I could get a better sound than I already had. I have my show on one side of the kitchen and my speaker on the other side and the sound in my kitchen is AMMMMMAAAAAAZZZIIIINNNNGGGGGGGGGGG!!!!  It‚Äôs juat a tic or two below the sound of a Bose stereo at a wayyy more reasonable price! I have a lot to learn about all the things the echo  and the echo show can do, but I‚Äôm going to have a great time learning about it. Music is at the top of my reasons for having them. Without music this world would be a very dreary type of hell. I have music playing almost constantly üëçüòÅ Right now I have a screensaver of a crackling fire going. White noise can be very relaxing.
title: Definitely buying a 2nd Echo Show 2 in the near future!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Mermaids and Monsters
content: I love the Show, it replaced an 2nd generation IPad 2 that all I could do was look up recipes and watch Sling. Just prior to the purchase of the Show, Sling informed me it wouldn‚Äôt support older iOS systems so my days of enjoying it on my iPad was numbered. I did a bit of research and decided on the Show and traded Sling for Hulu +. I am enjoying it immensely with only a few complaints. I have a HBO subscription on my Prime Video but unable to access it on the Show which is disappointing. Also, I will be watching something and when I ask the Show to turn on or off the lights or drop in to another room it doesn‚Äôt return to the program. Lastly, Alexa is so much louder than the programming so am always physically turning up or down the volume.  I know,  1st world problems right? Small annoyances, that is all, but important to point out. The Echo Show has been, for the most part,  a wonderful kitchen companion.
title: Love it, with only minor complaints

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: A. Gift For You
content: You have no way of getting the pictures off the Echo once they are on.  I downloaded my pictures and there are ones I forgot about and do not like.  I cannot delete them!  They are there forever.  Also, Alexa wil show the same picture reel over and over again.  You ask her for new photos and you get another short reel of other pictures over and over again.  I have to turn Echo OFF to stop seeing the same thing every day!
title: Hate It!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Joe R
content: The audio goes off (no sound at all) often. It requires a cold boot (often by unplugging the adapter plug from the unit) to get the audio back. Alexa responds differently to the same request at times. There's NO option to customize the clock (size and/or font). There's no option to add/remove apps to the home screen.  Need Alexa app in a mobile phone to use it with more functions.  No integrated hub for Philips Hue smart devices. Moreover, I bought a bundle - Echo Show plus Philips Hue Smart bulb (that doesn't require a Hue Hub). When they processed the order, the bundle became two different orders and sent a bulb that requires a Hue Hub. I'm sitting with customer service for over an hour now and still we're going in circles.  This issue is still unresolved.  They want me to produce a screenshot of the offer when I ordered.  Go figure.  So much of Amazon Customer (non)Service.
title: Not very stable...

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Mary Claire
content: I own a slew of Amazon/Alexa devices: 3 fire sticks, a fire tv an echo and three dots in addition to the ring alarm and multiple ring cameras. I‚Äôve loved all of their products up to this point but the Echo Show 2nd Gen is underwhelming to say the least. The key issue I have is with lack of responsiveness to touch or voice. Touch is a 50/50 to work and I often have to tap things multiple times. If it does work there‚Äôs major lag. For example: I swipe left from the right side of the screen to pull up my smart home controls, it take two or three seconds for it to actually do it on the screen. It‚Äôs like an old computer that lags. Voice is much the same. For a $229 product it‚Äôs unacceptable. Unfortunately I‚Äôll be selling mine and hoping for a better product in future generations. Sadness. The display is also not the greatest in terms of quality and for smart home controls it‚Äôs just clunky.
title: Lag time to respond to touch and voice - disappointed!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Kailaphx
content: Love it !!! Came 7 days early the sound is amazing only frustrating thing is I have Spotify not amazon music and if I use one Alexa device to play Spotify and can not then play on another device
title: Great but can‚Äôt use multiple devices with spotify

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: WJ Walthall
content: Have a first generation Echo Show and a couple Echo devices throughout the house.  I wanted a bigger screen for our kitchen and better sound for music.  This 2nd generation is perfect and the screen size is really nice compared to my older Show.  Great quality sound and pictures.  Love all of the new features.
title: Perfect size, perfect sound

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Pickles
content: 1. Cuts off mid-song then goes to the next selection. Sometimes just stops mid-song because it pauses itself, then restarts. 2. No matter how I set it, it keeps going to the "try this" page, scrolling constantly. Doesn't seem to be a way to keep it on home screen. And when it's scrolling it gives the little sound that says it's hearing me but right after, does the sound again and stops responding to my voice. It was a total mistake. I bought it end of August but going to try to get them to take it back and give me a credit for the 3rd general Echo speaker I just purchased. Total disappointment.
title: I've had it for only 3 months and now the problems begin

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: pj
content: I love the Show. The sound is great and does not require connecting additional speakers (unless you are really picky about sound settings). We have 3 Alexa devices in our home and use all of them. I especially like being able to see the display of the words to the songs while playing music on the Show. I listen to music on all my devices but connect additional speakers to the Dot in order to use it on the deck during warmer weather. I have no complaints about any of the devices but like the Show the best. It (as well as the Echo and Dot) was very easy to setup and use. I purchased the sandstone color simply because I like the lighter shade but I'm sure the black looks just as good. It's merely an aesthetic choice.
title: Echo Show (2nd Gen)

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: AmazonBandit
content: especially after the last update. It freezes if I try to drop in on some one. the screen is just blank if I try to video call. look at the ring doorbell. this morning it just went blank when I ask it to show me the story it had on the screen.  And for some reason on all of these show device they put the mics to where the are angle towards the back of the device. it can be three feet away from me and not answer or respond but my 3rd generation dot in the other room will answers. we often find ourselves yelling at it or just getting frustrated trying to interact with these. I had little no problems interacting with the spot and no problems with the dot 3rd Gen. Just saying. If you buy this and think you can deal with it send it back it get old over time
title: This thing always Freezes

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Maxine Donaldson
content: We bought this for my mother to be able to communicate face to face with my sister during Covid. What has been spectacular about it has been when she has fallen and her fall detector or emergency button goes off.  Myself or my sister use the Drop-in function to check on her.  Twice we have been able to communicate with paramedics in the house thru the device and give them info they cannot get from her. Many of the first responders have asked us what this is and how nice it was to be able to communicate directly with a family member.  2 of them had said when they left that they will be buying one for their mom. As for it working, my mom can answer calls on it and occasionally will make a call but not often. She uses no other features of it but it is still worth the money to be able to see her when on a call. It has a nice big screen, she is hard of hearing but can hear on this perfectly. As I said, she is 91 and I didn't expect her to use the other features.  Unfortunately she thinks she can talk to it like a person, for example she'll say call Sonny, and it says something to the affect of "Ok, would you like call Sonny Smith?" and instead just saying yes she says "I would like to call Sonny" then it snowballs going back and forth with Alexa trying to figure out what my mom means. But, for what we use it for, I would buy it a hundred times over. I tried to set it up for medication reminders but there was no app that was reliable enough.
title: So good for 91 year old mother living by herself

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Amaranthus
content: As a Prime subscriber, we decided to purchase the Echo Show in December 2019. Now that we have used it for almost 1 year, I wish we would have upgraged to the comparabel Google product instead. We have a Google mini and it responds to our queries much more accurately than the Echo. Our son and daughter-in-law use Google and their's seems to be much more responsive and reliable. With the Echo, we often have to repeat a command or just use Google to provide answers to our queries or commands. I can't imagine buying another Echo.
title: Very disappointing product

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Jared Lashley
content: I have had alexa integration in my house now for about three years and spent a ton of money on Echo Show, Dot, Original, Fire Tv, Auto, etc.  The best of these devices are the dot and the ring devices.  The rest is garbage.  Sometimes works but is very glitchy on video playback and the Amazon excuse is that those devices aren't intended for that purpose.  If that is the case then why give them that functionality?  I still use them mostly because I have spent so much money but overall they have been a big disappointment.  I am not sure what the alternative is but I will always regret buying these devices.
title: Great idea - poor quality

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: BeZen
content: I thought I would be able to use this device to show me recipes and listen to music or movies while I cooked.  Alexa doesn't understand my requests and 75% of the time I'm using my laptop for recipes instead.  You have to be very specific when asking for things.  Now that I've owned it for six months or so, it has stopped working almost completely.  It won't turn back on.  I'm so frustrated. Update:  I should have tried the first thing with all electronic devices....Reboot.  My Amazon Show is back up and running!  Still, it's only good for music so hopefully there will be an upgrade in the future.  Amazon contacted me trying to help but I haven't called them back yet.  If they are able to troubleshoot the communication problems, I'll be back with another update!
title: Very frustrating to use

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Baker Mom
content: This device does a lot of things well. Hardware aesthetics are elegant, sound is great (Not as good as my true studio monitors, but this is for casual listening), and the screen is crisp. The automatic screen brightness and far-field microphones work flawlessly so far. Other reviews cover its qualities very well. I have two gripes with the device, one software and one hardware. My software gripe is that there are few options to change the time, weather, and suggested phrases on the home screen. I expect this will be added functionality in a future update. (Amazon, I hope your SDE's are reading these!) I'd like to have an invocation button on the device as the Echo/Dot/Plus do, but that's minor, and something I knew before purchasing the Show. My hardware gripe is with the rubber base. I was playing music with notable bass at 80% volume. The device continued to shake backwards, sliding away from me, until it almost FELL OFF my painted ledge. The rubber needs to be thicker to absorb the lower frequencies to mitigate this. I hope Amazon will offer a fix for this to keep devices from falling to the ground below.
title: Great device, until it falls off its rocker

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Harvey J. Putterbaugh
content: Take this with a grain of salt since I didn't spend any time to train .  But appliance was not user friendly.  It does manage turning lights, fans on/off IF speak the connected utility ID clear enough for it to do it, otherwise get which one? And you have to repeat until it passes your pronunciation. You can't casually direct requests.  In games it will only except the EXACT answer'vemg. If answer is New York City it may not accept it (wrong-answer is New York CITY), etc.  Interface is not as smooth as I thought it would be.  But again, I did not delve into perfecting my procedure, and just yell at it.  Cats are more perceptive, intelligent and adaptive.
title: Well...

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Squeaky
content: I dislike how not useful it feels. Like I cant watch news apps or YouTube videos without using some hidden browser I have only been able to use once. It's just a dot with a screen to read the text that alexa says. It's also kind of clunky to use smart home devices. If it wasnt given to me as a gift I would have sent it back because I barely use it and feel like it's just a block taking up space on my counter.
title: I can now read what Alexa says?

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: smart_shopper
content: I bought mine on July 15, 2019 and I had issues with sound ever since.  Maybe I just got a defective piece because I had issues right out of the box. There was no sound when I initially set it up but tech support person told me that software update will fix the issue. It was working for few weeks and then lost sound again. I reset it to factory defaults and it started working again. Now, I have no sound again for the last two months. I finally contacted Amazon device tech support today and this was my worse customer experience with Amazon. I tried to provide details of my experience but my review was rejected. Looks like only positive reviews for Amazon are allowed. It is a nice device when working properly but unfortunately mine hasn't been since I bought it. It has been rather frustrating experience so I had to share it.
title: No Sound from time to time

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Tehachapi
content: I am getting use out of it and I enjoy having the screen feature vs the dot.  It can stand being more of a versatile unit, say having internet access but then it would be something else and not the echo show.  But I do like having it in my craft room where I can have access to something else besides music and sound.  I recommend adding more channels for video entertainment options. If you want high end echo features and you are more visual this would be your choice.
title: Nice

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Keith Kramer
content: Normally, I would not grade so harshly - especially with the limited evaluation time I had.  I have a Gen 1 that I have had for quite some time and it has worked well.  Gen 2 seemed like it would be a step up in nearly every way and I was very interested to try it out.  However, the Audio failed within a week. Alexa would get the commands but then was not able to output sound. I called and asked and hoped there might be an easy fix or a new device might be sent fairly quickly as a replacement . Instead, they had me ship the unit back for evaluation and repair if possible, or replacement if not. I finally heard back with an email that wanted a clarification of address so they could send the unit. I responded immediately to the email with the chat option.  Here I spent 40 minutes before they could even determine the device I was trying to get help on and then they finally reported that they couldn't proceed with the promised repair or replacements.  Instead, they had the audacity to suggest I buy another device and they would refund this later.  So... Now they have my money and my device and their solution was to ask me to purchase ANOTHER device. I asked for a refund.  I'm still waiting to see if that goes through.  The rest of these devices may be good.  Maybe I just got a lemon but this situation has made me very wary of purchasing another Amazon product.
title: Audio failed in a week then a customer support fail

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Milton Marrero
content: The Echo Show is a good addition to my echo ecosystem. I have the original Echo, Echo Dot, Echo 2, and the Fire TV Cube. I wish I can give this more stars. Pros: the screen is clear the integration with my ring doorbell and some of my other cameras are great and the Hub features very convenient. Cons: the sound quality if the screen is facing you the sound is not that great if you're facing the speakers the sound is amazing. The other issue I've had is my microphone there's 8 microphones and it still has a problem hearing is especially if the TV is on but my Fire TV queue which is right next to the TV here's me very well. I think with a few software updates they can make this unit great and I can give him more stars. Also still waiting for some of the features that it will promise but it's still not activated.
title: The potential for greatness is there.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Nonna
content: My husband and I are ‚Äúseniors‚Äù and honestly, it was as easy as 1,2,3 to set up the new Echo Show.  So much better than previous Echos and dots.  Starting with the packaging which was phenomenal how it was engineering to fit this gem just perfectly.  Instructions couldn‚Äôt have been easier, literally plug and go.  We haven‚Äôt begun to tap into all the new features but are looking forward to trying them.  Way to go Amazon!  You got a winner with the Echo Show and better yet we were able to take advantage of Prime Day and a trade-in!
title: EASY PEASEY!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: DILSHAN BOTEJU
content: Owning a Echo show 1, Echo Spot, Echo plus , dot etc etc , I was on the waiting list for the all new Echo Show. Having now got it, i must admit that its a must have at every home. Compared to the Show 1, the screen size is a big improvement while HD quality display makes watching the Show 2 a pleasing experience. The sound quality is far improved with an in-depth Base sound on the new Echo show. The touch panel is also more sensitive and responds to even a slight nudge. I received the Echo Show 2 with a one months Hulu Subscription. Now that's what i call music! This Echo Show plays all our favourite Live TV channels (CNN, Fox, Cozy, Boomerang for kids .......) available on Hulu. This is indeed a new chapter in Television entertainment. In addition, Echo Show now has apps that can also play back some free to air Live News and entertainment channels. I have so far no negative feedback on the product. I did however noticed that once connected to a Bluetooth speaker (in my case to a Yamaha bluetooth), there was a little lagging in the sound track. This is not the case with Echo Show 1. Maybe at the next software update, Amazon can fix this minor concern. As always, A great product from Amazon. Try it Guys - it's sure worth the price!
title: Best Echo Show thus far!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: K. A. Dawg
content: Well I think when you're reviewing this item it's really a matter of taste.  You either like Alexa or you don't.  For me, the sound is good (i'm not an expert on sound, so it wouldn't surprise me if you disagreed), the picture is good, and it just straight up works.  I personally think the device is great.  I like how it does food recipes and music.  I don't really use it for smart home use, so I can't comment on that.  It's a great device for what it is, and if you like Alexa, then you'll like this device.
title: Alexa at its best

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Joshua E. Emery
content: Bought this with great excitement to be able to play prime movies while in the kitchen. Sadly this Alexa is very hard of hearing. Some commands went unnoticed. The worst was trying to get it to play Prime Movies. That's right Amazon's device could not play movies from it's own streaming service without us wanting to pull our hair out. Most of the time she ignored play commands, other times the movies would just never start even though she showed the movie, and said she would play it. 1 star is to generous.
title: Awful device, pure frustration

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Juli
content: Wow! I LOVE the Echo Show! The ease in set-up is excellent. I remember all too well how difficult it once was to install/set-up any computerized device...those days are long gone. It's only been a couple days, but, I'm astonished at having recipes and the companion videos available without lifting a finger! I loved my Echo Spot, but the Echo Show is phenomenal! I'm giving the Spot to my son and I'm sure he'll upgrade to the Show at some point. The HD is excellent. The sound is excellent. I'll update this review as I work with it more, but I'm extremely happy so far! My only major, major COMPLAINT is the "Have Alexa Try This...," which pops up at the bottom of the display, which is a problem the Echo Spot has (many users complain about this). With the Spot this took up the whole screen; with Show it is smaller but so what. If Amazon wants to stay ahead of Google and Facebook gadgets it best listen to the complaints...the Show is not cheap and the feeling of being being used is palpable. At least give us the choice to have the suggestions on or off. Can't this be changed during your updates? Anyway...yes, it deserves a 5-Star Rating!
title: The Echo Show is phenomenal!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: RBartlett
content: The quality of the video and the sound is great.  We can view our lists, weather info, recipes, videos, our photos, etc.  We haven't had our Echo Show very long so we are still discovering new uses.  We will be adding a Ring doorbell to our system in the next few weeks.  And my wife loves the Sandstone color.  I would have preferred it in Charcoal but I don't always get what I want.  HaHa
title: We love the 2nd Generatiion Echo Show.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Gary M Seabolt
content: I got this as a gift about a month ago & I haven't found much use for it yet other than to use it like an echo or echo dot. It will do everything that an echo (I have 1) or echo dot (I have 2) will do with voice commands. The sound is better for music as it has a better bass response. I can have it show me the camera from my ring doorbell but I have to tell it to show me. I haven't been able to figure out how to get it to come on automatically when motion is detected or the doorbell rings which is what I hoped to use it for.There is a lag time of a second or two in the video & sound from the doorbell. I don't think that the lag time is from router speed. Could be from the ring. I have an Orbi mesh router system with 2 satellites. The test speed of my router is 84mbps which should be fast enough.
title: Excellent picture & sound

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Juan
content: I had previously bought external speakers, but once I got my Echo Show, I returned them. The sound is phenomenal and it is well compacted to fit in a desk next to your monitor. I have a Macbook pro, so I am connected via Bluetooth. I was expecting lagging or some interference sound, and Echo Show syncs very well. If you have errands to do having the Echo Show next to your computer is great as you can sync up calendar events from Google. I found this Echo Show version perfect for my desktop as I don't need one which rotates like the next version.
title: Great as an external speaker for your computer.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: slim11361
content: I use my Echo Show everyday.  I can't say enough good things about this device.  I can play my music on it, when I am cooking it can look up information for me, it walks you through a recipe so you don't have to pull up your recipe while your hands are gooey, it hooked up to my Ring Doorbell so I can see who is at the door much quicker than I did using my cell phone.  There are so many more things the Echo Show can do and I don't want to bore you with listing them all.  Just buy one, you won't be sorry.
title: Love, love, love my Echo Show

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Jon
content: I had always wanted to have something like this in the kitchen. I had often used an iPad for looking at recipes. This just blows that concept away.  Having the visual to along with things you already use everyday with Alexa is one of the best ideas Amazon has come up with. I love being able to see the lyrics for songs as they play. I love being able to watch my favorite movies and Prime originals from my Prime account while I'm cooking dinner. I love being able to see the weather forecast with icons and multi-day outlooks. I love being able to pull up recipes using "The Sous Chef" app. I love seeing everything that is on my shopping list as I create and add new items. We have so many different Alexa enabled devices in our house and I can control everything from this amazing little hub. The screen allows me to dim lights I have in different zones in the house. I can check our baby's room with our Wyze camera. I can drop in on other rooms to communicate with the rest of the family when they are in a different section of the house instead of having to yell "dinner's ready!" at the top of my lungs. The sound quality is superb compared the generation 1 echo and echo dot devices. The picture quality is stunning for such a compact device. I watched one of "The Hobbit" movies the other day while cooking and I could not get over how crisp the picture and sound were. Some things are not fully integrated yet, which is why I did not give it 5 stars. I have Kuna lights and I was hoping to be able to see my Kuna cameras at each door, but this hasn't happened yet. Also, there is no way to set a screen time out on it yet. You can turn off the screen by saying "Alexa, turn off screen" but otherwise it stays on for quite sometime before shutting down. Also, with the screen time out, if you are in a web browser, like Silk, watching something streaming online, it will go back to the home screen after a few minutes. This is frustrating if you are watching youtube videos or streaming content from Netflix or something like that. Overall, I love this device. It has taken the great Alexa-enabled home we already have and enhanced it to juggernaut status. I think some of the things which are cons right now will eventually come through in the form of an update of the software. The price, design, and features are on point and worth the money. Thank you Amazon!
title: Home automation Juggernaut

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: William Seitz
content: We are so grateful for this product, it worked flawlessly to allow us to drop in daily on our 97-year-old mother/grandmother in assisted living. The sound quality was outstanding, and she could always hear and understand our conversations (unlike the telephone, which didn't work well with her hearing aids). The drop in feature allowed us to do video chats without the need for her to do anything, other than come sit in front of the screen to see our smiling faces. She was even able to make outgoing calls just by saying "Alexa call Sue". However, if Alexa asked any questions, such as "phone or alexa device" it confused her. Fortunately Alexa learned to call the most recently used device, so that was not a recurring problem. We also set up a Amazon Prime Photos album to display family photos on the screen when not in a call, which she loved. It was a bit annoying to have Alexa suggestions appear on the screen over the photos - we turned off as many features as we could (weather, calendar alerts, etc.) but it still showed stuff over the photos frequently. I was able to control most of the features remotely from an iPhone logged in to the same Alexa account as the Show. We could also check the status of the Show from the Alexa app on the iphone, and alert the staff at her facility if the Show needed to be reconnected to the wireless, which happened twice over six months. Overall this Show was a huge factor in helping us all stay sane and in touch with our otherwise isolated loved one.
title: Godsend for visiting with grandma

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Steve Hobson
content: The Echo Show is an awesome product.  It's like having another person in the room, only waaaaay smarter.  Great for keeping current on news and weather.  Also nice for sports highlights, movies and television shows.  Lots of amazing games and music / trivia attributes.  Excellent device for streaming Sirius XM or any other on-line service.  Alexa will play any song you ask her to.  She is great.  The perfect companion.  There are so many more things I could say but will stop here.
title: You NEED the Echo Show.  The sound is superb and visual display is amazing.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Cherie Ann
content: Bought to put in my moms memory care facility room.  Due to the COVID-19 it has been a lifesaver I have been able to check in and see her every single day and talk to her and see her it‚Äôs so easy. You use the drop in feature so she doesn‚Äôt have to touch any buttons it‚Äôs all run by the app on my cell phone-  five stars
title: Perfect use for loved one in a facility

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Ed
content: First, the Echo Show has a very nice display and the sound is fantastic! But the display sleeps too fast and there is no way to change it yet. I bought this device after seeing the ads and the pictures in the product description that show people using it in the kitchen.  My wife and I have a lot of recipes in Pinterest.  The display will go to the home screen if it not touched every few minutes. This is not ideal for cooking or baking. There is no way to adjust the screen sleep time apparently. I contacted customer service and tech support and was informed that it's not possible to do at this time. The Echo Show will probably be returned and we will go back to using our laptop in the kitchen.
title: Can't adjust display sleep time. Makes using recipes from web difficult

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: RJ
content: I do much of the cooking and cleaning in our house which means I spend a majority of that time in the kitchen. We started with a Echo Spot in our kitchen with the idea that some music or an audio book might be nice to help pass the time while stuck in the kitchen. Once we got used to the Spot the Show started to sound like more of an good idea. I've had the Show for a month now and am really pleased with it. The sound is great and the video is nice to have for YouTube or other videos. It even connects to my Ring doorbell although I haven't used this feature much yet. A couple of nitpicks... The shape of it does not allow for the Echo Show to be easily mounted to a wall or under cabinet. Important for those of use with limited counter space. YouTube has to be set to 'desktop' in order to watch it without the screen timing out. This was frustrating to have to work out. The touchscreen could be easier to use. At least for my old and inflexible fingers. I might purchase a pen for it.
title: I use it every day

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: B Batteiger
content: I originally got this because it could play Bloomberg TV.  Now they have taken that away. I used to be able to ask it to spell words for me and it would actually show the word on the screen which was nice.  No it now longer shows the word on the screen.  Why the heck would the developers remove that feature. Browsing for movies on Prime is clunky and slow. You can not play U-tube or Netflix on this. I have spent a lot of money on Alexa devices, now I am worried that maybe I picked the wrong infrastructure.  Shall I see what google devices can do for me? The weather has very little detail.  You would think that a radar on the video screen might be a nice touch even, but you can hardly get a basic forecast that is more than a few icons and a temperature. I was hoping things would get better over time....Instead it is getting worse!! Also note how they rig the review with just the 3 features that it can do.  Sure it can do Voice Recognition as well as the $30 dot, sure it has Alexa integration as that is a basic feature, sure the sound is pretty good and better than $30 dot.  But that is not what is most important in a video enabled Alexa.
title: Doing less all the time

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: lpb
content: My first Echo Show 2nd generation!!  I love it!  I bought the deal of buy 2 and get $100.00 off.  I gave the second one as a gift to a family who has helped me out a lot this past year.  They were thrilled and loved it.  Still playing and learning the system.  What I am going to like a lot is skype!  I have it connected to my smart plugs so on command it turns the lights on or off.  The sound is ‚Äúwow‚Äù sound.  I even found a screen saver called my aquarium which is quite impressive!  I‚Äôve read other reviews that were rating this item low and their gripes but so far I don‚Äôt see it and love the all new echo show!!!
title: Wow all the way around!!!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: JohnV
content: I keep trying but the VR algorithms for this product are VERY weak. For example ‚ÄùPlay Amazon video‚Äù results in an ‚Äú I don‚Äôt know how to‚Äù response. Ask to play Prime Video and a random video from Prime not a menu. And why does Fire TV have a Netflix app and This device does not? UPDATE: The more I use the Echo Show 2 the more I wish that Amazon would port over the Fire Stick apps & software to it. The 8" screen is superb and the sound terrific. It would be a GREAT Kitchen/bath TV, if only... 10/2020 - I just asked Alexa to play a news story displayed on the screen and it ‚Äúcould not find an app for that.‚Äù Another example of  Not-Ready-for Prime-Time nature of this product.
title: They got a ways to go with this product.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: RickO
content: The connection and video  from show to show isn't very good. The picture of the caller, you, at your location shown as a smaller picture in the corner is very sharp. The app isn't user friendly. Doesn't lend itself to much help when issues arise. I've purchased 4 units and have trouble connecting all of them so we can video call. The newest of them calls only one way, when I call it tells me that the party I called didn't pick up when they are actually waiting by the show for a call. Hope this gets better, after buying four of them , kinda of expensive, it seems I will be using the phone. Has not been a good experience. My next move will be calling Amazon help. I will update again if my feelings about the show changes. Update...... The day after my review with two star review and listed issues I had a call from Amazon asking what my issue was and how they could help.  Honestly, this is why I consistently use Amazon. Took a few calls but bottom line is that we rectified the issues. Went to 5g to help the picture clarity , had to set up a separate account for one of the shows to get it to connect. Much happier....again.....best customer support out there. Still needs to be tweeked to make a 5star concerning features.
title: Much better

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: WAMPY
content: I was super excited to receive my Echo Show but quickly realized that it wasn't exactly what i was expecting. The screen quality is excellent and the sound is fantastic. While i love how the image quality looks and how the sound performs, it does have a few flaws. There is no main screen where all of your apps will live, You will need to ask the Echo to open things up. For some reason when ever i ask to open spotify it asks me to set up a video provider on the alexa app. The Hulu app is limited in what you can search or watch and its the same thing for prime video. It is almost impossible to get the echo show to open up the correct show when you ask her to. I have found i have to ask the echo to open something and then look for it manually. It is pretty bulky and takes up a bit of space . The alexa app itself is a little hard to figure out and has made me use a google home to control my home devices. All in all its a good speaker and great for video chatting ( Once you can figure it out), but there are still a lot of things that are lacking that Amazon could improve.
title: Awesome but lacking!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Jennifer
content: I now understand that this product is more for people that want to have a touch screen.... but you should be able to touch it to have it do things then!  I have had nothing but problems with this.  Hulu does not steam correctly.... half the time when I ask Alexa to find a movie she does something else.  The voice recognition is crap.  I have several other Echo devices and do not have the same problems that I do with this one. I purchased two.... one for home and one for work.  I seriously can't get either one to work correctly.  I really wanted to get one for my grandma so that we could video chat, but I don't think she would be able to get it to work. Also.... if you want it to be touch screen you should be able to pull up the skills to use them.  I like to use Spotify but forget it on this thing.... it has no idea what Spotify is let alone telling it to play a certain play list. I was trying to give it the old college try and now I'm outside of the return window.  I really wish I would have just gotten a new Fire that had Alexa.... it would have been a lot cheaper and so much easier to work with. Last but not least..... LET US HAVE NETFLIX!!!!!!
title: Not impressed at all

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Dog Judge
content: The new Echo Show is a significant improvement over my first generation Show, which I have kept. Voice recognition and sound output is considerably better and it remains easy to setup. I soon as I plugged it in an connected to my wifi, it connected, downloaded a lengthy update and then downloaded necessary personal information from the Alexa app. It works with all of my enabled products of several different brands with no difficulties and I did not have to setup anything just for this new product. The app took care of that for me. A quick run through of the settings and I was all set. My only disappointment is not new, its the fact that Siri does a better job of understanding what I want that Alexa does. Amazon, it is time to improve this, please do some more work on the software that controls this. 4 Starts until this improvement takes place.
title: Significant Improvement Compared to First Generation Product

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Carolinakeeper
content: My husband is in his sixties. He had rotator cuff surgery right after Christmas. I got him two Echo Shows for his gift as I knew he wouldn't be able to lift up his arm to turn on the light. This Echo Show has been just great! He cuts the livingroom light off and on by just speaking and the lamp by his bedside also. He asks the sports scores without having to look them up. The bulbs were free as a Christmas incentive from Best Buy. We have used this as a timer to remember when to give medication and when to use medical devices, like ice machines, that you can only use for a certain length of time. We just speak and the Echo Show sets the timer all day long. The timer displays as it counts down, say for 20 minutes. For timers that are set for hours it shows how much time is left until the next alarm without asking. We don't touch anything. It has been a life saver! I just wish it were easier to watch TV or Netflix on these.
title: Great help for people using medical devices

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Paul C
content: First impression is it a quality device but still getting to know it. One observation is it takes a very long time to open camera views in the Blink skill and there is a serious lack of live video skills...hope there‚Äôs more coming. Seems like it should be easy enough have access to Playstation Vue or other.
title: Quality build lacking responsiveness and some obvious skills

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Bidjey
content: -Why can't the Alexa app be preinstalled on this device rocking a 10.1" HD Screen? Why??? I have to use a phone, tablet or a PC/Mac to access the Alexa app this device is supposed to portray. -Alexa dim all lights 50%!!! "Sorry all hue lights are not responding!" (Lights are offline on the Alexa App but perfectly fine on the Philips Hue app) -It is supposed to "sync" with my Philips Hue account and mirrors my HUB setup from the Philips Hue app but no! Instead of just 4 fully assigned lights, this thing discovered 4 extra factory-named lights duplicating the ones that were fully assigned. Delete the duplicates then all of a sudden "Sorry Hue Lights are not responding". -Why is there no option to raise or lower Alexa voice directly like changing volumes for media, ringtone and notification like on any regular mobile device? -Why is there no real settings to customize the Home Screen especially the CLOCK? - Why under "Lights and More" you can only toggle on/off your lights. How about dimming and stuff? - Most annoying if you're watching a video and say "turn on/off lights...!" You have to wait for it to execute the command then wait 15-20 secs before it resumes the video. Hopefully they address those issues soon otherwise I am returning it
title: This still needs major updates

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Edward W. Yowell
content: I really like this device it resides in my Kitchen The Alexa functionality is good and getting better all the time. Sound and screen size is pleasing but like the rest of the device, it could use improvements. My two main complaints are #1 the is lack of multiple users control and #2 tablet type functionality.  If you want to make a call you can only pull from one address book which is cumbersome for a device meant to serve a home as a centralized device. The device is limited to the echo show mode and Aleza only and has no tablet-style functionality like adding your favorite apps which is limiting at best and a gross omission at the very least. I do hope the platform improves overall. Look at it this way if I want to add a new Hue or smart thing device I have to pick up my Fire HD 10 or phone or laptop to add it so Alexa can control it because the Echo Show is useless in this regard. Not what I expected and I'm sure very frustrating for many less tech-savvy DIYers.
title: Not all that, Yet

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: TBro
content: Bought 2 of these. The sound doesn‚Äôt work on either one. I‚Äôve walked through all troubleshooting w amazon and arranged for replacements. What a waste of time. I hope the new ones work.
title: Sound doesn‚Äôt work

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Theresa Conarello
content: Really disappointed with this echo show. Sound is mediocre. But I didn't expect much on that front. I have it right on my kitchen counter. I will call out alexa from 10 feet away and instead of echo show answering my call, my echo in another room thirty or more feet away answers. I physically have to stand close to the show for it to answer. Connection pops on and off constantly. My echos don't do that. Had so much trouble trying to get pinterest up which is main reason for my purchase so I could use it to read my pinterest recipes. Also i keep bluetooth on as I also have a fit that is connected. I had paired my phone bluetooth with echo show so I could make phone calls but now it hears me on phone and responds thru it.  What a mess. Not happy.
title: Not happy

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Debra
content: I currently have an Echo Tower and Dot.  In addition, I have the Nest thermostat and Nest doorbell.  I purchased the Echo Show to display recipes, streaming videos, playing/displaying music,  and displaying and letting me know when someone is at my door or ringing the doorbell.
