I love everything about the Echo Show, except for how it works with my Nest Doorbell.  Echo show  will not tell you or display, if someone is at your door or ringing your doorbell.  I have to ask Alexa to show me the front door.  I am very disappointed with the way Echo Show works with the Nest doorbell.
title: Nest video doorbell and Echo Show lack compatibility features.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: BeagleMomma
content: I bought this specifically for the video capabilities. I bought 3 so my kids and parents have them and we can video with granddaughter. It is easy to use for things like turning on movies, music, video conferencing, viewing security cameras, and video conferencing. HOWEVER, I cannot even fathom the reasoning behind not having even a short term battery. It comes with a six foot cord which won't even get you out of the room you're in.  My plan was to be able to keep it in my office and take to kitchen when needed.  I cannot do that without unplugging, replugging and waiting for it to set up.  The only reason I can come up with for no battery is Amazon doesn't want you to be able to take it room to room but wants you to purchase additional shows for each room you would need it in.  I find that frustrating...and a little infuriating. I am currently looking into whether a longer power cord can be purchased and will update when I find out.
title: Handy & Easy to Use...BUT No Battery

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Christopher Thornton
content: I was very surprised by the sound quality. I have a pair of Sonos play 5 mounted on top of my kitchen cabinets my wife was playing some music and I had to ask if the sound was spraying out of the Sonos or the echo show. As for the echo show itself . I‚Äôm not super impressed with its functionality. It kind of crashes when trying to watch Hulu.  We have a large open kitchen / dining / living room we used to have a echo dot on top of the fridge, it could hear us at normal conversation level in any of the rooms . The echo show is on the counter directly across from the fridge , and now we have to shout commands when we are in the living room . One of the features I do enjoy is having it show my camera roll . Most of the Alexa apps are designed to be used with out a screen . We have rings and the integration seems week. I would like the camera view to come up on its own, with out my having to say the command .
title: Great sound, but that‚Äôs about it

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: JesseNYC
content: Great sound and very decent bass especially considering this unit‚Äôs size. The page slide is snappy and quick. The OS is android based and operates smoothly. The YouTube integration isn‚Äôt the best and still takes several steps to get to. The voice recognition is as good as it gets; however, I recommend selecting ‚Äúshort answers‚Äù to avoid having to listen to the rather long and drawn out default responses. Adding smart home devices is a breeze and so far I‚Äôve added smart outlets, Wemo smart dimmer switches, Philips Hue bulbs and a couple of echo dots. I‚Äôll continue to update this review as I get deeper into using it.
title: A lot of what I wanted, but will I use it?

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: rgerson
content: Great improvement over gen 1 echo show. Larger screen makes it  easier to see things like time and temperature. Sound is amazingly clear with improved bass response. Don‚Äôt really like ‚Äúbooming‚Äù bass sound while listening to rock music so I had to turn bass down using equalizer. Besides music, we use it for timers, reminders, weather reports, phone calls, recipes, jokes and various skills. What a great ‚Äútoy‚Äù as well as useful device! Only wish Amazon would update software to allow us to adjust font size of time/temperature & include day/date on home display along with the time/temperature.
title: Great Improvement!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Tom
content: Nice idea, but not fully there. It feels half baked, mostly because the screen in not very functional or useful. I think this will be great for my mom to be able to make video calls and I've decided to give one of mine to her. I'll keep the other one to talk back and keep it it in the bedroom or office to replace the alarm clock. To make this better Amazon needs to make the screen more functional. Just give us a control panel with different screens. Let us put the home automation controls in there so that I can view (and change) the settings of all of the items in my smart home setup. THAT is what this should be. Actually I've been using one of my Echo Shows in the same room as my Fire TV Cube and that setup is almost impossible. I just wish this was functional with the voice control turned OFF  and that this and the Cube could work together rather than against each other as this would be a perfect control/info panel. It already has all of the hardware necessary to be that--but the software isn't there. Not even close to there in fact.
title: Mixed Review - 2 and 1/2 Stars

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: JJ
content: In all honesty I really did not need to purchase the Echo Show 2nd gen. But couldn't pass it up during Amazon Prime Day!! Anyhow it took me a week or so to install do to work schedule but after setting up I could have done it in less than 10 mins. Pros: 1. I really love the on screen display. It alternates with weather info, news articles and makes suggestions on current events you can watch. 2. If you are not into that you can setup for it to show you photos from your amazon account. 3. If you own a Ring door bell, another cool feature is that you can ask it to show you camera "xyz." This feature comes in handy if you need to see an alert you got at your front door. Yes guys if you set it up as a routine you can have your Alexa say " someone is at the front door. " 4. Each time you trigger her name "Alexa, Computer, Echo" you hear a nice tone that lets you know she is listening. This comes in handy if you are not facing the unit. Other wise if you are able to see the unit you see the typical blue lights as a bar across the bottom of the screen. 5. When playing music from Amazon Music, the echo show, displays you lyrics which for the kids is a lot of fun. For adults who thought the lyrics were something else you are in for a learning treat as you sing along to the correct lyrics. 6. You can integrate multi room speaker setup so that you can play music simultaneously throughout all your alexa devices. 7. The sound quality on my echo gen 1 was pretty nice. The sound quality on the echo show 2nd gen is AMAZING! 8. I went with this model because it has a lovely 10.1 screen, big enough that you can see pretty well across the kitchen as you prep your ingredients from a recipe. 9. I don't watch movies yet on the device but I do watch videos 10. I don't make video calls yet but I do send messages to friends and when they respond back you can see an icon letting you know you have a message. 11. The echo show 2nd gen is terrific about showing you your events. For some reason echo gen 1 when I would ask for my events for the day it would tell me I didn't have any. Perhaps operator error. This unit shows me everyday what my events will be!!! 12. When you ask it to do something you get to see that it is turning on lights and at what percent those lights are on. You can either manually change the percentage or you can ask her to change the percentage. Just really cool that you can see it being done in front of your eyes. Cons: 1. Not a big deal but the echo show 2nd gen seems to take a few seconds longer when I ask it to do something. Overall I am very satisfied with my purchase, the family loves using the unit more than before, and I would highly recommend this product to friends and family. I can‚Äôt wait to see how they continue to improve on this device.
title: Overall I am very satisfied with my purchase

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Clever User Name
content: I purchased this 2nd Gen Echo Show in July 2019.  Fifteen months later the audio is dead, kaput, gone.  It still reacts to my voice and will control my smart plugs, but it won't play music or audibly respond to me.  Yes, I've rebooted it, and even did a factory reset.  No, it's not a problem with my wifi.  Yes, I have the volume turned up and it's not muted. It gets 2 stars because we liked it while it worked, but it should last longer.  :-(
title: It was nice while it lasted

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Mr Speaker
content: I have had this for about a month now. Sound is very good and overall a great product. I had been using an echo which I liked but was going to purchase an echo plus but decided to get a Show, Spot, and fire tab 8 with Alexa. My biggest complaint is you truly cant get the display to show what you want. With some effort you can get close but ultimately you get messages that say Try"Alexa ‚Ä¶. Playing movies and such is also not convenient. I have several fire sticks and they work great and way easier then the Show. Another issue is if you start adding hi Res cameras you better have a very good internet connection. I run dual band DSL and upload speed seems to get in the way with a few devices running. With a few software changes it could be a great product, the hardware is overall very good. My spot and show went back. I kept the tab but still fighting with show mode when I put it on the wireless dock (show dock). I may end up abandoning the dock and simply use it without show mode.  Going back to echo, a very nice product
title: A great start but not perfect

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Larry
content: I would give the Echo Show 10 STARS if I could. It works great with all my Ring products. And the things I can do with the Show are great. The picture quality is great for a older person like me, for I can see everything real easy. Cons: Alot of us been telling and calling Amazon about this.  We need more then 4 names for the units, I alone have 7 Amazon Dots, 1 Echo Show, and 1 Echo Show 5.  I have a unit in every room of my house, I control the lights thermostat, and a ton more things. So when one of your commercials comes on about how many miles form the Earth to the moon. I don't need the units telling me because they hear the question from one of my TV's. So please give us more name are better yet let us set the names we want.
title: I would give the Echo Show 10 STARS if I could

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Frugal Shopper
content: I had wanted a good sounding device to integrate with my other Alexa/Ring devices. Stopped by Best Buy a few months back and the salesman talked me into a $200 Sonos speaker. Thank God I got the 2 year warranty. Took it back after dealing with the disappointments and shortcomings for over 2 months. Got my money back and used it on the Echo Home Second Generation. OMG! I'm sooooo glad I did. This device is the bomb. Set up is the easiest thing I've ever done. It walks you through everything without lifting a finger. Registration was a snap. And within minutes all my Ring devices were hooked up and showing everything I asked to see. Highly Recommend. Gonna get one for my son for Christmas if he doesn't get one before then once he sees mine. I could go on and on but I'd be wasting your time. Quit reading this and order one NOW!
title: I LOVE THIS DEVICE!!!! HAPPY BIRTHDAY TO ME. Woohoo!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Catamaran42
content: I really do enjoy using this product in the mornings when I'm getting ready for my day. I just ask Alexa to either tune me into my favorite radio station to listen to my favorite DJs in the morning or I have her play some of the songs I have on file or I have her show me some of the films we have available on Prime Video. The only issue I have noticed so far is that on the one in my smaller bathroom (I purchased 2--one for the master and one for the smaller where I usually get ready) she (Alexa) does not respond properly when I ask her to stop playing or to pause or whatever it is I am asking her to do--she does not get the command correct until I typically shout it at her several times. I have gone to just straight up ignoring the voice commands and using the swipe mode instead!
title: Wonderful Morning Assistant

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Kothon
content: got this for my wife, wanted something to cook with in the kitchen, sounded like you just say a recipe and alexa pulls it up for you to use... blah way more trouble than its worth.. lots of inbetween stuff needs to be done to just get a simple recipe to show.. she winds up using her phone to get the recipe she needs.
title: Dont get this unless you want an Alexa with pictures..

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Jon H.
content: I like the product. The larger echo show for the kitchen (2nd generation) has great sound quality. The video also seems to be better quality than smaller echo shows you might use to replace an alarm clock by a bedside. It‚Äôs a little confusing out of the box knowing how communication works, especially if you have several and family members have one or more. You will want to know which shows ring in somebody else‚Äôs house. Does one ring, or do all of them ring in their house! I think they are tied to a contact, and their amazon account, and a mobile. However, you could call them from the Alexa app in your cell phone, or a landline, or Alexa amazon device to another one. It gets a little confusing if you have kids and they do not have their own amazon account. So if you call the parent‚Äôs large echo in the kitchen, the kids echos might also ring if tied to the parent‚Äôs amazon account, and mobile. In summary, great product, wish there was an extensive manual on communication features for the show product since they have video capabilities. People buying that product will focus on interconnecting with family via video calls. I liked the vast array of commands Alexa responds to. Many of them are useful, such as maps and directions, weather, cooking recipes, and playing music. Ability to pair your phone for music is nice too. If you have several they can work as an intercom throughout your home, and more.
title: Great sound, handy helper, stay connected with other family, and supt. for smart devices.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Nes Lax
content: Pros: - Nice display. - Sound is nice although it's more of bass. Cons: - Touch screen is not responsive. This is my main issue. Very disappointing. - I've noticed that when it's in YouTube subsequent searches will be made within YouTube; it won't go back to the previous screen or get out of YouTube. I have to wait until it decides to go back to the main screen. - Sometimes it gives the wrong search results (I own 2 other echo dots and never had such problems). I received this as a Father's Day gift from my children. I have used it everyday since. I like the fact that I can watch videos on YouTube. But once in YouTube, I can't go anywhere else. If I give a search command, it gives back the results from within YouTube. It doesn't recognize the command, "go to the main screen" or "go back". Instead it searches for those words in YouTube üò¢.
title: Disappointed with the touch screen. Not responsive.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Grant
content: Big Cons: -Annoying snippets/tips at the bottom with no way to disable them. -When using as photo frame, the photos do not shuffle -No settings available to customize photo/slideshow function -Blink camera integration is minimal with no 2-way audio despite Blink being an Amazon company -No YouTube -No Netflix -No Disney Plus Honestly we were really thinking we were gonna love it, but it actually doesn‚Äôt do that much. What it does do, is plagued with flaws. For a device with a screen, that it meant to be a home device, I would expect them to have far more customization/settings available especially for the photo slideshow function. How does Amazon produce a flagship product with a massive team of developers but so little features?
title: Basic Device with major Cons

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: SLE
content: After reading the reviews of the first gen Echo Show, I opted to wait. I now have gen 2 and I love it! I haven't had a chance to try video calls yet, but I've used lots of other stuff, including the basic Alexa stuff like shopping list, reminders and alarms, playing music, playing audio books and even music videos and Hulu! So far, I love it! I'm really glad I opted for the adjustable stand (at an additional cost). The only thing I wish I had so far is a physical volume up/down button. Sometimes you just want to tap the volume up or down quickly, but I don't think it has that. Otherwise, I super love it and I plan to get one for my Mom, too! Ps: there are volume buttons on top!
title: I love the new Echo Show!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Scott T
content: I replaced an Echo Show 1st Gen with the new 10" Echo Show 2nd Gen.  The increased screen size and clarity is great and the sound is a step up also.  I sure would like better integration with YouTube, but I understand that is more in Google's domain.  Alexa devices continue to have the largest and most functional set of skills.  With the larger screen size of the 2nd Gen, I am hopeful that the screen interface of the Show will be modernized to have a more advanced interface.  It's a disappointment that the Echo Show interface has remained essentially the same since its original release.  Most notable, I would like to see "routines" that could control information displayed on the screen with a voice prompt.
title: Echo Show 2Gen a nice step up

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Josh G
content: The Show is my favorite Echo device in the house. I have a Echo and an Echo Dot, but having the screen and other added features make it well worth the price. I am able to connect my Ring video doorbell up to the Show to see who's at the front door. Also, I can see the words to songs that are playing on Prime Music. Speaking of sound, It sounds much better than all the other Echo devices... Clear sound with nice bass (Has an equalizer that you can tweak). There is also a lot of Bluetooth tech capabilities like using it as an external speaker for your TV or Stereo. The wallpaper is customizable as well. You can have the Show display your photo library or a specific picture for the main wallpaper background. The touch screen is also a nice touch. Hopefully they will update the Echo Show to include more touch screen options like a tablet. All around good and solid product.
title: The best Echo device available!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: albuquirky
content: Buyer beware - there is a known issue where no sound will come out.  Some users will have to plug and unplug device frequently to resolve. That worked for me once and doesn‚Äôt any longer.  Now sending to Amazon to repair/replace. This will be the last echo product I purchase due to lack of response on issue from amazon and poor customer service on remedying the problem. As for the unit itself, when it worked...  sound is nice.  My wife wanted it for pictures of the kids in the background.  it‚Äôs okay for that, but there‚Äôs always an annoying overlay of ‚Äòtry this‚Äô notes. It tries too hard to push use of device through this feature and it‚Äôs annoying. reminds me of when i first bought the the first kindle fire...  just not as good as I hoped.
title: Not a good device

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Nanc
content: Loved the picture quality, but it never worked completely right. It kept loosing the music stations, when the echo dot didn't. After a few months It would rarely finish it's sentences. We should of contacted customer services but we just put up with it. Now it will not shut off the music. We have to ask the echo dot it's connected to to shut off all the music. It doesn't respond to many commands. We wish we had contacted earlier to get an exchange.
title: Loved the picture quality, but it never worked completely right.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: nesnet
content: I own three 1st Gen Echo Shows... and just purchased my first 2nd Gen Show. Very nice product, a definite upgrade. Screen looks great. Overall I am pleased with it, except for the "Alexa hints" at the bottom of the home screen. Let the user decide if we want hints displayed on the bottom of the screen. I don't. Give us a software option to turn hints off. Provide a simple on/off toggle button in the settings. I would give this product a 5-star rating if this one major annoyance was remedied. The home screen should allow some customization by the end user. Please fix this issue, which is long overdue...
title: Nice Product... Except for Annoying Alexa Hints

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: JKL
content: We bought 2 echo shows one for us and one that was set up 1800 miles away from ours in a nursing home. This product allowed me to drop in on my chronically ill sister whenever i wanted. She was no longer able to reach and answer her phone. I got to see her everyday which made her feel that I was sitting with her. Sadley she passed away last night and I was able to be with her until the end. God Bless the people who developed " my friend Alexa" who did her job and let me be with my sister, it was comforting for both of us.
title: Please read this review and it may help you too.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: sharon chapko
content: Could hardly wait to get my Echo Show (2nd generation)! I was like a little kid on Christmas! It's been a week, and I'm a little disappointed so far! Most of the complaints I read on here, I do not have with mine. My complaint is that when I tell her to play music such as "Smooth Jazz", she'll play it for a little while maybe 30 minutes then shuts off!  Even when I tell her to play music for eight hours= she doesn't!  Also, I thought she would be like Siri where you could ask her anything and she would answer, but 4 out of 5 questions I ask her, she answers with "I don't know that"!  I even created a skill called My Questions, where you make your own questions and answers for her to repeat; but when I ask her any of those questions, she says "I don't know that"!  What good are skills if she doesn't recognize them?  Yes, her sound and picture is awesome, but that's about it! Very Disappointed in this expensive purchase! I thought about returning it for a Google one and I wish I would have!
title: My elatation turned to deflation with the Echo Show (2nd Generation)!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: John R
content: I love my 4 Echo Dots.  So, a big-screen Echo Show 2 should be even better, right?? Despite the gorgeous 10.1" screen... Can't set Home/Ambient clock to be bigger than the size of my thumb. Can't display date on the Home/Ambient screen.  It'll speak it to you though. Can't display a simple, plain monthly calendar.  But it can show your personal events. Nest app will let you see and hear Nest Cam, but you can't speak to it (person at the camera can't hear you). I would have returned this day 1, but kept it for Nest Cam use.  I've only belated realized I cannot even speak through it.  What I have is a way overpriced Echo Dot that takes up too much room.
title: Dumbest use of smart screen device

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: en sabbah nur
content: Ive used the 1st gen Show as a background media device for about a year and my only real complaint was the screen size for watching shows. In that time we have lost then gained youtube access, and gained Tidal and Hulu support, This device is wonderful as it s basically a tablet in a speaker enclosure so you get a full screen experience at the expense of front directed audio. Since I still feel they are targeting the this for a corner of your kitchen all of the sound is now reflected from the back and while it is much more "spacious" and "immersive", its not nearly as clear as front fired speakers, this is true with TVs, phones, tablets, laptops etc so its not a device specific behavior. This gen also has a built in Zigbee hub so you can use things like Hue bulbs without having to buy the additional hub. If you can grab one at a discount, its definitely worth a try.
title: A worthy generational evolution

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Johnny010
content: *****READ THIS WARNING First, I have to say I love it when though it shattered four hours after opening it. Here's the warning part: I had the new Echo Show on the end table in the living room three inches from the edge.  The music was at 70% jamming some Red Hot Chili Peppers.  For context of what happened next you must know, I live alone and no animals, and was in the office working when I heard a loud BANG.  I thought surely not, but yes, the Show was face down on the tile, shattered.  The bass of the music must have slowly been moving the Echo Show back until it fell off the end table.  There's no other explanation.  I had a picture that was taken about an hour before with my mom and daughter in the background and you can see where it was on the table.  So be forewarned, this thing moves even though it has a rubber pad on the bottom.  Other than that, great device already have another one on the way. Also for photos, you'll need Amazon Photos and create an album in order to see on the Show. Seems to be a common question.
title: The Echo Show that moves***

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Bjudo
content: I managed to pick up the Echo Show on a recent sale.  It has a very nice quality of base and overall sound quality to it. I was somewhat surprised when compared to a lack luster speaker in the Echo.  Music from my Amazon collection as well as station such as Pandora have a rich sound to them. The visual display is crisp and certainly suitable for displaying images, through I prefer a larger screen to watch video at home.  Voice recognition, even across from a small room while playing music is dependable.  It is configurable so that the screen only displays time when not in use so not to be distracting.  The bluetooth pair is not quite as reliable as it should be, as it did not connect to a device sitting directly next to it.  Overall, a good purchase at a discounted price.
title: Booming sound

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Becca Miller
content: Updating my review from 4 stars to 2.  Less than a month in and it's malfunctioning.  Way way over priced for what you get.  Should have stuck with my echo....which by the way...is also malfunctioning. A little pricey considering it doesn't do much.  The touch screen doesn't have many options at all.  Most programming needs to be done with your phone.  Great sound.  Nice, heavy and sturdy so that it can't get knocked over easily.  Works good with my security system...however wish that the live camera feed would automatically show when it detects movements.  A split screen on my security cameras would be nice too.  I don't like amazon music as much as my other music app.  Some of the music titles they play in their stations aren't the #1 hits I want to listen to....some aren't desirable at all.  Still giving 4 stars because having my home controlled by Alexa is pretty cool.
title: Way over priced!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Lawrence J. Reinholt
content: I bought a 2nd Gen Echo Show, and it immediately presented issues (from the camera) I could see it in my screen of my image and my callers could see it on their screen.  I spent 1 hour or more with Tech support, no fix, and received 3 emails once a week they were still looking into it.  My software was and is up to date.  So I returned the first one.  Bought another (on sale this time) and magically the same issues.....I own 9 echo devices, I am an early adopter, but this is truly impacting my trust in the Amazon brand, it took me 30 mins to get a replacement sent out...This should not be so hard to fix, both the hardware issue and the customer service!
title: 2nd 2nd Gen Show with Camera Failure

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Katie
content: There are mixed reviews here on whether or not you can get the home screen to not suggest "Ask Alexa to...." ideas consistently. I have just finished a chat with Amazon support who confirmed there is NO WAY to turn off these "Things to Try." Clearly whoever came up with this does not have children, because my children interrupt Alexa every 4 seconds to ask her whatever she is suggesting. Or maybe they do have children, because who else is going to ask her to "tell me a horse joke" or "share something weird"? Beyond that, I do not necessarily want my children to be aware of all of these skills, especially when she is suggesting they play certain videos. We've had a kids' Echo Dot for a year, and it's been fine because as far as my kids have known until now, the only thing Alexa can do is play music and read stories. Now they are NONSTOP asking it to do all sorts of stuff. Not okay, Amazon.
title: No, you cannot turn off "Things to Try"

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Shannon McMillen
content: I bought the 10.1 inch echo show for my mother of 88 years old.  I wanted to buy her something very useful and something that she could use to make her life more easier.  I was correct to buy a 10.1 inch echo show. The 10.1 inch is a larger screen so it would be easier for her to read things from it and see the images better.  She only has one functional eye which limits her vision considerably. She also likes the picture show and she can glance also to see the time and outside temperature and what day it is. It's getting harder for her to get up and walk around so much to do things now.  She can now turn on the air conditioner, various lights in the home and also the fan.  She can also change the channels on the direcTV.  She likes to ask it with the temperature is and the seven day forecast.  She likes to see the video news briefs and if she wants to watch one of them all she has to do is tell Alexa.  She has commented quite a number of times but she just dearly loves this echo show and it was the best thing I ever could have bought for her.  In the beginning she thought $230 was way too much for something like that, but now she does not care how much it cost because it does so much for her and it makes her life more enjoyable at home alone when I'm on working.  I surprise tour with the video call from my cell phone sitting in my truck over 1500 miles away she was just absolutely thrilled that she could see me and when I moved my cell phone around looking out the doors and windshield she saw what looked like where I was and it made her happy and she felt a lot less lonely and depressed living alone while I'm working away from home. Thank you Amazon.Com and Alexa !
title: At first she hated it but now she loves it and uses it all the time.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: K Lehn
content: My first Echo Show was the first generation, so when I bought the 2nd generation, I figured it was an improvement.  Screen wise it is, speakers, there's too much base (there is an EQ, even with the base turned all the way down, still too much base).  The other issue is the speakers facing away from you, behind the device.  The first gen unit I could hear throughout my apartment at lower volumes, the second gen unit, I can't unless I really turn it up loud.  As I said my apartment, I use my Echo Show as an alarm clock, and listen to music while I wake up.  Getting back to the base issues, the last thing I figure my neighbors want to hear is the base coming from my Echo Show as base travels very well through walls.  So if you live in an apartment, and you wish to use this device as an alarm clock, I would advise finding a gen 1 Echo Show instead, as it's a much better choice, even with the smaller screen size.
title: Nice large screen, too much base

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: MCote
content: So frustrating--this device fails to hear us in the same room.  We will repeat ourselves louder and one of the Alexa enabled devices in other rooms will end up responding before this one does.  I thought this had more and better microphones.  This is one of the most important features for this device-response and it is lacking.  Knowing what we know now we would have bought a second original Echo Show or waited for improvements.  I expected much better.
title: Device Is Hard Of Hearing

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: bearyhot
content: I don't know how I lived so long, without the Alexa Show! It's wonderful and I actually find myself wanting to talk to the experimental AI bots. They can have an entire conversation with me, with which I'm fully enamored! I thought that the Echo Dot was amazing, but the 10 inch Echo Show is brilliant! It has a rich color screen as well as amazing, full, booming sound for such a small object. You also have an  option to integrate it with your surround sound system, via Bluetooth. It was extremely simple to set up and get onto my network. I even enabled several skills, so it would work with my new Mini Cooper, as well as my Samsung 55" TV. I cannot say enough good things about the new Alexa Show, but if you are on√® the fence about purchasing the big 10" screen, just go for it! I promise, you'll love it! Thank you Amazon, for brightening my days with Alexa Show!
title: ALEXA SHOW, OH HOW I ‚ù§ THEE!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Mike B.
content: This device is spectacular and the range of the  sound quality is excellent. The highs are crisp and clean and the bass delivers a decisive boom. When ie..... asking Alexa for to play the news flash aka flash briefing as I do on my dot every morning, I was pleasantly surprised by the Echo show which played a video flash briefing (watching the news instead of listening) This sevice allows some Apps (Amazon calls them skills)  like Hulu,  Prime video, You Tube, plus a few others,  but sadly like many Amazon devices they dont allow competitors like VUDU, Netflix, Google Play. This device allows one to call other  show device to show device much like the DOT , in addition it allows Skype, This device also has the ability to be a hub as well ...  overall great buy / gift
title: AWESOME BUY

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: NyNy12259
content: Wish I had saved my money! I wanted this to replace a kindle fire I use to stream videos and live TV in my kitchen. Needless to say the kindle works better. This Echo Show does not do what it says it is doing. For example I ask for a Prime Video by name and episode (yes I am that specific) and Alexa says here‚Äôs blah blah blah (exactly what I asked for) and NOTHING plays or it says it is playing something completely different. Also cannot add apps or really do anything. Big waste of money! Use a Kindle Fire attached to an Echo.
title: Does not do what it says!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: antuan robinson
content: It's an great upgraded to the original echo show. The design is definitely a nice upgrade ...the bigger screen definitely a plus. My one gripe is ,  performance , although it seems slightly better not enough considering the huge upgrade in design. It works well and as expected( as most Amazon echo devices)and as with all the Amazon echo devices there's so much untapped potential and I say that because there's such a high learning curve for making things happen with Alexa / echo that is hard for the average person to use alot of smart home functions... My only other real gripe and despite the speaker sounding great its still positioned in the back... Oh well I guess that's the trade-off for that great screen.
title: Loving!!! the new design but...

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Pamh
content: I was excited to receive this product and it would not go into the set up screen.  Went through all the troubleshooting and had to be sent another one which worked fine.  I do like it and it works well with my wireless devices - Stove, Vent hood kitchen lights, cabinet lights, living room lights, porch lights, iRobot vacuum and thermostat. I like the features of asking Alexa things an most of the time getting the answers and videos I need in the kitchen and other things.  I do not like that I can't type in and search the web unless I trick her into going to a page and then redirecting it.  I wish there was a way to video call my kids that have Google Duo and Google Home.  I also would like to listen to music while reading a recipe online which it will not do.  I am sure there are ways to "trick it" to do this but I shouldn't have to go through all that.  Overall I am happy with it.  The video is extremely clear and speaker is louder and clear.  There should be a short cut manual of commands that come with it to get you started LOL.  Overall I am very pleased with it and would purchase again
title: First one did not work but was sent another one and it worked fine

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Gracebay
content: While this is not my first Amazon Echo product, it is my first Echo Show.  I just set it up in a few minutes in my kitchen.  Now I can use it to provide recipes while I cook, listen to music ( also displays lyrics so I may be singing more!), make phone calls, watch my favorite Amazon Prime Shows, check the weather and news, and so much more!  It is a beautiful screen and the sound is great.  I am so excited to have this in my home.  It also arrived earlier than expected. Because it is so light weight, I could bring it anywhere in my house but I think I may buy another one.  Great job Amazon!  You made my Christmas!
title: AMAZING!  Beautiful Screen, Vibrant Sound - Perfect Gift!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Richard
content: Music sounds really great. Have a few things connected to Alexa such as, lights in different rooms, home thermostat and a ring doorbell. Everything works great with Alexa with one personal drawback with the ring door bell and that is you have to tell Alexa Show to "show front door" in order to view the video, otherwise it only announces there is motion or your door bell is pushed. I wish it would automatically show video in order to give you a faster response. I have a bulb in a tall floor lamp beside my chair that works with Alexa. The light is a little out of reach for me and all I have to do is tell Alexa to turn the light on and can be dimmed too, works great. My Alexa is several feet away from where I sit and I have to raise my voice in order for her to hear me if I have the TV on. With a few minor drawbacks Alexa is a great convenience.
title: Sound quality

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: A. Beasom
content: These devices are great.  I own two of them.  The display is sharp looking and the sound quality is fantastic.  As a digital picture frame they are terrible.  The problem even occurs on the gen 1 Echo show.  I am talking about the background picture display and NOT the slideshow mode that is also possible on these devices. For the background, I choose a folder of pictures from Prime Photos.  It cycles the photos every 90 seconds or so while showing the overlays I have selected (weather, drops ins, sports scores) and also transitions between the Amazon trending topics.  At least once a week, it will get stuck on a picture and never change it unless I power cycle.  Also, when it gets to the last photo in the album, it will usually just go back and show the last 10 pictures again, rather than start back over at the beginning. I have contacted Amazon product support about this and they ignored me.  I am not a software engineer, so perhaps programming for pictures is a very difficult thing.  It is possible though, as I've seen other devices do it.  I would also like to see some options for the background pictures, such as picture duration/speed and a shuffle option.  This request to Amazon has fallen on deaf ears too.  Maybe they just don't care. I have tried about everything I can to fix this/trick it to work and have not had luck.  Others I know have the same issues with background pictures.  I would use the slideshow mode, but it doesn't display any overlays or additional information.  If Amazon would fix this I would give it a higher score. UPDATE:  The show devices keep getting worse for using as picture displays.  I have an album I use as the background (not the slideshow feature).  It changes between a photo in the album and the Amazon trending content.  Every 3 cycles the picture changes to the next one in the album.  It has got progressively worse.  It used to get stuck on a picture forever, unless I reset it.  Then it would get to the end of the album and instead of starting over, jump back about 10 pictures or so and loop them.  Now, it skips pictures in the album randomly and gets stuck in a loop randomly in the album.  This keeps getting worse.  This should not be that hard to program.
title: Great device, but background pictures continue to loop and not cycle correctly

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Trevor_Amazon
content: UPDATE: just don‚Äôt buy this garbage. It has become terribly slow even after resetting, and is nothing more than a good speaker. You could just buy a really good speaker for less money than this paper weight. When I first saw this product announced I was super excited.  After spending far too much money on it, I'm left sad.  As the title alludes to, the hardware is there.  The hardware of this thing is amazing, the sound quality is great, the screen is great.  But the software is terrible.  Alexa herself certainly needs some upgrades, but the actual OS of this machine is terrible.  It is not intuitive to get to anything, including the browser.  It also has about no app support so no Netflix like I was hoping, and youtube is usable at least through the browser, but definitely not great.  I have hope for the echo show 2 though after maybe another year of software improvements.
title: DON‚ÄôT BUY: Nice Body, Bad Personality

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Ace Ducey
content: This product has become more of a disappointment when comparing to the google nest hub products. More specifically, in terms of accurate voice recognition and understanding of commands, this device falls short. Its loading times are also very slow, including respond to touch. After selecting a video on the screen, it takes several seconds for the video to load in any capacity. The limited music selection has also become apparent. Inconsistencies in playing music after issuing the same commands is frustrating. This product is better than nothing, but I eagerly await to replace it with the google nest hub max.
title: Slow and doesn‚Äôt understand you well

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Eric Moore
content: Very poor as compared to the original. I thought that I would be patient and see if maybe it improves after I interacted with it a bit but it has gone from bad to worse. I have several Alexa enabled devices that function just fine including an Original Echo Show, (2) Echo show 5s, an Echo Dot, and 2 Fire Sticks but the 2nd Generation Echo Show does not live up to the hype. It often does not recognize my wake word ‚ÄúAlexa‚Äù or has an incredible lag of 30+ seconds before it recognizes it. If I‚Äôm streaming a video and I give an auditory command such as ‚ÄúAlexa Pause‚Äù,  the blue light often comes on acknowledging that the device heard the wake word but refuses to comply to the directive. I most often have to interact with it using the touch screen which is not its primary design. Very disappointed.
title: Not worth it!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Jimmy J.
content: I previously had two echo plus (2nd gen) paired with the subwoofer downstairs in my house.  I Moved one of the echo plus upstairs and then tried to pair the echo show with the sub and the other echo plus.  Found out that only similar devices will pair with the sub.  So you need two echo plus or two echo plus shows to pair with the sub, you can not mix and match which to me seems a bit ridiculous.  If the alexa "plus" devices can communicate with each other and broadcast to each other why would they not be able to mix and "sync" with the sub. Updating my review to add the fact that so far the echo show (2nd gen) will not detect the temperature in a room as does the echo plus.  Amazon seems to have dropped the ball on the echo show overall.
title: Will not pair with Echo plus in stereo configuration

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Gale
content: Having two of these products, I really would have liked to be able to communicate from one Echo Show to another or another Alexa device.  Example if I have one upstairs and another one somewhere in the house having the ability to talk, send notifications, see the other person to whom I am trying to communicate with would be wonderful.  An alert that some one is trying to contact you, with the ability to reject or accept the contact would be beneficial.  If not excepted within 30 seconds the call is dropped and a message could be left on the screens of the other devices.  But overall I have enjoyed the devices.  I also have google devices to compare to and have found the Alexa devices much more "intelligent in nature"  giving great responses.
title: Missing a usefull feature

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Dark Wolf
content: I contacted Amazon Technical support. They stated the "Network port on the back of Echo Show is meant for specialized Enterprise experiences. We currently do not offer support for consumer use of the Network port." I asked for documentation on the "specialized Enterprise experiences" and was informed "that information is not available on Amazon website. It is internal information. We do not have access to further details regarding this port." This is sad considering many media sources and reviews touted the port as a feature. I primarily use this device for video conferencing. Every 10 minutes or so, there is a slow down on the connection. The device doesn't have any troubleshoot options to see where the issue is location. Other than that, it works great.
title: Good, but not as advertised

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Dr. Jim Bordwine
content: When I first bought this device, it worked flawlessly. Over the last few months, however, the device has been filled with problems. Voice recognition doesn't work one third of the time. When something is playing through the device, it simply stops for no obvious reason. And trying to integrate this thing with the Amazon sub has been an absolute nightmare. It is a device that should never have been rolled out as companion for other echo products. I'm at the point where I'm ready to scrap this device and several other echo devices in my home and go with a different manufacturer. My problems reflect increasing issues with customer support and the updates that are provided for this device. Instead of improving features, these updates are rendering the device almost unusable.
title: A maddening experience

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Mandyf1231
content: My husband bought this for me as a gift. The sound is wonderful and I'm impressed by the quality of the screen. I like being able to play music, check the weather, hear the news without touching the device. However, some of the limitations have surprised/disappointed me. I was bummed to discover that there isn't a skill for Netflix and that video streaming services like Hulu and Prime don't have their full capacity. It's difficult to navigate Hulu to find all of the movies and TV shows I like. More importantly, I am shocked it's not easier to use the Show for storing and accessing recipes. It seems obvious that this device be used to view recipes while cooking without touching it and getting it dirty. AllRecipes appears to be the only skill for recipes, but I get very few if any of my recipes there. As an experienced cook, I have a ton of favorite recipes I'd like to pull up on this device, but instead, all I can get are a bunch of "suggestions" that are not my tried-and-true choices. Even if I request a very specific recipes by title or publisher, my requests don't pull up. I've seen that customers have commented about this issue for a very long time now with no response from the company, which suggests that perhaps Amazon isn't doing a great job of improving their product to suite their customer's needs. All in all, I'm excited to have this product, but I hope Amazon makes some improvements soon!
title: Surprised by Limitations

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Gemini LMW
content: This was really an impulse buy but I'm actually not sorry that I bought this thing-a-ma-bob.  Yeah, you can tell how techy I am, but still, this is a nice addition to the kitchen.  I am still waiting for it to inspire me to follow a complete recipe from start to finish, but it is promising.  I would buy it again for the entertainment aspect it offers.  It sounds rich and full, and screen display colors are clear and vibrant.  Surprisingly, though, my Echo Spot gave me a more detailed response and display on an anatomy question than the Show, but still, I am good with it all in all.
title: Pleased with Purchase

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Jamie Stewart
content: I bought my echo show used on eBay.  My comment is just that I have no way of changing when the screen times out.  I went to settings under display options using the echo show itself and using the alexa app on my phone.  I went to settings on device options using the device and the app and there were no options to change how long before the screen times out.  What I loved most about the first echo show- which I bought from perpay for more than it sells on Amazon- were/are the daily routine abilities and the constant flow of news updates going across the screen.  I also put my favorite artists as the background image.  I wouldn't have even gotten the second echo show except the first one kept making a popping noise.  Why are they letting these things happen?
title: The screen time out issue

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: maximus31ad
content: This is actually quite larger compared to the pictures and it can take up some real estate depending on where you will put it. It also has some weight on it. Other than that though, I think this is the best echo yet. Screen quality is very good, alexa responds quick and the sound is absolutely amazing. It also has a mic mute button but it does not have a camera shutter so you would probably want to put a shutter on it if you are paranoid like me. As far as integration with smart home devices, its even better. It supports all the other stuff I have previously and  If you have blink, you can now view your bllink cameras on the screen. You can even make calls and camera quality is actually quite good. Overall, echo show 2 is a very cool and impressive device!
title: Very Impressive!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: rc
content: No matter which duration I select, the photos display for one minute. There is no randomization for displaying photos. It might be random where it starts from but then it stays in that folder showing each photo before going to next folder. In between photos it shows promotional messages which is annoying. Plus it shows messages over your photos. I purchased this primarily to provide a slideshow of photos when not using Alexa and am very disappointed.
title: Horrible slideshow capabilities!!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Kelsey A. Maynard
content: I had to come write a review just because I almost didn‚Äôt get this due to the complaint of too many ads. Yes it does flash recommendations across the lower part of the screen, they don‚Äôt bother me one bit, and I actually find them helpful or interesting at times. Plus it‚Äôs like having a mini tv in my kitchen now which is great for watching shows while I‚Äôm doing the dishes, listening to music while I clean or getting recipes to follow when I‚Äôm cooking (no more printed recipes). Overall I love this product, now I just need to talk other people into getting them so we can video call each other! Oh and probably the most used feature, for me at least, is ‚ÄúAlexa, where‚Äôs my phone?‚Äù Lol
title: Great device, I absolutely love these things!!!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Peter
content: This new Echo Show was so easy to setup.  I wasnt sure about the split keyboard layout at first, but it is actually really comfortable to use when needed.  I do wish the browser would load a bit faster, both Firefox & Silk a bit slow to open and load a web page.
title: Easiest of Echo Devices

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Thomassee
content: Two main problems: Alexa often behaves like Hal 9000. Getting it to play Tune In Live,  the Cardinals was an exercise in frustration. The second is, if you have DSL which is all that is available to me, any video is slow and jerky. Apparently Amazon didn't support Net Neutrality. Downloading the update for the new device took all night. Alexa is no longer available on my Chromebook, so I still haven't been able to hook up my sub woofer. (It is available on my phone, but one of the required steps isn't available even when I carefully follow the instructions.) And, I refuse to deal with Amazon's techs. I've been through that scam where you spend all day on the phone doing all the work and then some change in programming brings you back to square one. Good luck, Amazon, you keep stealing function. When the last one I still enjoy (read, put up with) disappears, you and I are done.
title: 2 Main Things

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: C. Smith
content: Free light bulb, doesn't work. Oh well, it was free after all. Logitech Hub & Harmony Elite remove have worked perfectly since we set them up 2 years ago. The instructions on the Alexa app say to down load the Harmony app, sync it to  the hub, then add to Alexa app. That's it. I download the Harmony app, it works with all the devices we have attached perfectly, I sync it to the Alexa app, no errors, Alexa doesn't recognize any of the Activities that are in the Harmony App, not a single one. I don't know where to begin to trouble shoot this mess and I can't find anyone to call to help. So far the only things connected to Alexa are 1 plug and 1 light bulb. Also, if I had know I'd have to download an app for everything and connect the apps I would have re-thought the whole thing. What happens if I leave the house with my phone and mu husband wants to turn a light off? Is Alexa taking his command, using my phone data plan to  send it to the Alexa app on my phone, have Alexa on my phone connect to the app that actually controls the light and sending the proper response back to Alexa in my house to turn off the light?? do I have to load all the apps I loaded on my phone on his phone too?? And again, where do I go to get answers to my questions? The help is helpless, the search engine doesn't understand complicated questions and there's no on to call.
title: Lack of setup help is a hinderance

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Linda M.
content: My son had one and then I decided I wanted one too.  You do have to be clear in your speech to Alexa, I have it in my bedroom and what I really really like most about this product is all of the music, the sleep sounds that I use every single night and tell Alexa to turn off in one hour, I like it when I wake up in the middle of the night and ask Alexa what time it is I don't have to fumble around with a clock turning it on to figure out what time it is, I like that the display turns off for a darkness when you go to sleep, I just really really like this product, I have a "dot" downstairs in my work area where I will ask questions ALMOST FORGOT I love how you can tell it to turn on and off lights, this helps me a lot.  I am elderly and this product in my opinion makes my life easier and safer.
title: Great Product

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Solo
content: When you have a screen, it makes sense to do what is most intuitive - touch it. While there are a few major skills that are built in and seem to make use of the bare minimum (pause/back/forward with spotify is one example), why not extend the Echo ecosystem so that 3rd parties can put some basic apps into here if we add their skills? Spotify should allow us to select playlists, radio, or artists from the echo touchscreen. We should be able to use a basic web browser to find recipe's online instead of the terrible "all-recipes" app and search functionality. We should be able to cast from our phone, or at least do something like "pushbullet" does, where we send a link to the show, and it loads it in the Show (I'm thinking for random web recipes, or youtube links, etc... Without these basics, I don't see the appeal to the show right now - these are really bare minimum to me to make it useful. The Google Home Hub does a lot of this already as well from my experience with it. The sound is quite decent, the form factor is good, the screen is nice, it's still an echo and has alexa. It's just not quite there yet, and I hope it improves.
title: It's ok, It's good mostly, but it should do more, and it drives me crazy

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Nr
content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. Barely functional, no Netflix, no Hulu, no YouTube, Amazon Video is stripped down and barely works. It was a real expensive disappointment. A pricey heavy clock. Update: a rep from amazon called. They told me there is Hulu and YouTube how we I wouldn‚Äôt know as the attached video is what happens when I go to give it some pretty simple commands. My fire tv cube, and echo dots are great. This is not.
title: Nope.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: gavin
content: ive had my Echo Show 10 and Show 8 now for about 4 months and i love to listen to music on it and otherthings but it leaves MUCH to be desired on the voice recognition side. i have to yell at them for them to respond when their playing music loud they can barely hear and they are SLOW  very very slow at times. specialy when watching youtube or videos it acts like a slide show at times and takes forever to load. Now i also have an Echo Dot 3rd gen and Echo 1st gen they can hear much better over music and my echo 3rd gen can even hear me talking low from across the room i do not have to yell at it. The main difference between the screenless echos and Echo Shows is the CPU that is used. the regular Echos use ARM cortex Proccesors which are the main player in tablets, most android devices general and Even Raspberry PIs. Even Amazon Fire tablets use ARM CPUs hmmm i wonder why. BUT The Echo Shows use Intels ATOM proccesors which i am almost 100% certain is why The Echo Shows are so slow at times. Intels Atom line is extremely inferior to ARM and Snapdragon when it comes to running tablets and small devices they are slow and do not sport nearly as many cores theirfor the RAW power that is needed to run a Tablet smoothly or an Echo Show HUB is non existent. I now ask amazon WHY did you use ARM CPUs inside regular Echos as well as your Fire Tablets YET you used Inferior ATOM CPUs for your Most expensive Echos with screens that need that Raw power ARM can provide. ARM CPUs are cheaper as well so i do no understand why you would undercut your loyal customers. Intel ATOM CPUs barely even work inside Netbooks with Linux or android tablets i wouldnt even Expect them to do Remotely well in voice recognition/AI based Smart home Device that is basicly Multifunctional Stationary Tablet
title: Inferior CPU to Screenless Echos

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Bridgette Leising
content: The absolute visceral emotions of hate i feel for this machine is unlike anything else i have ever experienced in my entire life. This glorified bluetooth speaker never seems to want to connect via bluetooth and in trying to connect she just starts spewing out dumb trash about something completely irrelevant every time I try to connect my phone.  If it wasn't for my wife wanting to keep it around to ask it what the temperature is outside I would have thrown this useless brick into the trash immediately.  I despise this thing with every ounce of my being.  Not only that but the stupid thing is just sitting around listening to my every word and reporting it back to Jeff.  I was talking about clothes hangers to my wife in the nursery and boom clothes hanger adds online.  Jeff, you come in second place in my hate rankings.  Stop listening to me and my family you terrible demon man. Anyway, don't buy this.  All it does is not work how you want it to and invade privacy.  It's amazing people like this thing, absolutely beyond my comprehension levels literally all I ask of it is to be a bluetooth speaker and it can't even do that.  alexa I hate you so much.
title: Horrible garbage machine

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Karen Ricard
content: I‚Äôm very disappointed with this product since I first purchased the show gen1 this summer ..  my bf n I purchased each one so we cud video chat ... my first one after the abt 3 weeks the speakers started to make popping sound... returned it and they sent me a 2nd gen... after a few weeks of that one the screen started to flicker ... returned that one too.. in the meantime my bf‚Äôs started doing the same thing ... for the price I wud expected better now I have kept 1 gen 1 and 1 gen 2 and I live with the intermitant flickering.. and also because i live in Canada some of the feature like the web are not available (big hype they use to sell them) so I created a US account and had them change it at amazon... that seems to work
title: Not worth the money if ur purchasing it for video calls

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Colin P. Fraizer
content: I like the Echo Show. It's in my kitchen and I use it a lot. (I also have Echo or Echo Dot devices in my living room, bedroom, home office, and the kids' bedrooms.) A couple improvements that would have made this a 5-star review: - It does not support the same set of apps available on the FireTV and FireTV Stick (which I have on my TVs). Notably, it apparently does not support the Netflix app. I don't understand why. - It lacks some nice features that FireTV and FireTV Stick support. For example, I subscribe to YouTube Premium (formerly YouTube Red) and like to skip ads and share video history between my devices. Signing in to Google (YouTube app) on a FireTV is EASY-PEASY. You visit a link on your phone or computer and it gives you a short code that you enter on the FireTV. [If you use a password manager or use long/complex passwords, it's a real pain to get them and type them on a non-keyboard device like FireTV. It's a similar pain on the Echo Show touchscreen.] - If I "drop in" to the Echo Show from the Alexa app on my iPhone, it does not do video chat, though it seems like it should. [I actually tried it with the Alexa app on several camera-equipped and reasonably-recent iOS devices.] More nice-to-have features: - Allow Echo/FireTV devices to belong to multiple, overlapping groups. I want a groups like "whole house", "upstairs", and "downstairs" where the latter two are subsets of the first. - Allow the announcement "Alexa, tell everyone‚Ä¶" feature to be directed to groups or individual devices, so I can say, "Alexa, tell group 'upstairs' to come to dinner." - Allow Audible book playback across multiple Echo/FireTV devices just like music playback (so multiple devices act as if they were speakers attached to a single stereo receiver/CD player).
title: Doesn't support some apps from FireTV

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: pinoyki
content: Amazon get rid of tips or things to try  texts on homescreen!!!!
title: Annoying tips and things to try on homescreen

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: ALS
content: Take the cheapest Smart Television you can find on Amazon. Remove the ability to use Netflix and most other relevant streaming content. Make navigation very awkward and really really slow. Make the Alexa digital assistant just slightly less smart than she is on any of the other Echo devices. Reduce the quality of the image and the sound. And cut the screen size about 50% from the smallest Smart TV you can buy these days. If you're still happy, buy another Echo Show. I have no idea why people are buying this thing. I purchased a 49 inch Samsung Smart TV for only slightly more than the cost of this expensive paperweight. Not saying a 49 inch TV is comparable, by the way, so please don't try to online shame me for my opinion.  I have 5 echo devices which I love. This is simply not worth the money for what it does. A moderately good Android tablet would be better.
title: Why on earth would you buy this? I wish I could return it.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: MJ
content: I got the Echo Show specifically to be able to see my Ring Camera feeds. For this it works great. I did have some challenge since I have a number of Amazon Echos about, so sometimes one of the other Echos would intercept the command rather than the Echo Show. My biggest challenge was the Alexa App on my PC intercepting. I unistalled the app on my Windows PC, and now the Echo Show picks up the commands fine. So far I am liking the Echo Show. It was a good addition to my Smart Home experience.
title: So far so good

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Cac
content: This Echo Show has terrific sound and picture quality.  The speaker is great!  With the clarity of the picture one may easily watch videos.  We are also looking forward to using this to "drop in on" family who we do not get to see as often as we would like.  The first Echo Show that arrived with my order was defective and had absolutely NO sound.  Tech support was very helpful and tried everything to help fix my device.  When it was determined that it would not work, they ordered a replacement which arrived within a few days and it was just perfect.  The technician even called me at a prearranged time to make sure that my Echo Show replacement was working properly.  That is how a company keeps customers happy and coming back.
title: Terrific Sound and Picture Quality

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Natalie Kriese
content: Where do I begin Pros: - My thermostat, door bell, light bulbs and outlets are compatible with the Amazon show - Good size screen - Great for recipes - News articles are an okay bonus Cons - You can't search the internet - video quality for video chats are not good - you can only watch tv on PRIME and all the good shows COST ADDITIONAL MONEY - this is the big reason I am only giving this a 2 star review and consider that lucky -Netflix and Hulu are NOT compatible - You cannot search the internet - you can play music from Pandora but you CANNOT click on the channel you want Summary, Spend a bit more and Buy an old IPad or anything similar.  you'll have access to a LOT more things!
title: Bought for the kitchen

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Louis B
content: I purchased this after buying my first Alexa device (Echo Dot) for my grandchild's bedroom.  I got a great deal on it during Black Friday and thought what the hay.  It has been great.  I use it to look up recipes, video call the kids, and listen to music.  (Which sounds amazing)  I have since branched out and added smart plugs and switches.  It has been a learning experience for me but I enjoying the product very much.  Only two complaints that I have is.. 1) I wish it would come with some sort of internal battery.  Doesn't have to be much, just enough to move it from room to room without having to reboot.  If I receive a video call and do not want to be standing in the kitchen but maybe sitting in my chair, I have to disconnect, unplug and relocate.  Also it would be nice to have the stand included with the unit instead of an additional purchase.
title: I Love this thing

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Dennis Plaza
content: I have an Alexa Echo, several Dots, and even  a Tap.  All are very capable and enjoyable AI communication products., but music is our most go to feature.  I never thought I needed an Echo with a video screen, until I added Echo Show.  It‚Äôs located in the kitchen, the epicenter of our household.  The visual displays are eye catching and engaging.  We see the daily weather, temperatures, suggested recipes w/how to videos, and news, all at a glance.  It‚Äôs changing colorful screen shots add beauty and a sense of motion to our kitchen.  The Echo Show has a quiet presence and is ready to respond to any requests.  The Show plays music ‚ÄúEverywhere‚Äù and fills our home with music.  It even displays the words to the music as we listen,  just in case we decide to sing along while enjoying those moments of solitude.  It is so much more then I expected.
title: So many features.  Engaging!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: LuisR
content: I recently traded my Alexa Echo (first version) and purchased an new Alexa Echo Show. I am very happy with this upgrade. Not only the hardware is very well done, but the software is very intelligent.  I noticed that while first installation the system was smart enough to find all information provided during previous installations of Echo devices that the system was able complete the installation of the Echo Show without requiring any additional info from me.  The system auto completed the Wi-Fi connection and to other components, including the Ring Door Camera and integrated  all functions needed to complete installation, in less than 5 minutes.  The Music sounds great and the picture quality is outstanding.  Alexa seems smarted than before.
title: Alexa Escho Show, I am super happy with this product.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: J. Krystowiak
content: If I could it would probably get a 4-¬Ω. Bought it primarily for displaying Ring video, because the Ring app, takes more time than it should to load and display. The eShow Ring skill takes somewhere between 7 to 8 seconds from when the Ring Doorbell is pressed. But everyday I seem to find something new. Works just like an eDot, but more interesting with video.. Love the recipe photos, step by step instructions voice controlled, also downloaded 2 recipe Skills one being the Food Network & All Recipes, so quite extensive. Spelling, now you also see the word. Shows any calculation, if you don‚Äôt get all the numbers after the decimal point. Weather shows current statistics, followed by forecast. News in some cases you see the person reading the news. Music playing shows the lyrics. Trending topics ‚Äî some are interesting. Down graded ratings because speakers face backward. Bass level better than an eDot, but not that much better, because of the direction. Works well with Hulu. Overall summary, everything is a little better and more interesting with video. Oops I should have worded that differently. The Echo Show doesn‚Äôt automatically show Ring video when the doorbell is pressed. You must say, Alexa who‚Äôs at the front door ‚Äî then it takes 7 to 8 seconds. I guess brevity doesn‚Äôt always work for me.
title: Overall summary, everything is a little better and more interesting with video.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Chase M
content: Screen size is great, and sound quality is much better than the older models but it‚Äôs not even close to sonos or bose. The microphone seems to be pretty bad. I can be standing right in front of it, and Alexa will answer me from my echo dot in a completely different room. Pretty annoying. The microphone is one of the major functionalities so I can‚Äôt rate this one much higher than 3*. Also I used the trade in to purchase, which was a racket. Turned in an older model for a specific price, and after Amazon received my old show (which was in great condition) they downgraded it to almost nothing with no explanation at all. Charged my card the difference. I wouldn‚Äôt have even traded it for what they offered me, would have been better off keeping it for another room. Not happy with Amazons customer service as of late. Downgrading to 2* for the poor buying experience.
title: Nice screen, pretty good sound, poor mic, poor service

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Oscar N. Amador
content: I got the Alexa device so that I could keep tabs on my dog at home. The camera does not utilize the full screen and instead shows a small rectangle where your face is, and a small square which shows you what the other person is seeing. The camera quality is low, and takes time to load even when being in a Gigabyte environment. That being said, it's underwhelming for the price tag. I'm intending on keeping it, but for a different purpose now in the kitchen area. I am looking for another device with a better camera than what the Show provides.
