It's very unfortunate that the actual software of the Alexa is so lack luster. A little investment in a decent programming team would be very beneficial.
title: Expect less

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: D
content: I loved this when it first came out! It was so much better than the first gen. But know, it doesn‚Äôt respond to the commands it used to. I have  a fire re-cast, I used to be able to watch ‚Äúlive‚Äù TV by saying ‚Äú show program guide‚Äù it would display what was currently on the air. Now it doesn‚Äôt do anything. If you unplug unit, and plug it back in ( to move from one room to the other) you cannot just plug it back into the wall, you have to disconnect the power cord from the back of the unit every time or there will be NO Sound!!!!!!!!! I was told by and Amazon tech person, that you have to do that! What? that needs to be fixed along with all the other small things. Like the response has slowed over time, commands that once worked, no longer do.
title: I LOVED it, at first then......

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: fillycheese
content: I have been so disappointed in the echo show. My unit has had so much issue responding to me calling Alexa, so bad that another echo device in another room responds with the echo show picking up the commands. It‚Äôs super bad when volume is over halfway that you have to walk directly within 2 feet of unit to shut it off by voice commands. I tried replacing my unit and all amazon wants to do is spend time on the phone to trouble shoot. My unit is also suffering from the sound glitch. What happens is no sound will come out of the unit. The only fix is to unplug the power from the unit for at least five seconds  and FYI unplugging from the wall does not work only from the unit (see forums for discussion on this glitch)
title: Very disappointing, poor voice recognition and glitches

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Yamiraq
content: I purchased this for my 75yr old mother who has no clue how to use any modern technology, but this makes it so easy. I was able to set it up with both English and Spanish controls so she can control Alexa when I am not around. The Drop In feature is perfect. My siblings and I can see her everyday and talk with her which makes her feel more included in our lives. By setting up the Amazon Photos as her wallpaper and sending out the link to family she is also able to get all the latest pictures of all her grandkids and great grandchildren. Plus, now she can just ask Alexa to play her favorite songs which seems to be her favorite feature. This really is one of the best home devices out there. It makes keeping an eye on an aging parent easier.
title: Great for senior citizens

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: L. Holzwarth
content: We absolutely love the Echo, particularly during these difficult times keeping in touch with family who are going thru very difficult times.  The Alexa devices are not without their issues when you have several different models in your home and can't figure out how to get them to work all together.  The Echo has beautiful screen quality, great audio so other than the difficulties getting the devices to become one happy family, we're pleased.
title: Love the Alexa Echo Show-not without problems with other devices

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Kels
content: Very pleased with the quality of video calls, it definitely beats Skype and zoom. However I am incredibly disappointed that my galaxy buds are not compatible with video calling. Meaning I can use them to listen to music but they disconnect during video. Alexa is also incredibly laggy if you try to command during a video call. This and the simple lack of Netflix bring it down quite a bit as far as it being a fun item, it does work well as a smart home hub and I do love the visual aspect. If it weren't for my mother loving hers I would have returned it for lack of functionality imo. If you don't need/want privacy during your video calls then this shouldnt bother you at all.
title: Good, but could be better

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: CarlosC
content: The Echo is handy to have around. Allows you to multitask by being able to look things up, listen to and change music, get the weather, etc., while you're busy doing something else. She is able to hear quite well from a reasonable distance, even when playing music and is hooked up to our Ring doorbell, letting us (and the kids) check who is at the door - with audio and video - without getting up. You must be aware that when asking Alexa questions, you have to phrase it just right or she may not understand, although I am impressed with the amount of commands/questions she can respond to. One thing I have not figured out is how to eliminate her bias for the Seattle Seahawks, which is her answer to, "What is the greatest Football Team of all time?".
title: Handy gadget

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Colos
content: Not at all what I expected. Not as user Friendly as I thought. So disappointed.  üòüüòüüòü
title: Not user friendly.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Domenico Perriello
content: I HAVE REPEATEDLY  HAD AN ABSOLUTE HORRIFIC EXPERIENCE WITH ORDERING, THE SHIPPING, THE DELIVERY, AND RECEIVING OF ALL THE PARTS OF A COMPLETE SYSTEM THAT I HAVE ORDERED. AFTER NUMEROUS PHONE CALLS, EMAILS, AND OBSTACLES JUST TRYING TO REACH THE COMPANY, AS WELL AS THE NUMEROUS PROBLEMS WITH SPEAKING TO MANY CUSTOMER SERVICE REPRESENTATIVE AND SUPERVISORS, THEIR LACK OF ATTENTION AND RESPONSE TO MY CONCERNS AND REQUEST, THE OVERWHELMING DEFIANCE AND DENIAL OF MY REQUEST FOR RESOLUTION TO THE MULTIPLE PROBLEMS, MY NUMEROUS ATTEMPTS TO FIND RESOLUTION; THE FINAL ANSWER FROM THE COMPANY WAS FOR ME TO REDO PROCESSES I HAD ALREADY DONE AND TO PAY MORE FOR THE PRODUCTS THAT HAD ORDERED AND ALREADY PAID FOR. THIS AL RESULTED IN HAVING TO RETURN ALL THE ITEMS I HAD RECEIVED FOR REIMBURSEMENT OF THE ENTIRETY OF THE FUNDS I PAID FOR AN INCOMPLETE SYSTEM RECEIVED. THIS IS BY FAR THE WORST EXPERIENCE I HAVE HAD TO DATE, AS A CUSTOMER ORDERING ON-LINE. I WILL NEVER EVER DO BUSINESS THROUGH AMAZON AGAIN.
title: ABSOLUTELY THE WORST EXPERIENCE OF A LIFETIME.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Dennis Phelan
content: The Echo show works like any other Alexa product except it has a small monitor screen that can display information.  The display is nice in many applications.  HOWEVER, the technology is not quite there yet.  Specifically; I have a Ring Doorbell with video.  I can ask Alexa to show me the front door bell and it will show the view from the doorbell camera, and it will.  I can also (using alexa routines) when the doorbell detects movement, it announces "there is movement at the front door" and it does.  What I wanted to have happen is Alexa would announce that there is movement at the front door AND then show me the view of the front doorbell camera, which it can't do.  The system is getting close, but there is a ways to go.
title: Good product, but the technology is not quite there yet

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: A. London
content: It has excellent sound. Set-up takes a few minutes for it to download, configure, install etc. It found all my "Ring" devices and Honeywell thermostat. I have 4 WIFI channels and it chose the strongest one and connected without input from me. It also recognized all of my "Echo" devices. The alarm feature is set really low. You can adjust the volume in the "Equalizer" section under "Sounds". The video screen seems more vibrant than the original "Show". The screen dimming feature seems more intuitive than the original "Show". It has learned my speech pattern and it very rarely doesn't understand what I say even if I am talking in a very low voice and not directly in front of the "Show".
title: Is an improvement over the original "Show"

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Atort Photography
content: Honestly saved my life this little device monitoring my Mom during this nightmare covid journey that just won't quit!  This Alexa Echo Show is really amazing utilizing the Drop In feature for my Mom who is 86 with dementia....really helps keeps us connected during this covid mess!  It is not perfect, but very grateful for it.  The sound and picture quality could be improved on and seems to only do well with a really strong wifi to wifi connection, but still does work just not as well and clear as I would like.  Don't get me wrong I really highly recommend this especially to anyone with parents in facilities or nursing homes or having a hard time with technology.  They do not need to do anything you simply Drop In and it auto answers on their end.  I really hope the next generation is that much better and would easily spend $300 for a higher end model....just an amazing tool for the senior community and anyone like myself who is a caregiver!
title: Amazing Potential With Elderly/Dementia!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: BillH
content: I think the Echo Show was inaccurately described on Amazon's page.  It does everything that the page says.  What the page doesn't say is that the ES doesn't run a web browser (Chrome, Edge, etc.).  You can't run common programs like Thunderbird or Gmail email programs.  It doesn't stream from Netflix. What this really reminds me of is a smartphone in a larger box plus wireless bluetooth speakers.  If you want to control everything in your house with Zigbee devices do Skype-like video phone calls it will do that.  It has many links to content providers, many of which will charge you extra for their service. If this is what you want, the ES will probably satisfy you.  If you want more as mentioned above, you need a laptop or all-in-one computer, which, granted, is quite a bit more expensive. Not recommended except for its specific functions.
title: Limited usefulness;  won't surf web

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Teresa Delaney
content: Love it!  Really easy setup. I have one in my kitchen and the other in the dressing room for my handicapped daughter. I like the ease of being able to ask questions or get music if I am assisting my daughter. Installed a light with smart plug in my daughter‚Äôs bedroom. Pretty easy. Plan to install camera to monitor my daughter at night. I ordered a Moon City Brand and send it back. Do not recommend that particular brand. No support. Just bought  a D-Link-DCS Pan and Tilt. Hoping for better results. There are some questions that Alexa can‚Äôt answer so you have to make sure you are wording your requests carefully. But you get the hang of it. I am still experimenting and figuring it out. Lots of fun. I don‚Äôt think I would like one without a screen.  So glad I spend the extra money to get the Show.
title: Love the screen.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Erez Hazak
content: I'm overly disappointed in general from the Echo Show 2, we bought it since we were very happy with the original Echo, and the promise for a Skype integration (which we use a lot), pushed us over the edge. I'll start with the one  thing I think it's outstanding, sound quality. The original Echo had excellent sound quality, but the Echo Show 2 surpasses that easily. Now for the bad: Skype Integration: 1. I wish I would be able to see my Skype contact on the screen, Alexa has a hard time understanding names that are not common - I need to confirm the chosen contact every time I ask her to initiate a call. 2. My video feed keeps getting stuck, and I need to stop/start the camera in order to release it. 3. Call will disconnect, and Alexa will claim there's no internet connection, while it's connected to my home network, and all the others devices connected to the home network are operating without an issue. I have to stop/start the WiFi to get things working again. 4. When you're on a Skype call, or calling someone, or someone calling you - Alexa is essentially absent, she will not respond to any commands. Spotify Integration is clunky at best. The device will only show up in the main Amazon account holder Spotify. It will lose synchronization with the device that "cast" the music over, and will sometimes disappear altogether from the list of available devices (old Echos in my home don't have that issue). Only a full restart will fix the problem - why the hell isn't there an on/off button on this thing ??? Video streaming - no NETFLIX integration, really???? I can leave without YouTube, but I think most people have Netflix and not HULU, this doesn't seem to much of a big deal to fix... but it's been almost a year since this was launched, so I'm not keeping my hopes up. Prime Video - works only for the main Amazon account holder - why can't other accounts connected to my account, and also authorized to use Alexa can't watch Prime Video? Also, the UI is horrible, really hard to get to where you want, and if I try to use Alexa to do this: "Alexa, Play Bosch" it plays the first episode of the first season, while I'm actually watching the fourth season now. Smart home - same issue with the accounts. Smart home devices only show up on my account, what's the point of having a household in Amazon, if nothing works for the other members. This is more a vent than a review, but it's a lot of small things that make a device that has great potential to something really mediocre.
title: Very disappointing...

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Mhuss1
content: This product is one of the most awesome devices that one can own.  The Echo Show has so many features that make them fun to use.  Everyone should have many Echo devices in their home.  They have so many skills and are extremely easy to use.  We have had many Echo products since they were introduced in 2015 and use them everyday.  Whether it be for Notifications, Important dates to remember, Communicating with friends and family members, News, Weather, Sports or just listening to your favorite music, nothing beats the Echo products.  You can also use them to control all types of smart devices throughout your home.  I would strongly recommend everyone to consider purchasing many Echo Products as soon as they can.
title: Awesome New Echo Show

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Tyler
content: I have many echo devices as well as many Sonos smart speakers. The sound quality of the Echo show is ok, but not great. The biggest issue with them though is that they don't last. My Show just died after using it for less than 18 months. A device in this price range should last for many years. Amazon used to stand behind their products, I guess they don't anymore. Support offered to give me a 15% discount on the purchase of a replacement device. Why would I buy another one if they fail so quickly?
title: OK while it lasted

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Shaun Cassells
content: I have mutliple dots, and echos in the house.  I replaced the Echo in my kitchen with the Show.  The Echo has an omnidirectional speaker and can be clearly heard from anywhere in the large room.  The Show is a directional speaker and feels much more muddy and quiet.  Muddy appears to be due to an over engineered sub woofer piping (trying to increase resonance in a small space) which causes a muddy less accurate sound.  The screen is fine the touch is fine.  However the vast majority of uses I am used to via voice with Dots and Echo seem silly when you have a screen.  Perhaps I just don't know how to use the show appropriately.  Also the intergration with my nest cameras and door bell are very minimal.
title: Interesting hardware that doesn't really have a point

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Hamid Mukhtar
content: I primarily use echo show to replace my bedside clock. I like the large display but hate the fact that I can't change the clock face. Despite the large screen, it shows time in top left corner only. I want to be able to see the clock without putting on my glasses. I don't want to disturb others by asking Alexa what time it is. It is really silly that Amazon does not give me the ability to use the entire screen as a giant clock that may also display date, and possibly current weather.  It has the ability to display it by I can't customize it to make it occupy the entire screen
title: Please make it a better clock

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: SMO
content: I purchased this for the bigger screen and better sound. The screen is great but the sound is what is really outstanding, as I use it primarily for music. Crisp, good clarity and a decent amount of bass. I have a few bluetooth speakers from Bose to Klipsch and I actually prefer this Echo Show to any of them.
title: An improvement over Gen 1

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: JWilson
content: I ordered the Echo Show so that I could have face time with my grandkids, who already had an Echo Show. So far, the only thing I am upset about is that this went on sale right after I purchased mine at full price, wish I could get the sale price and the light bulb. While I am no stranger to a computer, I will admit new technology isn't always easy for me to do by myself and when I had to go and select the newest Amazon Alexa app - well that's where I got stumped, have you seen all those apps. I simply asked my son, he sent me the link and wa-la all done. I'm still learning all there is to use with this Echo and my husband and I are looking forward to enjoying talking face time to our kids and grandkids.
title: Pretty easy to use

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: E_The_Real_Dragon
content: I bought this to replace my original 1st generation Echo in my kitchen. Honestly I had no idea it was touchscreen until I turned it on the first time, as i couldnt find any info in the description. I was very happy that it is.  The main reason I wanted this was to use with the Wyze Cubes for a cheap security camera system and this works perfectly for that.  The sound quality is also amazing for its size and we love the easy accessibility to youtube and prime videos as well. My only complaints is that the youtube app is quite clunky and a but difficult to use, and theres no netflix on it yet. If they add netflix and fix the youtube app this would be 6 stars
title: Media Player, Security center, and Timer/Alarm in 1 small package

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Brian Baldridge
content: Very unhappy.  I currently own (3) 1st gen echo shows, (2) echo show spots and several other Alexa - responsive devices.  This 2nd gen show has the worst field of sound in terms of hearing my family‚Äôs commands.  We almost have to yell to get this device to appropriately respond.  This device replaced a 1st gen show, same location in our kitchen.  It‚Äôs 10x worse in terms of response.  About to unplug and return and go back to first gen.
title: Hearing and response to voice is worse than 1st gen, what happened Amazon???

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: RFC
content: I am very happy withal of  my Echos.  This one is no exception.  For folks new to Echo, the software is very good and the capabilities grow every day.  Software reliability is rare in a world what is charactized by competitive feature growth, but nearly everything works, and all of the core capabilities work.  Speech to text is super excellent - rare to find something that works so well.  I am continually surprised by new capabilities, e.g., sending a text message to my sister who also has an echo.  There are quite a few music subscriptions services out there, but I am totally happy with Amazon - I never fail to find that which II want to hear.  20M records is a LOT.  I have integrated my lights, Ring door bell, cameras, furnace and other household items.  I could not say this a few years ago, but everything works.  Easy to understand how a recent review had Echo atop the competition.
title: Does Everything that I Need

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Laura
content: I first thought this item was amazing. But I started using it less and less after I realized it only does a few things I require. At the moment its just a glorified alarm clock. It can only play Hulu and Prime Video that I use, and it has started to buffer and stop playing while I watch Hulu. I've been using it a lot more now that I'm working from home during quarantine, and it honestly has a lot of lag issues. I've tried getting it to play Spotify and it replies with, "Say, 'Play Spotify.'" When I do it just repeats the command instead of playing Spotify. Hulu has become a nightmare. It lags soooooo much while playing to the point where I just have to turn it off because I can't stand the lag every other sentence. I think for what I wanted this for I was better off just buying a small smart tv instead.
title: Not really worth it.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Dr. Gregory Johnson
content: The Echo Show can hear me but produces no sound when it responds. I have to restart the device several times to get it to work. It seems to lose sound on its own every few weeks. It's irritating. I also wish I could do two tasks things at the same time. For instance listen to music while browsing a recipe. Also, I want to be able to browse the regular internet on the Echo show. Finally, the slideshow function does not work well. It shows the same picture repeatedly and moves very slowly. I need it to be faster and more configurable. Overall, the Echo Show is okay, but nothing I would recommend at this time.
title: Sound does not work reliably

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: CulturalHistoryProf
content: Perhaps you would like to watch videos on this device. Amazon Prime, YouTube, Hulu? After a few minutes the screen times out and returns to the home screen. The device cannot resume where you left off. You must go through the entire video location procedure and start over. Quite disappointing. No way to change time out. Also times out for Amazon Prime Music screen and returns to home screen. If you touch the screen, it will return to the music screen, but will time out again. As others have pointed out, the home screen always has "Alexa try..." or "Alexa show me the best selling...( fill in random Amazon product here). No way to shut this off. Over all it is merely ok. Lots and lots of room for improvement. Mostly underdeveloped technological possibilities and therefore annoying.
title: Video screen times out! Other issues.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: HB
content: I bought this so that I could ‚Äúfacetime‚Äù with my home while away from the house.  It worked fine until Aug. 17 and then decided to be offline when ever I try to use it.  The window to return closed on the 16th.  Very disappointing.  Not it won‚Äôt keep timer or do anything.  Waste of money.  I tried to speak to Amazon about it and was told it was outside of the return window.  They told me to de-register it and it would be fine.  Not working still
title: Not happy

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Matthew S.
content: It was a waste of money, but I can't return since the window closed while we took our severely disabled son to Walt Disney World (they failed to accommodate him under the ADA), and now we are stuck with an expensive and useless product.  The Fire Stick is excellent though.  I plan to report to AG's office and my congressman so he knows that when we asked, "do you listen all the time," the thing replied that it only listens when you say the trigger word, BUT, we asked the question without saying "Alexa" first! So it does invade your privacy.  We unplugged it.  We do recommend the Fire Stick though!!
title: Not worth the money, iPhone does the same things...

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Chris Raine
content: Very disappointed in this device. Have the first generation Echo Show and I hate to say it works so much better. I can stand 6 feet away from the new Echo Show and speak to it, and the Echo in the living room 30 ft away (https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00X4WHP5E/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_search_asin_title?ie=UTF8&psc=1) hears me while the brand new flag ship sits idol. Wish I had saved my money. This thing is not ready for prime time. Update: Called in for support. Still under warranty.....and have to send it back so a tech can decide if it is broken and fixable. With the amount of $$$ I spend a year at Amazon, the least they could do is just replace it. Not happy Amazon makes a customer go through the hassle of sending it back and wait for a possible repair. So far this thing is a dud and not happy with the response from Amazon.
title: Mad I paid for this - don‚Äôt care for Amazon‚Äôs support

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: McCool
content: We got this to connect to our children's Echo Show so we could talk and see them and the granddaughter at the same time. Integrating a VOIP connection like Ooma, Skype, or What'sApp is practically impossible. I have been on the forums to see how to do this and immediately saw that others have the exact same problem. Asking Alexa how to do it is a joke. Alexa doesn't know 'jack' about how she works or can be configured. Going to the Alexa app is a total waste of time, there is no information there about the best way to integrate your Skype contacts into a Skype connection. I can't even really tell which phonebook Alexa is using (I have three contact lists) or how to switch from one to the other. One even wonders why on earth there is a screen on this device. It seems useless unless you need another clock or want to watch liberal-bent fake news stories continually scrolling past. Maybe if I were to use it to watch Amazon Prime it would be OK but I have an entertainment system in my family room and don't need another small tablet screen for anything. It really is just a bigger, more expensive version of Alexa with a screen. Nice speaker, I listen to IHeartRadio on it, but that's about it. Oddly, I would like to listen to Amazon Prime Music on it (I am a member) but it can't seem to make the connection. Very curious indeed. The purpose of this device was to make video calls and it can't do that, even though it is marketed to be able to do that.
title: Cannot connect to VOIP phone calls.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Astrid M
content: Simply do not understand how there are so many amazing reviews. Truly at a loss as literally nothing works with our device. Not the commands, not the lights, not Arlo baby, drop in to other devices. It's basically and overpriced speaker now. If we lived in the US would have returned this. Simply the biggest waste of money ever.
title: Nothing works, literally nothing works.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Gadget Dad
content: Just bought the new 2nd Gen Echo Show.  I bought the bundle that included Hue light bulbs as it‚Äôs advertised as being able to directly control the bulbs without need for the Hue Bridge/Hub.  But to do this you must enable the Hue skill by linking accounts.  So you go to setup a Hue account but that requires the Hue Bridge.  So you just try to link using the Alexa app....and are told it can‚Äôt find the Hue Bridge.  So a big fat waste of $50 for bulbs you can‚Äôt use as promised.  Rest of Show works as advertised but this is really misleading.
title: Misleading re: Direct Hue control

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Yoseph Feit
content: One of the settings allow you to change the trigger word. So you can call it Alissa, Amelia, Angelina or whatever if you want to.  Anyway... The screen is surprisingly sharp and the touchscreen features are useful and well integrated. We love using it for video phone calls to our numerous progeny. I have not figured out how to make it multilingual, but it understands my version of English well enough.  It can understand a lot of what I ask it to do, and when it doesn't, at least its amusing. Don't mix languages, or you will confuse the poor thing. The sound has a strong bass bias. Even when I used the equalizer (yes! it does have one) to minimized the bass and maximize the treble, I still have trouble understanding speech.
title: I just found out that I don't have to call it Alexa

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Bob Kennedy
content: I had the smaller version of Show but gave it away.  This one was on sale during Prime Days so I got it.  The sound is so much better, the screen is huge and the mic is very sensitive.  I actually have 2 different Echos in my kitchen area and they compete to answer me.  Only one answers but I can hear them both make the tone when I call Alexa.  I'm not likely to tie myself to the Show to watch movies, but it works for some.  I love the "What am I holding feature."  Only some of us need it, but it's a great plus for the Show line.
title: Bigger is better

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Britt
content: I'm pretty under impressed. I bought this to watch  instructional youtube videos and watch shows/movies in my kitchen while I'm cooking. Thought it would be easy especially with Alexa. However you have to go to Firefox and type in the youtube website then the video. Usually that wouldn't be a big deal to me but when I'm in the kitchen my hands are usually dirty or wet. When I saw it didn't allow Netflix, I wasn't sure but talked myself into it for the voice control and being able to stream HBO.  However, I can't watch HBO because I didn't purchase it through Amazon. I have cable and can access the app. If everything you have is Amazon, you will like this product but if you purchase entertainment from other companies like Netflix, Google, or HBO, you need to know this product does not support them.
title: Not an ideal kitchen tool

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Tony
content: "NOW CONNECTED TO IPHONE" "NOW PLAYING FROM IPHONE" "DISCONNECTED FROM IPHONE" This worthless paperweight makes me cringe every time I stream from my phone, I've read that their are fixes to the problem of Alexa announcing to the entire neighborhood that she's connected to you're phone but so far none of them have worked and I don't have time enough to enroll in a class at MIT to try and figure out how to stop the announcements despite already having turned off announcements, honestly you'd be better off getting a comparable iPad Alexa is more of an clunky annoyance then an actual benefit to your household.
title: It's 3am and you're........

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Margot
content: I've been using this echo for a few weeks now, and I love the screen and sound. However, it's buggy. It would start making scratchy noises for no reason, and all of a sudden it doesn't play any sound. I have to unplug, wait a few minutes, and then plug it back in to get it working again. It happens from time to time, and it IS annoying. Also, I often have a problem controlling music using the touchscreen.
title: It's great as long as it's working properly

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: mr1040
content: I bought the 2-unit set so I could send the second unit to my son and daughter-in-law so they and their children could video chat with me.  My unit was easy to set up, using the Alexa app on my smartphone.  We haven't been able to video chat yet (because the other party is unavailable) but the system is ready and Alexa always asks if I want to send a message and when I have recorded the message asks if I want to send it.  The messages have gone through flawlessly.  I use my unit at this point mainly for playing music and the sound is great.  I also use Alexa for making shopping lists and my Show (and Alexa) pick up all my additions  (even when I sort of mumble).  The unit looks very well made.  This was a great purchase.
title: I am just starting to get to know all the things my Echo Show (and Alexa) can do

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: czupet
content: The biggest disappointment is Echo Show has issues with Smart Connect which allows the router to select the best WiFi band which has the same SSID, it keeps disconnecting and the only way to reconnect is to turn off / on Echo Show. There is no option to select the band.  I have 19 devices on my network some connect at 2.4 GHz and some connect at 5 GHz and none have any issues, only Echo Show does. That's why 2 stars for Alexa integration - after all if you can't connect to the internet you can't integrate with anything. The speakers have too much base to a point that vibrate the device, far from premium sound.  The stand is an extra $30.00, it's plastic but it's needed.
title: It's OK

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: HNB4EVER
content: Cons no youtube on Alexa control no google as you have to find other ways around it. A bit annoyed that I can‚Äôt tell Alexa to pull up a YouTube video. Seems Alexa answered question when I first plugged in now seems she doesn‚Äôt know anything. Have asked her things I asked Her the first day and now says she doesn‚Äôt know. I think amazon screwed themself when they blocked google from using their things now we suffer more. I would have recommended but now I don‚Äôt, to many cons this was just a few cons I‚Äôve listed and not enough pros. The pros good video chat, good to pull recipes up will keep it on a good amount of time. Like how you can put her to sleep so tv doesn‚Äôt command her. Like the few workouts they have, wish they would add more apps though. The Smart device hookup is good and does have a lot to offer. The first day I had it was allowed to YouTube which was great then googled stop them and now super annoying how I have to open up browser and type no voice control  to watch YouTube instead of asking Alexa to pull up
title: Need to have YouTube and few others things

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Tammie Lazzaretti
content: Love this addition to my tech abilities in my home.  I do wish it had the ability to access other apps like Netflix and such.  Additionally, it's a bit off when I attempt to pull up programs from Amazon Video.  Doesn't get it right most the time when I use voice.  I usually have to find my program by using the touch screen.  Which the latter makes it more like I could set my tablet up and use it more conveniently.  But as time has gone by I'm getting better at speaking the language the Echo Show understands in order to voice my selections better but it still is frustrating more often than not.  The speaker/mic quality of this device is very good in my opinion.  Another feature that I find pretty good is the screen brightness ability where it senses the environment and adjusts accordingly. Pretty nice feature and it works well.
title: Great Sound and picture

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Janet L McDuff
content: I previously had Alexa Plus, Alexa Dots and Smart Plugs for controlling interior lights which I plan to add to.  I love this Amazon Echo which I keep on my nightstand.  If I want to get up during the night and go to the kitchen, change the thermostat, I do it right from my bed.  It gives me regular daily and weekly weather conditions, news updates on a rolling basis and at any time I can ask Alexa any question just as I do the other devices throughout my home.  It will also show me the words to Music I may ask Alexa to play; any genre.  Very enjoyable and I don't have to hold anything in my hand like my iPad.  Love it!
title: Alexa integrates with my Home Security to set and security, thermostat, lights, locks, garage, etc.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Trent Allen
content: Easy set up.  Works great.  good value for the money. and the uses.  The app takes a little to get use to, till you use it a couple of times.  I love this am able to talk to my 09 year old mother and grand kids  with Drop in feature.  Controls my over head projector and sound system, lights, and door bell.  Good quality, picture is good if not excellent.,  Sound is great.  Not a full stereo set up but,  you can group it with dots in the house for music or intercom  Has a lot of value for the money.  With the covid 19 travel restrictions, I am able to stay in touch with family and my mother face to face.  I would recommend this.
title: Works great.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Leondria Gray
content: I am upset because I bought this on Amazon Prime Day and it has absolutely no sound. If I have to troubleshoot on the first day, that's a problem. I looked at YouTube and read other reviews from people who had this same problem and I can't get it to work! Very disappointed but will be sending this product back!
title: Alexa can you hear me? Well, I can't hear you!!!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Taylor
content: The sound did not work right out of the box.  All other features work but there is no sound.  Spent over an hour with support, talked to 4 people and still could not get it resolved.
title: No sound

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: C. BLACK
content: The only noticeable Improvement what's the largest screen. I've noticed no improvement in voice recognition compared to the Echo gen 1, Echo spot and Echo Show. The different LED lights that indicate whether you have an alert , message, delivery or any of the other statuses have been removed. There is no visual indication that triggers you to check the device if you're not next to it anymore. If you happen to be next to the device and the notification appears it disappears within four seconds so you barely have any time to read it. When a reminder appears on the screen it's always shows the current time at that moment that you are looking at the screen. it's very confusing if you look at the screen after the time that a reminder first appears because the screen always shows the current time next to the reminder instead of the time reminder was due. You can't tell how many minutes have passed just a reminder became due. I definitely prefer the Generation 1. This product seems rushed and it's lacking many of the features of his predecessor and no real Improvement besides a larger screen
title: Lacking features that Generation 1 has

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Herodotus
content: The Echo Show (2nd generation) is extremely useful and full of features.  Besides all the things the other Echo devices are capable of doing the Show can process a verbal command and display on its large screen the video my Ring Floodlight Camera (and Ring Doorbell camera) is capturing.  Pretty cool.  My wife loves the visual displays of recipes and timers.  I am somewhat ambivalent about the incessant news and information prompts...some like them and some do not.  The sound is much better than the Echo but I have a whole house audio system so I don't listen to the Show for music very often.  Podcasts work great.  I am still learning about all the tasks the Show is capable of performing but so far it has been a huge plus.
title: This thing is great!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: MROD
content: I am a Prime member and get Amazon Music through my Prime account and don‚Äôt pay for Amazon Music Unlimited.  The music that I‚Äôm able to listen to is more restrictive in the Show than what I can listen to on my Dots. For example, I can ask Alexa over the Dot to play an individual song and she plays it.  When trying to play the same exact song over the Show, Alexa tells me I can‚Äôt play individual songs and need to upgrade to Unlimited.  Then, she starts to play a channel inspired by the song requested.  When I bought the Show it did play individual songs free that were part of Amazon Music.  I was never notified by Amazon of this change.  Very disappointed. I use the Show for music, weather, random questions, and some videos on Amazon and YouTube.  For music, facts, and weather, it works pretty well. For videos, the Show is clunky.  Using the touch screen to get around is also slow and clunky. If it wasn‚Äôt on sale during Prime Days, I wouldn‚Äôt have bought it.  I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs worth the price at this time.  I likely won‚Äôt buy another.
title: Music is Restricted Compared to Dot and Echo

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: meagan_ivory
content: We love our Echo Show! The picture and audio quality are really good. We were all impressed with the sound and how rich it is. Not Bose quality but kinda close. We listen to music all of time while we cook dinner and it‚Äôs fun that it shows the lyrics to songs. I love that I can load photos to play as a slideshow on it and that I can see and edit our shopping list on the screen. Love. Love.
title: Great picture and audio is really good too!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Randy Morrison
content: Haven‚Äôt explored everything about the Show yet but loving it already. The sound quality is just amazing compared to our old 1st gen echo. I‚Äôm loving the feature that allows ‚Äúdropping in‚Äù on other rooms of the house by using multiple echo devices. We will be getting a dot or spot for every room to create a cool whole house intercom system(though that‚Äôs less a review of the Show as it is of Echo devices in general.) Our Show is on the kitchen island so it will be handy for recipes as well!
title: Handy for multiple uses

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: George C. Dalton
content: The initial setup went well.  I moved it to a different location and the sound stopped working.  After fiddling around with it and googling known problems for an hour, I found out this is a known problem and Amazon sent it anyway without fixing it or at least letting me know so I wouldn't waste my time.
title: Big Problem with Sound not working - Dont buy until they fix this!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Laura Huber
content: This is the 2nd one I purchased of the 2nd generation echo show.  I purchased this one because the first one I bought stopped responding after 5 hrs.  This one did the same thing.  So, then I wanted to try and resolve the issue.  The support team didn‚Äôt have any answers since I had called them the first time.  So, I looked online for help.  One person said to turn on the Do Not Disturb under settings and this didn‚Äôt work.  Another person said to check the network.  So, the echo show was on an extended network (we have a repeater to get a better signal).  I took it off the extended network and put it on the main network and it works fine.  So, I still had the first one and did the same for that one and now it works fine.  Three days in and they are both responding every time.  Awesome! Also, I had purchased a google home hub and it doesn‚Äôt work well with an iPhone.  It‚Äôs more difficult to set up and sync then Alexa.  I do like the fact that the google home hun read recipes step by step and pauses until you‚Äôre ready to continue.  But, ALEXA my favorite.
title: Alexa finally works, don‚Äôt put it on an extended network

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: HCM-CUC
content: I don't want to write much review for this product.  Because last time, I wrote a review for other product, Amazon didn't post it and they refused to publish it after a few days.  My honest review had never got a chance to be posted.  Thus, why bother to write a lengthy review. Compared to the first one, this one has more bass sound and the screen is viewable.  7 inch screen size is considered small now.  The microphone picks up fast.  I have no problem calling Alexa.  The large screen makes it more pleasure to see the lyrics when playing song from Amazon music. The YouTube app is working with Amazon again.  Great.
title: Good picture and sound quality

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Scott C. Smith
content: Amazon really got it right with this second gen Echo Show. It does so many useful things for me. I use it to ask questions, activate Alexa compatible devices, play Spotify, etc. However, it also makes a great speaker phone since you can link a mobile phone number and have it make calls. Very useful since I work from home sometimes. It also has a browser (2 actually), so you can get to things like YouTube with a couple steps. It gets plenty loud if you want it to. Alexa is getting better at answering questions asked with natural language, but there are still times when I feel like I have to memorize a specific way to ask for certain functions. Bottom line, though, is that Alexa with a screen is a nice plus. I traded in a regular Echo to upgrade to this and I use it a lot more.
title: So many uses...

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: looney
content: I am really enjoying slowly adding smart devices to my home. I love the  versatility of this device. I purchased 2, and sent one to one of our children who is grown and moved out. It definitely makes for better communication with them. The only 2 design flaws I have are: first, it doesn‚Äôt have an internal battery. So if I want to move it from the living room to the kitchen, to follow a recipe, I have to unplug and set the whole device up there. 2nd, it dosent come with an integrated stand that you can control the tilt or swivel with. I had to order a separate stand, I. Order to adjust the angle so the camera could see everyone in the living room. Other than that, I love it
title: Needs internal battery for portability

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: La Jolla Library User
content: I was interested in the first generation of the Show, but since I have a functioning Echo (1st gen) and Dot (1st gen), I thought I would wait for this 2nd Generation Show.  I think it is absolutely wonderful.  My original plan was to put it in the kitchen but in the end I swapped out the Echo in my bedroom and put the Show in there.  I find that the dimming function makes the display on the Show so soothing that sleeping in the same room is no problem.  The sound is great.  I replaced the background with a picture of my own choosing and I find at least some of the rolling screen suggestions worth taking.  If I need it in the kitchen, I can always pick it up and move it there.  I bought it in the Amazon store in my local mall.
title: Waited for the 2nd Gen

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Rawest
content: It‚Äôs nice for simple functions like weather, play music and using smart home telling it to turn lights off and on etc. I bought four Wyze v2 cameras for my home. The cameras are great to view on my phone and tablet when I‚Äôm away from home but when I‚Äôm home in my bed I like to use the echo show view the cameras but on the echo show sucks when it comes to viewing Wyze cams it buffers every 3 to 5 seconds it‚Äôs REALLY ANNOYING. I have great internet and this problem only happens on the echo show v2 not on my phone or tablet. I did some research online and a lot of people seem to be having this same problem since 2019 I guess Amozon don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs that important to fix this kind of problem. Witch it sucks because that was the main reason I got it for in the first place.
title: Good not great!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: smetzger
content: I bought this to try to replace using a "paper calendar" so everyone in the family can see everyone's calendar in one place (kids aged 16, 12, 8) and it makes planning easier.  I linked it to my google calendar and am in the process of creating a "family link" family calendar.  The Show will display the calendar in line-by-line, but not a monthly view.  When I asked "show me my calendar", it works.  When I asked "show me this month's calendar", the reply is "Currently, this calendar query is not supported".  So take the answers to questions about being able to view your calendar with a grain of salt depending on what you're trying to do.  Also, I had hoped I could lock the home screen on a calendar view, but that's not an option either.  I REALLY hope the ability to see your calendar in a standard calendar view a month at a time is made available.  Outside of that, everything else about it is great - works like a standard Alexa device except with video.  Pretty awesome.  It just doesn't do what I primarily purchased it for (and was led to believe it could do by reading the answers out there to customer questions), so gotta go with 4 stars.
title: Very integrated, gorgeous display, but can't view monthly calendar or watch Netflix

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Thomas J Wargel
content: We have a Echo Show 1st generation in our AZ home and we ordered a Echo Show 2nd generation for our Chicago area home with high expectations as we have been very pleased with our AZ Echo Show product. The Amazon tech was very helpful but after a gallant long effort told me to return the defective unit. This is our first Amazon disappointment after countless weekly various product deliveries but we will not reorder the Echo Show product. Not too bad - Nobody bats a 1000...
title: Amazon‚Äôs First Strikeout

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Coco Nuts
content: I purchased this an upgrade for my first generation.  And like a darn fool, I traded in my first gen. That was one of the WORST mistakes I have ever made.  This 2nd gen Show does not have any sound! It hasn‚Äôt since a few minutes after I plugged it in.  Customer support was no help.  They finally agreed to send me another one, and that didn‚Äôt work!  There is apparently a glitch in the software, and I have to patiently wait for an update. I am really disappointed and disgusted with Amazon. I really regret this upgrade.  If you have the first gen Echo Show, keep it, this second gen is an expensive disappointment.
title: Still not working! Bought on Prime Day.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: kimberly carmichael
content: Wow, what an improvement in sound quality! The addition of a screen has brought so many more features. I love the way it works with audio/video door bells. It is a great safety feature to be able to see or talk to the person before opening the door to them. I am a blind person, and the security it gives me to be able to speak with somebody at my door is immeasurable. I also like that I can turn on speech output and navigate through all the screens with no problem. The only reason I gave voice recognition a 4 rating is that there are times my Echo Show doesn't appear to hear me. It isn't bad enough that I wouldn't purchase again, but there is room for improvement.
title: Very nice sound and the addition of a screen is a plus

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: K. Jones

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Anthony
content: Love this glad I bought it! GET THE STAND FOR IT !!! (Sold separately). It will protect your echo show and raise it up off the counter. Allow you to tilt up and down as well as all around 360. Its worth the extra money for the stand! I also bought 4 plugs that works with alexa too. Not amazon brand, (gosund brand)... Now I can say "alexa turn on living room light", without having to walk all the way over to the lamp! Also if you have an old school coffee pot without a timer, get one of those plugs! You can prepare the coffee the night before and when you get up in the morning you just tell alexa to turn coffee pot on! Those plugs are a must have with any echo device! Watch you tube videos for more reviews and Helpful tips. Also the alexa app has been easy to learn and navigate! Amazon music is my best friend! Also bought an extra echo dot for the bathroom so I can rock out in the shower! Overall I love these products!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Steven Neff
content: Love my Show.  Vibrant screen, nice sound quality and I have gone a little crazy adding switches and plugs to automate EVERYTHING. My only complaint with the Echo devices is Alexa integration. I have the Show in the kitchen and a DOT in the living room. When playing music it‚Äôs cool that I can create a group and play on both devices at the same time but that‚Äôs where the integration seeems to end. For example, we are in the kitchen and set a time. Then we go sit down in the living room. The timer goes off and we say, ‚ÄúAlexa, stop timer‚Äù however Alexa in the living room responds,‚ÄùThere are no timers set‚Äù which means we have to get up, get closer to kitchen Alexa and repeat the command. Kind of defeats the purpose of automation. I would like to have Alexa all over the house whereas no matter what command I give they can all respond.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: K Register
content: First of all, it's a gorgeous device! I received it as a present from my husband. Easily a 5 star device. So, why am I deducting 2 stars? There is a ridiculous, ugly, horrible nag line at the bottom of the screen that says "Try. 'Alexa, (whatever)'."For  example, it may be displaying a beautiful pic of a 15th century Puerto Rican fortress and splashed along the bottom is "Try, 'Alexa wake me up to 80s music'."  YOU CAN NOT TURN IT OFF on the 2nd gen. It was possible on earlier model or version but not now. Trust me, if you want to use the Show as a photo display, you will be disappointed. The ability to turn this off is one of the most requested features, yet Amazon is not listening! I am beyond disappointed... Google Home Hub is going in the bedroom not a Show.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: CMM
content: I've had the Echo Show now for a week and have to say its not a 5-star product.  The build quality and screen are very nice, but the software is lacking.  A simple example is the slide show of background photos.  It doesn't shuffle very well;  It consistently shows the same picture many times in a row and stays within the same folder.  Maybe that's a minor issue to most, but I use it as an example of what should be an important part of its capability.  I looked for how to fix this and found out its been an ongoing issue for many years and i couldn't even find a response from Amazon on how to fix the issue. The other frustration is with many of the skills not being very useful.  This may not be Amazon's fault directly, but if they would do some quality control of who is writing to their ecosystem, they would be much better off.
title: Just OK.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: D. R.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Dee
content: So I recently traded in my Gen-1 echo show. I was excited to try this 2nd-gen out. First when I got it, the seal was broken. I didn‚Äôt pay much attention to it bc everything inside looked new, albeit a little dusty, but nevertheless it was new. It‚Äôs a lot bigger than the Gen 1. Anyways here are my pros and cons: Pros: clear screen: the display is gorgeous, large (a little too big for my kitchen), good for following recipes, fantastic sound quality (Dolby), hella bass. I got this over the 8 for speaker quality; which it does not disappoint. Cons: idk if it‚Äôs the update but Alexa seems to lag a little. She‚Äôs not quite as responsive as she once was. It kinda slides around if you‚Äôve got the music up loud, I was thinking of getting a stand to elevate it a bit. (Speaker is on the back of the device, so it doesn‚Äôt project like the gen 1). Again, not sure if it‚Äôs the update but sometimes the music I‚Äôm listening to just stops (even though WiFi is fine). The camera doesn‚Äôt have a switch, if you wanna turn the camera off, it disables Alexa. So I‚Äôve had to put a little dot over the camera. I‚Äôm a little torn here, I had tried to see if I can get this one replaced bc I think either the updated software is messed up or I have a faulty device but due to the Shelter in Place order, customer service is delayed (for obvious reasons). Or I may want to return this one for an 8, as it‚Äôs a newer model. My only hesitation is speaker quality. Hoping Amazon will get in touch soon.
title: Great sound quality but the rest is underwhelming

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Gdshort
content: We bought a ring doorbell and found it would not ring our old doorbell and of course it we wanted to look at who was at the door we used our cell phones.  The Echo Show (2nd Gen)  was a perfect answer.  It plays a chime and if we say something like "Front Door" we see and can talk to the person.  Since then we have used to play music, videos, answer questions - and always can see the weather conditions.  I can even say Call Anne and it will make a phone call or video call.  Lots of fun.  The sound quality is great as well.  We keep adding its various programs when something come up where it says "you may like this"  Is almost human at times

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: MeandMibooks
content: I first purchased the Echo 5 during a Khol's sale. I enjoy having a visual assistant at my bedside. After discovery Alexa can play my favorite news and music programs to start the morning, my husband is hooked too. Now, we have several devices!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Amazon customer
content: We replaced our old Echo with this Show. We have been surprised by how much we like it. We received it as a package deal at Christmas when there was a good offer on a new Samsung Galaxy phone. We have been surprised how much functionality it adds to the Echo experience. It is great to see your shopping list on the screen, it is helpful to see your audio books, nice to see the lyrics for music that is playing. Also, it works as a photo frame showing us the family pictures we uploaded. All in all, we are thrilled with it. I would recommend it to everyone who already has the Echo (and I guess anyone who doesn't! at well.) It's a nice upgrade! It can do so many things.
title: Surprised by how much we like this

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Scott Evans
content: I purchased the Echo Show to replace an aging PC that we used as our family organizer along with integrating some home automation. While Alexa handles the home automation just fine, the Show's home screen lacks the "at a glance" features my earlier PC setup did. For instance, the home screen doesn't show the month/date/day - only the current time and temperature. There is no built in calendar display to look at although I can verbally schedule appointments to a linked calendar. If I want to peruse the calendar, on the Show I'm out of luck. Upcoming events for the next day do show up but it would be nice to be able to configure it to show me (n) days in advance. Contacts are also a problem. Although I have my contacts linked and they do show up in my Android Alexa app on my phone, only 5 of those contacts show up in the Echo Show. After doing some research, it appears that the reason those 5 show up is because Amazon detects that they also have some sort of Echo device registered. Not very useful to me because I want to be able to see ALL of my contacts.
title: A lot of potential but not there yet...

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Celine S
content: For the first 2 months I was quite pleased with the device. The sound quality is excellent and voice recognition, processing power and image rendering were acceptable for the price. Over the last 3-4 months, performances started decreasing, it doesn't respond to external inputs (e.g.: asking Spotify to play something on that device, falls into a bottomless void), the voice recognition seems somewhat worse and sometimes it answers to me in Spanish (which helps me practice my Spanish but seems like a big code glitch). The lack of integration with Netflix and Youtube apps is also a big gap. To be honest I was hoping for more.
title: 10 months later review

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: CO_Mike
content: I upgraded from a Gen 1 Echo; primarily for the better sound and screen. While the touch screen is great and the sound is better (not significantly though), my main complaint is that unlike the Echo which has a clearly visible queue, this unit only has a front facing indicator. So if you're anywhere in the room other than in front of the unit and you call Alexa - you have no idea if it heard you or not (more often not). And since Alexa doesn't respond until after you ask your question; I find myself having to ask multiple times. Another issue but one that I can't definitively claim is related to the new unit; is the Alexa responses seem much worse and off topic. It's as if it is prioritizing responses that support a visual response rather than the most accurate response.  This has led to a lot of frustration and repeated, rephrased questions in an attempt to get the unit to respond with a useful answer. I do not recall having this level of difficulty with my old Echo.
title: Poor Visual Queues and inaccurate Responses

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Petur Parkour
content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. I love the Echo Show, i have it controlling every light in the house, my front door, cameras, wall clock. Everything is seamless and easy to set up. However, a few months after the warranty expired, my unit stopped responding to voice commands and Amazon refuses to replace the unit. When i spoke to customer service they insinuated that I somehow did something to the unit and that's why it isn't working. This is a item that stays in the same place in a safe part of the house for its whole life. It should last forever. And it was very surprising to me that Amazon, did not replace the faulty unit. I am now stuck with a $230 picture viewer/clock.
title: Will Stop Working a few months after warranty expires and Amazon will not replace it!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: James
content: Sound good, voice good, and that's it.  No ability to change what shows on the home screen (besides photos)  I purchased this to put in my kitchen so in the morning I could have a quick glance at my day.  I wanted the day and date to be on the home screen along with stock market info.  Any way be aware that all that will show is time and temp and you have no choices how is displays.  If you turn on stock market if will show randomly along with other info you cant control.  Beware your paying for a data collection and mini bill board to invade your privacy. Amazon took the product back no questions asked.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Donna Christiansen
content: I like the screen on this better than the Google hub since It shows both the time and temperature where the Google will only show one or the other. At first I didn't like the "messages" it shows on the screen I was able to turn on only the one I wanted (Alexa suggestions). It also lets me show upcoming games and scores of my favorite teams.  My only complaint is that if I set the volume up for music I have to lower it for Alexa responses. Wish they had separate volumes for voice, music, and videos.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Raul Gonzalez
content: This product would not allow me to set it up because it would type by itself and would not let me control it. So expensive yet not good at all! Was so looking forward to it and it failed. I should have gone with Google Pod Assistant. SHAME ON YOU AMAZON!!!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Sara
content: We have many many Echo products and this one was the worst! Perhaps it is because it is the most expensive and Amazon wants you to buy a new one over and over again. After having the Echo Show for just over one year it stopped connecting to WIFI. I looked up all the troubleshooting tips from the forum and it still wont connect. Factory reset, unregistering the device....nothing. I contact "HELP" through Amzon and the solution was I have to purchase a new device because we are out of warranty by a few months. You are better off purchasing another brand OR a "Kids Edition" Amazon device because those Amazon will replace for 2 years. This hunk of junk is going to the dump to be recycled. Oh and to top it off you cannot trade in the 2nd Gen Echo Show only 1st Gen. Such a joke!
