product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Colby Thompson
content: 1 Star: No sound out of the box. Not happy.  I tried all the troubleshooting steps, no sound. Update**** 4 Star:I youtubed how to take it apart, and I unplugged the speakers and plugged them back in and it worked.
title: No audio

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Allan
content: Decided to buy the 2nd gen when it went on sale and also traded in my first gen. Price was right (25% off from trade in plus $15 credit for old one) and I'm definitely overall happy.  The voice recognition, or more specifically it hearing the wake word, isn't as good as the first gen unit.  But everything else is better - image quality, sound quality, overall look and design.  Putting the first gen and second gen next to each other makes them look like they are 10 years apart and not the actual 2 they are. Definitely happy I upgraded even if I have to yell the wake word a little louder for it to catch it.
title: Voice recognition not as good as 1st gen but speakers and design are much better

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Rick
content: No sound out of the box.  Will see how Amazon handles it and update my review accordingly. EDIT:  So, after living with this thing for a while, my rating remains a solid ‚Äò1‚Äô.  Here are some things to think about before buying: - Customer support.  On the plus side, Amazon reached out to me regarding the faulty sound on this device.  Unfortunately, though, their ‚Äúfix‚Äù isn‚Äôt a fix at all, unplugging the chord from the back of the device is a subpar workaround at best.  Worse, there‚Äôs apparently no plan for a real fix for these defective devices. - The faulty sound issues persist, bringing three thoughts to mind for me ‚Äî Does Amazon really think unplugging and replugging the product is a satisfactory fix for this $200 device? ‚Äî How many times does Amazon think we‚Äôll be able to pull the plug and reinsert before the plug breaks? (the answer is not many) ‚Äî How much use will a device that has to be rebooted every time you want to hear something get? (the answer is not much) - The device is inordinately slow.  Even standing directly in front of it and speaking directly to it, my other devices in other rooms answer before the Show can - Lack of content.  I agree with some of the others who have said this is basically an expensive echo dot. Yes, it‚Äôs nice to watch Amazon Prime Video or Hulu, but where is YouTube, Netflix, etc.  Same with the communication capabilities.  They are much too limited - Too few home screen options.  The home screen can‚Äôt be customized to do anything useful and can‚Äôt be set not to turn off automatically ... or to not turn on every time you pass by - Limited compatibility with other hardware.  If you have already purchased video cameras/doorbells, etc that Amazon doesn‚Äôt advertise, you‚Äôre likely to be headed back to the store to purchase new equipment All-in-all, I‚Äôd say this is a device whose time has not yet come, in terms of hardware quality, utility, and usability.  It‚Äôs a shame ... big promise, little result.  Amazon should recall these defective units today!
title: Things to Consider Before Buying!!!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Stonington
content: This device just doesn't live up to the hype. Microphones are not good at all. Have to yell at it at times to recognize me. Also, when I try to turn off a device, say my bedroom light, alexa will say "a few things share the name bedroom light, which one do you want" when I only have one device named bedroom light. I can pick up my phone, use my tp link kasa app and turn it off no problem. This device needs some work before 5 stars can be given. EDIT: Changed to one star because of the microphones. I can be less than 1ft away and speak to it and it doesn't recognize me. This device needs a lot of work to compete with google.
title: A few things share the name......

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Leon
content: Great sound.  Used it during Christmas to play Christmas tunes.  Since I have the basic Amazon prime music, it was annoying that some no-names or ‚Äúother‚Äù recordings of my favorite tunes played when requested if Alexa.  Solution was to just Blu tooth my phone playlist through the Echo-show. I preferred that better.  Initial reason for getting it was to help my 9 year old with spelling.  For now he mainly uses to get the weather and sport scores.  Easy integration to my Nest Cams, Kevo locks, and smart wall plugs and light switches. For security reasons, Alexa will not unlock doors.  This is good, it keeps people from walking up to your window and shouting ‚ÄúAlexa open the front door ‚Äú  üòÅ  Oh, video calls from and to are great.
title: Great sound, right size.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: VH
content: We like having echo show on the kitchen but it's performance is terrible. Half of the time we have to repeat what we requested several times, occasionally the device decides to mid program, there is a significant delay between  receiving the command and actually executing it (sometimes up to 20 seconds), in some instances the device receives the command but does not execute it, yesterday it started crashing for no apparent reason mid show. After third crash in span of 5 minutes we switch to TV. Very nice idea but horrible execution.
title: The worst amazon product ever

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Ready Teddy63
content: I'll have to admit that I got my Echo because I was feeling left behind by the future (yes, this can happen to techies as they age).  I wanted to have the opportunity  to play with the nexus of AI, home automation, home security,  entertainment, communication, and  voice-based information retrieval.  I'm surprised by how easy it is with Alexa and the Echo Show.  I believe that the visual experience is critical to appreciating the full range of capabilities (e.g., videos, amazon prime, amazon music lyrics, data presentation).  I can't compare the Echo Show with other devices from other manufactures  but I can tell you that I am so-far  happy with this one.  The sound is very good for the size of the device, but I could use a little more base.
title: Entertaining and Useful Addition to the Family

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Corey
content: Only purchased this Item because I was forced to have to have an Echo device to use the Echo connect I purchased. However,  tech support still is unable to get the connect to properly work totally junk! Now the show it's ok borderline usless. It will not play Netflix because some childish lovers spat between Amazon and Google how pathetic. The show has no Security or way to lock specific sections of the controls so anyone can just use it to do whatever it can do. I'm totally not impressed! Lastly it will not connect to my Vitamix scale the show would be useful if it could have the Vitamix app established as a skill allowing me to not have to have the pathetic Show and my tablet both on my kitchen counter. The tablet is a thousand times more useful and the show is just usless.
title: usless my tablet is better!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: D Kuntz
content: In general like most everything about this product. It's size and clarity of screen, audio and ease of setup. The reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is that it has limited compatibility with my Nest Doorbell and Arlo security systems. While I can view the cameras on these devices I cannot do vocal communication nor will the Echo show create an audio alert when my doorbell is rung. It does not work at all with my Schlage electronic door locks.  Least not that I can figure out. I realize this is not the primary functions of the Echo show but the Google hub seems to have better compatibility for more of these type devices.
title: Great product with a few limitations

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Jeff R
content: I like Echos.  I have a few of them around the house.  This is a device that I thought would be a home run, but ultimately is pointless.  The obvious use case is watching short clips on Youtube, but Amazon and Google are in some kind of spat so you can't.  There's also no Netflix app. The reason I got the Show, though, was to use as a baby monitor.  I tried out a Wyze internet camera, and I liked it so much through my cell phone that I thought the Show would be even better.  However, it seems that Amazon has blocked the Show from displaying a video stream more than 10 minutes long. Sound quality is quite good, but considering the video is pointless, you'd be smarter just to get an Echo Plus.
title: Pointless device

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Alex R
content: Now days , people are not even satisfied with 1080P and looking for 2k , 4k or 8k .  This device is not even 1080P and the pictures are kind of  dark most of the time even on the brightest mode.  the touch screen is also very weak , most of the time won't work, very difficult  to get You Tube, no app store, and .....  You cant even change the picture on your albums with the touch  and most of the time stock in one picture . Amazon need to reprogram  this device and for sure the new one should should have at least a full  HD 1080P.  I give it two star because of the sound quality only.
title: Poor picture  quality , not a full HD

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Eric
content: Update: The first one I got must have been a lemon. Once I unplugged it, packed it up for shipping and removed it from my account everything worked perfectly. I can unplug the one I have now and plug it back in without any of the issues mentioned below. I am very happy with this addition to my collection. The show2 is a great addition to my collection of amazon devices. I have 2 dots, an echo, and now the show2. I really like the screen resolution and the sound is great. My only complaint is when I set up a music group. The initial setup of the group works great. The buggy part comes in when you unplug the show2 to move it. Once you plug it back in and tell alexa to play music "everywhere"(my group name) the music plays on all the devices but the show2. At this point the show will display the lyrics but no sound comes out of it. If you tell alexa to turn off the music it will. But if you ask alexa on the show2 any question after this occurs you can see her response on the screen but still no sound at all. After trying to figure out what the issue was by messing with the volume and a whole host of other things I figured I just got a defective one. I called support and they had me try several things like rebooting but nothing seemed to fix the no sound issue. They sent me out a replacement. While I was waiting I kept trying to get it to work. I finally gave up in frustration and just unplugged it. Fortunately I am not one to just let things go so I plugged it back in after a couple of hours and low and behold it worked with the "everywhere" group again. As long as did not unplug it everything worked great. Once the replacement showed up I did a test with it. I set it up in the "everywhere" group and started playing music. I then unplugged it. At that point I went to one of my other devices and told alexa to turn the music off but it would not turn it off. I went and plugged the replacement show2 back in and all of a sudden the music turned off. Crazy right? So what I have determined is that if a show2 is unplugged and then plugged back in there will be no sound and may have other issues related to the music group. The solution at that point for me is just unplug it for a while and then plug it back in and the sound magically starts working again. Amazon need to figure out this bug with the show2 and the music group feature. I can unplug any of my dots or echo and plug them back in and they work just fine once they are booted up and online. So if if you are thinking about getting one just be aware of this issue and hopefully Amazon will read this review and fix the bug. Update: The first one I got must have been a lemon. Once I unplugged it, packed it up for shipping and removed it from my account everything worked perfectly. I can unplug the one I have now and plug it back in without issue.
title: Show 2 - Updated review

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: newraze
content: There used to be a problem that if you have 5000+ photos uploaded to your amazon photos account and want the echo show 2nd gen to rotate through them on your home-screen it just would stop at 50-1000 pictures but amazon fixed that issue and now it works flawlessly and perfectly for what I want it to do. I originally had it this review at 3 stars for that issue but now that it's fixed I am updating the review to 5 stars. The sound quality and microphone are way better than the first gen echo show. And the 2nd gen echo show works perfectly with other smart devices that are alexa ready. I have a harmony hub that controls my oscillating fan and my whole home theater system, 8 philips hue light bulbs that have a bridge, a leviton smart light switch, and a ecobee 3 smart thermostat all that the echo show 2nd gen works perfectly with. For my philips hue lights I have different groups for each room they are in set up in my alexa app and I can have alexa turn on/off each group of philips hue lights one group at any time I want and she will do it perfectly. I have the leviton smart light switch set up to control my florescent lights in my kitchen and connected to my echo show 2nd and alexa turns them on/off perfectly. I would now definitely recommend people buy this product.
title: Amazon fixed the photo rotation problem

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: David T. LaFrance
content: This device has a great screen and fantastic sound when it works as it should. Far to often with volume at 60% it will be so soft it is hard to hear. I will ask to raise volume by one and it will still be the same too quiet level but the bar will show 70% volume. Then I tell it to set volume 50% and the volume will come back to what it should be robust and perfect, sounding fabulous like it should. It does not seem to be a speaker issue but a software issue as simply asking for volume by percent when the issue randomly happens resets it fine and the sound is great.
title: The sound is great when it is consistant

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Steve A. leland
content: I located the Echo Show in several rooms to view security cameras, play music, turn off and on lights, turn on fans, watch pets, kids, etc. The larger screen really makes it nice when watching TV, movies and cameras. The sound quality is excellent for listening to music. Andi it's a lot of fun. I ask Alexa all the time "who's the man" and she replies "you the man". You can ask Alexa to tell you a joke or a story.  A lot of fun as well as being practical and useful. Once you have one you will want more. Therefore, look for it to go on sell and buy several. You won't regret it‚Ä¶
title: Excellent device.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Chelly Eric
content: There is no setting to change this. Amazon devices does NOT come with an instruction booklet or trouble shooting. However you can Pay for one. Most problems I've had I can find a forum or a complaint with the same issues, but Amazon does not correct or do anything with this information. Just keeps giving the same recorded feedback of " thank you for your feed back we are getting many others with the same problems. We will look into it." Two years later still no resolution... Very disappointed in "Alexa" she does not hardly answer the question I ask or play the music I asked her to play. Often times its something I have no idea where she gets it from. I ask her to play a specific playlist and she has no ides what it is or she can't find it... Soooo Freaking Annoying...
title: Display goes dark after a few miniutes. There is no way of stoping this.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Steve Fuller
content: I took baby steps into the whole smarthome thing. I started with the ‚Äúdot‚Äù expanding to the ‚Äúplus‚Äù before landing on the first generation show.  I had purchased 4 shows, 4 dots, and a couple of the ‚Äúplus‚Äù until I had an echo product in each room to control my homes lighting, temp, and security system. I tried out other products before settling down on the Amazon devices.  Now for the Show. I have added 2 of the Show 2 to my home. I absolutely love them. I have one beside my bed so at anytime I can check security cams throughout the house and talk to anyone who‚Äôs at the door. In add to an alarm, sleep aid with sleep sound skills, home intercom, speaker phone, I now have my own tv to catch up on prime movies or Hulu. My personal opinion is simply this. Compare all you get in one device for the money. The new upgrades are amazing. The larger screen and speakers kick butt!  And the best part is the price remained the same!!!  If you haven‚Äôt, try it. I don‚Äôt see how you couldn‚Äôt be more than satisfied.
title: Bang for your buck!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: MR & MRs. KAOS
content: I really enjoy the new show.  It has a nicer design than the original. The only DRAWBACK I have is that I have it in my bedroom on the nightstand right next to my bed, and even on its dimmest setting, the light is annoying.  I wish the screen could turn totally dark and I would have given it 5 stars.  There was no setup.  It came preconfigured for my account and wifi out the box. It also sounds great.  I am considering ordering a second to see how the subwoofer only option works.
title: Sounds Great

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: FJ
content: Great unit, fun and easy to use. Amazon's Blink cameras just need to be able to send motion detection notifications to unit since it can already "arm and disarm" and "live view" them.  I haven't seen where you can look at saved clips or set up notifications for them anyway. Otherwise pretty easy to use I even "drop in" to visit with my sister once in awhile via hers.  I like the "guard" function added as well.  I previously criticized not having that feature since it has a camera and microphone.  I haven't tested it's functionality quite yet though.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Eddie
content: Good but needs to improve with more improvements, like: 1. integration with apps like Spotify and YouTube. 2. Should be able to use as an external speaker. 3. No options to cast video to this screen, for instance if I want to cast a YouTube video from my mobile to this echo show screen, can not do that :( 4. Give more options to integrate with news and videos, YouTube has more options, I believe amazon should have latest news in videos option too. So just do it amazon, get more amazongly amazing
title: Improvements needed.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Crystal Sanger
content: I had come across an Alexa show in a lobby. I was playing with it and really enjoyed the trivia portion. So, that was the main reason I purchased mine. I found that I really like and use the grocery shopping list, I mean let's admit how many times do we go to the store and forget our shopping list? I do more times than not! I like that I can add whatever to the list and when I am in the store I can bring it up on my phone. Another feature I use is the reminders, they can be helpful to keep you on task for deadlines and such. It's awesome that Alexa will tell me when birthdays are coming up also! I married into a large family that is very close so Alexa is instrumental in making me the favorite in-law!!! I'm not exactly tech savvy and setup was a breeze. Learning what Alexa can do for me was real fun and easy. The only thing I do not like, and it is as others stated, is that you cannot turn off the "Try "Alexa, tell me about...Blah blah blah" messages on the screen and they scroll a lot so it is kind of a distraction. Overall, I am very happy with my purchase.
title: Happy with my purchase

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: BalletBabe
content: I have dots, and the original echo and the first Echo show.  I love the larger screen and the sound is awesome also.  I highly recommend.  I am so impressed with Amazon service.  I was actual able to see where the delivery truck was, and a approximate time when my package would arrive.  They also took a picture of my porch where they left it.  I am impressed.
title: LOVE THIS NEW VERSION

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Small Waffles
content: Had first gen and had to replace due to glitchy, twitching screen flicker. Not impressed with the process to ‚Äúrepair‚Äù (found out only after I reached out to amazon it can‚Äôt be repaired and at that time, unable to be returned). So I was leery of the second gen but it‚Äôs much more refined - bigger and better screen, definite improvement in sound quality. Picks up my voice an easy 25‚Äô away and is good for background music (for our use). Just beginning to ‚Äúdrop in‚Äù with other devices at home and with Contacts ‚Äî easy and beautiful screen with no lag in video conferencing. Would rate 5 stars but need to give it a few months ‚Äî hopefully it‚Äôs more reliable and doesn‚Äôt fail!
title: Dynamic sound, modern appearance, fast response times

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: DCD
content: I have been using Echo devices since the first release. Over time I have built an ecosystem of these devices and I have enjoyed watching the growth of these smart speakers. I use these to control most of the lighting in my home, my thermostat and my TVs. I also use them daily to listen to music. Unfortunately this is where they fail miserably. The sound quality is acceptable, and quite good if you add the subwoofer. The problem is they continually stop playing music and need to be rebooted to resolve this problem. These need to be rebooted multiple times a day to function properly. This issue is well know by users, and a topic on many forums. I have contacted Amazon, but they do not have a fix for this problem. I would recommend anyone looking for a smart speaker to do their research. I will be selling my entire ecosystem of Echos and looking elsewhere.
title: Terrible at streaming music and Amazon has not resolved this known issue for years.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: B A S
content: We were a earlier adopter of the alexa push.  We purchased a large Alexa and then followed suit with numerous echo dots and then a spot. Due to the spots limited use and small screen we did not move to a 1st gen show. but when Amanzon came out with the 2nd gen Show with a larger screen, discount at holiday season, we took the plunge. We ahve also move more in the Ring devises, cams etc. The new Show has a nice large screen, better sound and works well. It now sees our security cams and runs our lights etc. - Con - not much in video content and must use the screen to navigate some apps which makes it difficult to reach across the counter.
title: Nice Clear Screen, Improved Sound

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Ian Currie
content: The screen is very nice.  The sound is horrible.  Even when using the EQ and lowering the bass as FAR AS IT WILL GO, it still sounds muffled.  I've boosted the mids and treble a bit and made sure not to put the unit anywhere near a wall but Alexa still sounds boomy and music isn't great. How did they get this so wrong? Another issues is that the mic doesn't pick up as well as an Echo Dot.  I can be 3 feet away from this unit and ask Alexa for something (e.g. play music) and my echo dot in the other room hears me first and plays music there! Definitely needs improvement.
title: This device has issues

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Tracy K
content: The Show is attractive looking, if a little bulky. The main issue is that it does little more than display the weather. I have 3 use cases for have a smart device in my kitchen- play my Apple Music, watch Netflix, and have my recipe displayed. The Show handles none of them. It sits in the kitchen showing the weather while my iPad plays movies and shows my recipes. Essentially this is just a regular echo and there‚Äôs no use for the screen.
title: It‚Äôs an echo device with a useless screen

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: David S. Monteiro
content: As an Amazon customer since 2000, I never been disappointed until now. While the sound quality on this device is great, that‚Äôs where the quality stopped. In my home, I have an ecosystem powered by Alexa. It includes devices in the master bedroom (Echo spot), my kids‚Äô room (Echo dots), my office (echo dot), and the kitchen hallway (Ecobee thermostat). I also have Echo Buds, Fire TVs and Fitbit Versa 3 with Alexa integrated but I honestly use those. I did not expect the performance on the Ecobee to match that of the other devices so when my wife wanted a device that could be used to watch some of her shows in the kitchen, I thought the Echo Show would be a great solution. The first disappointment was the assumption  that we would be able to steam Netflix. After receiving the device, I realized it did not have a Netflix app. I tried to connect to my account via the browser, but that was not possible either. The second one was using Hulu. In this case, the device includes a Hulu app, but you are not able to link the different user profiles with the device. In this case, my wife was not able to get to her shows where she felt off. The interface is limited but using Alexa alone is not yet good enough. I‚Äôm still a fan of Amazon line of products and wanted to wait for the next generation of this product yet to be released to see if all of these issues are resolved.
title: My First Disappointment with an Alexa Device

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: M Cham
content: Got this as a gift from my work over a year ago, would've never been inclined to purchase one if not been gifted it...and I love it now. I use it 90% for music (the speaker is amazing), and the remainder for a clock, random Qs, sleep sounds, and weather updates. Now here's why I'm writing a review (I don't usually write these): I'm a college student, and so this thing has been put through a lot. This weekend she got puked on, and dropped face down from four feet. After cleaning and scrubbing the speakers (i'm not sure this is recommended), she works and sounds just as good as day one... amazing. If you're wanting an interactive speaker you can't beat this. I love the screen feature as a clock, seeing artists/songs, and to provide a little lighting at night if I want it to.
title: SHE SURVIVED A COLLEGE PARTY

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Carl F
content: When the Box arrived it was so beautifully packaged  I could tell lots of thought went into making this a great  product .  I wasn't disappointed!!  Its pretty and works as well as one would want it to.. I had a ball trying out the many tricks it can do.. I love the announce function  I use it as an intercom with my other Alexa devices...  I had an issue with interaction with another unit within hearing range  they both responded at together.  I fixed it easily by changing the wake word in the older unit  . Bottom line  get one  its a great utility and toy
title: LOTS OF FUN

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Rick J. Harron
content: I have a first generation echo show that I keep in my kitchen.  I like it so much I got the second generation for my bedroom.  I use this device to read my kindle and audible books while in bed.  I use it to turn on and off my bedroom light.  I use it as my alarm clock to wake up.  I play amazon music.  I check outside temperature before deciding what to wear.  I use it to make sure all the doors are locked before going to bed.  IT IS FANTASTIC!  I can‚Äôt speak highly enough about it. Note to editor.....For some reason I could not rate the sound quality.  I would give it 5 stars.
title: My second Echo Show

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Theduck71
content: Great unit, it sounds good for such a small device. (10‚Äù) I am glad I made the purchase, the screen is amazing. I would like to get a 2nd one for the kitchen, but might hold off until it goes back on sale. I do not think it‚Äôs the unit, but I have notice some words that I say to Alexa are not picked up, like it was on the last Gen Show. I have noticed it on other non Show devices as well. Wondering if they did an update to Alexa, causing it not to be as sensory?? Other than that (again, I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs related to Show 10)  it‚Äôs a really great device!
title: Wow, the screen and sound quality is great.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Dat
content: Update 08/22/2019 - I would like to subtract another star if I could.  This thing is laggy and slow.  I have three Alexa devices near by, both of the other devices would execute my command before this one even registers the command even though I'm standing right next to it. I wanted to use this mainly as a clock, but I'm near sighted and can't see the tiny clock.  There are no options to  make the clock full screen.  I am aware that I can "zoom in" on the clock to make it bigger, but that's just ridiculous.
title: Dissapointed

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Joe L
content: I absolutely love the larger screen size compared to the original Show; however, there are still a few major flaws the Show 2.0. I will say that I use this primarily in my kitchen to watch shows or listen to music while I cook/prepare food. However, I've also used it to do drop in calls with my family and play customized (blueprint) trivia with the Alexa buttons.  My initial thoughts summed up below: PROS - Larger screen size - The screen size is much bigger - Did I mention that the screen is larger? CONS - It seems like any hardware enhancements made to account for the larger screen size, weren't enough to make the Show a faster, more viable hub - Slow to respond to some commands (I.e. stopping while watching a video and returning to the home screen) - Touchscreen isn't a stellar experience, often times having to use it to adjust brightness settings that have seemingly changed on their own (away from the auto adjust) - Buttons pair and work inconsistently (to be fair, not sure if that is a Show issue but that has been my experience) OVERALL The Show 2nd gen does what I am hoping it will do, but I can't help but wish for a few more improvements.
title: Honey, I blew up the Alexa

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Sean Devlin
content: Would be a five star review except for one major flaw that should be an easy fix. I have the cloud cam in my nursery and use it as a baby monitor which works GREAT. I can view the camera on my phone, tablet, Fire tv (of which all our TVs primarily use) and now I can ask my new echo show to display the nursery as well which works great as a night stand monitor! Only problem is I also use Alexa to control various lights and switches throughout my house and when I ask my show to perform a smart home command like ‚Äúturn off bedroom lights‚Äù when it‚Äôs time to go to sleep, it leaves my nursery cam then displays a control screen for whichever device or group the command was for. Which would be fine for a short while so long as it returned back to the nursery camera... it doesn‚Äôt... it displays the smart home control for a bit then goes to the home screen... forcing me to have to ask it to display the nursery again. This is very frustrating. As soon as this problem is fixed I will edit review to 5star.
title: Almost great

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Mark T Roberts
content: This is my 3rd Echo and I'm generally satisfied with the products.  However, I'm having an issue with the Echo Show Gen II. On three separate occasions, Alexa's voice stopped working.  The Show seemed to be hearing my questions and responding on the screen.  However, there was no verbal response from Alexa.  After doing some online research, this seems to be a common issue. Mostly with units purchased on or around Prime Day. I did find where Amazon tech support has offered a tempory workaround by recommending that you unplug the power cord from the back of the device and reconnect it after a few seconds.  The process did restore Alexa's response voice for a few days until it stopped responding again.  I hope there will be an eventual software update to correct this issue, or perhaps a replacement unit offered if this issue is a result of a bad batch.  Other than this random issue, I am satisfied with the Echo products and Amazons service.
title: Issues with Echo Show (2nd Gen)

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: susiecc
content: The Echo Show is a fantastically neat device. It will talk to you, play music for you, show you recipes, tell you the news, read to you...EVERYTHING!! I was even able to make a phone call and there's so much more that I haven't tried yet.  I received one for Christmas and love it. I have hooked up my Ring with it and wanted to do Nest, but for some reason, Nest doesn't work. I'll keep trying. The only criticism I have is that the App will drop connectivity with Ring and then I have to disable and re-enable. I can live with that. Love it! Love it! Love it!
title: Echo Show...WOW! WHAT FUN!!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: maddscot
content: Initially loved this device as it showed family photos (digital frame like), our upcoming events and reminders.  Plus the added feature of the screen for recipes and shopping lists.  Then after two weeks, the screen times out to a blank screen with the clock on it.  Many are having this issue, and the only way to return to the screen is to "Alexa".  Stays on for a few moments then goes back to timeout screen.  Checked settings, but nothing to reset or change, and no change if changes are made.  Best part is that I tried the Chat, but the server is not "working", so I called, got a call back but no one there (3 times), placed a request on the help forum under Echo Show and nothing as well...  I think this will be going back.  If updates are made or fix in place, then we will keep it and update the review.  For now, its a clock, unless we ask it something.  Not much more of a feature set compared to the standard Echo with no screen.
title: Great Idea - Poor support & Device Issue

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: sad dad
content: I like this echo Show and use it daily.  The sound quality is generally good biut the volume control is not.  trying to lower or raise the volume si not very good as the volume control cause the volume to increase or decrease in :"bunches" rather than a smooth transition.  I am often disappointed when I ask a question because Alexa either does not understand my question or it can't find what would appear to be a simple inquiry.  Overall, I am very please with this echo Show.  I wish that I could use the echo to play music through my stereo system.
title: Very good but could be much better

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Richard Haws
content: Overall a great device to own if you like cooking it will display recipes. Really easy to set up and use and the voice recognition is nice for smart home integration and control. It is a little extra with Vivint systems since it will say ‚Äúok completed Vivint.smarthome, ok turning off these lights‚Äù it‚Äôs a little annoying but it still does the job. There are a lot of additional skills that help integrate other services as well which is nice. If you‚Äôre familiar with drop in, you say forget the other things like the FB camera thing. Alexa allows someone with the app on their phone to drop in and video chat with contacts and displays the video for both which is cool especially for family. You can do it between echo devices or other contacts.
title: Pretty good with smart home integration

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Stephen
content: First the good: the sound is much improved and the so is the screen compared to the first gen. Unfortunately the Show is slow to load different things such as Hulu shows. The voice recognition seems worse as well. I have to shout at the device at times to make it work. If you have a first gen device is wait until they come with with the next generation. Don‚Äôt buy this one.
title: Disappointed for a 2nd gen item

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Kelly & Jennifer McCormick
content: Overall,  very pleased with our Alexa Show. It was easy to set up with the TV, plugs and  cell phone app. The only thing I'm not happy with is, the basic word command i.e.turn on tv it doesn't work. It worked when we originally set it up but when I accidentally switched it to the basic command, to tell Alexa to turn the TV on,  it goes to the screen,  but doesn't turn on. I don't know how to switch it back. The smart plugs for it can it get expensive and it can only be heard in a certain distance of the house. But, it's a wonderful devise! Its amazing what Alexa can do! We love it!
title: An amazing device at your voice!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: John E. Brandt
content: I am a little displeased with the brightness of the video and am hoping this is not a defect. I have the settings cranked up to the highest level to see the image adequately. At the half-way mark (default) it is really hard to see. I can sense that the screen brightness is adjusting to ambient light, but it is really just too dim. I've only had the unit about a week and am still evaluating. If this is the way it is supposed to work, I may need to return the unit. Sound quality on the other hand is quite improved and rivals that of the Echo Plus 2nd gen. The speakers appear to be in the back so you get a fuller sound (almost too loud).
title: Brightness of video

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Felix
content: She often doesn't hear your request well; difficult many times to exit out of music; insists on playing a lot of music samples & won't play albums. Bartender app is poor, google better. A lot she doesn't know. Music is fair, really all I use it for. I leave off for days at a time. She frequently responds with "I don't know that". Really expected better. Difficult to get a good news station & can't get one locally. Hate Fox!! Wish she understood "background music", still trying to download my own wallpaper, but found it exhausting & don't understand. THIS IS CLEARLY FOR TECHY PEOPLE AND NOT THE OLDER GENERATION...you'd think it would be helpful for us older folks, but it is not sorry to say.
title: Fairly good for music...

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: robin
content: Pros - Sound quality is good. I listen to music when I'm in the kitchen. Easily pulls up recipes. Haven't watched a movie on it but the screen is clear and the colors pop. The cons below are more a nuisance but I felt I should add them because I didn't know this before I purchased Cons - You CANNOT say Alexa play (insert song and artist) and it will play. You have to subscribe to Amazon music. The echo show often talks when no one is in the Kitchen. Haven't figured out why. The only Alexa we know is in the kitchen so we do not have the need to say that name unless talking directly to it. You cannot put your own picture slide show on it.
title: Overall a good product

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Shawn L
content: I really enjoy using the echo. We have it set up to control our lights, for listening to music, and overall general information. Very helpful. We got the 1st gen Shows when they first came out and were impressed. We recently gave one show to a family member so we could use it to communicate with them, and honestly, a reason for me to get the newest gen Echo Show. However, I have run into more issues with the 2nd Gen Show than I ever have with the 1st Gen. I've had issues with this Show not displaying anything, then no audio, delays in response, and now it won't perform what it's asked to do. For example, I'll ask it to give me my flash briefing and it won't respond with anything. No action!  I have restarted this Echo so many times thinking it just needed a reboot. If it keeps doing what it's doing, I'm going to request an exchange. And if the exchanged 2nd Gen Echo Show does the same thing, I'll go back to the 1st Gen.
title: 2nd Gen has more issues than 1st Gen

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Nikki Graves
content: I work from home and have this sitting on my desk.  I like being able to show my yards from Ring when the dogs are barking at something.  I can even tell them to knock it off! - without having to drop my conference call to go look out the doors or windows.  I was also able to turn off the computer speakers and use the Show speakers that have a much better sound.  Alexa can do simple calculations for me so I don't have to pull up a calculator.  And when I need a break, I can watch YouTube or Netflix without leaving my office.  Show is my own little personal assistant/multi-tasker.
title: My new computer speaker, Ring video, and Netflix right on my desktop.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Dabba's Mommy
content: I received this as a gift from my husband.  He had read the reviews and thought itcwpuld be a great asset in our kitchen.  I believe that the ‚Äòintegration‚Äô with things like our dish network and things was strongly misrepresented.  Yes it integrates with these other programs, but you can‚Äôt actually use the dish app on the Amazon Show, you can only control whats showing on your tv with the Show.  We thought we‚Äôd be able to stream these other services on our Show.  Not the case.  And what little user i terface there is is quite cumbersome to use.  The lack of a homescreen where you can touch icons to do what you would like is frustrating (instead of using voice commands that Alexa doesnt always understand) This device sounds great.  But you can buy a great speaker for much less than the price of his device.  It is quite limited in its funtionality. Overall in our house, its basically a digital screen saver that plays music.  I can‚Äôt say i‚Äôd recommend it.
title: Overpriced gadget, great sound, very limited functionality.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Grady Nelson
content: Love her. But if you already have an ECHO with out video note this is a replacement device not an add on to add video. The device will need to be programmed. E.g., I have a Ring Door bell 2 But her behavior was quite different that the 4 gen Echo device she replaced. When someone  came on the front porch or rang the doorbell she would just ding. After working with an Amazon Alexa expert she taught me how to use Ring sensors in the ring skill to write routines that would make her say some one is in your front yard or some one is ringing you front door bell or there is motion in you front yard.
title: Depending on eneabled skills and the addition  of  a few eaislt written routines it works great.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Liz Fattore
content: The sound quality is great and I really don't mind the constant Home screen messages. I subscribed to Hulu live and this unit replaces the kitchen tv. It takes multiple steps  to get to a station. The touch screen is not sensitive and we need to press the station several times for it to connect. If you pause, it lasts for less than a minute and then goes back to the menu screen and you need to start the process all over again. Fast forward and rewind is a joke.  It freezes once in a while and we need to unplug it and restart.
title: Works fine, but it can be annoying

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Rocket Ron
content: I originally purchased this to video chat with my parents.  They are very technically weak, but Alexa calls worked great for them.  Since then we have used our echo as a remote TV.  Not cable and voice activated.  The link to Amazon photo is great feature, as it turns screen into picture frame.  The price is little high but it does work well.
title: Simpilest Video Calls

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: K.Montana
content: I love and hate this :) I bought it to pair with my Ring cameras. It‚Äôs wonderful for this until you want to snooze announcements. Nothing short of deleting the device will stop the annoying repeated announcements when mowing, snow blowing or just playing in the yard. Almost makes me regret buying it even though I love it most of the time! I have several Echo devices, so dnd isn‚Äôt an option. I hope someone has a fix for this and calls me out for not realizing how easy it is... but so far no one has been able to help. For everything else, I love it!
title: Love it! Except for Ring Camera Announcements.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: cginger
content: The device has a decent screen and quite good sound for a small video oriented device. The thing to be aware of is that it is slow to start videos, and slow to respond to any commands while streaming video. If you tell Alexa to ‚Äúgo home‚Äù while playing a video, the video will continue playing for up to 10 seconds before finally turning off and returning to the home screen. Very annoying. it seems worse with Hulu than with Prime Video. When using with recordings from the FireTV Recast, it is quite unresponsive when using the touchscreen to play individual videos,  you may need to tap on a video 3 or more time to get it to play. The screen clearly registers the tap,  it sometimes does nothing. In fact, tapping on the screen in general seems slow and sometimes unresponsive. It seems like a faster processor might help with many of the above issues.
title: Cool device, but slow to respond to commands; video underpowered

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: R. Camp
content: Set up was very easy.  I have several Echo devices but was always looking for something more.  This was it.  I would love to see Amazon offer a link to WeChat which is the familiar video/audio link in China.  I use that service when I teach English to my students.  Skype is only available as a VPN option over there.  But the big plus for Echo Show is the sound quality.  I like to listen to relaxing music and I simply ask, "Alexa play some relaxation music" and she connects to some internet station and we can listen to the wonderful sounds.
title: Easy to set up

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: teenie
content: I wanted this to replace the first one. I am not sure this is better. The one thing I have found is better than the first ones, the music  is louder. The screen is larger.  You  can use Firefox and play youtube. The bad for me is my one young kitty goes nuts for sound, and the speakers in the back make her want to flip this over. Tv sounds are low, so adjusting the volume from music to tv is a slight pain. I use mine to drop in on the cats while working. Most of the time they get busted doing naughty things. Drop in and calling is very handy, when someone can't be with you, they can check on you. I feel the first generation is better, but this will work.
title: Check in on the family

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: James L. Thyden
content: If I could give zero stars I would, buyer beware.  I bought this for our kitchen and it worked well for about 3 months, then it started lagging.  Becoming unresponsive and certain functions just wouldn't work.  I now have to hard restart every day.  Regardless of it saying it has the latest software running, it barely does anything except take up space now.  I have been happy with most of my other Amazon products but this one is a big fail. Stay Away! As for features, it is supposed to play content on Hulu and play Apple Music, but those interfaces are decidedly limited.  So just know that going into purchasing.
title: Glitchy and over promises and under delivers

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: amazonamy
content: Omg I love my SHOW! I‚Äôll be honest... I hated my Echo Spot. HATED it... with a passion. Too small of a screen, the speakers were horrible & it was glitchy. So I did the Amazon trade... smartest thing ever. The Show has a huge, clear screen. The speaker system is excellent- lots of bass++. And my smart integrations work extremely well. Highly recommend!
title: Best Echo on the market!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Stephen C. Holtzman
content: We have so many Alexa models in my home I have lost count and always upgrade when a new model arrives. These two as you can see are placed in our Bedroom and kitchen. We have tried the ‚ÄúCompetition‚Äù and have one also next to our Alexa in the Kitchen (not shown in the picture) but do not like it! Amazon wins on our home hands down... one in every room!!! Our lights, stereo, health, everything connected. Do I care that they are listening.. no as I have nothing to hide. I am a true believer in the Amazon Alexa products and highly recommend them! Still though waiting since day one for my Amazon Alexa Echo Auto.... long wait and with having so many devices surprised not to get an invite yet! Does not matter love Alexa!
title: I have one Alexa in every room of my home!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Maureen T.
content: 6/21/20 I have not gotten a response from my first review, but I see an Echo Show 2 for the same price I paid for the one that doesn't work. Can I return the one that doesn't work and replace it with the new one with any kind of discount? ------------------ 5/29/20 - My Echo Show 2 no longer works. When I turn it on, there is nothing. I cannot reset it or anything else recommended since it doesn‚Äôt even power up. Even tried plugging it into another outlet. Still nothing. I called Amazon Customer Service, but they are not answering calls due to COVID-19. I understand that, but in the meantime I‚Äôm not able to enjoy my device that I purchased from Amazon in November 2018. I‚Äôm stuck. I would have thought it would last longer than 1 1/2 years. I gave my rating three stars since my device doesn‚Äôt work anymore.
title: Device no longer works

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Duda
content: Cannot get ring spot lite camera to show on screen! Picks up signal and says there was a detection. iPad does all and the video is there. I am versed in works and cannot figure out the problem. All units operate on same net and pass. Amazon techs are also baffled. They say reset the Ring but it is up 25 ft. and how come phone and IPad works?
title: Ring and Show are out in space

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Alexander T.
content: We waited till gen 2 before picking up the show and while I do believe it is a marked improvement from gen one there still seems to be some technical hardware/software issues. Amazon seems to be aware of this as well as when we called in they had a whole system to walk through and said it was a common issue (recall?)- one of the issues is that sound will just stop working which then requires you to reset the device multiple times (which means plugging it in and unplugging it over and over) this error/glitch also effects the screen or sometime the start up of the show. - and the whole device is out of warranty coverage in like 30 days or something from purchase. This first happened to us about 15 days after we got it - in hindsight should have probably exchanged it then - but we hoped it was a one time thing - however this is turning into a weekly routine at this point. Besides that the device is great - screen is beautiful sound quality top notch, for what it is, and our kids (4-2) love it. They can ask for pictures of fish and then scroll through images on the touch screen or to play their favorite song or ask for their kids show on Hulu or the time or weather etc. It really enables them to be able to interact and explore without the ability to type and spell - which for them is very empowering.
title: Beautiful device when it works...

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Alan
content: No significant change compared to the 1st generation, besides size.  I frequently have to order Alexa to "stop" several times and with my voice volume progressively louder, before she will hear me and stop. The technology is still behind times.  The screen should be able to show the date and day as it does the time and weather. I don't want to add my calendar and email. The screen should offer the option to view a list of music by genre, artist, albums, era, station, etc.  Customer should not have to refer to the app on the computer or cell phone to select music options.
title: Boring

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Yupik Eskimo
content: The commands don't always work...for example when playing music from Music Unlimited won't stop using commands, one has to go to streaming music like Abby Road by the Beatles then stop the music to get it to stop. Look online for the same problem. Amazon MUST give the option of stopping the "Suggestion" line that changes at the bottom of the screen. No matter what you are looking at it remains. See online complaints regarding that issue. I am able to see Notifications by continuous rotating light on my Dots but not on the Echo Show in any way. I really like the sound versus the old Alexa. Overall, I am satisfied with it but Amazon needs to make the common issues people have go away.
title: Works well but not yet perfected...read review

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: E. Porter
content: After using the Echo Show for a little over a year, I woke up this morning and the screen isn't on and is unresponsive. Tests: I've unplugged the device for  3 min. and plugged back in. Nothing. I've also tried pressing the mute and volume down button for 15 seconds.  Nothing. I've tested the power supply and it's registering the correct voltage. 18V. No other electronic devices have any issues, save I have a digital picture frame that sometimes gets stuck on a picture. (Meaning I don't think this was the result of a power surge or brown out)
title: Worked for  a year, this morning it was unresponsive

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Jaime J. Brownell
content: I'm very satisfied with this device.  The second generation is much nicer versus the first generation. The 10" screen is a nice size with a very clear and high resolution display. With the Alexa app, it works seamlessly with my Ring doorbell and shows me who's at the door. Since it has the built in hub, I'm able to remotely control my lights, and thermostat and I'm also able to connect to my other Amazon devices in other rooms as an intercom. The sound is very good when I want to listen to music apps such as Pandora or Amazon music. Another cool feature is that I'm able to see my shopping lists on the screen and take it with me on my phone with the Alexa app.
title: Very intuitive device. A must have for techies.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Cousin Eddie
content: First off, sound is fantastic for such a little device. I didn't realize we could get music/video of this quality from such a small device. However, with that said the software has me concerned. I'm staring at my Echo Show right now and it has powered off on it's own. I've had to reboot this unit several times since receiving because it either locked up or for some reason powered off by itself. If this wasn't so expensive, I would probably be more forgiving, but at $200 I expect more. Screen quality is good, video playback is good as well. Touchscreen responsiveness is also good. My biggest gripe is when the unit has stalled. Perhaps when future updates are pushed out, this Echo Show will be more stable and less inclined to locking up or powering off on it's own.
title: Seems unfinished...

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: dwayne harris
content: I bought this one from Amazon sale was a great price I received it yesterday I went to set it up and the volume won‚Äôt work I called your office they said they‚Äôre working on a situation I gave them my number they said they call me today which they haven‚Äôt and still not working this is a bad sign of a product that you just bought and it‚Äôs not working
title: Echo show has no volume

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Barbara
content: If you love books, music, need help spelling a word Alexa is always ready now envision a TV at her fingertips of what you want  or need to see ‚ùóÔ∏è Could be that recipe  or your smiling Grand baby from your arsenal of pictures that she holds and displays proudly ..  I highly believe the Show is worth her weight in gold... ( pretty solid device) .  Now I can‚Äôt wait for my family members to also have one so we can chat while moving on with the rest of our day.. there is no need to hold your phone or iPad to video chat the Echo show has a camera that can follow and auto correct the picture..
title: Always ready..

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Holli
content: Love the product except for this:  The "Try" suggestions at the bottom of the screen, in italics, are the same size they were on the first generation product with a much smaller screen.  I purchased the second generation version, mostly because the screen is larger (the main reason ANYONE purchases the upgrade).  One would naturally assume that the text for the "Try" suggestions at the bottom would be a little larger also.  We have this Show not more than 7 feet from our couches in our family room, on our entertainment console, under our flatscreen.  It's ridiculous too think that we cannot read the "Try" suggestions because they are so small.  BTW, my (and my wife's) vision is 20-20.  At the very least, Amazon, allow us too change the font size for the "Try" suggestions.  This is an EASY FIX.  Come on, Amazon, THINK!
title: "Try" suggestions at bottom of screen still too small

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: S. Rittenhouse
content: The main reason I bought this device was to communicate Face to face with my elderly mother.  Unfortunately, the calls were constantly dropped (up to 10 times in a row), and the camera quality is poor.  I upgraded my mom to FIOS, and we have high speed internet, so I know the dropped calls were not due to wifi quality.  Also, the camera points upward, so if the device is on a table or counter, and someone is sitting on the opposite side of the room, all you can see is the top of their head and the ceiling, instead of seeing a panorama of the room.  I purchased the Facebook portal, and the camera and speakers are of much better quality.  The Echo Shows are being returned.
title: Calls Constantly Dropped; poor camera angle

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: George
content: I'm currently using both Echo Show and Google Home Hub/Lenovo Display. This one is very closed to perfect, but I'm ignoring youtube in this review since that have nothing to do with the actual product itself. It would be great if the home screen can rotate some photo/image of the day like the Google Home Hub can, it actually nicer to look at and not repetitive since it cycle differently every day. The Echo show just have some simple repeated artworks and cycle trending news, it gets old very quick. Unless you create your own album to let it cycle. Controlling lights is a bit unorganized when you have a large amount of smart lights in the house. The Google Home Hub have much better organization when it comes to linked smart home products. Though the 10.1" screen amazing, really great for kitchen use. Sound is MUCH better than other smart display, bass and sound are just really good for what it is. Amazon could really use some features from the Google home hub to improve the Echo, it's REALLY close to being the best in the market.
title: ALMOST Perfect

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Caitlin
content: For a speaker all around the sound could be better, with it behind the device, you can‚Äôt have it against a wall or anything it needs to be centered somewhere, I don‚Äôt want a big screen in the middle of a counter, I want it pushed back. It lags as well, all my other devices are great. I wish when looking for a recipe it showed them from all over google, instead if I want a specific one i find on my laptop or cellphone it won‚Äôt show me it, only ones Alexa suggests unless I go to internet and do it myself, but then it times out and won‚Äôt scroll or answer ‚Äúwhat‚Äôs next?‚Äù for you.
title: Expensive for not being perfect

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Craig Baumgartner
content: Home integration... can‚Äôt wait to get everything in the whole house connected and integrated! You need apps for all your components that you want to use and they need to be integrated with Alexa! Amazon installers and support were excellent and helped us hit the ground running... together with our builder Lennar the whole experience was superb and flowed easily through entire process... air conditioning temperature control, lights, security, music... all via voice command... I never would have expected the system to be so cool, fun and functional! What a fantastic experience... thank you to Jeff Bezos and Amazon developers for making an amazing product and experience and to both Lennar and Amazon for working together so well! Must also mention Amazon Support for the great follow-up support ( 3 months including onsite walkthroughs!!).
title: Heavenly!!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: curtis stroud
content: Not a fan of the compatibility with digitally broadcasted channels (it just sucks), sticks a bit trying to hit the two arrows for either navigational menu, does not work well with YouTube (which again sucks), I found it a bit difficult to find podcasts, and the most annoying thing is not understanding the voice command to link with my dot. I just want to play my Tank 100 (screwed and chopped)  and switch via voice commands. I have to disconnect then reconnect via the app to pair with my echo dot. Overall I like the product at the discount price. A dollar more, and I would have been pissed!!!  Now the sounds make me overlook some of the upgradable issues. PS - which I hope is a free patch.
title: Screen size is great and sound is amazing!! But huh

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Don B.
content: Display on the 10" Echo Show (2nd Gen) is great, sound is great, real world capabilities = not so great. Even an experienced user may get frustrated having to reword their questions a few different ways or you will get the "sorry I don't know that one" for a response from Alexa. I asked my google device the same questions and it finds the answer right away (without having to unnaturally rephrase my question a few times). If anyone tries the Echo Show's or anything else Alexa (yes it does have good capabilities)... you should ask common questions about what store is in your town but not the big stores like Home Depot, Walmart, etc. Try to ask in a natural way but you may have to rephrase it a few times for the answer. Try to ask about a local business in your city/town and decide for yourself if Alexa will meet your needs and expectations. You may find yourself almost knowing all the information from the way you have to rephrase the question. You will understand when you start using it for real word information. Hopefully, Amazon/Alexa folks are working hard but there is still a long way to go. Try... "Where is ______" and it might know the answer how far away it is inaccurately... BUT it doesn't know the business hours (Google does). Try... ask directions to a known restaurant in your town that you know has a chain in another city... you might get "sorry, I couldn't find what you're looking for" or the chain that is far away (Google knew the local one I wanted and also sent directions to my phone). Some pluses... If you ask about restaurants in your town, it will show and tell you the names of a few on the screen (but I question how many it really knows). If it knows a business, you will see the information on the screen such as address, logo, store hours and it will verbally tell you where it is and the store hours. If you want to like Alexa, do not use Google Home or Google Assistant. Once you do, you will start revealing the real world differences. I'd rate it 3.5 stars overall due to things being unnatural and not as fluent as the "other" device out there. Display is great.... I think if you let Amazon/Alexa KEEP your voice recordings/questions, the "voice recognition" would be 4 stars in a quiet environment but when you add in an A/C or a fan in the room it might not recognize as well unless you look at it and speak clearly and slightly louder. I hope this helps...but again, the Echo Show (2nd Gen) is great BUT has "Alexa" limitations you should be aware of.
title: Echo Show (2nd gen) is being held back by "Alexa" capabilities..

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Operational Necessity
content: For that skill alone any of these Alexa products are worth it to me.  Does still need work though - which will come in time.  Today, I asked her to tell me about a story that she was showing on the screen and at the bottom the screen it said "try asking about [this story]".  I did, and was told about a Mexican basketball player - nothing to do with the story in question.  I asked again and was told about something completely different - again, nothing to do with the story I was prompted to ask about.  I had to touch the story the next time it came around to actually see it.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal

Unplugging the cord from the wall didn't do it, but unplug the plug from the echo unit itself, count to 10 and it will miraculously fix the nonresponse problem. author: David S.
content: After a few months of use it remains to be good hardware with incomplete software. Almost all of our content comes from Amazon and I would expect it to work easily. Trying to get a movie to play can sometimes take forever. "Alexa, play Rouge One" "Sorry, I cannot find any services that can play Rouge One, A Star Wars Story. Try managing you video apps on the Alexa app" Constantly it will understand what you say but fail to get any content, whether movies or audio playlists. For a device that had a touchscreen it suggests you use the Alexa app on your phone almost half the time. The home screen is annoying and there are a few volume issues where you might get really surprised when Alexa speaks with much greater volume than the content playing. Bought two so we could let the kids video call my in-laws. Needing a smartphone besides mine too set that up was frustrating. This makes the first "family" device that only makes sense to have on the kitchen counter. Profiles and multiple users are terrible and it can only learn one voice per user account. Everything works great 20-30% of the time and it feels like a great purchase, but it's often frustrating. When we filled the house with the original echo we showed them off but this one is too buggy.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal

title: Screens keep dying just outside warranty period

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Steve Duran
content: The one thing I disliked was that there's not a way to physically block the camera.  I saw a model of the Echo Show 5 in a store, and it had a plastic lever that you could use to physically obstruct the camera.  This device has three buttons on the top - the one on the left mutes the microphone and "turns off" the camera.  I guess we're supposed to have faith that there's no way a hacker could interfere with that and access the camera anyway.  Fortunately I had a little dot-shaped sticker that covered it up perfectly.  The sticker doesn't seem to interfere with the device in any way - it continues to work perfectly. When I first set up the device and noticed the issue with the camera, I asked the device to show me how to control the camera.  It instead showed information from the web on how a camera works in general.  The device is constantly giving hints on things you can ask it to do.  Eventually it said I could ask it to take a selfie, and that's when I figured out how to test the camera.  The selfie didn't work - which was great.  I can always peel off the sticker if I decide to use the camera. I got the Amazon music subscription.  Now I can ask it to play albums.  Even if the album has the same name as a song on the album, it's smart enough to know to play the album and not the song.  It supports routines, so you can schedule things to run at a certain time.  It has a way that lets you customize it's answers to specific questions.  It seems to have the ability to access radio stations like CNN using TuneIn, but it can also access SiriusXM and iHeart Radio.  However, I think Google has an edge here - when you play a song on Alexa, that's it.  When you play it on Google, Google will play another song like it, and another, and another, allowing you to discover new music.  Alexa doesn't do that, at least not yet. Here's something I didn't expect - it supports Google Calendar better than Google does.  I have appointments coming in from my Outlook Calendar at work to my Google calendar on my phone.  Google Assistant can't see them, but Alexa can.  Isn't that weird? Now that we're on lockdown because of COVID, I can run my smart speaker without disturbing my co-workers, so this thing has been my constant companion throughout the day.  I love it.  News, music, podcasts, books, web searches, timers, even math calculations.  Surprisingly it supports timers, but not a stopwatch, so it can't time how long something takes. But wait, there's more!  Unsurprisingly, you can buy audio books on Audible and play them on the smart speaker and your smartphone, but not every book is released with an audio version.  What if it's just an e-Book?  In that case, Alexa can read it to you!  This means that you can purchase an e-Book, and have Alexa read it to you while you're walking your dog.  Right now eBook support is restricted.  I think it only works with Kindle and Audible. This is still a developing technology.  There are apps called "skills" available, but they sometimes have surprising limitations.  For example, there's a "work tomato" app to assist with time management.  Once you start it, you can't stop it and you have to let it run to it's conclusion, playing that annoying ticking sound the whole time.  Generally, there are rarely screen controls for apps, and least from what I saw.  From reading the feedback, the impression I got was that the limitations were from the Alexa platform, and not from the skill developer, which makes sense.  I'm thinking that over time the platform will get better, and the hardware I have now should be able to take advantage of that for some time. It's a totally awesome product.  I love it.  Get it, and put a sticker on the camera.
title: Great touchscreen display, sound quality, and Alexa integration

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: caweaver
content: This could have been a killer device.  With a fairly large 10 inch screen and improved sound over the majority of echo devices this had tons of potential.  Unfortunately Amazon missed the boat. Cons: No ability to reset device other than unplugging the device (seriously?!!!) No list of downloaded skills available on screen (must use secondary device such as cell phone) No options for display clock (even the spot and Show 5 have this) Limited media capabilities (can't access Netflix, Disney+, MLB.tv, etc.) Intrusive ads As their flagship Show device you would think this thing would be more intuitive.  It is actually less so compared to their mid-line products.  The Echo Spot has multiple options to display a clock where this does not.  The Show 5 comes with a lens cover.  The frustrating part is a lot of the shortcomings can all be improved with software updates.  I supposed someone in corporate thinks we'll rush out and buy the Echo Wall Clock since they refuse to implement a clock on this.  Lol, whatever. Pros: Better sound Displays security cameras via voice command Z-wave hub This device does have some good points.  Sound is improved.  I pretty much only use it to display our cameras.  For my needs, this device does not do enough to justify it over anything else on the Echo or Show line of products.  The screen is treated more as a novelty.  Don't get me started on the lack of skills that actually work.  So many (such as NBC) do nothing.  This skills store needs better regulation. So why and I so frustrated?  Because Amazon does make some decent hardware (FireTV line) and I was hoping this Show line would be good as well.
