If Amazon (hello Elias Saba) decides to merge the Show with the FireTV we will get a media device of the decade.  A portable FireTV with Alexa capability.  A device that actually makes good use of the screen.  A device that is actually sufficient for media consumption.  That's the endgame folks.  For now, just use your phone or tablet.  This device is lacking.
title: Frustratingly crippled

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Darken
content: I purchased the show to replace an echo dot and I wanted to use it to view my security cameras and make video calls.  It replaced the dot and has much better sound quality.  It falls short on video calling.  When trying to call someone from the show to an iphone it keeps picking up on the other persons echo.  It only works when the person is out of the house away from their echo dot.  It also seems like it only works if I first call the other person and tell them to open the Alexa app on their phone before I place the video call.  Useless.  Went back to FaceTime.  It also doesn‚Äôt give enough time for me to answer a call on the show. If you don‚Äôt answer in about 2 seconds it hangs up.  Now for the security camera.  I have Arlo cameras.  I can arm and disarm using voice commands.  That‚Äôs a nice feature.  You can say Alexa show me the driveway and then it takes several seconds for the video to show up but the picture is good.  The problem is that there is a huge delay.  The video is delayed sbout 10 seconds from the live view on my phone.  This is a problem because if I am watching the camera because I am expecting someone, I can see them park the car but the delay is so long that they are ringing the doorbell before the camera even shows them getting out of their car.  This product was a big disappointment.
title: Not Good for Security Cameras or Video Calling

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Brad
content: Works great for smart home functions and other random voice command stuff. Honestly haven't had it long enough to get the full effect. HOWEVER, if you are thinking of using it for anything that requires the screen to be on for more than 5-10 minutes at a time. DON'T. There is no way to turn off the screen sleep/timeout function. So if you are using to follow a recipe, better get it done before the screen goes to sleep. Watching a video? Better hope it's less than 5 minutes long. Amazon Music displays song lyrics...until the screen falls asleep after 5 minutes. Etc, etc, etc. It seems like, no matter what you are doing, if the screen is active, it will fall asleep after a very short period. I wish I had just purchased an Echo Dot...would have saved a ton of money and basically had the same level of satisfaction without the frustration. BTW...the screen timeout complaints have been around since the 1st generation release in 2017. That leads me to believe Amazon as no intention to fix this issue.
title: Sleep functions defeat the purpose of screen

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: jesuis
content: I'm new to "Alexa" and have only had it for a day.  There are some things that frustrate me.  I can't get Alexa to pronounce my name correctly.  Played spelling game and it started getting funky after a while (I'm an exceptional speller).  But when I played music on this thing, oh, tears in my eyes it was so beautiful.  Beats out my Bose surround speakers in my 17' ceiling room, and my portable Bose speaker.  It just shakes me.
title: Incredible sound!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: gamez807
content: I have several Alexa dots and an Alexa first generation. I bought the echo so that I could use to view my Blink X2 cameras and ring cameras. I love the simplicity that Amazon has made with integration of smart home devices and Alexa devices. The system is very easy to use very responsive and I am very happy with the Alexa echo and all Alexa products.I would highly recommend Alexa to everyone Who likes simple and reliable devices. Alexa Is what Apple is for the cell phones Alexa is simple easy to use and very dependable.
title: Alexa is AWESOME!!!!!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Paul
content: Although it does a lot, there are not enough games for kids to interact with the touch screen. I bought this for my son who has developmental disabilities,  to help with speech and cognitive abilities. Need more interactive activities, games which are touch screen sensitive.  For example, to play connect for you must say the location , such  as slot four, no visualization is present. On tic tac toe you must say the location such as  right column second space. If you could see it, the game would improve all learning styles. This would then become a great marketing device for those children with developmental delays but have the ability and understanding of how a computer or tablet works..
title: Need more touch screen intefaction

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Devin & Stephanie
content: Loving my Echo Show so far. I no longer have to take my tablet or my phone with me to the kitchen when cooking and I need a recipe all the while either eating battery life or having to wake either device up once they time out. My show is right there. I love the visual que and reminders on the display.  I have connected my Amazon Photos and created a show file with family pictures and fun quotes to cycle thru the home screen.  No complaints so far.  I'm looking forward to exploring more and hoping more features/apps are added. Pintrest would be AWESOME!!
title: Convenience in the kitchen!! Or anywhere!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Gerald L. Muffoletto
content: I really like being able to get the hourly temperature but the feel like is just a single hit. I would like having both the temperature and the feel-like temperature so I can plan my 30 mile bike ride. I would also like a double line picture of the hourly temperatures. The barking dog is great since I get to see my 3 dogs trying to find the dog intruders. I have not discovered how to get a string of dog sounds. Alexa sometimes does not understand me from 6 feet away and I repeat talking slower.
title: Tempature and Dog Barks

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Angela Clough
content: I am only giving this a 4/5 rating on everyone except for the sound quality because I believe that it should have more video for things like Fox News, CNN News, and other various news outlets.  When listening to videos Alexa should be smart enough on the Show to bring up videos.  If you ask your show to bring up Hulu, you should not have to click 18 things to bring it up.  If you ask it to bring up facebook it should bring it up.  I think there could be a lot more updates done to the show itself to integrate it to be more user friendly.  When you're hands are all sticky, or you're doing a dish full of dishes, the last thing you want to do is be touching things like youtube.  You want to be telling it what to do, and what... your Alexa SHOWING you... Duhhhhh!  My house is fulled with 18 alexa devices.  This is my most disappointing one.  This device needs upgrades!  I would also like to see updates made so it can FaceTime and DUO with other phones since it can call devices. The sound... AMAZING!
title: Alexa

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Shirley gahagan
content: Dislikes- It is not as easy to connect with other sm as r devices as I thought it would be, it is not as user friendly for someone with low technology skills. I cannot figure out how to connect to my ring doorbell camera? Likes- I do like the feature that shows lyrics to the songs I play, and the weather reports.
title: Some connections are complicated,  others are not!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: NOT amazed
content: I have been struggling with this POS for 2 years of having amazon support blame this POS's problems on everything except for their pisspoor engineering of 5G and Trump. Almost like clockwork, this along with ALL 6 of my echo devices, would "lose" the private network I had built just for my baby alexa. My IT guy proved it wasn't the 5G that was causing the problems, as he literally came in with a google equivalent and connected to the 5G that alexa said didn't exist. He then brought in an old hp with some odd antenna and connected to the 5G that alexa said didn't exist. He did the same with my laptop, then his laptop. He then ran through the full setup AGAIN with the show AND a dot, they both wouldn't connect to the 5G. So he tried the 2.4 G network.... well hoooleee sheep dip!! they ALL connected. He figured out the problem because he got sick and tired of charging me $100 for every visit to amazons POS echo's
title: NOT 5G COMPATIBLE!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Mike Tavares
content: I like this product a lot.  The integration with the Ring doorbell is great and the sound meets my expectations.  I like having my appointments show up on the home screen, so I don't miss doctors appointments and things like that. Works great for cooking and displaying multiple timers.  It is also nice to see the lyrics when playing music.  I wish there were more video options like Netflix, as opening the browser to load Netflix doesn't seem to work for me The design is compact enough and doesn't take up too much room.  I also like the weather skill big sky as it gives very detailed weather information. I haven't had any quality problems and the setup was very straight forward and easy.
title: Great Product for the Kitchen

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: RH
content: This was a gift that was apparently intended to replace FaceTiming on my iPad.  Picture quality of who we‚Äôre video chatting with is  probably a 7 out of 10 (FaceTiming was a 10).  Of greater concern to me is the device is not at all intuitive.  Every change must be done on the Alexa app on my phone‚Äîsuch as adding a contact to video chat with (not sure I did it correctly).  I even bought a book to help me, though it truly wasn‚Äôt the answer. I‚Äôm no slouch with tech‚Äînot a whiz either‚Äîbut these devices should be easier to use.
title: Meh...

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: T. Poet
content: Love everything about this, except it can't hear us unless we are standing right in front, and sometimes not even then. We have multiple Alexa devices in the home. There is an Echo in one bedroom and a dot in another on either side of our livingroom - both around corners. But, when in the living room, there is a much better chance one of the devices in another room will answer, not this one. Often the light comes on, but still, the one around a corner and behind the partially closed door answers. Frustrated. We've moved it, and the other devices and no luck, this one just defaults to one of the others, it would be fine if it was the other way around, we want this to be the primary. The good - touch screen, view screen, visual answers - love it all, but useless when it can't hear us.
title: View can't hear us

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Joseph White
content: This was delivered on Christmas eve. It worked great up until the other day when it lost contact with my wifi. I have tried everything to get this thing hooked back up but nothing works. I know the wifi is working because everything else in the house is good to go. I hate that I wasted my money on this. Do yourself a favor and save your money. Because of my review I got a call from Amazon customer service. A very nice young lady got me straightened out on exactly how the show works. It seems one of the buttons on top of the device is a mute button. I thought it was an on/off button. My bad. All is well now and I'm back to using my show. Thanks Amazon. Two thumbs up!!!
title: junk (update not junk)

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: patrick rosencrans
content: It's awesome don't get me wrong but it has a major issue that needs to be addressed by Amazon. The sound just stops working completely and needs to be hard reset. Some component inside the Echo Show Gen 2 is either overheating and shutting off or the power is being choked. Whatever it is it stops all sound from producing. I would open it up a reflow the solder or check the internal temps of some capacitors or transistors and see it if above operating temps but I don't want to void the warranty.  After research, this seems to be a common issue. Don't get me wrong it's amazing sounds fantastic when its working and it is a great buy. But the only fix is get a new one and they stop working after a while.
title: Sound stops working at least once a week

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: jd
content: I have 5 echo dots and this is my 2nd echo show (the first being the 1st gen). This new one is extremely buggy! If I ask for sports update, I'm lucky for one of the team's logo to actually show up. There are numerous others, which I would express directly to Amazon, which leads me to my next major concern: There is zero option to provide feedback on what works and what doesn't. Unlike other products, there is seriously no effort on behalf of Amazon to report bugs in order to improve their product. It seems as all the focus is on selling as many as possible, with no focus on actually improving the product or taking feedback from customers/bug reports. This is the last 'Echo/Alexa' device I will ever purchase.
title: Extremely buggy; no channel for reporting bugs/feedback

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: dogmarcopolo
content: To me the software is so buggy seems like it was pushed out before testing was finished. Specifically: 1. Do not disturb doesn't work. At first it refused to set the time. Then it would immediately go into that mode even outside the specified time period. The issue was discussed in various forums and couldn't find a solution yet. 2. Photo slideshow doesn't work either. Uploaded my photos to prime photos and specified fast (2 seconds) for slideshow. The picture doesn't change for minutes! After waiting a while for it to finally changed a couple times, it stuck and stopped! How can functionality so basic failed so miserably? update 11/7/2018 ---------------------- decided to revise my rating from 2 to 4 stars based on the following: 1. received phone calls and email from Amazon customer service after just a few hours leaving the comment with offer to help. surprised by the speed and appreciate the sincere effort. 2. after letting the device sat overnight, the 'do not disturb' feature started to work and the slideshow is behaving better (still slow, but at least work consistently). i suspected the device came with old software and were updated constantly in the background. so you might want to let it sit for a while before exploring the features seriously.
title: Really disappointing! (updated with new information)

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Nathan Olson
content: You have to mostly figure it all out on your own.  The is no user manual that comes with it and none that you can download for free.  It sounds nice and looks good and can do some neat things.  You can turn your light on and off, but the scenes don't work very well.  To dim or brighten you may have to tell it a percent amount, and just forget about any color scenes for your lights, it doesn't know that.  But it can do math and act as an egg timer.  I'm sure it does other stuff too, but like I said there is no manual for the thing.
title: No user manual

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Michael A Davis
content: I really tried... I liked being able to play amazon prime and hulu, but quickly learned that asking for a timer would drop me out of the video and not resume it, oh and trying to pick a specific episode is an exercise in frustration. Not too useful in a kitchen. I liked having a screen that displayed photos in my kitchen that I hadn't seen in years, but then I noticed they would play in order with no sorting options. I liked seeing my upcoming events, but having an all-day event display all day in the center of the screen seems excessive. I really liked the improvement in sound quality... I was willing to work with it, and then, like so many others here, it rebooted suddenly while playing a video and when it came back, there was no sound. I followed the instructions to reboot, no sound, rebooted again and again, no sound. Finally I did a factory reset. And then I realized I had just spent 2 hours of my life messing with a glorified speaker with a screen and I had only had this device for less then 2 weeks... So I'm done. I hope they actually start fixing this thing. It could be useful, but they've lost me. Not sure I'll continue investing given the advances from google and the overall device usability from apple (side note, a 32 gb ipad is on sale for 250...kinda makes the regular price of this kinda sad). And as a final kick, did the trade in an old echo thing, hadn't sent it yet. So, to cancel, I'll be charged 5 more dollars until they get this junk back...just kinda bugs me. I realize it will work out in the end (if my return is processed), but it bugs me to be charged any more money for this waste of my time.
title: Slower than a 1st gen echo (original echo). The sound will cut out, good luck getting it back

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: DrewK
content: I can‚Äôt believe this gets decent reviews.  My $30 Amazon Dot works better.  Why, I have no idea.  The interface is counterintuitive and clunky.  Sound quality is decent but in a ‚ÄúBose‚Äù bass heavy kind of way.  I‚Äôll use it as a cookbook, for music in the kitchen, as a timer, and to check the time and weather.  Other than that, it gets confused too easily.
title: Nice screen, counterintuitive and clunky interface

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Sidewinder
content: I received my new Echo Show today. I had no idea it was impossible to play Netflix on an Echo Show. The sound quality is good, the picture quality is good, and I like a lot of the features, but the unit is kneecapped by its inability to play Netflix, whether through a Netflix application or through Silk or Firefox, which are the browser options. I watch Prime Video, and I subscribe to Prime Music, but the lack of ability to run Netflix is a deal breaker for me. I am very disappointed because otherwise the unit is just what I wanted.
title: You cannot watch Netflix on the Echo Show

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: reidmylips2001
content: I use the Echo Show in my kitchen. I love it for recipes & how-to videos. I connected my doorbell camera, so I can easily see who is at the door, while I‚Äôm cooking, or if I can‚Äôt get to my phone. I can also video chat with my contacts. There are countless skills I am learning, daily. The speaker is great for music or video & even has a nice equalizer. Since it‚Äôs located in the kitchen, I bought a nice swivel stand to keep it above any spills. This thing is fun & I look forward to learning all it will do.
title: So glad I bought this!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Matt Sturgis
content: Order on Prime day. Received and set up only to have the sound stop working. Received a replacement same issue. Alexa will work and respond to commands, but literally no sound. Only fix is to erase all settings and set back up. About 12 hours later.. Same thing. Great idea, poor execution.
title: Doesn‚Äôt work

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Marcos
content: I initially liked the device but with time the voice recognition has gotten worst. I have to basically yell at it to get it to listen. Lastly, I‚Äôve had it for 15 months and the monotheism AFTER the warranty expires the device started rebooting randomly and it continues to do so. I called Amazon to see if they could help me, but they said they would take 15% off a new one. After spending $230 for this device, I don‚Äôt want 15% off a new one. I want a replacement even if it‚Äôs refurbished. *sigh*
title: Amazon not willing to back it

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: LaChama
content: This product is used to provide a display to the Ring camera. The ability to shut off the internal camera and microphone is a big plus. Not being able to turn off motion sensors and the targeted ads is a detriment to the system. Technically, the product does met its design intent, an description. My concerns here are security, privacy, and influence; these are not included in the product description. The always-active motion sensor supplying Amazon's AI algorithms with more pattern-of-life data about a specific-known individual. The continuous targeted ads allow Amazon to exert some influence on your buying. A software update that allows for turning off these two features would be a great benefit, and return some control back to the user.
title: Pay for Amazon Ad

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: John
content: This is a mixed bag; I want to like the Echo Show so badly, but I'm having some major issues. To start with the bad points, if the music volume is over 50%, I can put my mouth 3 inches from the microphones and scream the wake word as loud as possible and it doesn't seem to hear a word I say. How can it be so much worse than my regular Echos, which can hear me say the wake word from across the room with my music playing almost as loud as it can go? I've tried different locations to see if that would help, but it hasn't. After using it for about a week the sound completely went out.  It showed that music was playing, or indicated it was speaking, but no sound would come out. I had decided I had received a bad unit and was ready to ship it back when I found other people on the internet who were having the same problem. Turned out that if you pull the plug out from the back of the unit (but not the wall) it resets itself and you get volume back. The problem hasn't shown itself again. Then about a week later the Echo Show started responding very slowly, or not at all. The display would not power up when detecting someone nearby like it had when I first got it. Unplugging it and plugging back in has seemed to lessen the problem. The Echo Show is definitely sluggish in responding to many actions. There's a noticeable delay after pushing a button or making a request that the action happens. Seems like a faster processor would solve a lot of that. I big gripe on not only this Echo Show, but also my regular Echos is the inability to set Alexa's speaking volume separately from media volume. If I have had music playing loudly the next request I make Alexa responds so loudly it can wake the entire household. On the plus side, the sound quality is very good. Out of the box, the bass sounds somewhat boomy and muddled, but with the sound controls most of that can be eliminated. I'm still adjusting it, and it seems my adjustments for one type of music don't sound so good with other types. Custom presets for the type of music might be helpful. The screen looks great! I was concerned initially because the specs weren't that great compared to some of the other devices I regularly use, but in practice it's bright and clear. The unit itself is nicely designed and looks like a quality piece of equipment sitting on my countertop. To sum up, overall the Echo Show does what you would expect it to do. It looks and sounds nice, but the big issue with it not hearing the wake word when loud media is playing is close to a deal-breaker. I have music playing almost constantly on it, and it not being able to detect me speaking is huge.  There's enough I like about it that I'm keeping it in hopes Amazon releases an update that will improve its hearing.
title: Echo Show Doesn't Hear Wake Word If Music Volume Is Over 50%

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Dave Parker
content: Just got this last night and we couldn't be happier.  We were going to go with the Echo Show 8 but the Amazon Days deal was too good to pass up for the Echo Show 10. The large screen is perfect for viewing our security cameras and the sound quality is amazing. Plenty of features and all of our skills from our echo dots work even better now. We can control everything from the touchscreen or by voice.  There are plenty of high quality skills for screensavers as well. Video calls also work great Great! Overall, a really great item! Highly recommend if you already have echo and want to upgrade to one with a screen.
title: Excellent item. Large screen is amazing. Sound quality, very nice!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Kendell P.
content: So for some perspective, I am an Echo, 2 Echo dots, and now an Echo Show. I have purchased much more for gifts. Black friday I decided to get a google home mini for $20.00. Wow, it blows Alexa out of the water. Answers every question unlike Alexa that gives me I am not sure or the wrong answer. For example, I asked Alexa how do I defrost frozen fish? Alexa show gave me recipes for defrosted fish???? Google told me how how to defrost in the fridge or the method for a quicker defrost. I think about all the money I have spent on amazon devices and now my go to is a $20 goggle mini.
title: Would like a do over

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: YOGI-BEAR
content: The all new look and feel of the newest Echo Show (2nd/generation) along with its awesome speakers and screen clarity is amazing!  I can‚Äôt wait to purchase several more for my guest bedrooms. Thank you, Amazon for an AWESOME product!
title: I‚ÄôM BLOWN AWAY!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: A Christy
content: I have the original show and I knew my parents would love one, so I bought a new generation of it for their house. I now have total jealousy over this large and beautiful screen. Works great and a side by side comparison shows no loss of sound power from first to second gen at all. Super easy to set up, very intuitive too. Even my elderly parents are loving all those features. Bonus....since I commute between my house and theirs, I'm never out of touch and can see my house via all my shows, spots, and show 5. Perfect!
title: Superb...love the bigger screen.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: TheTerrorBeyond
content: This device has very limited functionality.  If Amazon would have made this a self-contained FireTV, they would have had a winner, but, as it stands, this device is crippled and basically pointless.  The fact that you cannot install things like PLEX onto the device to access your media server is a complete deal breaker.  Applications such as Hulu, while functional, are crippled on this device as well. AMAZON: Make a standalone FireTV and I will buy one, but this one has already gone back.
title: Not what I hoped or expected

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Jason H
content: I already had the original show and have been very happy with it, but received this one as a gift. Tried justifying the need for a second show in the house and almost exchanged for credit. Glad I didn't. I was curious about the larger screen being too big for our kitchen but its pleasantly a nice fit. The speaker on this thing is out of this world for such a small unit. We like to play music throughout the entire house via all of the dots and shows in the various rooms, but this thing can pretty much eliminate the need for all over speakers. :) Very nice product which I am happy with!
title: Awesome

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Brian Mintel
content: Very disappointed that the time out of 30 seconds cannot be turned off. When I use my smart home to view my cameras, it does not pull it from my local LAN, it goes out to ring.com. It should connect through my local Wi-Fi.  For people who don‚Äôt have the best Internet connection in rural communities, going out to the Webb to view cameras makes them pixelated. When I view the cameras through my Ring app on my iPhone it uses the local lan. I‚Äôm going to return this device. Hopefully the third generation will be better.
title: 30 second timeout and timeout watching cameras

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: gmark99
content: Installation was effortless.  The sound quality is great.  It's inconspicuous when not used.  Having a screen is a lot more useful than I thought.  I expected it to be an unnecessary gimmick, but I use it particularly with the Ring security cameras.  I just bought a new Cadillac with their voice recognition system and while it's a great car, the voice recognition pales in comparison to alexa.  So I got another alexa for the car.  But this with the screen is very nice.  Not a luxury.  You need this.  It replaces a lot of other crap you might buy.
title: More useful than expected!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: S. Martin
content: Nice item for the kitchen. Alexa seems to be improving. This set up and worked with our Ring Door bell for about 24 hours, also worked with our IP camera's via the Monoclecam app for about the same time. Now will not connect to either. I spent a long time on chat with Alexa Support and they couldn't get it to work either. So they claim it is the Echo's fault and are sending me a new one. I will try to update this when I received the new one. We will probably keep it whether it works with Ring and cameras or not.
title: Nice sound, good screen. Worked with Ring for about 24 hours

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Yvonne Knight
content: I have a son with sever short term memory problems. For years I have tried to find a way to set reminders for him so he gets ready for his job and is waiting for his ride on time. My daughter in law suggested the Echo/Alexa. I chose the Echo/Alexa Show. I just received the Echo/Alexa a few day ago. I will report back later to review the performance. For now, the set up was easy. Alexa speaks the reminders as well as displays them on the screen. I have also discovered Smart Light Bulbs. I will also report on how Alexa works with the bulbs. At this point I know they were easy to set up as well and seem to be a good accessory to the Alexa.  More to come.
title: This is amazing

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: JLopez
content: Not worth the money. I bought it so I could get my ring alerts and communicate with anyone at the door since my office is upstairs. I was hoping I could also use it to stream but it doesnt allow you to add apps. It only has hulu and prime. I also thought I could watch online streaming but it goes to sleep mode. It's frustrating when she doesnt understand a command and I have to keep going to the alexa app. I'm comparing it to my fire cube and alexa works great on that device. I should have just stuck with my phone or my fire tablet. I'm keeping it for my daughter to have access to motion detection notifications since she doesnt own a phone.
title: Not worth it

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Shelly K
content: I bought 2 of these on a Black Friday deal for our adult children. They love them! Decided to get one for our home so we can video chat since we have a new grandbaby. I was all set to order, when I decided to do a quick google search. I actually found this at Best Buy for $70.00 less, with a free Echo Dot, and free 2-day shipping. I order A LOT from Amazon and consider myself a loyal customer, but, obviously, chose the much better BB deal. I don‚Äôt understand why Amazon sells its own devices for so much more!
title: Great device, but shop around

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Jose Quintero
content: Me gusta todo pero no est√° el idioma espa√±ol incluido y las personas que vienen a casa no podemos compartir con ellos y dicen que si no entiende espa√±ol no les gusta
title: Tiene que entender espa√±ol, a√±adir en settings

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Stacy K Lewis
content: I won this at a company event, so the price was definitely right.  I have echo dots on my wish list, so this was super sweet!  The volume is AWESOME!  I've tried a few different wireless speakers and unless you spend a fortune, your music never gets loud.  This certainly does!  Since I'm not fully integrated into "Amazonland" with all the products, I really haven't explored all the features.  It's awesome to listen to my music while cooking, set timers with voice commands and find my phone when I inevitably lay it down somewhere.  Looking forward to getting a few of the dots and seeing how this product works with my Fire Stick.  So far, a fun product.
title: Great volume and it finds your phone!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: James K. Warner
content: So was on the verge of sending back because of being unable to turn off the "Try..." this and that stream of message rotating at the bottom of screen. Super annoying, as many have commented. However I got on a creative track, and eventually put black tape over the bottom of the screen, until just above the constantly appearing messages. Does not seem to require the sacrifice of much screen real estate, and blends in well with my black frame. Simile! Smile! Set my own picture background, with the time, and the temperature with a cloud in upper corner. Love the addition of  more names to get the assistant's attention; and being a Star Trek person, love saying 'Computer'.
title: Work-around to "Try..." unstoppable stream of messages.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Michael
content: I just unboxed and set-up my 2nd Gen Echo Show, this device sounds...AMAZING!!! Set-up was a breeze, took, all of 10 minutes with a new software update download and install. Ordered it via the Amazon mobile app, it was on sale for $179, I was prompted to trade in my 1st Gen Echo Show for $45 and then received an instant $30 gift card making the total investment $113 I originally wanted the Apple HomePod, but at $350 plus AppleCare and taxes, $400 was just too much for me to consider investing in a smart speaker. This device is worth every penny and I‚Äôm so glad I was able to snag it at such an attractive price point. Cheers.
title: Best Echo Device Yet

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Josh Mcpheron
content: Alexa show has been one of the best purchases we have made lately so many functions! Not to mention our little ones are able to ask Alexa to play Disney music all day!! Nothing better than hearing the sounds of ‚ÄúI just can‚Äôt wait to be king‚Äù blaring through out our kitchen and living room while our littles are dancing and giggling!! Also love that I can access time, temp, reminders, set timers, and have recipes right at the command of my voice in the kitchen and all visible on the screen at the same time!! I highly recommend this product!
title: Love love love this product!!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: WS
content: the Echo Show limits the display of any connected cameras to 10 minutes then automatically goes back to displaying the homescreen. you cannot set it to display the camera for a longer period of time or until you tell it to stop. part of the reason I got this device was to use it as a nursery & playroom camera monitor, but with the 10 minute absolute limit that is really not feasible.  hopefully this will be added as an option in a future software update. otherwise I am finding little use for the screen and would have just stayed with the echo dot.
title: very limited function for displaying nursery/security cameras

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Zipperhead
content: there has been a complaint about the fact that this device closes the silk browser every five minutes for over a year.  There response was it is not for browsing get a tablet.  That is NOT SATISFACTORY!  This would make a great kitchen addition if they would  allow you to turn off the browser timeout so you could keep a recipe on the screen.  Until they fix that, DON‚ÄôT BUY IT.  Buy an cheaper android tablet instead.
title: Allow users to turn off the silk browser time out.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: J M Gerkman
content: I've got Echo's (Gen1, Dots, Tap, all except Show) all over my house and figured I'd add an Echo Show to the Kitchen.  Seemingly nice addition, but realized fairly quickly that the screen is really rather useless.  I ask it to search for recipe for dinner for instant pot...only searched one site...great (sigh).  Got more specific and asked for my favorite vegetarian chili mac recipe for instant pot...couldn't find it because it only searches one site (and nothing else).  Tried to watch some videos which wasn't very intuitive...also a fail. I mean, it's a touch screen, so theoretically it's like a tablet, right?  Um...no. If you just want visual output for Alexa, then this device is it.  If you want anything else, including something which can make managing your life or home easier, then you might consider the Google Home Hub or even a inexpensive tablet instead.
title: Screen seems like a nice addition but very poorly utilized

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: wes68
content: There isn't enough granularity in sound volume - there are only 10 levels of volume. There should be at least twice as many. Also, Alexa voice volume is considerably louder than media (music) volume at every level, and it's uncomfortable. Other than that - the device required getting used to, and getting to know it. It's actually not bad.
title: Could use more volume levels

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Kelly A. Wellman
content: Love it. Easy set up. Works like my echo. What I love is .. shows the words to music. I have my very own karaoke machine. What I don‚Äôt like is it did not come with a manual to help navigate all of the features. I feel like I am just going in circles because I don‚Äôt know where or what to look for. I purchased two shows.. one for my son‚Äôs family and one for me so I can see my two grandchildren that live out of town. Just waiting for him to plug it inüòÄüòä I also what to use it for recipes storage and viewing but don‚Äôt have any idea of where to look.
title: Need instruction of all the features and benefits.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Dawn
content: I love it! With the exception you can't and apps or use netflix and you tube easily and theres no search engine like google. These features would make it not only perfect but the most useful tool I'd have at home. I have my own recipes I don't put on the internet like all recipes cause they're my recipes and I don't want to share them with the world and since I don't I can not access them with Alexa. But if we could add apps....I could download my app I save my personal recipes to and access them.
title: Needs to be able to add apps and use netflix and you tube and a search engine

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: WVH
content: Great sound quality. I have six Alexa's and this one delivers the best sound yet.  Also, to have a screen is very valuable for many applications.  Instead of using just a regular doorbell we installed the ring system with camera which is connected to Echo Show.  From now on we can see who is at our front door.  Great addition to all the other Alexa's we already have.
title: Great Alexa addition!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Bob
content: It took much longer to receive the Echo show and dot.  When I did receive I did the hook up and did not have any major problems connecting to my internet.  It was when I was trying to listen to the show play a tutorial that the sound was like a whisper. I also asked Alexa a question and she was barely audible.  Volume was all the way up. Called service and through their phone issues I tried to follow their instructions but audio was worse than my show.  I could not get manager.  Called back and found out that they were having phone issues.  Found that audio on music was ok but terrible on Alexa . This unit was definitely dead out of the box and I should have been offered a new product immediately but  that was not the case so I asked for a return and full refund. It is a shame because I do believe that the unit would deliver what I was looking for in my home but spending  two hours trying to get service is just not worth it. And you have so little in hard instructions to do your own trouble shooting.
title: Technology without good customer service is only a stress maker

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Ren√©e
content: I‚Äôm not sure how I feel about my new Echo Show yet... Great - video AWESOME- sound LOVE - when song comes up with lyrics (Karaoke style) Sad - That when I ‚Äútap‚Äù on a song (previously listened to) in history, it doesn‚Äôt always bring up the RIGHT song and Lyrics don‚Äôt play Sad - Can not shop with Alexa, the way I would like LOVE- Recipe- previews, videos, ease of saving Hate - Can not seem to bring up Recipes by search ‚Äúshow me Hors d‚Äôoeuvres recipes‚Äù ‚Äúparty appetizers‚Äù or any other thing I ask for (other than ones,  Alexa shows across my screen) Apps ? Skills? I‚Äôm still so confused... I WANT to love love love... but ease of use,  seamless between products and voice recognition seems to have a way to go ...
title: Pluses and minuses- still haven‚Äôt decided

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: advanprin
content: The speaker system is really great ... I love the sound.  I've ordered a stand and I'm hoping that will help with angling it for phone calls ... sometimes you have to pick it up to get the right angle, but that's not a huge issue. The reason we purchased the Show was for video calls with our son who lives out of state and that has been awesome!  The call quality (video and audio) is great.  My main problem is that it gets "stuck" while rotating through my photos in the background so I have to unplug it and then plug it back in. I'm not sure if this issue is the Show or my phone or our WiFi ... but, so far that's my biggest complaint. Overall I love the Show!
title: Excellent Product ... No Major Problems

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Me
content: Bought this for wife to be able to watch tv in kitchen.. Remodel done and calling up a channel from recast on this is horrible, and if fire tv is on they send the channel to that device. Channel names are mess and alexa can't recognize them. Would send back but we are now a week outside the return window since I bought this during reconstruction, to keep wife happy.  Guess I'll go buy a tablet so she can see the tablo and watch things that way. Amazon.. you really messed this one up.
title: Don't get to watch stuff with recast

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Sarah S.
content: I have been extremely happy with my echo dot and echo spots and was hoping the echo show would be on par. I got this for my bedroom and was excited about the video compatibility with Prime video and Hulu. Almost every time I ask Alexa to play something on Hulu or Prime video, I get a response that my request is not supported or it acts like it is going to bring up the video, then it just goes back to the home screen. The touch screen when trying to play video that way is extremely slow at responding as well, and often does the same thing...returns to the home screen after a few seconds. I thought it might have been a WiFi issue, but I have tried on both the 5gh and 24gh networks and even placed a WiFi booster in the room to ensure I had a strong connection. Still the same issues. Pretty disappointed.
title: Good sound, poor video performance.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Doug Martin
content: Set up was very easy and we have been enjoying the Echo Show in our kitchen.  I have used it to get recipes, listen to music, watch videos, watch Hulu TV, and monitor our Ring devices.  I can watch the video live from our Ring Door Bell and back yard camera any time, or see who is at the door.  The sound is surprisingly full and the bass exceeds my expectations. I may buy one for my father so we can have video calls.  The scrolling news, stock market info, and sports scores is pretty cool as well.
title: Great addition to our Echo device home network!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Reviewgirl
content: This is my second echo show. It was DOA. Returned. Scared to even use Amazon products after this....
title: Dead on arrival

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Stephen L. Stewart
content: I have purchased a number of Echo's over the past few years and have the first generation show and love it.  This second generation puts everything to  shame.  It is stunning!  The picture and sound quality are incredible.  You could actually use the second generation show as a beside television.  I do.  I will be buying additional Echo Show's as upgrades for the other rooms in my house.  It is a wonderful product and if you sit down and learn all it can do, It can actually make your life easier.  I use Echo for all my lights, alarms, cameras, intercom, music, shows, news, cooking, etc.  It takes times and the purchase of other products to do some functions, but well worth it.  I just love the new Echo Show.  Thank you Amazon.
title: WOW!  Just amazing

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Keith
content: My sub and all lows have gone out completely on this device. It used to sound pretty decent. I bought the device 15 months ago. It is only under warranty for 12 months so I am stuck with something that I can‚Äôt listen to music on. Which was the primary reason for purchase.
title: Lows completely out of Echo Show

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Renuka Anand
content: Alexa is like a helpful assistant which is pre-programmed to do a lot of small inane things like weather, news, give insights, play music, photos, etc. But the biggest disappointment is the lack of seamless integration to videos, existing social media accounts (amazon has none) and most importantly US centricity - all the claims works if you are paid customers of some of Amazon's favourite partners. If you are not too bad for you - you can help Alexa fine tune its AI capability by banging your head trying to get stuff which frankly somebody sitting in a backoffice is trying to help Alexa understand and program for future consumers. Be ready for many "I don't understand" and then keep worrying whether it is picking up private stuff as a trade off for your effort to help amazon become better.
title: A cute device which is still work in progress

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: G E B
content: We traded in an Echo 2nd Gen for the Show 10 and are very, very pleased with the upgrade. Visual + audible responses are more than 2x better than audible alone. The Show 10 looks great in our kitchen and continues a larger great smart device experience with our Show 8, two Echo Spots, and 4 Echo Dots.
title: Echo Show 10 a Super Device

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: GregL
content: It was packaged well and functions great! We enabled Hue Lights by Philips. They are excellent! Routines are easy to build. I get up and say Alexa, good morning and a strategic lights come on. No need to stumble through a dark house. End of day I say, "Alexa, good night." and all the lights are turned off. I've also set a programmable timer (WiOn) to control snow melting mats on the stairs to be controlled by voice. The information and 'Skills' are amusing and some are actually helpful. We can 'drop-in' on our grandkids 900 miles away. Easier than a Skype call. Just say, "Alexa, drop in on NAME." and we have video call. Love it so far.
title: Easy Setup, Excellent Sight and Sound

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: daughter of Anna
content: I bought the Echo Show premium 10 to be able to communicate with my 90 year mother, who has dementia.  She is not able to pick up or hang up any phone.  Neither is she able to touch an Echo screen to accept a call.  However the Drop In feature allows me to pop in and we can see eachother's faces and talk.  She is lock down in covid 19 quarantine in asst living and so this has been a blessing for 2 weeks. However there is a bug that hasnt resolved.  I drop in from my Alexia app on my tablet from my home, and it says that her Video is off.  When we check her device settings, it is turned on.  The only thing that helps is to unplug it, wait and then replug.  However I need the caretakers to go up to her room to do this for me.  When I was calling her on the phone, I was dependant upon the caretakers and that is why I bought the Echo. I found that this glitch has been reported since Feb 2018, and here it is 7/20/20 and still there.  Here are the people who have complained about this: https://www.amazonforum.com/s/question/0D54P00006zSqjzSAC/drop-in-camera-not-working-on-show I do love the radio feature, where I can create a number of radio channels through the Routine and skills.  I am able to activate them throughout the day from my App, so she has a variety.  She listens well, but doest watch tv.  As a remote controlled radio, it is an awesome device for someone with dementia.  It also has very excellent speakers.  However it is pretty expensive device for just the radio.  I only gave the rating a 3 star because the radio is awesome, but the video feature is a 0.
title: There is a glitch with "Drop In" so that the camera is not on

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Jana D
content: Purchased Echo Show for Mom, in her late 80's, virtually deaf & not tech savvy, specifically to pair with Ring doorbell and solar cams to  view the perimeter of her property from inside her home. While not electronics savvy, she has quickly learned how to use the simple commands, "Alexa, show me..." She would not be able to operate a computer or mobile device for other types of security systems, so Echo Show turned out to be a fantastic option without breaking the bank. The video image is decent for our purposes, and of course relies on the signal strength of your wifi (Spectrum in this case). Have not tried with Prime video, nor any other feature available. The suggestions at the bottom of the screen are confusing to Mom, but she's learned to ignore them.
title: Great Video Option for a Senior Who is Not Tech Savvy

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: William A. H
content: It works like an echo dot but has video for some things.  I was expecting there to be more video related apps.  You would think it would be easy to pull up a weather forecast and see a radar image.  No not really.  Hopefully YouTube will be an app soon now that Google and Amazon are working out their issues.  Amazon video works well.  No Netflix either.  Music sounds nice.  If you are on the taller side a tilting stand is pretty much a must have to be able to view the screen and touch it easily.  The on screen keyboard is meant for you to use it while you are holding it which is odd.
title: Nice but thought it would be more visual

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Kenneth Puent
content: I like the Show a lot and it‚Äôs great having it upstairs and being able to see my ring is great! I control everything from the lights to the Echos throughout the house. The one thing I really wish is that it had a deeper bass and could provide a little more kick when using it as the music source for the room. That truthfully applies to all the Echo products cause I have them all and even when they are all playing at once it still just seems like I set cell phones in each room and hit play. Hope that makes sense. Just better speakers in the Echo, echo dot, and echo show.
title: Great Screen and easy to use needs better speakers

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Janice C.
content: Hello, bit of an early adopter here. I purchase an original Echo back in the day and enjoyed it. When the first Shows came out, I purchased one but returned it. I found the ‚Äúscreen management‚Äù features off-putting and went back to the Echo. Cue to present time, the Echo finally gave out, one day it just wouldn‚Äôt wake up. So, the subject of this reviewed was ordered. It does everything it‚Äôs supposed to but, I still returned it. I found the sound to be unsatisfactory, probably due to the speakers residing on the back of the device. The sound of the original Echo was better, IMO. Unfortunately, the display is still a dealbreaker for me. I can‚Äôt turn off the endless succession of try this, watch that. Perhaps it‚Äôs not a software design flaw but another way for Amazon to raise revenue. So, I ordered a Studio. My review of that resides in the Studio review area.
title: Not for me.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Jeremy
content: This thing is awesome.  I love being able to watch Hulu in the kitchen w/o bothering my husband while he naps on the couch in the living room!  The apps (like SideChef) are great for cooking... picture by picture instructions so mistakes are a thing of the past.  The music sounds AMAZING!!!  The bass is outstanding and really fills a small/medium sized room very well.  The Echo Show (2nd gen) is seriously worth every penny!!!!!
title: Couldn't Love it More!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Lunacy
content: So up till now all we had were Echo Dots and Echos in the house. This was our first screened device and we love it! It's bigger on the shelf then I imagined in my head which is a good thing! It has plenty of room in there for the speakers and the screen and the speakers sound GOOD. Alexa and I are still working out my wake up routine but the alarm on, lights dimmed on, and music video starting up is a great way to start my day.  It works great with the Wyze cameras we have around the house and for video calls too!
title: Sounds good, looks good, I want another.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: GTnH
content: The Show Gen 2 has a very good screen and pretty good sound quality.  I have to take off as star because it has one glaring defect and that is that the screen timeout is not adjustable and the screen doesn't stay on when doing a task if it times out.  For example I am running three timers.  With the screen on all three show up, but then suddenly the screen times out and only one timer shows up.  Also while it can be used as a picture frame it is relatively short-lived and it cannot be changed.
title: Great Screen and Good Sound

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: jackintx
content: I bought the Show 2nd. Gen to replace my old Echo Show.  This unit is much better than the first because of its screen.  The Bluetooth connectivity is little better than the first.  My first Echo Show keep disconnecting my Bluetooth speakers. The sound still needs more help.  For better sound, I still need to connect my speakers to it.  This 2nd. gen Show do have better voice recognition than the original.  I would give the 1st. generation Echo Show a D & the second generation a C or 3 Stars.
title: Better Than 1st. Gen

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Douglas Rinehart
content: Tried wyze and blink cameras with Alexa ‚Ä¶ always a "BUFFERING" issue.  So Amazon's explanation is low bandwidth internet.  Hey ‚Ä¶ don't need it to stream over the internet just need it to stream in the house, on the same wifi router, direct.  The camera apps for each camera stream just fine, but Alexa has to do something "special" so it reports buffering with occasional video coming through. I love the Alexa functions and capabilities but it does not provide a decent streaming display.
title: streaming video is terrible

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: lois
content: Main use for me was to monitor cameras. Device unable to return to previous screen if WiFi blinks. If it buffers it does not recover and the screen returns to home. No battery so if I move it, I must start over. Too much hassle. Wanted a device were the screen would stay were I placed it. Liked the large screen . Picture good. Weight good for stability. Wish there was an app store for all apps so I could see my professional hard wired cameras not on amazon's list. Alexa skills are good but in my opinion apps allow more choices.
title: I want it all !

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: James Gray
content: Echo Show is so much nice to have around than just the regular Echo device because I can see the time and date on the screen any time I look at it, for one. Also, I enjoy being able to watch videos and see my photos, the weather and so much more. It's just icing on the Echo cake. I wouldn't go back to using the standard Echo again. I definitely recommend that you give this a try and not to mention you can make payments through Amazon instead of paying for it all at once if need be. So give it a try and I'm sure you'll agree with me and wonder why you didn't get this one to start with!
title: Much better than regular Echo

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: RC
content: I am totally impressed. I bought the Echo Show and I thought it would take numerous hours, a few headaches, and some curse words to get it set up. Let me say, it was one of the easiest things I have done with computers in a long time. To be transparent, I only have 3 smart home devices (SONOS, Echbee, and Rachio). They all linked within minutes of me initiating the process. Note, I had to download the app and link the above devices manually. Alexa was not able to add them through voice command. However, it was easy and worked perfectly after being linked. This is my first go at a smart home and I am super pleased.
title: WOW!!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Bryan H
content: I got this for FREE with a cyber Monday purchase I made and I don't even want it. This thing is terrible... I don't even keep it plugged in anymore because it isn't worthy of using electricity. Do not buy this. I love tech and was more than willing to give this a shot, but its just garbage. Save yourself the aggravation and just get a Fire HD 10 tablet instead. Pros: - Decent speakers Cons: Just about everything. - It is heavy and oddly shaped - Touchscreen is useless since you need to ask Alexa to do anything on the device - Heavily reliant on the Alexa App configuration to do anything. - On screen keyboard is split to the left and right of the screen. Placed a microphone icon in the middle to force you to talk to Alexa who doesn't understand you half the time. (Try entering a domain name in the web browser using Alexa, what laugh) - No such thing as multitasking on this device.
title: Not worth it.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: ARMELIA SNYDER
content: The overall looks are great and the sound is wonderful. The larger screen is worth the money depending on how you use the device. We have two of original Echo Shows, one in my study and one in the bathroom. Both are fine the those rooms. We also have a Echo Show Dot which is used as a bedside clock and controller. All these devices work very well though sometimes we do have to reboot our modem/router when they lose connectivity.
title: Best Echo Show Yet

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: ashnden
content: With very minimal use for a year the speaker stopped working. Screen still works. Alexa recognizes commands but no sound. Troubleshooted along with resetting and no change. For as much as this cost and the minimal use it‚Äôs ridiculous that it would stop working after a year. NOT HAPPY.
title: Great until it wasn‚Äôt

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Matthew Saindon
content: Calander, weather, time and timers at a glance and the news briefing skill having video are definately positives. Severely disappointed with the media streaming capabilities. No Netflix app, YouTube app, or xfinity streaming app. Has Prime video but the app is laggy and shuts off completely when you start a cooking timer, you can't resume Prime videos with a voice command either. I haven't even bothered trying Hulu yet since Prime video is so bad, so I don't know if this is an app or a web browser shortcut like youtube is. I thought Amazon would at least put a shine on there own product but even prime is a turd. Not worth the money right now maybe after major improvements in streaming capability.
title: not suitable for streaming media.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: J. A. Quayle
content: Screen size is perfect, I got the first gen show as a present. Which got the family hooked, we had an echo previously, but the Show opens up so many use cases. My son loves to see the lyrics as he listens to songs he's never heard, like the Beatle's Blackbird. We play games, see the the weather for the week ahead, have our photos scrolling through, see upcoming tasks, see news items we've missed or weird things to know. The list goes on. Home Hubs have been available for over a decade, but the Amazon Show 2nd Gen, makes them a reality. I use the first gen show on my desk, with is the ideal viewing angle.
title: This is what the first generation device should have been!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Dave
content: The lack of YouTube, Netflix, and Hulu support really makes this a niche device for most people.  For music, this is great, but you can do this and most other functions on an basic Echo. Also, searching for Prime Video content is frustrating. We use this in our kitchen so we were hoping for some (now) universal streaming capability.  It shouldn‚Äôt try to wall off the garden and embrace other services like Hulu and Sling (assuming it can‚Äôt resolve the childish dispute for world control with Google). In sum, unless you absolutely need this to glimpse a security camera in a different area in your home, this device is relatively useless.  Sorry, I love Amazon, but this not worth the cost.
title: Niche product with more limitations than expected

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Cody
content: This thing is absolute garbage. I end up yelling at it most the time because it never has the function I need.  I mean, I do not want to play a game and I don't need a joke, but I would like you to be able to add multiple items to a grocery list without me have to say "Alexia" every time.  I basically have a 200 kitchen timer.  Everything that I want to do to customize it take 9 thousand steps and just isnt worth it in the end.  BTW I have tried to sell it and no one wants it.  I was going to send it back to amazon, but i was a day late on the month return. I have tried and tried to give it a chance but it just isnt worth the hassle.  Buy Google and save yourself the hassle
title: Wait on something better

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Baby G
content: The 2nd Gen Echo is worse than the first gen, which I had for while and loved.  It has a hard time hearing my voice, even after I setup the personal voice recognition stuff.  It is also starting to freeze on me.  At first it was once a week now its every other day.  I have to unplug it and plug it back in to get it to work.  Wish they would've just upgraded the first echo, this really seems like a downgrade, which is so sad since I have so many Amazon devices.
title: After having this for only 8 months the Echo is freezing on me and glitching.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Bridgett Briggs
content: This is our 4th echo show but 1st one with the 10 inch screen. I bought this because of the larger screen for my elder parents. They love it. It's crazy the difference in size and what a great picture it has. My parents love it. So do I.  I would recommend to everyone.. my aunt and uncle after seeing us use ares for 2 years got them for xmas this year one for them and one for my cousin who lives by me ( we live over 1000 miles from our parents)  so they see the benefits of keeping in touch face to face so far away!.
title: Bigger screen is great for elder folks!!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: grillman39
content: This echo show  Hub will blow your mind it takes everything you have that can work with Alex work so much better than before. The video screen is picture is amazing. Once we learn everything it can do it‚Äôs is becoming a tool to make our lives better Just the list app you just ask Alex to add butter to the shoping list when one of us go to the grocery store we open the list and see what everyone has add that we need it really is excellent. We have the ring doorbell just ask Alex to show me the door and it‚Äôs so fast because of it being a hub we have  noticed  That the seed or your internet don‚Äôt slowdown. We are very impressed. Thanks Amazon for making great product for families to use in their home and make our lives easier
title: This is a amazing hub it‚Äôs a excellent addition to our home

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Ole45mag
content: I have thi and I like seeing the clock at night.  But the TRY THIS junkmail type stuff keeps me up.  And on my Show, there's the BIG notifications changing every 20 seconds, and the little one.  Are any of the Google products any better?  Had two ordered the same time, sent one back and kept this one.  But, to be honest and NOT CUSS on a Sunday evening, between Alexa's IQ in understanding human thoughts, and this noiseless sort of visual junk calls every 20 seconds, I feel this machine won't be here another week.
title: Dang Try Messages

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: jman80
content: The voice recognition is not as great as the other devices, the wake word sometimes doesn‚Äôt get recognized.  I have this paired with the smaller devices and integration is good and has been seamless.  I have the Ring Alarm and cameras and this does work well but would like to see the Show be able to show the camera during motion or bell press, rather then just tell you there is motion or bell press.  Sound quality is better then the smaller devices as it has more bass and better all around sound, especially when paired with the echos.
title: This is 4 out of 5 stars, here is why.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Pam Tlamka
content: I thought at first I'd made a mistake. I bought 5 of these 1 for each of our homes and 3 for our children to have in their homes. I wanted to be able to keep up with the grandbabies and I thought this way they could call me on Alexa and not bother with Momma. LOL. Well I couldn't figure out how to hook ours up so they worked on different phone numbers on my acct. If you have one of these and haven't figured out just what they can do, spend a few minutes with one of Amazon's wonderful Show experts! THEY ARE AMAZING! After I got off the phone I taught the young ones a few things. LOVE LOVE LOVE
title: Love!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Tony Edwards
content: This generation of Alexa sound great, we did have a problem with it at first, we didn‚Äôt know it had an equalizer so when it came it was factory set with the bass and midrange set halfway up the scale which ended up blowing the speakers once we turned it up, Amazon was good about sending us a new one in just a couple days and having us send the one we had back so they could analyze it since it had just came out at that time. But besides that, it works great and sounds great, I would suggest buying it......... just turn down the bass a bit before cranking up the tunes.
title: Before you rock out adjust the bass settings down a bit.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Robert Blackader
content: This was a gift from my son who is very tech savvy. I don't even use a smart phone, just an old flip phone. I am learning my way around the Alexa device and am amazed by it's capabilities. I'm sure that when I get a real understanding of how to best use it, it will become invaluable to me.
title: Amazing Device

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Jadu Terinazar
content: Update 8/22/19 Amazon support was great. Right after I posted my disappointing 1 star review, I received both an email and phone call on how to resolve this issue. Sound is working now after an unplug/re plug from the echo itself and not the outlet. I‚Äôm upping my review to 3 stars pending further use of this device and also because I‚Äôm still disappointed I had to experience this nonsense for a brand new system out of the box. Original review : Right out of the box on first plug in, I would expect a system like Echo Show (2nd gen) to work and this one although somewhat functional, the sound did not work at all. The mic worked fine and Alexa would respond to my commands visually on the screen but zero sound. After reading a few support forums, this one included, I was able to reset and unplug/replug twice before the sound finally worked. After a month of use and having to unplug to the device to move it, the sound stopped working again. No amount of resets and replugging would get this thing to work. A piece of junk if there ever was one. One shouldn't have to reset and fiddle around with a brand new device to have it work the way it should, being brand new and a product from Amazon. Very disappointed. Returning and getting an Echo Plus instead. Fingers crossed!
title: Sound failure

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Gwtw83
content: Bought this just to display ring cameras ( I have 4). The Echo Show will only notify you of a camera event, it won't actually show the video stream! Worthless! You have to say Alexa, show me camera blah blah. By the time the Echo stream loads, whatever was there is gone. This is the most frustrating thing I have encountered from Amazon. I figured I couldnt go wrong with the Echo since Amazon, but no! No youtube either! This thing is basically an expensive speaker now. Such a waste of money.
title: Ring cameras integration is a joke!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Joseph Glover
content: The sound is great but I don't understand why I would pay for Prime Music, which doesn't have music videos, instead of just using Bluetooth to play YouTube music or anything else. It is more of a speaker, an awesome speaker, that was given the ability to search the web as an afterthought. If It could cast audio/video from my phone to the device then I would give it 5 starts, but since it is just another Amazon consumption device I can only give it 3 stars.
title: Mixed feelings.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Jay Duran
content: Bought this for my wife and a second one for her sister so they could video chat. The echo show has so much more to offer than that. When in the kitchen cooking she can pull up music, a favorite show from Hulu and other providers as well as recipes or videos for cooking tips. The sound quality is awesome, it pretty much booms in our kitchen. My favorite quality is the integration it has with all my security devices. I can set up alerts with my brinks doorbell camera, my blink xt outdoor camera or my inside wyze cam. If someone is at the door all I have to say is Alexa show me the front door and Bam camera is on live view. The echo show is wortg the cost and pays itself off with all the conveniences it offers.
title: Perfect for keeping in touch or security

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Miss Luxe
content: It's a great visual communication device for when I am at work and want to say hi to my kids during break time. The only down side is the video quality. Also, it allows other users to due authorized purchases even if they are 6 years old. It should require the permission of the main admin or a passcode to access certain futures. I was able to cancel the subscription a minute later but that is something that could have been avoided had Alexa recognized my child's voice as it had been previously stored.
