But aside from that, the family has fun with it.
title: Good but could use some improvements

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Hendrik Hartsuiker Jr.
content: Basically the unit is fine, but there is a glitch with the software. The sound, after a couple of days, just disappeared. I unplugged it from the wall jack and restarted it. No change. then I went through the process of resetting it to factory defaults and still no change. So I went online and found a blog of a slew of people with the same issue. Apparently the fix from Amazon is to unplug from the back of the show, not the wall, and it fixes the problem. So far I have had to do that twice. Obviously it is something that Amazon knows about and there is no permanent fix for the moment. REALLY?!  Other than that it is fine.  BTW, this is the first bad review of any Echo device I have.
title: All sound, sometimes just stops...and there is no fix yet!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: chris234
content: Turning off things to try!!! I hate this annoying line on the bottom of my screen!! I went to rotate once but it is still coming back!  AMAZON  2018 why can I not  ALLOW TURN OFF THIS ANNOYING FEATURE!! Will change to 5 stars when options given to remove things to try off screen!! Update: 2019. Why?? Does Amazon not allow the customer to turn off the *things to try"? From my echo show screen. Can someone give a real answer.
title: Why? Turning off things to try!! Are not allowed to remove it?

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Bharani Kothareddy
content: Sound quality is just awesome. I have bought this item assuming that everything works as usual without extra premium subscriptions as I am a prime member. This turned out to be a waste as we need either Spotify or premium amazon music subscription. On top of this music streaming issue I found that in order to make this work we need to install amazon Alexa app and also install amazon photos. In order to do anything we need an amazon app which is an overhead to person who have all google apps.
title: Good sound quality and overall not satisfied

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: MGK
content: The second iteration of the Echo Show is a marked improvement on the original.  The sound is truly impressive and the response times are nice and crisp. However, the lack of an internal battery, and standalone YouTube app severely dampens my love of this item.  Furthermore, more thought should have gone into an optional stand for this. (i.e. one that tilts, swivels and can move up and down.)  It seems the kitchen counter is where it's designers focused but it works in so many other places that a little more design thought would add multiple user experiences.
title: Fantastic Second Attempt:  Still needs work

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: E
content: I so wanted to like this unit because I heard so many great things about the 1st gen and how great it is.  When I saw a 2nd gen had come out with a largers screen I was in.  ***Buyer Beware*** voice recognition sucks.  It‚Äôs slow to respond.  It often has issues and I have to turn it off and back on at least twice a week.  For the money spent I could have gotten two echo spots instead.  WAY overpriced for what you get.  The only decent thing about the unit is the sound quality.
title: Not like the others...

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Daniel R. Welch
content: Love the new Echo Show. I bought two Echo 8‚Äôs and an Echo Show second generation so our family could do video chats. For that purpose, it works great. The kids and grandkids love how easy it is to do a video chat. I also use the message feature to leave messages when our kids aren‚Äôt home. I have integrated all of my devices with it. I have 4 WiFi outlets and a Ring camera that work flawlessly with the Echo. Also have all my music and video services integrated. There is not much to not like about this product. Setup is minimal and you will be using your Echo within minutes of opening the box!
title: So easy to use and extremely versatile!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: PMFINMD
content: I love my Echo show and replaced it only for  the newer version with larger screen and some better features.  My other one still works fine.  This product lets me talk with my grandkids several times a week- up close and personal without the annoyance of holding a phone or them holding a phone (which makes me dizzy because they can't hold it steady)....I also can talk to them longer because we are not using Mommy or Daddy's phones.  One of the best things I ever bought for myself and my grandkids.
title: Love Love Love my Echo Show - Replaced older unit just to get newer features

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Lovetoread, Hatetoreview
content: I'm on the fence as to whether I like it or not.  The integration to Alexa and the sound is great, but the screen is hot all the time, is that normal?  I have it in my kitchen and I've noticed when playing music the bass causes vibrations on the counter.  Can the bass be turned down?  Also, it woke me up in the early morning hours with a loud sound to let me know that my wifi was down. (at least I assume it was the echo as my smoke alarm wasn't going off and there was a sign on the screen letting me know it was down) Is there any way to turn that off?
title: Echo Show (2nd gen)

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: RuthAnne
content: Received this as a Christmas gift and if worked perfect, one of the coolest devices I own. However, on 4/4/19 is stopped connecting to 5g wifi and stopped streaming without constantly buffering.  It has been in for service, returned with same issue.  Amazon sent a refurbished one, same problem.  Customer service claims they are working with tech support, but I just keep getting the same emails, telling me to be patient.  We have rebooted, reset, reset and reset, nothing. I have consulted with Internet provider, but all is fine and every other device in the home works, so.... gotta wonder if an update on amazons end did something?  I will update if it gets resolved.
title: Stopped working

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: jmumv
content: This device has a really nice screen and excellent sound. The display colors are good. It gives trivia like tidbits at the bottom when you are not interacting with it. It's smarter than the Fire Cube. Music sounds really nice, even when volume is turned up high. I couldn't tell if the music is stereo or not. The bass is surprisingly good. The only negative is the unit is kind of big and bulky. It takes up space on the counter.
title: Better than all the other Echos combined

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: 98northwood
content: I wish it came with directions, because other than costing more money, I haven't been able to get it do do anything more or less than the smaller version.  Once I can figure it out, or get someone who knows how to use it, I may appreciate it, but for now, it's just taking up space. I personally enjoy reading it's little pop ups, although I don't participate. I tried to watch the news, but you have to go into your Amazon account and something about apps and downloads, which is beyond my technological ability.
title: Echo show

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Scott
content: It‚Äôs not a bad device. It‚Äôs not a great device. We set it up in the kitchen so you can watch cooking videos or Hulu or whatever while prepping or cooking. By far my biggest issue is that there is zero way to mount it under the cabinet. Why this doesn‚Äôt have standard vesa mounting holes is beyond my comprehension. There are literally hundreds of mounts that would work if it did. I despise having it in the counter taking up space it should not have to.
title: Needs Option to Mount Under Cabinets

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: H
content: I love this Echo device!! We have it in our kitchen. While a lot of the features I use most are available on the Echos without screens by using the app, it‚Äôs so convenient to just have the ability to have it pull up your shopping list right there. I love being able to see all my individual timers while cooking. Seeing what‚Äôs next on my to-do list as I‚Äôm finishing something up or adding things as I go, makes my multi-tasking much more efficient. The sound quality is great, we use it when entertaining in the kitchen often. I‚Äôm a music video fiend so I enjoy being able to watch those on a whim and sing along to the lyrics as they pop up when just listening to music. It‚Äôs great for quick cooking instructional videos from time to time too. Sometimes Alexa has no idea what I‚Äôm asking for but this device‚Äôs does a much better job of it than our Echo Dot does so there‚Äôs that. So much to say, but I‚Äôm really ecstatic we received this from our wedding registry!!
title: Favorite Wedding Registry Item

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: rk10007
content: I regularly listen to the same 3 or 4 radio stations and can do without pompous announcements that tell me Echo is activating a station dedicated to certain topics (news, culture, music, etc.).  I know what stations I am selecting and why I am selecting them.  I don't have to be further sold on the nature or value of a particular station that I've listened to for years, if not decades. Also, if I want whisper mode, it is not because I want to hear Echo whispering, which is an annoying affectation, and which only works on some things and not others (like the redundant announcements discussed above, which  blast full volume even in "whisper mode." Finally, there should be a setting that allows me to speak to Alexa without the screen turning on, which then has to be turned off, each time.  It is the visual complement to the aural annoyances outlined above.  At night, in particular, I don't want to have to have the screen activate every time I tell Echo I want to hear something of interest.  I know what I asked for, and I don't need to be lectured about how worthy my choice is or be invited to see an intrusive splash screen.  If I want to see something, I'll ask to see it. If I only want to hear something, trust me to know that I know what I want to hear and to know to what it is I am listening.  What time will these changes be effected?
title: Discretion would be the better part of Echo etiquette.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: YURI
content: Very nice, this is my third one, love them, grandson approved also for his bedroom, he can play his own music and watch different programs on it, great sound too, family loves them, great for security also just ask Alexa show me the front door, and there it is. You can even check on your house when gone, on your phone, ask her to show you your echo and you can talk or look to see what is going on in house...Cool!
title: Newest edition is Awesome

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Billy O.
content: Over all echo show gen 2 is a convenient form of my iPhone Siri. My problem is I purchased it to view and monitor my ring camera set up. But basically all it does is show and warm the motion. It does not have the playback or control features as the ring app for smart phones. Would like it much better if it had a program for monitoring and controlling multiple ring devices. Then I would consider it a must for home cctv monitoring. If you didn‚Äôt have to do all commands by voice. Touch screen access would be much better in most situations. To much having to ask alexa! Alexa commands for playing music, controlling lites ect. Little pricey for its capabilities
title: Not so good for ring cameras pricey!!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: ElMexicano
content: Loved the different language set up options.  Alexa speaks Spanish perfectly now.  The camera looks better.  Sound is spatial and loud, but I preffer front facing stereo speakers.  The new set up is spatial sound, not stereo driven.  When speakers are mounted on the side, it bounces off the walls, which to me is just noise.  You can not really hear details. The audio fades, voices are not as clear in music and as it echos. I like good old stereo sound.
title: Great video calls, nice bass, not for stereo sound lovers.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Texantothebone2500
content: I was really looking forward to this product. Price wise I got a great deal but the voice recognition was so poor that the unit only recognized a few commands. I tried it for about a week, and decided it wasn't worth the aggravation. It would be a great device if Amazon would work on the recognition problem. The display and the sound are great but the lack of recognition spoils the unit.
title: Great idea but...

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: James L. Jones
content: My echo sits in my kitchen, i use it daily Great sound system, you can ask "her" to play a song and seconds later, she does so i often listen to music on my echo while I cook Sometimes, it's a little Mozart, or Alternative Country The sound system is much improved over Gen 1 and well worth the money She'll answer questions, keep timers, turn off lights, close the garage door, set alarms Nearly perfect personal assistant And.. I can video chart with my son So a must own
title: Clearly better than Gen 1

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: John Tanaka
content: While we like the Echo Show 2 for what it does, one of the main reasons we got it was to easily video chat with kids and grandkids.  We have the unit set up on our kitchen counter.  With the angle of the camera, we either have to stand in front of it for them to see us or somehow prop up the back of the unit to angle the camera down.  I'll probably end up building some kind of stand to more easily and securely angle the camera.  Other than that, we think it works great.  The video screen is very sharp and the sound comes out great.  All in all it was worth the cost for what we wanted.
title: Works, but needs a way to adjust camera angle

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Aphrodite Teya Rios
content: I've got the echo dot, Echo spot, Echo & Echo Plus.  The Echo Plus sounds amazing and best of all but after getting the Echo Show I'm pleasantly impressed!!! It knocks the Echo out of the water easily!!!  The bass is phenomenal!! A tad better sounding than the Echo Plus but you can watch movies on it from amazon prime, I love gadgets so I need to see how to put the Echo show to better use with such a big screen.  Love the sleek look and I guess the back had to be wide enough to support the acoustics so I'm ok with the size, for this reason.
title: LOVE THE SOUND

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Andismom
content: This was not something I thought I would want but for Christmas we received the show and two echo dots.  They were easy to set up ( We're senior citizens and not super tech savy) and we are having fun with them.  We have grandchildren that live out of state so it is great to talk to and see them everyday.  Alexa is a lot of fun.  We learn new things from her every day.  I've figured out how to have music play all over the house.  She is great for keeping my shopping list up to date.  I tell her what I need and it shows up on my smart phone.  I would recommend this to everyone.
title: just lovin my echo show

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: PaulaD
content: Edit - I received my replacement unit today and the sound is much clearer. That first unit was a bad unit. It is quieter because the speakers are in the back instead of the front so I need to move the volume up but it is clear and I can understand it. Original - The speakers on the right side of the unit and the voice is muffled. It‚Äôs a terrible sound.  I‚Äôm returning it and ordering a second one in the charcoal. Maybe that one has a better sound quality.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Sloth
content: Only reason I give it a 3 is because of Amazon's stupid feud with Google that prevents it from having more Google integration like a YouTube app, calendar, etc. And there's no Netflix integration which sucks. Sound quality is excellent, Alexa works as advertised and it works great as a zigbee hub.
title: Stop fighting with Google.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Onesassymommy
content: We love using Alexa for lots of things, starting the day, tells us the news. I‚Äôm still trying to figure out the recipes better. It would be nice if it didn‚Äôt try to sell you something when you‚Äôre trying to do almost anything. I have prime, music should just be included. Stop telling me I have other categories in a game that I can buy, I understood the first 3 times.
title: Good but stop trying to sell me things every 5 seocinds

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: AdamW.
content: Lets start off by saying the speaker in this thing is awesome, has a good bit of bass as well. Playing music on here is much better than on the echo. I use it for unit conversions, timers and some recipes also, goes great in the kitchen. Every now and then it goes silent, it still listens but no noise comes out from Alexa or to notify you about the end of a timer. All it takes to fix is to unplug the power cord wait 30 seconds and plug it back in. Unplugging from the wall will not fix it, the cord must be removed from the Echo Show. If not for that problem it would have been 5 stars.
title: Sounds great, goes silent some times. Still worth it.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Csanderson
content: Love the screen, love the idea. Unfortunately if I ask it to play music it only plays one song and then stops. It will start playing and stop without any reason. It will play without being prompted. Unfortunately I‚Äôm outside the window for product assistance. I just bought it last December- These problems started in the last two months. Frustrating.
title: Like the idea and the video however as a whole needs some work.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Scott G
content: Honestly I was very much looking forward to getting this product, unfortunately not so much anymore. The sound from the original Alexa was soo much better. The reaction time on this is very slow. You can‚Äôt turn off the automatic time out feature so forget using it for a recipe, or a website that you are reading. After 5 minutes it goes back to the home screen to continue offering suggestions of things to do and so on. I talked with technical support and was informed that this feature cannot be changed at this time. I‚Äôm very disappointed!!!
title: Disappointing!!!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Customer G
content: I‚Äôm requesting an exchange. I ordered two. The one i have didn‚Äôt have sound. After research, I discovered this was a common problem. Suggestion was to unplug from back. Worked for a few days. When I left for 2 days, Echo would not respond. Unplugged again. Works now but who knows for how long! I hope I get a replacement because I like its functionality, but I don‚Äôt want to deal with the issues.
title: My Echo has problems

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Hencat
content: Buyer beware! Bought on Prime Day. No audio when set up. Tried to reboot several times and did a hard reset. Alexa was mute. Tried to get an exchange. Passed around the India call center a few times. Manassa said he would process a refund, but no option for an exchange. Not going to pay extra because the unit was defective. This is very bad Amazon service. Beware of yet another nefarious Amazon policy. Not customer friendly. Hear that Bezos?

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Cindy H
content: If I could give it a zero I would. Got it as a gift and like others noted it just constantly scrolls trending things or crap and always has ‚Äúask eco...‚Äù at the bottom. If I wanted a display like Times Square in my house I‚Äôd get a ticker. I hate it.
title: Media overload

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: DJS-MA
content: I have every the old Echo Show and this new one. I def like the new one better as the screen size is awesome. It does sound better as well. The only flaw, which was also in the last generation is when you use the drop in function, or even picture function, the view is not great. It needs to till forward a bit. There are stands out there that will allow you to rotate or tilt, but not do both. I‚Äôm waiting for a stand that can do both. All & all i‚Äôm Very very happy with the show!
title: Love Alexa

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Betty Jean Bogoly
content: I really like the sound and screen quality but it's been a challenge to learn how to phrase sentences that Alexa will respond to. I also have had a problem setting up skills but will continue to work with it. The one thing I don't like is the fact that if I want to turn off the camera I also have to turn off the mic. It would be great if I could turn off one without turning off the other. In the long run I really like this product and have fun playing with all it's options.
title: The quality of sound is outstanding!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Craig Hollabaugh
content: I'm an Alexa skill developer and looked forward to incorporating Echo Show into several business apps requiring visual information. My Show sits on my dev computer desk and I'm constantly tell it to "Alexa, blank the screen" This is a serious pain in the ass. I'm on the verge of returning it. In addition, when you're playing music, some songs show a constantly moving lyric display, I hate this. What's next the bouncing ball?  Just about every screen shows tips, shown here, "Alexa, what's on my to-do list?"  Disabling these tips, lyrics or an absolutely black idle screen are not configurable. To summarize, I have 8 Echo Dots used for IoT voice integration projects. So I want this Show to be another development tool. The audio is great, however the non-skill screens are a constant irritation. Does Amazon sell Echo Show hoods?
title: Audio great, screen is constant irritation!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Pamela Carrillo
content: I had a google and I asked for the Alexa show. Big difference. Alexa show is awful. You have to be very precise on your wording for the show to get it right. The sound is not as sharp as the google and the sharpeners is not there either in the screen. The only reason why I gave away my google was because I have a ring door bell and google doesn‚Äôt work with ring. Shame on amazon for having such a poor quality smart hub. Don‚Äôt purchase it get a google smart hub if you don‚Äôt have a ring door bell.
title: Dumb hub

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Laura Volk
content: 4 stars because the first day, when I got it straight out of the box, the sound didn't work. I looked up how to get the sound to work & everything I tried didn't get it going. I thought "great, I have to send this back already, I got a dud." I read somewhere that the speakers could come loose during travel & you can plug them back in. Then I realized the device I had is a different generation than the one I was reading about... So I put it back together & figured I'd just send it back. But then I turned it back on & it was working again. After about an hour of messing with it, the sound came back. However, that was a big turn off & hassle, especially since it was brand new. But anyway, I got it working. Other than that mishap in the beginning, I've had a fun time with it. It's pretty simple to get tasks & commands set up on your phone. I like having Alexa wake me up in the morning & saying goodnight to her & the screen turning off. I like having pictures that I choose scrolls in the background. I just don't like that I can't get rid of the "try this" suggestions at the bottom. But other than that, it's neat & it'll be a great way to Skype with my fiance while he's in the Army.
title: Really neat gadget

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: ezofia91
content: Love the larger screen compared to the 1st generation, but voice recognition  is horrible. I find my self yelling at the device  at times in frustration,  while none of my other multiple devices  have these issues. Also when  alexa does pick up there is a delay (same with the 3rd gen dot) the blue light is delayed to pick up compared to earlier generations.  Speakers are good, wish there were some in the front  as well as the  back for more of surround sound. Also when asking simple  questions i would think the device could look up online for me, it either had no answer or would come back with  something completely  off topic! Disappointing  i had to use my "ok google" feature on my phone  while cooking one night bc my hands were dirty and i needed some information, or asking  what kind of birds have black and yellow feathers (my 2 year old saw one in the yard) and it kept responding to me with what the yellow notification  light meant...  so frustrating that you cant ask random questions...
title: Love the screen size, but not so much the voice recognition or question capabilities so far...

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Sparky
content: Alexa runs my house in just little ways like cameras, locks, lights, TV, etc.  The last thing I needed was more Alexa.  BUT I caught this on sale and I really love it.  In the kitchen I can view the door cameras or play CNBC while prepping a meal.  The sound quality is excellent.  Now my older gen Echo is on the patio, the spot is in the master bath and the dots are everywhere else. The next sale I am catching one for the master bath - guest room gets the spot. I LOVE my Hues bulbs.  Snag them if there is a deal.
title: Alexa lives here!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Everett Hewington
content: Full disclosure, this was a gift, so I paid nothing for it. Pros: -Good speaker -Microphone can pick up my voice really well (better than the dots) -Screen can be nice for video chat Cons: -Speaker evoremphasizes the bass (though the bass is adjustable) -Screen never shuts off (I wish there was a power-save mode for when I am not using it) -I rarely use the screen, I feel like it is a bit of a niche thing right now As it stands I like it. I give it 4 stars because I don't really think it would be worth the price, but if you have spare money, it is a nice toy.
title: I like it

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: richard blowers
content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. To me this is the best alexa device she hears me so much better and the device sounds amazing one thing i would like to see is a full 1080 display but this one is pretty good but it would be great plus a camera button to block camera
title: Great product

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Larsen
content: I am sure I'll love it once I figure it out. I have one for my wife she uses in the kitchen and I guess it took her forever to figure it out as well, not sure to what extent she is able to utilize it even now.  But it sound great. UPDATE: Upon further review and use I am NOT loving it. Too buggy. lag between touchscreen commands and execution, voice mode is VERY inconsistent. With the thing in my lap (and after doing the learn my voice skill) is doesn't respond half the time. I end up having to mute and un mute the mic/camera to get it to respond... Oh well, the music sounds great....
title: Some basic instructions would be nice

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: THill
content: Overall this is an okay product, however, I am crazy over the lack of interoperability with WhatsUp, Skype, Facebook Portal.  When none of the products work seamlessly together, people will stick what does transcend platforms which the common smartphone.  Being able to call anyone using another service must be a basic capability.  Standards are what makes the phone the goto for communications.  Bridges are the answers, the big tech companies need to figure this out.
title: Bulky, needs an integrated wall mount option with cantilever

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: DJ Jimmy D
content: I have two of the First Generation Echos, Three of the Shows and Two of the Echo Studios. This Show is my favorite. It all comes down to the video screen. You can download your favorite photos on it, you can watch Hulu on it, it gives you plenty of suggestions for skills including games and helpful tips. Find out the latest news on it. Plus the sound quality is just as good as any of the other models. SEE the time and SEE the weather. It's simply the best.
title: The Best Echo In My Opinion

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: BilLowry
content: Overall this is a nice improvement over the 1 gen Show.  I have multiple Echos and Echo Shows of all types throughout the house.  My wife is mostly blind, and as a tool for someone visually or otherwise impaired, it's simply a miracle.  I'm quite surprised that Amazon hasn't used that in their marking.  My wife calls and receives calls from all her friends and family from any room in the house.  Even in the back yard.  She plays music and controls all the lights as well with the Kasa devices.  The only reason I didn't give the new Show 5 stars is I feel the processor is a bit slow.  There seems to be a few seconds delay in responses that I don't experience with my other Echos.  But I love it.
title: Love the whole Echo line. GREAT for the VISUALLY IMPAIRED or INVALID

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: NJ Buyer
content: It seems as though Alexa prefers voice communications, but still hasn‚Äôt mastered it.  With the 2nd generation Echo Show you would expect the touch screen to have more functionality.  Like if you touch the temperature, it would bring up the daily weather without having to ask Alex ‚Äúwhat is today‚Äôs weather‚Äù.  More ‚Äútouch‚Äù interaction without the need for voice commands would be preferred.  Such as, if i touch the screen while it is playing, I should get quick options like; Pause, Stop, Volume +/-, channel up/down whatever is relevant to the app/skill at the time.  Why have the large touch screen and not use it fully?
title: Touchscreen needs improvement

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: arjaygee
content: UPDATE: Performed a software upgrade and so far seems much better. Music consistently plays now, etc. After owning my Echo Show for 3 months now, I have to say that I'm disappointed from a reliability standpoint. I'm surprised to see how consistently high rated this unit is and can only assume my issue is more on the level of quality control. Almost daily, she will not respond to commands at all, and I have to cycle power to resolve this, which at least a power cycle consistently takes care of this.  What's equally frustrating is when I play music, roughly 1 out of 5 times she'll act like she's playing a song (i.e. I can see lyrics moving on the screen) but no sound at all. Again, this is resolved consistently with a power cycle. How is it possible that I am the only one dealing with this problem?
title: Very glitchy unit

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Mark D
content: It's larger screen is better and the sound is better and deeper than the 1st generation.  I wish it had more options for video apps, but more are probably on the way. The Hulu function on it is cool, but it doesn't give you the option to choose what episode to view.  It auto starts any show at episode 1, which is annoying. The SirusXM app, Amazon Music app, and Spotify work great on it. A fun kitchen device!
title: A cool device for multi smarthome functions.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: sheri
content: I am having problems with the new Alexa it doesn't seem to understated my request after saying it several time, it just don't seem to be a good as my old one, slow to react, slow to t-on, , slow t to adjust to different add on. I understand it new and will need time to adjust to my voice and my house but I am not use to asking several times and it still don't react to simple command like, my favorites music, add to my favorite, what is my 7 minute work out or show me a work out , my shopping list, add or delete a item also I am not happy because I need to pay for everything such as movie, exercise, receipts etc
title: commands

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: R. ODonnell
content: I've been wanting the Show for my kitchen where I look up recipes. Screen is the same size as my Fire 10HDx, but the sound quality is so much better. I can watch a movie or online videos while cooking. I'm struggling to add apps to it. On the Fire (which was on a Show dock) I could access FoxSports Go, Curiosity Stream, and many more. Some things I can access through the Silk browser, but others elude me. However, because I can see my recipes, this unit is a welcome addition to my kitchen.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Ron
content: The Echo Show is everything I expected it to be and more. Replacing my existing Echo with it was seamless and oh so easy. I just plugged it in, waited a few minutes while it got to know me (my other devices etc) and we were off to the races! Noe, I can say "Alexa, show me what a persimmon looks like" and voila - I now know what it actually looks like and don't have to rely on just my imagination from Echo's  description of what she found on... And so much more. I see upcoming reminders, the weather forecast, videos, some shows and on and on.. You won't be disappointed!!
title: No Surprises!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Eddieman
content: I had a thin white line appear in the middle when watching a video or tv show on the available apps.  When I tried to connect to my Alexa app my new Echo 2nd generation did not show as an available device in the app.  It seemed to have every other Alexa made, but the ones with a video screen.  The sound also gets muffled or like its coming out of a giant tin room at times.  Cant hear it.  If you unplug it and reset it it does go back to normal.  Just a pain though.
title: Alexa App did not, or does not recognize the latest model

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: JimJim
content: The unit will stop playing prime movies or spotify music whenever it wants. That happens if I can even get it started. The echo show It hangs when asked to start a movie or show so I have to reboot it often. This happens through voice recognition or touch screen. Voice recognition is sometimes very picky or sloppy. I don't have a philips hue bridge and that might be why it doesn't connect to my  Philips lights  often. Sound quality is good though. Hindsight, I should have bought a fire tablet and a bluetooth speaker.
title: Not to happy with this.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Steve Gameroz
content: HONESTLY,  I wish I would've just kept my Echo and bought a Samsung tablet for the same functions this Echo Show has. The Show is extremely laggy even though it's pretty close to my router (maybe a software update will help?) Most of the available apps are overly simplified, I'm guessing because the Show can't handle anything more intricate. No app for YouTube. Show gets onto it's own web browser, Amazon Silk, to open YouTube. No option that I'm aware of to change the web browser. Eventually, when videos get up and running, the quality seems pretty good. Also, the audio/music options are good. The design is ok. The mobility is little to none. It's heavy and has to be plugged in, which was expected before buying. All in all, my expectations were high and maybe I screwed myself in comparing it to Samsung tablets. For around the same price, you can get mobility, better design, keyboard/pen, a stand and more intuitive/faster software. Only thing the Show has going for it is it's giant speakers. Besides that, with Google Assistant you can do all the show can and ALOT more...
title: Didn't meet already low expectations. Go with a Samsung/Apple tablet.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Jim R
content: I have been adding devices over the past two years, making my home "smarter and smarter". This device just about closes the loop.  Very satisfied with the video and sound quality. Feature rich, easy to use.  I love the picture display using the Amazon picture cloud. The price of a quality WiFi connected electronic picture frame this sized is closed to $100 alone. As a side note, I looked up when I bought my first Alex device, and Echo, in 2016. And it cost $150. So considering what you get for $180 - just WOW!
title: The "Jetson's"  have arrived

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Radiospotz
content: I can now answer my front door by voice using the Echo Show. I've been waiting for this feature for 3 years and it's finally here. The problem with my ring doorbell is that I could not pull it up fast enough on my tablet or phone because the person or delivery people would be gone by then. This is instant. I also bought the swivel stand which is pretty pricey in my opinion but it works perfect and it should have been included with this from the very beginning. This swivel stand does tilt in case you were wondering about the older reviews.
title: Newest update to Ring Doorbell and Echo Show, I can now answer my front door by voice..

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Traci
content: I love this device. I thought about getting the Show 5, and decided to go with the one I really wanted and I am not displeased. I can see it across the living room as it sits between the living room and kitchen. I bought a stand, which I recommend, so that I could turn it when I‚Äôm in the kitchen and turn it back when I am in the living room. We started with the Echo Spot, loved it and decided to buy the Show and put the spot in the bedroom. I love the skills and finding out how much I enjoy using Alexa.
title: Great device. Highly recommend.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: matt
content: I absolutely love this piece of technology I use it everyday I have the dots throughout my house I like that I can connect to them to drop in on other rooms in my house I can control all my SmartThings with it. It takes a little while to get used to but once you have it set up and running you'll find yourself using it a whole lot more then what you think. So if you're looking to invest into a great piece of technology pull the trigger on the Alexa 10
title: Very nicely built and very good sound and video quality

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: David A Gibbons
content: I really should have just bought a tablet and a stand. Don't buy this expecting to watch videos, really any videos. Music videos and youtube kinda work, by going out to a browser and navigating to a video, but it drops out of full screen each time. Other video services don't work at all.  No headphone port either but you can bluetooth pair a set of headphones to it. I was really hoping for a device that could sit on my desk and play movies while I work, but this isn't it.
title: Disappointing... Why have a video screen when you can't really watch videos?

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Sookee0310
content: I spend more time in my kitchen than ever before and the Echo Show is my constant companion.  I watch movies while I meal prep, I play Jeopardy and other games, I know the weather, I look up recipes, I create my shopping list, make telephone calls, listen to music and podcasts, get the news from NPR, control my lights, see who is on my driveway and at my door through RING, etc. all while I'm up to my elbows in activities that were once solitary events.  I love it.
title: Constant companion for our kitchen

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Repro63
content: I am happier with the new 2nd Gen Echo Show. Bigger screen, better sound, but the screen has very limited use. No YouTube, StreamPlayer is losing content with much less live channels than a few months ago. If you are happy with Amazon Video for your watching pleasure, I guess it is OK. A friend of mine has a Google Display and that thing has lot's to watch. Better watch out Amazon, Google has already caught up. You will be playing catch up if you don't start getting more video choices here soon. If you don't, I may have to abandon Amazon for Google. By the way, I had two 1st Gen Show and opne broke, The second one is starting to act up. Hope it is not going bad too. If so, this will be a reason for me to make th jump. They don't last more than a year.
title: Better than the 1st Gen

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: GEM0430
content: Our Grand Kids gifted us an Echo Show...specifically...to use for Video Calling with them... Turns out...after HOURS with Amazon 800 Help and Chat...and Google...the ONLY way to make Video Calls is to download the Alexia app onto a Smart Phone...then transfer ITS Contact List onto the Echo Show... Because neither of us have a Smart Phone...although we can enjoy the Information the Echo Show supplies...we CANNOT send or receive Video Calls!!??!!
title: NO Video Calls w/o Smart Phone

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: "siezetheday"
content: Loved this. I own three.Then I bought a top of the line Netgear Nighthawk RAX200 wireless router. It has a feature called smartconnect where it will have all broadcasts use the same SSID. The Gen 2 Echo shows will connect fine whenever you repower up the echo shows. But later the will disconnect and if you try to connect (without powering off the echo) they will claim you have the wrong password for your network. Bad enough that one person in my house has just unplugged their echo show because it is useless. Iphones work great, as does my other non amazon wireless devices. Hopefully the amazon and/or netgear will buy each others products and find out why they are incompatible. They seem to work when you first power up, so perhaps that was as far as they were tested. Probably the smartconnect switching over to the best confuses amazon echo 2. Wish them both the best though. I have thought of maybe moving over to google if this remains a problem, or turning off smart-connect. But when echo show stays connected to the wireless/internet I love it.
title: Does not work well with Netgear Nighthawk RAX200 SmartConnect

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Bob S.
content: This thing is basically a paperweight on our counter at this point. Everything SHOULD work well. Device integration and setups for routines is relatively easy but that‚Äôs more Alexa than this device itself...it‚Äôs just that the echo itself never works properly. It doesn‚Äôt stop when you ask it to. It‚Äôs a crapshoot if it will even bring up the right song or playlist that you have asked it to even though it‚Äôs the 1000th day in a row that you have asked it to.  It will just stop playing music for no reason. It reboots itself at least once every other week. We have to unplug it and plug it back in at least once a week. This thing just doesn‚Äôt live up to its potential which is a shame since the Alexa system itself with our other devices and echo dots works great.
title: A rebelling teenager probably listens better

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Brenda R.
content: Over all we really like the Echo show. It works well with our ring doorbell too. We have a number of echo dots and Sonos speaker, one with Alexa so this is an added feature to our system. My husband loves it for looking up recipes as well.  Unfortunately Alexa doesn't always do the things she is programed to do the first time. Like turn out lights. She say she is, but it is not 100%
title: Works well and is fun

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Rock
content: Amazon did a good job in seeing what improvements should be made with the Show 1st gen.  Bigger screen is a huge plus.  Speaker sound quality is much better than the 1st gen.  I paired mine with the Alexa Sub woofer and have good all around sound, but not quite bose quality. I tried bluetooth pairing with an AIWA speaker and the functionality was awkward.  It would play music through the AIWA at one point and no other sounds would play, such as Alexa responding.  When it finally connected with Alexa responding and music then I would get a thump out of the AIWA speaker every several seconds.  If you are looking for the sound quality as I was, I highly recommend considering the Alexa sub woofer.
title: Good upgrade from the Show 1st Gen

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: qatbill
content: The audio and video quality is excellent. It doesn't seem to respond to inquires or commands quite as easily as my echo dots for some reason. I bought it bundled with a Ring Doorbell 2 and wanted to be able to quickly see who was at my door while in my family room. The problem I've had is with placement. The tables are on the sides of the couches and chairs, so the device is not facing me or others, which is likely part of the problem with the response. There's no convenient place to put it...certainly not like I see people making these things work easily in commercials. I still like it a lot. I just have to figure out how to use it more effectively.
title: Great product with some qualifications

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Christopher Montt
content: I was going to get this for my nana so we could facetime her whenever. But the other people need to have Alexa compatible devices to do it. And I figured it was way to high tech for my nana and I also ended up loving it way more than expected. Totally unnecessary because I have multiple Echos and a Google Dot but it was too cool to return. So I'm keeping it. It's like an ipad with great sound quality. Would have given it 5 stars if Amazon is the first to figure out how to incorporate more apps in to their devices. I want youtube on it, and whats app so I can play stream stuff from ChilledCow lofi study beats and facetime anyone with Whats app or Skype. So hopefully one of the designers does that next.
title: Great all around, definitely recommend. Expect for Video call capabilities...

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Aircooled VW's of the USA
content: Has a little more base to her voice than I prefer. But was kind of disappointed the camera wouldn't pop up if it sensed motion. They say the software to do it hasn't been written yet. So being a little tech savvy. I got a dot then programmed it thru routines. So when it senses motion it does the following. Senses motion. Then says "Alexa show the driveway" Then the show hears that and pops up that camera view, and the same with my three other cameras.
title: Love it.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: GCD
content: After a month and a half the previous five star rating now falls to three with further falls likely.  A first the Echo Show worked perfectly and we could chat our granddaughter and great granddaughter live.  BUT, for the past week and a half it's either they can't see or hear us or I can see and hear them they can see me but they can't hear us.  "Support" (I used that term advisedly) is poor being limited to Google search results.  After doing a factory reset, which was supposed to leave the WiFi in place but didn't, we won't know if we can video chat until later today. We are disappointed.
title: Reality has set in

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: ROBERT T.
content: I loved the 1st generation Echo Show and the 2nd generation proved to improve thereon. I like the larger screen when visiting thereon with my grandkids and over all the larger screen help my ‚Äúolder eyes‚Äù. The sound is better but, too bad it isn‚Äôt focused to the front. I know that can‚Äôt be done with out increasing the foot print or finally developing a speaker ‚Äúbehind the screen‚Äù. LOL This is not a big deal and actually you get the better sound more directly when you walk around behind the 2nd GEN show, which does not happen with 1st GEN.
title: Screen size and Sound a definite improvement.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Sue
content: We traded in our old Echo, which we thought was wonderful, because it seemed to have stopped working.  We found out that a change to our internet service was the culprit, not the Echo, but it was too late, we‚Äôd already made the trade - and are we thrilled!  This display is excellent, the ‚Äúhelpfulness‚Äù is enhanced, we‚Äôve had video calls with the grandkids, as well as reminders to order dog treats.  What a great companion this has turned out to be.
title: Happy to have traded up

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Hunter
content: I have 11 WiFi smart devices of various brands throughout the house controlling bulbs, lamps, light fixtures, plugs, HVAC systems, security cameras and a gas fireplace.  I had 4 or 5 different smart phone apps controlling the various smart devices.  I purchased two Alexa Echo Show 2nd generation devices to control the devices. One for the bedroom and one for the living room. The installation was a breeze and all the devices interfaced with the Echo Show with minimal issues.  When I did have an issue I called Amazon technical support and they were able to work through the issues even to the extent of getting a Skill or two updated to work properly. These devices are awesome.
title: Work with many brands of smart devices

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: EVELYN JONES
content: I I love my Echo Show. . It allows me to talk to my daughter face to face which is wonderful because she lives in another state. It also gives me the opportunity to monitor my home via my ring security cameras. This picture is perfect and the sound is clean and clear. I use my Echo Show to listen to my music which has a stereo sound that is fantastic. There are so many things I love about my Echo Show.  Oh yeah, and the recipes I really love veiwing to cook different dished. I lUV LUV LUV
title: You definitely WON'T be dissatisfied

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Marj
content: I got the Echo Show to use with my alexa devices and it does a great job doing this. The issue with my Show is that the photo playlist stops every day, and the only way to restart it is to unplug it to reset it. I do this every day and sometimes twice a day. The amazon support technician wants me to reset the device back to factory settings hoping this will fix the problem. If I do this, I must reinstall every smart home device. Some of these devices were a challenge to get installed so I don't want to mess with it again.
title: Great as a hub, but have to reset it every single day. Ugh!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Judy
content: Love my echo show 2 .... needs a few tweaks tho .... like the ability to control the Alexa voice separately from music , news etc , controls my hue lights and links flawlessly with my audible account so I‚Äôm not wasting space on my iphone or iPad ....drop in let‚Äôs me check up on my pets  ....
title: Love it .... but ......

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Rhonda K
content: I have absolutely no complaints at this time. I am still exploring the possibility of this wonder of a box. The sound is simply amazing! As a screen saver I have downloaded a collection of amazing pictures from my brother's photography. They rotate freely. This makes for a beautiful addition to my living room even when not in use for music. I can call my mom and be sitting right in the living room with her during our whole conversation. I am able to view my security cameras quickly and clearly with the request of my voice. Display screen constantly displays time, temperature and weather. I cannot say enough about this piece.
title: Wow! Blown Away!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Richard Lane
content: My mother (92 yrs old) has trouble with even using a phone but the Alexa Show solved that problem.  She can now call me anytime and we can face time.  This has made her and my life so much simpler.  Thanks to who ever created the Alexa Show!  Perfect item for family members who are in nursing homes, hospitalized, or just cant handle technology very well.
title: This is a godsend

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Michael W.
content: I got two Show 5 and love them so much. Can't stop buying this 10 version. Watching my favorite shows in kitchen and anywhere. Most important, it can track my ring and Arlo cameras, and videos chat with other show devices. Today I just realized it can surf on websites! Always love Alexa voice recognition than Google.
title: A must have for any family.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Natiwatt
content: I like playing apple music, listening to radio stations, and the sound quality is good. I also like making a shopping list which goes to the app on my phone. That‚Äôs about all I‚Äôve tried so far. I thought it had a toggle switch to turn off the camera, but it does not. One button turns off mic and camera, but you have to turn it back on or no voice wake up.  I have tape over the camera for privacy. Easy set up.  Easy integration with Apple music.
title: Handy

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Michael Siu
content: Overall great design.  The device was a gift which I probably won't buy for myself.  Feels a bit overpriced.  I could use an old iPad and get even more functionality but probably not as good of the sound quality though. That said, it is a nice device for the kitchen or hallway/doorway on the way in or out to get a quick glance of information.  I wish there's Netflix on there or just more general way to consume content during work in the kitchen.
title: Nice device, UI needs a bit of improvement, and too pricey

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Fil L
content: Do not buy this product, it is very unreliable. Doesn't understand voice commands and can be very frustrating. Returning item and will be looking at Apple.
title: Unreliable

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Donna mae bowden
content: It's all one piece....didn't need a charging station.  Size is good I can see the screen well I can hear the audio good.  My only complaint is it has to be plugged in to use.  I have it in my kitchen as I mostly wanted it to use while I cook.  My plan was to have it in one location to charge but move it to my Island when I am using it.  But that can't happen unless it is plugged in.  Fortunately I do have an outlet on my island, but I was still disappointed in that.  Other than that enjoying using it so far.
title: All one piece

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Carl Brinson
content: For the most part it pretty good. Bought 2 of these, one for us and one for my daughter, so we could video chat with the grandkids. The only thing not so great is the speaker when playing music. It seems to rattle, sounds kind of like something loose inside, but I don't think there is, Once I turned the base all the way down it seems to subside, only doing it once in a while. So don't think I'll be using this as the main speaker for the house, we'll stick with the TV sound bar.
title: Rattles when I use it to play music

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Susan McCall
content: We LOVE our (4) Echo Show 2nd Gen 10" devices!  EASY to set up, connect AND talk (video) to the other Rooms  BTW: you CAN shut off the Cameras and audio. Our Families are downloading the Alexa app so we can video call ea other while waiting for them to receive THEIRs.  Found lots and lots of 'Skills' app to try. Tomorrow, we will be setting up 'smart plugs' and 'smart light bulbs'; then will ADD our Arlo Ultra Cameras, a Ring Spotlight camera, a water leak alert device at the hot water tank, and soon will add the Garage door opener AND a Thermostat on the SMART HOME HUB .  WooHoo! Our almost 95 yo Patriarch LOVED his 'Echo Tower' but he is THRILLED and ENTERTAINED by his new Echo Show 2nd Gen!  Soon Dad will be able to ask Echo to show him ALL the Cameras outside around our house and his gardens.... and the pesky squirrel who plants peanuts in the garden flowers.... LOL! We put 'Echo' next to his easy chair.  He calls his device 'Echo'; yesterday he istened to Airport Towers in SF (he is a WWII B17 Pilot), asks about weather in Cities around the Country/World, and today 'Echo' helped him listen to NPR Radio!  :-) .... He LOVES listening to Big Bands on our Amazon Music AND Andrew Sisters 'Boogie Woogie Bugle Boy'! The audio is AWESOME! YOU need this.... and get several for ALL your Family Members! Only (tiny) Con at this time:  waiting for the full blown Weather.com app to show LIVE RADAR on our Echo Show!
title: YOU and YOUR Families, need this!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Philip Holden
content: After 2 weeks of having this product, it starting rebooting on ots own every five minutes...then it started displaying an uh-oh error message. Because it was still under warranty....i contacted them to have it replaced and they stated that i had to send it back to them and then they would make the decision whether or not they would fix it. Ummm....ive had it 2 weeks and they have the nerve to say IF WE WILL FIX IT. Its two weeks old and shouldn't be having issues. It should be automatically replaced! It works great......when its working. Im sending it back, but lets see if they deserve me to change my review after their "decision"
title: Had problems within 2 weeks

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Coffee drinker
content: The Echo Show Premium 10.1 HD is beautiful and sounds great. The issue our family is constantly experiencing is that it does not follow commands to terminate actions, i.e. playing a video and stop, exit, cancel. Our previous version of Show follows commands better. Another issue is the device has periodic issues connecting to Arlo, Roomba, and Ring; although, I am able to execute the command through my iPhone. Aside from that its very helpful when it works. The kids love it.
title: Beautiful, but doesn‚Äôt follow commands well.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: s
content: I've had this thing over a year. I regularly have to unplug and plug it back in because it loses all sounds. You ask it that time and nothing. The weather, it shows but doesn't talk. It's horrible. It's been this way since early on and I've been told to just restart it. Well the latest time it happened I had to unplug and plug it back in about 10x for sound to come back. I've tried multiple power adapters and various plugs in the house and they all have the same issue. I wouldn't buy this again. I'm about to throw it out the window and go back to my old echo. At least it works 100% of the time. Heck, that one at least hears me all the time. This show I could be standing next to it and it won't respond. It's so frustrating. Waste of $200.
title: Don't waste your money. Sound issues and no resolution.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: MGelb
content: The good: Good image quality, lots of great functionality and integration, good sound quality. The bad: there is a several second lag of touchscreen, volume buttons, and response to voice commands. Even when I press the volume buttons it takes a few seconds to register. I feel some functionality is not as intuitive as it could be. Overall I think It is unacceptable for a device of this nature and in this price range to have poor And delayed responsiveness in the year 2020.
title: Needs improvement

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Anne T
content: I use for locking the front door, adjusting the thermostat, listening to music, viewing recipes in the kitchen, checking the weather forecast, etc.  Unfortunately, it has stopped doing many of these things and I don't have a clue how to get the functions back.  It also stopped showing ALL lyrics to songs playing.  These changes happened on their own.  I did not go into the profile at anytime.  I'm not really happy with it right now.  I have no idea who to contact for assistance.
title: Amazon Rep set up my "Smart Home".  Device has lost capabilities.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: The Fresh Family
content: I love my Echo,  I am new to the virtual voice world, my other device is a mini Google, used for lighting my home.  My Echo however has the best speakers on it, you can actually feel the bass if you turn it up.  I love how my Echo recognizes my commands and since Echo and I are currently in the process of "learning" each other, this makes it all the more interesting.  When first purchased I thought I could watch everything on it, not true.  I love the apps that are offered for Alexa.  One drawback is the Amazon Movies that are available for you to watch, that list is not the same as my list from my home TV and I do not believe you can watch all of the Amazon movies on the Echo.  Don't quote me on that last statement, I am steal learning my Echo.  You will not be disappointed I think the fun part is learning how to use the Echo!
title: I love my Echo

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Calucin
content: I purchased this item because of the show and tell feature. I am low vision with a visual acuity of 20/400. I thought it would be able to help me out in the kitchen. However, it‚Äôs got the pantry items correct only about 40% of the time. I‚Äôm sure this technology will improve and I look forward to purchasing a generation three or four. In the meantime, I‚Äôm going to return this item. Also, the audio is very bass heavy Even after turning the base down. I live in a condo and share walls. I do not want to be that pesky neighbor.
title: Show Intel needs improvement.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Kiamisha
content: I love the 2nd generation show. I originally had the first generation show.  This one is twice the size and the sound quality is great.  We have 8 echoes in our home and one echo auto, I have not had a problem with any of them and plan to keep buying more.
title: Very Happy!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Cory K.
content: The sound is great. It is great for playing music, like how a phone or radio would. That is it. Alexa doesn't know anything. Alexa doesn't have a direct line to google so therefor Alexa doesn't know any of the questions that I ask. Alexa can barely accomplish any request. I don't like it. I find myself yelling and swearing at the damn thing. I haven't had this much buyers remorse since voting for Obama in 08. This product isn't worth the money. The echo dot is more bang for the buck. The Echo Show 2 is crap.
title: Alexa doesn't know ANYTHING

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Marilyn Uyehara
content: I bought the Show thinking it would help more than the Echo.  It really doesn't.  I am visually impaired and can't read a thing on the screen.  The selling point for me was the Show and Tell feature...hoping it could read me the cooking instructions fo frozen food.  It doesn't.  In fact, whereas it read the Brand name of the food, it goit the particular food wrong.  Ahh, well...now I have two Echos.
title: Pretty Disappointed

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: D.Wo
content: Will not show you your complete libraries (eg, will show you some of your music, but you'll have to scroll forever just like the cube tv). Will not show ebooks (it will attempt to read them...which is useless if you want to read your purchased cookbooks). No apps store (skills are not the same as apps). This is a big failure and it feels like I'm only getting half of what I paid for.  I am really disliking it, and it may need to go back.
title: DISAPPOINTING...LIKE FIRE CUBE WITH SCREEN

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Rob
content: After owning an Echo Show 2nd gen for about a week the speakers stopped working. I contacted customer support and in the conversation with the Amazon employee I specifically stated that I wanted a new replacement, not just a refurbished one. There is a $50 difference in price between a new Echo Show and a refurbished one and the one I received clearly had issues from the start. They said they would happily send out a new replacement right away. A few days later I received my package... a refurbished Echo Show. After speaking with another Amazon employee all they could offer was just a return, no option for what I originally wanted or ordered. In most cases a return wouldn't be that bad except I waited to buy this Echo Show on "amazon day" and got a significant discount on my original order. If I were to take my refund to purchase a new one I simply would not have enough to buy a new Show. That being said I will not be purchasing another one.
title: Speakers gave out within one week of having it.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: T. Harmon
content: I really like my Echo Show. The only thing that puts me off is that there is *SO* much more that it could be useful for. Would be great if it could be uses as a 2nd wireless display for your computer so you could watch TV and surf at the same time. Would also be nice if it didn't time out after three minutes when watching some video content. Would be nice if you could say "home control" and bring up your Zigbee devices, and would be wonderful if it would pair with Sylvania, Philips, and Lutron Zigbee remotes so I could eliminate that "other" hub that I have to use.
title: It's an Echo...with show!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Megan Catlin
content: I feel like Alexa is getting worse at listening especially with Spotify. I've uninstalled and reinstalled the Spotify skill, but still have glitches. For instance, I'll say "Echo, stop music" I'll see the blue line indicating the wake word was heard, but it'll keep playing music and I have to unplug it to stop. It also will play a play list just fine one day, but then pulls up a random song the next time. For instance, I'll say "play easy 60s playlist" and often it'll play 1 song by "easy A". I've done the voice training with her too. Other glitches include stopping music randomly, restarting randomly. A lot of skills don't work well including Wyze and YouTube. Wishing I had bought a Google Home. Only positive is that the sound quality is good, but honestly not much better than the 20 dollar dot we bought.
title: After 1.5 years has had ups and downs, but mostly downs..

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: JLS
content: This is the first Amazon device that I was not able to successfully set up.  Would not control Smart Home devices - no Ring camera connection or Hue lights etc. I may have finally hit the wall on purchasing Echo devices. Amazon Customer Support was of no assistance,
title: Would Not Sync with Other Devices

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: ActiveUser
content: this is a unique device, and hence it is imperfect large iPad like screen with bad audio, is my take. I replaced my first device within a week owing to bad bass sounds. then the second one was also bad. the first gen Alexa had better sound, so yeah this one was terrible. moving now to echo plus hopefully will get better sound. hope in 3rd gen they improve the voice recognition and sound quality if you want people to listen to their streaming music your decide better sound really good
title: terrible sound

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: GRR!
content: Very poor voice recognition, I have to yell at it to acknowledge me and understand  requests,  speakers in rear of device  provide poor hearing ability if you are in front of device.  Volume is  either too loud or to low with  poor to no ability to adjust as needed. Large screen is very attractive and vivid.  Too Much advertising  detracts from your screen choices. First generation Echo Show  more user friendly.  A nightmare to use 2nd generations Hub if you already have a hub. Can't set up 2 generations hub without screwing up your whole house....needless to say not using 2nd generations hub. My whole house was offline for 2 days trying to straighten that mess out and regain use of my original hub.  If you are already using a hub (wink etc) stick with it unless you are a very good tech savvy person,  there is no place to go for assist  for switching hubs.  Just plug in  the 2nd generation Echo and go about business as usual  all will be well. Not quite what I had hoped it to be.
title: Poor voice  recognition,  hub switch is a nightmare.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Cody Brown
content: Extremely disappointed in this product. It never listens to me when I ask it to turn on the lights or to stop the alarm. We have a newborn and not only can it never hear me when I'm talking in a regular tone yelling or even in whisper mode. It only recognizes my husband's voice. I have done the voice recognition multiple times. The newest issue is that the reminders continuously alarm even when dismissing in the app. We got this so we can video chat with the grandparents and every time we do the video freezes or is very grainy is always a bad connection. We have great connection for internet So I'm not sure why this is never a clear view of them during the chats. also another downside when you ask it a question it has limited answers since it is not a search engine. It answers basic questions if you're cooking but nothing further than that. Honestly very disappointed in the product I was hoping for more. Hopefully they can fix these issues. I even tried giving feedback to the echo show and ironically it said it couldn't hear me. This just shows the issues that the echo has.
title: NEVER hears you /reminders continuously go off even when dismissed / not a search engine

Otherwise the price even on sale seems high for what it does.  Video quality is great as is sound.  Just add more it can do.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: sophiax
content: I am the biggest Amazon/Alexa fan ever. I have bought several Alexa echos, dots, shows, and TV's for myself and as gifts and constantly assist in set up and multi device and pairing and so on. However, since January of 2020...all of my devices simply suck. My shows ignore my request after playing music for an extended period. The only way I can get them to listen is to ask them to play something different and then ask them to stop. My dots are even worse. The can not hold an internet connection for more than a couple hours. If I set an alarm, they will not turn the alarm off once it sounds. I have to actually unplug it to get it to stop. My TV's will come to a screeching hault while playing Amazon prime but continue uninterrupted while playing Netflix. Don't know what they did, but they need to undo it. I can't see continuing my subscription.
