product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Gary Effren
content: First, my only negative comment - I‚Äôm surprised and disappointed that there is no option to display the Day and Date on the Home screen in addition to the Time. Since Alexa ‚Äúknows‚Äù the info, it seems that it would be an easy fix for the engineers at Amazon to program an option to display Day and Date on the Home screen. The Echo Show is a very good personal assistant, entertainment and utility device for our kitchen. Setup and integration with multiple music streaming services (Amazon Music, Spotify, SiriusXM) was straightforward. Sound quality is good for a device of its size and it‚Äôs very convenient to play nearly any song or artist if you are an Amazon Prime or Spotify Premium member. We integrated the Echo Show with our Ring Door Bell (‚ÄúAlexa, show me the front door‚Äù). We use it often to create our shared Shopping List, which is accessible from the Alexa Mobile App (‚ÄúAlexa, add Milk to the Shopping List‚Äù). If you have a second Echo device, like a Dot, in another room, you can use the Drop In feature as an intercom to avoid yelling from room to room or from upstairs to downstairs. It is convenient to have a ‚Äúhands free‚Äù personal assistant in the kitchen to answer basic questions, follow a recipe or set timers. Alexa can also control many ‚Äùsmart‚Äù light bulbs/switches. All in all, I‚Äôm happy with my purchase, we use it daily and I‚Äôd probably miss it if it were gone.
title: If only it could display day/date on Home screen

Much of what we do with this can indeed be done with Echo _BUT_ the fact that the Show gives a visual display adds an additional and welcome dimension. I haven't even touched the surface of it's capabilities yet, and I look forward to learning more.

author: David C.
content: I plugged my new Echo Show 2nd generation unit in and went through the setup process without issue. And then when I contacted Amazon, they told me to buy a new adapter!  I just requested a refund and it is going  back tomorrow not to be replaced! I have always been happy with Amazon customer service, but I just went from happy to very unhappy in a flash!  I really hope this is not the Amazon of the future!
title: My Echo Show 10.1 " screen died after less than 2 days.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: HonestConsumer
content: Nice screen size that displays lyrics when you play music, works well to show you Ring camera activity if you ask to activate your live view, and even though it is a small device, it produces an amazing bass sound. It is surreal how amazing the speaker is. Highly recommend it for playing music. However, I wish there was an even bigger version and that it didn't cycle through news when in idle mode. All I want to see is the time, not headlines that distract me. Overall, still recommend it.
title: Amazing Bass Sound, Ring Integration, and Song Lyrics Display (Distracting in Idle Mode Though)

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: E-dawg
content: Worked fine initially now I can‚Äôt get any audio.  When it did work it didn‚Äôt respond correctly to my requests Also it doesn‚Äôt respond I‚Äôm really bummed I was really looking forward to it.  Never even worked a day
title: Lost audio

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Julie Wiley
content: I was excited to have an Alexa in our home and the family has enjoyed using it. I do find it frustrating sometimes that the search seems limited. If I ask for questions, the results don't seem to pertain to the topic of my question. I tease that maybe I am not asking the right questions, it is not as broad of a searcher like a Google product might be, but I enjoy it being linked to my Amazon account and the notifications and such. It has been a handy tool and great home addition.
title: Great home addition

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: The Hobbit
content: Alexa is not very good at answering questions and didn't recognize a lot of the words I asked about. I wish it would let me spell something she didn't understand. For example, I was asking about Dionysus and she kept telling me about Princess Diana. I do like the screen and it is good for recipes and watching Amazon prime. I would like to be able to carry on a conversation without starting every sentence with Alexa. Maybe if the time lage is short we shouldn't need to use the wakeup workd again. Also, better recognition of the ongoing thread would help. For example, I went to Amazon Prime Video and asked for The Marvelous Mrs Maizel, season 3. It showed me a list of the episodes, which was good. Then I immediately asked for episode one and it took me to the Man in the High Castle. It needs a better understanding of context.
title: Alexa isn't very smart

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: F M
content: We really like our Echo Show. It is way more useful than we would have thought. The sound is excellent and it is very handy just to ask Alexa to play your favorite music. The interface to control lights, outlets is handy also just ask and it is on or off as needed. My wife uses it for recipes when cooking dinner etc. Too many pluses to list but we highly recommend the Echo Show.
title: More useful than we imagined.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Dan M
content: Got the new Echo Show 2nd Gen for my wife as a Christmas present. Started using it in the new year and found that the voice recognition would not work regardless of the volume on the unit. She would not answer to "Alexa" and the only way to get it to work was to unplug it every time. Initiated a return/replacement and missed the window by 14 days. Now we've only had the unit for 60 days and it's not functional. Initiated a chat with Amazon tech and they tried a reset and it did not solve the problem. After only two months of ownership, was told to send it in for repair at my cost. NO THANK YOU! What a waste of time and extremely poor customer service. Decided to just keep it and will probably move to another manufacturer or carrier of a similar piece of tech. You would think that they would realize their name is on the thing and it's what we use to order more items. Interesting that they would shut down an order point for a customer. Guessing the Amazon machine is getting too big to realize the importance of a customer! DON'T BUY THIS YET! They have bugs and need to figure it out before you consider this.....Lost customer here....
title: Can't Believe Amazon Wounldn't Replace A Broken Item Of Their Own!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: NamelessChamp
content: The first device we received didn't work at all.  The second device now freezes and is super slow after a couple weeks of use.  It takes forever to play Amazon Prime shows and even stops all together. Updated:. After about a year the Show is not a good product.  Alexa has a hard time understanding basic instructions and will always add an introduction like signing up for Prime when we already have it.  I'd give it 0 stars if possible. The only good thing about this is the sound and video quality.  Otherwise, I would have passed.
title: Garbage

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: J
content: Not at all impressed. The unit's sound quality was poor to begin with and the video is difficult to access and then the unit simply quit working after less than 3 months. I tried to contact support and got nothing. The Echo devices are sub par and I would suggest going with Google devices. I don't own any Google devices, but they can't be as bad as the Echo devices.
title: Less than 3 months and it's dead

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: CH3
content: Was happily surprised by the how good the sound was. I do not however like the rotating home screen of - try this or try that. Additionally it is easier to tak to it than use the touch screen. That aspect is slow and laggy in regards to the touch input.
title: Easier to talk to than touch

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Rickey M. Horwitz
content: Bigger screen, better sound than first version.  However, the sound goes out and twice a month we need to unplug it to reset it so that the sound is restored.  This is a known issue that has not been resolved by Lab126 so I am dropping it by two stars.
title: Alexa looses her voice periodically

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Amanda
content: I love the sound so much better than the dot! We are in the process of converting our household to work with Alexa...and everything is so convenient! I have it turn off my Christmas lights, scentsys, and lamps. Also looking at the home security system to tie in with it. Alexa calls me Queen Amanda...how can I give her a bad review?? Seriously, the sound on the music is great, and I love everything you can do with it...although, we have barely scratched the surface. Really glad we made this purchase.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Cal
content: Mostly a glorified clock and a calendar reminder.  Makes a terrible hub, wifi antennas and/or processor are weak, security camera images continuously buffer, images are strong on my other devices (iPad, iPhone, Desktop and even my TV).  It‚Äôs a so so device, display image is OK, speakers are OK, need to use a phone app for certain settings is a pain.  Basically it‚Äôs a typical Amazon device,  few & lousy apps and lousier skills.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Sandy
content: Wow!  I upgraded from the older show.  This screen is larger and the resolution is better.  I love it.  Use it all the time in the kitchen for recipes,  music, timers, measurement questions, trivia etc.  Have it set up to use my photos as wallpaper.
title: Wow!  Love the larger screen

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: rpalmer
content: Amazon's crack support informed me Hue Zigbee hub still needed. Could not find living room thermotate eventhough app could. False triggers from TV and NOTHING sounding like Alexa was said. Speaker was only thing worth using. Sad... Really sad.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Travis
content: The sound quality and Alexa capability are excellent. I purchased this as well as Sonos speakers and while this isn‚Äôt on par with the adobos, which have a large price difference, this product can hold its own in terms of sound quality. An audiophile may be able to tell a distinct difference, but considering the product wasn‚Äôt manufactured solely as a speaker with Alexa integration, I am still thoroughly impressed with the quality. If you are looking for a versatile speaker with Alexa integration and a touch screen to boot, this is the product for you.
title: Surprisingly good, exceeded expectations

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Hilldawg
content: Has zigbee but it barely works.  The software is junk.  Cant watch netflix cant set up a bluetooth keyboard, constantly defaults to the home screen.  If you pause a video for a minute it, it goes to the home screen and then you have to jump through hoops just to start the video again.  The touch screen is so laggy it's almost useless.  1 star is generous.  I could spend an hour listing all the flaws.  If you dont need zigbee then get a hd and a stand.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Richard King
content: we use Alexa for everything.  You tube workout and music videos as well as Amazon prime music. The 10.1 sow screen with the enhanced sound was a no brainer.
title: Great sound and picture quality. And any way you look at it bigger is better.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: L.W.
content: I like the fact that it has a larger screen, and the sound is marginally improved. However for some reason it doesn‚Äôt seem to be quite as responsive to voice commands as the older one. Plus the ‚ÄúSand White‚Äù cabinet shows dust and fingerprints more than the black one.Maybe they should take a page out of Apples‚Äô playbook and offer it in ‚ÄúSpace Grey‚Äù

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: sandroalberti
content: For previous users of the 1st-gen Echo Show, you will understand. The new model is so much larger and better sounding; so much better for updated 2019 video-watching and video-calling experiences. plus the old one seems so tiny now (something maybe for a closet or other tiny room). Plus my perfect place is the high kitchen counter, and the new tilt-down base makes it useful even when sitting on the lower chairs in the breakfast room. Plus... yesterday I had asked Alexa on my old Echo Show if she wanted to be my Valentine and, the gall: she said "no", because she already had "a strong connection to my WiFi". That was the last straw. Out with the old; in with the new.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: mlp

I would like to see more of the touch screen put to use due to some of the news moves to fast or the words are unfamiliar to me to say correctly to get the report/news.  Otherwise, I would have given it a 5 star rating but it is worth having if you like voice commands.
title: very happy with the unit

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Bob Gardner
content: It's one of those "must have" things.  I'd buy it again now that I am spoiled.  Built-in Zigbee smart home hub in it can't be found no matter what I do. I have ordered a separate stand alone Zigbee hub hoping that solves my light bulb lighting problem.  I would give it 5 Stars if it actually had a Zigbee Smart Home Hub that I could find and make work.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Cindy G.
content: Started up fine, installed update, but would not recognize any external speakers.  Took a couple of factory resets before it would recognize external Bluetooth speakers/devices.  No problem streaming to device, but could not stream/pair to external devices... be patient and restore to factory defaults a few times if needed.  Otherwise, big improvement over First Gen.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Jane
content: The Echo  has decent sound. It is sound sensitive and can pick up its name from about 20 f away. I love that it displays the lyrics  on the screen when they are available. While streaming a radio station, like the one I prefer, WMVY from Martha's Vineyard, it inconsistently shows the correct artist playing. Overall, I'm very pleased with it I'm glad I bought it!
title: Decent Sound- Displays Many lyrics

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Kay Tee
content: I like it but I have to say echo before everything and it‚Äôs annoying but I love the aspect of seeing a recipe and having it added  to a shopping list and my kids can tell echo what to add to a shopping list as well which saves lots of time asking and them not actually telling me. So it can‚Äôt get any easier than telling echo add milk to the shopping list!! Also I haven‚Äôt had it long but for some reason my daughter gets my echo reminders on her phone so I still have to figure things out with it but I like asking echo to tell me the local news or the weather. The more I figure it out the more I do like it. Just wish I didn‚Äôt have to say echo every time but maybe I could figure something out!!
title: I like it and it‚Äôs worth it

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: SteveL
content: This device is very difficult to set up, especially of your trying to link your phone contacts and pictures.  You apparently need to install several different apps to use it, which obviously are not accessible through the device. Most features you think would be enjoyable require monthly subscriptions. Little to no useful documentation furnished. Purchased 5, and will unfortunately be returning all of them.
title: UNFORTUNATELY NOT WORTH THE EFFORT OR PRICE

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: kas9103
content: I'm go back and forth between Echo and Google Nest Hub. I'm disappointed that I upgraded from the first generation Echo Show to this one. Why? The dang clock feature is abominable. I moved this to the other side of the bed. I end up telling Echo Show "screen off" at night, despite its being on the other nightstand, and then have my Google Nest Hub display its lovely, able-to-be seen clock right next to me. Amazon, give more clock options!! Please!!
title: Clock is horrible

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: James M. Wright
content: I love the 10 inch Echo Show. I have used it for five months now As a device it is wonderful. Voice recognition is great. Of course integration with Alexa is great. There are however, two problems that I wish to address here. First, from the advertising, I was lead to believe that I could display all of my recipes on this device. However, I cannot find a skill that allows me to do this. Why? I know that there are some third party apps that do this, but not well. This type of skill should be a high Amazon priority and it does not seem to be. The second problem is a little more general. I can find no central forum for suggesting improvements to Amazon for their Alexa platform. I would suggest that Alexa and associated hardware would be well served, as would the consumer, if Amazon would add this type of forum to its website and then publish that information so that the general public could request specific improvements.
title: Many missing skills and no capability to feedback needed changes to Amazon

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Kevin C
content: Got one of these to replace my echo dot but I don't even use all the features on it and it's pretty much a dot for me still. It's cool that it can do all of this stuff but once you do it a couple times you realize it's way easier to get out your phone and find what you are looking for on there. Alexa has a hard time of hearing me too and I find myself repeating things over and over for her to get it right and sometimes she outright doesn't respond. It's pretty cool to say you have one and all but if you are looking to use Alexa to automate your house, try an Echo dot first and then see if you need this.
title: Pretty useful but I never use it for all It's features

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Alexis
content: Volume stopped working after 2 days. Reset , turned off, unplugged, restart, talk and still no volume. And it's not on do not disturb, you just can't hear Alexa talk. Help.
title: No volume!!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: C. Flagg
content: Love the sound quality but the blasted try messages that constantly scroll across the screen really ruins the experience for me.  For this much money I should be able to have the display exactly as I want it and not have silly messages flashing across my photo gallery.  It's too bad because I really wanted to like this unit.  I have no idea who thought this "feature" was a good idea.  I'll be returning it tomorrow.
title: Can't turn off the Try Alexa messages

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: jeffreypaulh
content: We tried the Lenovo device as Google‚Äôs search is superior, but the speaker quality is poor and the screen is not real sharp. Sent it back for the 2nd Gen Show.  Sound and picture quality are great and there are some terrific ‚Äúskills‚Äù. HOWEVER...There is a banner across the bottom, like the score feed on ESPN, that keeps showing things to try.  It is very annoying and can‚Äôt be stopped.  There is no excuse for Amazon forcing us to see what is basically continued promotion for their product. And we are not warned about this in the product description. It is annoying enough that we are considering returning the product.  Update- Sadly it‚Äôs too late to return it.  Wife got me a Google hone for my birthday, thought about swapping it for a Sho 5 since we have so many Dots, but after reading the reviews about the banner ads and the stupid hints banner, there is no way I am spending that money so Amazon can send me ads all day long!
title: Annoying hints can‚Äôt be removed so I‚Äôm going with Google

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Jackie C
content: I have to say I'm not super happy with this.  The sound cuts in and out all the time.  I have to say alexa a number of time before it responds.  I've tried adjusting brightness levels a number of times but when I'm on a video call I appear as dark to caller.  The screen sensitivity is very picky too.  I have to press it a number of times.  I've tried turning it on and off a number of times to correct these issues and it's still the same problems. Dissapointed for the price.
title: Dissapointed

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Samhar
content: Held off getting an Echo until we saw the ad on TV.  Decided to try it and simply love it!  We stayed up til 1:30 am just playing music üé∂, giving A!exa song titles that popped into our heads.  Love that the song lyrics show up on the screen. She controls the TV and we are getting security lights and cameras for outside that she can control too.  She even tells us good night and to sleep tight.  Great companion for homebound elderly!
title: Our new best friend!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Daniel J. Topp
content: Very nice product. East setup. Voice recognition is excellent. I integrated it with my Christmas tree lights, my ARLO security cameras (it announces the motion detection), my iComfort thermostat. I can watch amazon movies. I make video calls with my son. I got him one also. YouTube videos play as well. The sound is incredible. Very deep bass and  very loud. No need to add a Bluetooth speaker. It‚Äôs a little pricey but well worth it.
title: Great all around AI device.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: BC
content: This will not make your home smart. It will let you stream music from your phone, stream some radio, set timers and alarms, make calls, make videocalls if the other person has the same device, and turn on lamps if you buy smart home lights. It will also often not understand you, talk with you at times you don't want, require rebooting fairly often, and constantly advertise on Amazon's behalf. Streaming music with voice commands doesn't work if you use Spotify (except with playlists). Videocalls don't work for most of the people you know. The general integration with different systems you use is clunky at best. Just a reminder: this is not an Apple device. It will not work like your phone does. It's clumsy and pretty meh all around.
title: This Will Not Make Your Home Smart.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Primary
content: I am an avid fan of these Echo devices.  I have several Fire TVs, 1st Generation Echo, Echo Dot, several Echo Shows 1st generation, and the Echo Show 5.  I purchased the 2nd generation because of the bigger screen.  However, this device cannot recognize my smart devices, i.e. Ring Doorbell/Alarm, Smart light switches, etc.  It sees the devices but you cannot control it via voice commands.  I opened a Support Request back on July 31st and up to now, they still have not provided me a resolution.  Support personnel Chris (1st call) and Mauricio (2nd call) were accommodating and followed up on my behalf.  However, the 3rd person (Zack) was not helpful at all and gave me the impression that he wanted to hang up on me because he couldn't do anything.  This is a shame.  This type of company representation, especially in the front lines of support, should not be allowed.  I may just end up returning this product.  Very very disappointed.
title: DOES NOT WORK WITH SMART DEVICES

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Michael F
content: Really like the Echo show traded up from first generation for this one . Love the big screen love you can rotate wallpapers through really a great product but still have a problem with the fact if you ask it seemingly simple questions it can‚Äôt answer unless you have a particular skill for the question your asking and my memory isn‚Äôt what it used to be so rembering the name of every skill to open to get an answer is quite a pain in the bottom.
title: Great but could improve

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Sebastian
content: Overall the product is great. So I won‚Äôt waste time explaining all the great things about this product you can read those in other reviews. The only piece I was not impressed was the voice recognition, This is not a software issue but it seems rather a microphone location issue.  So if you try to talk to the machine through the left or right side (in other words, you are not facing the front), there is a 10% chance that she won‚Äôt respond but if you talk to the machine from the front then no problem.  The echo dot does a much better job with voice recognition.
title: Are u talking to me?

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: J. Daniels
content: I like the Show.  It's fun being able to see the lyrics of songs being played.  The sound is good.  The only issue I've seen that is a tiny bit annoying is that when I tell Alexa to turn off the screen, she does.  But sometimes when I walk in the room a while later, the screen is magically back on again.  There are only two of us living here and I know my spouse isn't reactivating it, so I'm not sure why it's happening. One improvement I'd like to see with all the Alexa devices is the ability to pick my own WAKE word.
title: good sound quality and easy to use

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Don
content: Works great.  Already had a couple of Echos, but wanted this to see live view of Blink XT cameras, which look great on it.  They were easy to integrate to it.  Echo Show is easy to install.  Works great with smart plugs, and easy to create groups on app.  Very pleased with it.  Looks great on the counter.  Like it having configurations, like giving temp, forecast, and visible countdown when using as a timer.
title: Great Alexa addition

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Barbara Nicholson
content: There was no sound on my device.  The pictures were great.  I tried so many things because I really liked the Echo Show (2nd Gen) but to no avail.  When I phoned I spoke with a representative who was quite helpful but still there was no sound.  I was disappointed but there was nothing I could do.  I got it on the sale day and was supposed to get a couple of bonuses but they were held up.  I received the Echo Show on time however.
title: SOUND!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: JM Wheeler
content: We all know that the only thing Alexa isn't good at is reference. Maybe we need a google skill. The show is a good device. We have it in the kitchen and it does well. The sound quality is very good. I wish i could tweak the sensitivity. The device in the kitchen often hears me when I'm in a different part of the house trying to speak to the Alexa in that room. But I guess I should just whisper. Good device, looks sleek and very presentable.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: ktollstam
content: The Echo Show has come a long way. Amazon had a flash sale and I made an impulse purchase; glad I did. With total integration to all the music services, including Apple Music, as well as all the other functions embedded in the Echo platform, this is the device to own. The display is bright and crisp, great resolution and a versatile portal for video chats, viewing pictures, or even viewing movies and other content.
title: Sound as good as Home Pod, Sonos and Google Nest Hub

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: MeAndTheseKids
content: Hulu hasn‚Äôt been working for days. My Hulu account is fine. I receive this message when I try to play anything, yet there is nothing on Hulu help that refers to the error message provided, so I can‚Äôt fix the issue. I often have to unplug and reset the unit because I will say Alexa play Roseanne on prime video.. it says okay and then goes back to the home screen. This has been the most annoying piece of electronics I have owned next to the fire sticks which buffer every minute or so for several seconds at a time.
title: So very subpar

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Anthony Arena
content: I‚Äôve had this product for about a week now, and right from the box it has been nothing but trouble, the screen is very slow, it‚Äôs response time has been terrible and  it cannot get directions right at all, For example I‚Äôve asked it where the closest Walmart is,  it does give me the correct address however it tells me that it‚Äôs 10.1 miles away but in reality it‚Äôs a little more than a mile away. The sound quality is good, but it‚Äôs not enough to justify the  terrible performance,  all in all I would only give this product a one star rating if that! PS: Amazon technical support where are you?
title: Not worth the money

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Elaine K Mills
content: The Echo Show is the best item that I have purchased because it helps me connect to my loved one who is in a nursing home. If you are missing your loved one this is an awesome tool to connect with them. However, you must get the care provider to agree with connecting to their internet. I purchased this as a buy one get one free and I must say that the investment was the best thing I have purchased during this COVID experience. My loved one has dementia and we cannot visit in person and that was so heartbreaking. Thank you so much Amazon for creating this beautiful tool. Also when you set the Echo Show up you can turn off the purchasing options and you need to sign in to the device when you connect to the new internet. Your loved one does not need a phone to connect to the device just the internet. I'm not that Tech savvy and the care home my loved one is in is Top of the Line. It is so important to stay connected to our loved ones. The Echo Show has warmed my heart and put me at ease. Very Impressive Product.
title: Very Impressive Product!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal

We now have an echo in every room of our house!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: KamsMom

Need to make a call to hopefully fix the issue. **UPDATE** I got in touch with amazon custom service and after several tries and recommendations.. it was decided I needed a new one because it was defective. Got the new worked ok for a few months. But now the speakers sound shaky and it just not as good as the 1st generation one. Bummer!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Mike Leone
content: Amazon Echo Show works as advertised. It connects with our ring camera so we can see who's at the front door. Other functionality for the camera is limited so we have to use the ring app on our phones. We also want to install a smart lock that works with the Echo Show preferably without having to buy another device (smart home hub). But it is nearly impossible to get accurate, detailed, concise information about what locks are compatible. Chat with Amazon reps was useless; they didn't even understand the questions. The Echo Show came with a smart bulb from Phillips. Again, you're on your own to figure out how to make this thing work. How stupid are Amazon and Phillips to offer this bundle then leave you hanging with no idea how to get it to work. It took a while for me to figure it out (and I have two engineering degrees and ran a tech department for years), but I still can't get it to show up in the Alexa app on my wife's iPhone. Depending on what you want to do and your level of tech savy, be careful buying this device.
title: Good product, terrible support

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: L. Buchas
content: Got this on sale during Amazon Prime days. I am still learning all the features. Sound quality is very good and the HD display is great. Bought an extra power adapter to keep plugged in, in another room. I can move it easily between rooms without unplugging from the wall if needed. Shows status of other Amazon devices as needed. Can customize features.
title: Cool gadget

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Bonnie Lam
content: I have 3 Alexa Echo devices and have been using Echo devices for a few years.  So, I thought that I would enjoy the Alexa Show since it adds on video capabilities.  However, I am highly disappointed in the Echo show.  It's ability to support video is very clunky especially with 3rd party apps like Hulu.  The user experience is horrendous and it's much effort than it's worth to watch video on this device.  On top of this, it has some issues with the day to day playing of music, podcasts, etc that I don't run into with my other non-video Echo devices.  Sadly, this is a big disappointment.  Hopefully, software updates will make the experience better.  If not, I will probably try out the Google Home device.  I've been a pretty big fan of Echo and Alexa; but, unfortunately, this experience may lead me to try out the Google solutions.
title: Very disappointed in the Echo Show...  :-(

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: grannyB

It sits on my kitchen counter and getting recipes, listening to music, watching movies/shows, checking my calendar is great!  My grandson loves asking Alexa questions!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Dan Ness
content: I like the Echo show, everything with that is great. 5 stars. What I don't like is the deal they are running a deal that says the echo flex and bulb are free. It's 229$ total. So I look at my order and they drop the price of the echo show to 189$ plus 19 for the bulb and 20 for the flex. Altering a price to still come out to the same price doesn't make something free. Unfortunately due to the pandemic they can't put anyone on the phone so I got someone the first time on chat that had no vested interest in listening to my concern. The second guy did and offered me a 40 dollar gift, which is great but that doesn't fix the issue for anyone else buying this and thinking they are getting something for free. Free is Zero. Not $$$. I'll knock this thing up to a 5 star when it's fixed. Thank you!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Song
content: I love the new sound on this show, its got much deeper bass and all around sound. Be aware the majority of the speakers are rear facing, as the large screen takes up most of the front, but if you have a good bounce wall that its near, it makes for a full room sound. The screen is a very high resolution, and the additional features on it are great. The voice recognition and "listening" features catch your wake command and questions very easily. I would say its head an shoulders above the old show that I had. I'm glad I upgraded!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Phill O
content: This echo would be a great product but it is the worst thing ever if you have kids. It will not allow you to put any sort of parental protection on it to block your kids from using it. All in all I am disappointed with this product. If I could return it, I would in a heartbeat.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: John G.
content: Sound is good and gets decently loud.  I usually love a lot of bass, but I have to turn it way down on this. The screen looks nice enough, but I don't feel like I can describe it as very responsive, and I don't really like the touchscreen interface.  But then I remember that the Show probably isn't intended on being touched all that much.  With that in mind, it's the best sounding and loudest Echo I've had (until I get my hands on a Studio), so I'm happy with it.
title: Worth it for the good sound it makes

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: afalco8
content: I wanted to give it a chance to correct itself before writing a review. After a month of use, the following problems have not been fixed: 1. Volume switches off and doesn't come back on unless I pull the plug and restart. 2. Jeopardy is unplayable. If you answer a clue with "What is America?", Alexa will exit out of the game and do a search for "What is America?". Unforgivable. 3. Playing music via voice recognition works about 60% of the time. Sometimes she will try to convince me someone else is streaming from my account in another location and suggests that I upgrade my prime streaming service (nice try liar). 4. At one point she began reading what I believe was her code aloud to us. There have been more issues that I can't remember off the top of my head. I will say that the sound is great (when it works), but all-in-all I prefer my regular old echo.
title: Glitch Factory

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Peter A Harris
content: This device is painfully unintuitive. It looks beautiful it sounds beautiful, feels beautiful even, but it performs terribly. The AI is very limited. product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Hugh
content: My first Echo show. It's a big step up from Echo Spot, in size, sound, and video experience.  A 10 inch display makes it easier to enjoy web videos and interact with certain Alexa video skills. However, Alexa listening is not better, particularly when you talk standing from the back of  the device.  Also, there're some bugs that need to be fixed such as the timer will be cancelled if you click on a web video when there's still time on your set timer.
title: A generally well designed smart display with a few deficiencies.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Denver Zimmerman
content: The display and sound quality are really quite good and the integrated hub allows for using smart devices that require a hub to work such as phillips hue lightbulbs. It doesnt seem to pick up my vpice as well as my echo dot down the hall in my officenor the dot down the other hall in my living room but i believe that is due to where I have the show sitting so I will be testing out different places to decide the best location. It does connect perfectly with all the echo dots to have whole floor music streaming from amazon Prime a.d sounds much bettet than just the echo dot speakers alone but if music is your thing then I suggest using the Bluetooth feature or auxiliary cable that the show and dot come with and just use your own choice of speakers. All in all im quite pleased with everything the show can do and have no complaints.
title: Excellent device for smart home integration.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: renatana
content: I bought this so I could 'drop in' on my 95 year old mother.  It is the clunkiest piece of software I have ever used.  First, my 95 year old mom has to download an app, then all of her 10 children, 24 grandchildren and any one else who would like to drop in, have to download the app.  Then you have to go through voice recognition -then you have to add contact,-then you have to download ALL of your contacts to amazon for this to work ( support told me I could go back later and desert this!) Then my mom has to personally allow every single person to 'drop in' on her.  Once I thought it was set up- with tech support on the phone-a drop in happened but it came up with no image- just 2 boxes- 1 me -1 my mom...Don't bother!!
title: A total waste of time.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Dave K
content: Getting connected to various devices requires setting up skills which takes some patience. I use my IPad to do that, once all the information is in, THEN you can discover the devices with Alexa. Takes patience but I love turning heat on from bed before I get up, when I wake up and knowing exactly what the temperature is before I get out of bed. And access to cameras, fantastic, and lights, the list goes on and on. Perfect for those with reduced mobility. And the sound quality is quite impressive. And I have Echo dots all over the place. I used to take a speaker with me to work in the garage, but not anymore. Enjoy!
title: A second hand!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Sahm
content: I recently moved my mom into a assisted living facility and the Echo Show has been a Godsend.  I can set up reminders to let her know when her activities are, when to go to the dining room for meals, and when her favorite shows are on. I was also able to convert all of her photos into a photo album using Amazon photos and view them as a background slideshow. I can video chat with her and she doesn't get spam calls like she did when she had a cell phone. This has been perfect for giving me a little peace of mind when I am away.
title: Helps With Elderly

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: J. Ruiz
content: Voice recognition is way better than all my dots.  Sounds is really good along with picture. Reason I have 4 stars is this.... If you're power goes out, this will have no audio when it turns back on.  If you disconnect it from the wall you also will have no audio when it turns back on.  It's a weird known glitch that has not been resolved.  To get audio back on you have to disconnect cord from behind the Alexa show itself and not from the wall.
title: Read about glitch

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: D. Hibler
content: Love the screen size and the sounds is a big step up fro previous gen. But its voice recognition is kinda bad when music is at mid-high volume, you have to literally yell to try and get control. Great feel and build quality

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: EEWoos

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal

For me it was a substantial upgrade and definitely worth it.  You can also cash in on trade in offers if they're still available which will bring the price down.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal

Sooo many wonderful things and its simple enough for a 99 year old to use it!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal

Still discovering all the neat things Alexa can do. LOVE IT!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal

author: Jen L
content: My kids got the Echo Show for me for Christmas so that I could video chat with them.  I successfully downloaded the app.  However, it would not connect with my phone version 4.4.4.  After an extensive search online to trouble shoot, it appears that Echo Show was not designed to connect to a phone with a version less than 5.0.  So disappointed!  The Echo Show does do a lot of interesting things.  Just too bad I won't be able to connect to other Echo Shows.  Won't be able to purchase a new phone for some time.
title: Does not connect with android version 4.4.4

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal

The sound is amazing, the display is outstanding. One thing that really amazes me is, I can ask echo to show me pictures of a certain person from my photo album and every picture will be one with that person in it. A great purchase.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: swun
content: There seems to be a reason Amazon is giving these devices for free. The device is great looking and sounds pretty good. HOWEVER, that is where everything stops. The user interface for Alexa and Echo is absolutely garbage. I tried to find another word to not be too crude, but, I couldn't. Amazon, I'm sorry. I'm a huge fan of your great customer service and products. Why did you design such a useless device from the ground up? Say you want to play some songs on your pandora, well you will need to use at least 2 devices. You have to configure the station on a computer after going into 10 subselections (really well hidden). Then start pandora with a voice command on your Echo show. That absolutely defeats the purpose of having a smart speaker with a user interface. Amazon, please allow people to use the screen on the echo show to configure apps, otherwise you sold a very good looking paper weight.
title: Useless user interface

author: Erica Murphy
content: Had this brand new unit less than two months, started having audio issues when playing music through Amazon music. Stations or shuffle songs would stop after one song was played. product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Andre Carver
content: Love the screen size and clarity. Love that it can get on the internet, YouTube and other sites. I guess the only thing I can complain about is when music or a video is playing even at a moderate level Alexa can not hear you call her name for commands. All in all a good product. Now what they need to work on is making Alexa more like a search engine because I find myself asking her things that she should know but she doesn't or you have to be so specific in HOW you ask her the question. Often times it's much faster, easier and less frustrating to ask Google the question from my phone. But buy the Echo Show you'll like it.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: A. Mok
content: As an early adopter of the 1st generation Echo, I am a big fan of this device. product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: RopinCowgirl
content: I guess I had higher expectations for the echo show. I don‚Äôt feel I got a major upgrade from just using the dots. Everything is meant to be done by voice control but honestly that isn‚Äôt always convenient. For example, we really wanted to use this for recipes. So I setup the push buttons for Firefox, then click on Pinterest, then find recipe, click on it to open full recipe. So far these are all pretty standard items. But the screen goes back to the home screen after so much time, haven‚Äôt found the setting to change this yet, and then you have to start ALL over. The webpage you were on is gone!  The show also doesn‚Äôt really act as a hub anymore than the app on my phone does for the Dots. I really don‚Äôt see the point of the show over an app and the dots.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Renee Greenlee
content: Bought this because we thought it would be perfect to put in the room of my elderly mother with alzheimers. We could do drop‚Äêins and when wouldn't need to do anything. First off the constant try this is very confusing to her and there is no way to turn it off. 2nd the video camera stops working quite frequently and the unit has to be rebooted which isn't something she's able to do. I spent over an hour on the phone with Amazon before I got the unit making sure that nothing would be required of her for us to have a video chat and it's turned out to be a huge inconvenience. I've gone back to contacting one of the aid workers on duty and getting them to go to her room with their phone so I can face time her. The constant Try this messages confuse and upset her but Amazon made sure they can't be disabled. This had so much potential but it turned out to be a waste of money.
title: Do not buy for an elderly person.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: OphirDude
content: I found the following immediately noticeable: 1) Heavy unit, but makes sense as the weight is necessary to prevent the unit from vibrating on the surface it sits on. 2) Sound quality is noticeably richer with more bass than 1st Gen 3) Larger screen is much easier to read and watch videos (or webcam) than 1st Gen While it is still expensive, IMHO, the improved audio and screen size justifies the spend assuming you have discretionary cash.
title: Much better sound than 1st Gen

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Chris H.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: DJS
content: We're still getting to know our improved Alexa machine.  As seniors, the curves of understanding can be fraught with frustrating challenges. product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal

author: Marcia Bolden

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal

Let me tell you that there is no Netflix, YouTube integration is subpar at best, integration with CNN is sad.  There is very little you can do interactively with the screen, I mean almost nothing.  Unless you need this for video calling (I have not tried that so that me be great) it is almost worthless.  I give it two starts for what appears to be good build quality, and the sound from such a small device is commendable.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Brooks Yeilding

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: wjp

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal

The speakers work very well though and I'm happy with the sound quality. But that is really the most I can say about it.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: G A
content: Update#2: was contacted. And replacement sent. Working again. We will see if it lasts Update: didn't last long. What a run around Amazon gives you when there product is defective. The wifi adapter in the show is fualty. Very dissatisfied with this product and there customer service is terrible!!! I like it. Works well so far.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: james
content: I just got this for the kitchen for my wife we have three Echo five shows and one Echo Dot love these things I bought several smart bulbs and smart outlet they work great I also have six different ring cameras which work with the Alexa devices I have done video calls from a couple hundred miles away on the Alexa app from my phone to the house can't believe how good it was getting ready to buy a couple more thank you Amazon

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Agnieszka Matczuk
content: Overall very nice but definitely needs some improvements. Voice recognition worse then standard Echo. Settings are occasionally problem. Setting pictures to run as home screen creates slide show of maybe 5-6 pictures. Somehow unable to use entire file. Occasionally comes to life without provocation. Resolution on  Skype and Skype integration relatively poor. I use it as a kitchen TV/radio/timer and for these purposes works pretty well
title: Fun new gadget

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Vincent J Lilly
content: When opening the box for Echo Show, the first thing you feel is weight. Usually means better bass reaction in the speaker system. Guess What? It's all about that bass! I have taken the Echo Show through some of it's paces. I have listen to Audible. I have asked for a recipe for Roasted Chicken... YUMMY! I asked her where I could meet a geat woman... Still waiting for that answer... I spent the Christmas listening to iHeart Raidio's Christmas music channels. I am very happy with my purchase. Oh! When family uses the "Drop in" feature, they do drop right in!!! Other than that, Alexa Echo Show is fun, a dynamic speaker for music from Pandora or iHeart Radio, and an excellent reading companion! Enjoy! - VJ

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: symbiology
content: Got this for the kitchen to use it to keep a recipe up while cooking and not have to walk into the room with the computer.  Totally useless and irritating for the function it is sold for, applications auto-close after 5 min. The whole point is  to have it display it without me having to reopen the stupid thing all the time and re-find my place. A paper book is more useful if they can't program it better than this.  The screen is always on and it uses quite a bit of power, I have to pull the plug to get it to "power save" not very green. Great sound for such a small package.  I would have skipped this purchase if I was aware of how badly the interface works.
title: How can you use it for recipies when it closes the browser every 5 fricking minutes?

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Joseph R. Quesada
content: I bought two of these. One for myself and one my parents who are in their upper 80‚Äôs. We both are having the toughest time setting them up. First of all, there are no instructions and the YouTube videos are not helpful. After a few days, I got mine working, but my parents are still struggling. What a headache. If we cannot get it working soon, I‚Äôm returning both and buying the Facebook portal.
title: A frustrated Consumer.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: LP
content: Love the product and very easy to install. Amazon is terrific in customer support if you do have an issue. I have but three different sizes and purchased them as gifts. A terrific way to stay connected to family and friends.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: KJones
content: I really like my Echo Show, the sound is rich and it is loud enough to hear through the entire bottom floor.  My only issues are that the bass is too loud, I tried adjusting and it doesn‚Äôt really change.  Also, the last two times I have had company over and we were listening to music it went down twice- it looked like it was just searching.  My internet seemed to be okay, so not sure what the problem was.  Other than that, I think it‚Äôs great!  I like that you can put closed captioning on- both of my boys are hard of hearing, so nice feature!  We use it frequently and it sits in our kitchen.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Keeping it 1000
content: Looking around at all the technology, it seems Orwell was right. We will invite Big Brother into our homes voluntarily. He has been lurking in our phones, TVs, game consoles and so many other places already. Now with the Amazon Show 2nd generation) he sits there in all his glory, in high definition  and hi gh fidelity sound (relatively speaking). Add Amazon Music unlimited and you are good to go.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: JA#03
content: The sound is perfect plus the screens image. I would have given it 5-stars if it wasn‚Äôt for the clock. The clock is small and in one corner. A product with such a reputation should give the user an option on the size and color of the clock.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Rachael
content: Good size screen, nice speaker. I wish it came with a stand, although I did buy my own (not Amazon's though because theirs doesn't rotate). My kids enjoy the music, stories, jokes. I enjoy the weather, news, calendar, and voice control of other smart devices in my home. The voice recognition has even been able to learn to decipher what my 2 year old is saying, which is impressive.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Tim B.
content: Purchased for my 93 y/o mom to 1.FaceTime‚Äù 2. Photo frame 3. Remotely allow her to unlock her lower level door. FaceTime/ drop in works ok, mostly a problem due to  bandwidth on her end. Picture is grainy and takes a while to come in. Photo frame is the most disappointing. Initially while at her house I set up the background for 30 pictures. It was working good until she wanted to change the pictures. Now I‚Äôm 1000 miles away and use the app on my iPad, use the remove link thinking I was just removing one picture! Nope all pictures gone! Now I can only upload one pictures at a time and that only one picture is in the background.  Tech support was no help at all. She can use her voice to unlock the door. Although I had to change the command prompts to something other than Alexa!
title: Don‚Äôt try to use it for a photo frame

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Fred H.
content: I use my Echo Show in my office and absolutely enjoy the picture slide show from my pictures stored in Amazon Photos.  Voice recognition is great, sound is excellent when I play music as a background to the slide show.  Lots of additional features I'm still discovering and this device replaced my Echo DOT in my office.  Thanks Amazon!!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Fred Lucia

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: BB
content: My son gave me an echo show (second generation) as a gift. I love everything thing about this gift. It‚Äôs great to see the Grandchildren when we talk. Who knew when I was a little girl watching the Jettson‚Äôs cartoon, that I would one day be able to see a person on a screen while enjoying a conversation just as the jettson‚Äôs did.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Dilan Pradhan
content: Worked for 6 months. During 6th month Alexa stopped responding. Called customer service and tech. After 1 hour of resetting and rebooting. I was told there is something wrong that they have to check. Rep offered me to send them the item and they would check and fix for me. I was shocked but asked that is the only option. He checked with Technician and came back with good news. They would send me new device and I have to return old. At least that is not so bad warranty. Giving 3 star because this is 2nd device to have same problem for me. Not giving 1 star because warranty service helped to exchange.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Liana Claymore

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: DJPinna

Besides the normal voice enhancements we desperately need across all Alexa enabled devices (e.g. understanding user intent based on previous commands), I found the screen to lag a bit when browsing Amazon Prime Watchlist and it bugs out once in a while when playing movies.  I've had to manually reboot (unplug) a few times.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: K G
content: I received this as a gift. I set it up & it seemed to work fine. Next day it became silent. Alexa would not speak to me. It woke up & is now speaking to me.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Brian Williams
content: The 2nd Gen show offers some impressive sound quality (including bass). Added AI improvements like only having to say ‚ÄúAlexa‚Äù once, then providing multiple directions. I keep mine in the kitchen, where I can ask for recipes, videos or music. All hands-free so I can continue cooking. It‚Äôs great!

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: K Morris

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: AD

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Barb Smith

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: P. Schroeder

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: G. Carrico

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: George L Ipock

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Howard
content: Replaced the original Echo Show with the Second Gen because it was too good a deal to pass, reduced price, 25% for trading in old Show and a $30 gift card. product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Picster
content: This is an excellent and capable product EXCEPT.  The screen returns to home after 5 minutes.  So, have music playing with lyrics being displayed. There is no setting to stop this horrible feature.  if you plan to use this for anything visual lasting over 5 minutes you are bound to be frustrated.  If this is your intent don't buy. product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Gregory E. Vincent

Alexa displays music lyrics where available, and the videos are pretty sharp on the 10 inch screen. Alexa is very helpful with questions answered, reminders, and timer/alarm functions. The show plays my Amazon Music choices quite responsively. I haven‚Äôt tried my Amazon Prime on this device yet, as I always use my big screen television, but Based on the videos that I have seen on the Show, I am sure that Prime video works will also. I‚Äôm very pleased with my purchase, and recommend the Show as a fun and useful smart device.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: jon

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Nadine Murray

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: S. J. Jensen

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Ashleigh Gifford

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: D. Petrilli

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Pete

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: lilysman
content: Super loud works great I love it

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Megabyte

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: K Kosyla

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: fillwis

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Padenski

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: g gaskins

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: David Baker

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Lisa Smith

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Ken Genaw

In hindsight, however, for the $30 they offered for it, along with a 25% discount towards this model, I would‚Äôve like to maybe see Amazon recommending to go it to a friend, which would have more people on the bandwagon if they aren‚Äôt already.  Just a thought.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: JB Palkki
content: The first unit I received had no sound at all so had to chat with Amazon to get it replaced.  The setup is simple so it is not a huge problem other than the fact I got a defective unit. I refer to things like Netflix or YouTube, etc.. Adjusting settings can vary from a breeze to a real challenge.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: Tammy Jenkins
content: This is totally awesome. I'm just starting to use smart items in my home and this is so great. You can all kinds of different things with it, ask weather, recipes, and the one thing I really thought was great you can tell it to play your favorite radio station (example Alexa play 97.1 the river which is a station out of Atlanta Ga.) and it will play it without any static. And it sounds as good or better than your regular home stereo. You can set alarm to wake you. I could go on & on but I'm sure you get my point. It is TOTALLY worth it, and very easy to use. My 60 year old cousin can even use it and he doesn't even know how to use a smartphone. He lives with me and I catch him all the time asking it questions thought that's cool. Hope this review helps anyone who is one the fence wheather they want to buy it or not.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: hereistand

I decided to hold on to my Show gen 1 because I tried it out in the smallest room in the house and the audio sounded better there.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal

Also, no Google or Netflix, or movies on YouTube, although you can watch regular YouTube through a browser. The other Alexa Skills vary in usefulness.

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
author: June O'Brien
content: This product has great potential if you have a smart phone.  We don't! The Alexa Communications Ap for calling contacts has to be installed on a smart phone.  Without it you can not make visual calls. They down load your phone contacts through Alex Communications for Echo Show.  We still have our two flipflops phone because it is only $50 a month for unlimited texting through Verizon designed for retirees on a fixed income.  I hope Amazon doesn't ignore the grandparent market who would enjoy the visual phone calls of their grandchildren as advertised on the commercial and develops a software ap, so Alex Communications can be compatible with Office "People contacts."  Presently I use a Verizon text application on my computer so I can type texts on a real keyboard - my laptop when texting.  Amazon Echo show team should talk to Verizon.  Now it does the same as a the tower which is 1/3 the price. "Alex, what's the weather?"  A frustrated grandparent

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal

product: Echo Show (2nd Gen) | Premium 10.1‚Äù HD smart display with Alexa ‚Äì stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
